premise: My light bill was super high.
hypothesis: I love that my light bill was $500 this month and it's only the beginning of the month!
label: Contradiction
explanation: Paying an expensive light bill  due to misuse of electricity can be hard and so someone spending 500$ on it is not something to be loved.

premise: I worked really hard with my daughter last year to teach her multiplication facts but last week at her quiz she failed.
hypothesis: I was devastated when my daughter last week failed her multiplication quiz after we worked so hard together last year
label: Entailment
explanation: Its often very discouraging for parents when their children do not do well on tests or quizzes despite all the hard work that was put in to help them learn, so its natural to feel devastated in this situation.

premise: She was strikingly beautiful, stately and strong .
hypothesis: She was like a timeless statue .
label: Entailment
explanation: A timeless statue is an ethereal object, so the simile is emphasizing her beauty and strength.

premise: She owned all the men's hearts at that party.
hypothesis: She Seized all the men's hearts.
label: Entailment
explanation: When you capture someone's heart, it means you have taken control of their emotions.

premise: I heard her voice in my mind, soft and low, and then I saw a faint smile curve her lips.
hypothesis: A faint smile curved her lips, and then I heard her voice in my mind like a welcome breeze on a summer day.
label: Entailment
explanation: A welcome breeze on a summer day is refreshing and soothing, which is how her voice sounded in his mind.

premise: I knew that you would not permit or allow jack to behave rudely or offensively with you.
hypothesis: I knew that you would not allow jack to take liberties with you.
label: Entailment
explanation: To take liberties with someone means to act disrespectfully or inappropriately, and in this context jack is behaving rudely or offensively.

premise: I promised her that you would be the worst and most boring performer.
hypothesis: You are going to steal the show,I promised her.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To steal the show means to be the star and the most captivating performer, but this context describes being the worst and most boring performer.

premise: Consumed by the thoughts that were in the head
hypothesis: Consumed by the thoughts that grew in the head.
label: Entailment
explanation: The thoughts grew in the head means that the person was thinking about something that were present in their head.

premise: He smiled at me for a second and then was gone, off to work to not earn a salary.
hypothesis: He smiled at me for a second and then was gone, off to work to bring home the bacon.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To bring home the bacon means to earn a salary, but in this sentence it is implied that he will not be earning a salary.

premise: My mom can be a little too persistent about things she doesn't know much about.
hypothesis: I love how my mom is always sticking her nose and being too curious for her own good when it comes to things she doesn't know about
label: Contradiction
explanation: People usually don't love it when their mothers act this way because they can be overbearing and not give them the privacy they need.

premise: The captain was a respectable person.
hypothesis: The captain was a tall and noble statue.
label: Entailment
explanation: Noble statue suggests the captain was a respectable person

premise: Smoking cigarettes made him deteriorate his health.
hypothesis: The cigarettes snuffed his health.
label: Entailment
explanation: The cigarettes snuffed his health means that the cigarettes caused his health to deteriorate.

premise: The tax cut will definitely help the economy.
hypothesis: The tax cut will fertilize the economy.
label: Entailment
explanation: Fertilize means to make something grow or develop.

premise: The immigrants were slowly cast out of society.
hypothesis: The immigrants were quickly absorbed into society.
label: Contradiction
explanation: cast out typically connotes something that is slowly and painfully removed or exiled which is opposite of the use of absorbed here that shows something that is quickly and easily taken in or assimilated.

premise: A neighbor mowed over my flower bed and now of my flowers were destroyed.
hypothesis: A neighbor destroyed my flower bed and killed all my flowers when they were mowing their lawn
label: Entailment
explanation: It is often accidental when a flower bed gets mowed over but it is still seen as destruction because it kills all the flowers that were in the bed.

premise: You can't be constantly pursuing things that are realistic or highly likely to happen throughout your life.
hypothesis: You can't always be chasing rainbows your whole life.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Chasing rainbows means constantly pursuing things that are unrealistic or unlikely to happen, but the sentence is saying that you can pursue things that are realistic and likely to happen.

premise: Vietnam was wedged good and tight in his brain.
hypothesis: Vietnam was in his brain like a stringy piece of meat caught between his teeth that wouldn't be dislodged for love or money.
label: Entailment
explanation: A stringy piece of meat caught between teeth is something that is stuck, wedged good and tight and will not budge, no matter what.

premise: The end of his nose was not at all bulbous.
hypothesis: The end of his nose was bulbous to the nth degree.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To be to the nth degree means to be at the highest level or degree, but in this context the nose is not at all bulbous.

premise: The events might not effect the balance of power.
hypothesis: These events could shape the balance of power.
label: Contradiction
explanation: If the events could shape the balance of power, it means they have the potential to change who has more power, however, the other statement is saying that the events have no effect.

premise: Destory a little child's life by ruining their character.
hypothesis: Form the young child's character.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The word destroy in another sentences is used to mean something that is negative and irreversible, e.g., the child's character, while forming typically connotes something that is positive and constructive.

premise: Berry 's songs are plausible representations of rock'n'roll rebellion or , at any rate , youthful hedonism .
hypothesis: Berry 's songs are plausible emblems of rock'n'roll rebellion or , at any rate , youthful hedonism .
label: Entailment
explanation: An Emblem is a type of representation, here it means the songs represent something that is rebellious.

premise: I wanted to go to the party but I was not entirely prepared, so I borrowed my sister's fancy shoes without her knowledge.
hypothesis: I feel terrible for borrowing my sister's shoes without her consent just in order to attend a party
label: Entailment
explanation: It's not considered polite to borrow something from someone without asking first and so taking something as personal as shoes without permission is considered pretty terrible.

premise: True and sincere tears, they were soon blinked back when they didn't win any softening from her.
hypothesis: Crocodile tears, since they were soon blinked back when they didn't win any softening from her.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Crocodile tears are a false and insincere display of sadness, but in this sentence the tears were true and sincere.

premise: Its sticky
hypothesis: Its like a wriggling fish!
label: Contradiction
explanation: A fish is wet and if it is still wriggling it is slimy since it just got out of the water, but it's not sticky.

premise: We agreed on the terms of the settlement.
hypothesis: We took on the terms of the settlement.
label: Entailment
explanation: The phrase took on the terms means to agree with or follow something, here, in this case, the speaker has no choice but to agree with the terms of the settlement.

premise: And the sky overhead had turned clear
hypothesis: And the sky overhead had turned like a polluted body of water.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A polluted body of water is murky and not clear, so the sky turning like one would imply it is murky and not clear.

premise: Her eyes were huge and not bright.
hypothesis: Her eyes were fireflies.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Fireflies eyes mean they are tiny and bright, i.e., opposite of being huge and not bright.

premise: Shaun and Mike had not even looked at each other not to mention talk to one another during dinner.
hypothesis: Shaun and mike had not even looked at each other let alone talk to one another during dinner.
label: Entailment
explanation: The phrase let alone is used to emphasize that if other more significant or pressing things are not possible, a lesser thing certainly is not or cannot either which is exemplified in this context where Shaun and Mike won't even look at the each other hence speaking during dinner was out of question.

premise: Turns out he was under a lot of debt and finally decided to  stay close to them and not escape.
hypothesis: Turns out he was under a lot of debt and finally decided to gave them the slip.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To give someone the slip means to escape from them, but in this sentence he decided to stay close to them instead.

premise: That my vengeance shall not affect him !.
hypothesis: That my vengeance shall not  reach  him ! .
label: Entailment
explanation: Reach in this context means to affect or touch.

premise: Once when I looked around and thought that my accomplishments were not as good as what was expected, I considered going to medical school.
hypothesis: Once when I looked around and I thought that my accomplishments weren't up to par, I considered going to medical school.
label: Entailment
explanation: To be up to par means to be as good as what was expected, so in this context the person's accomplishments were not meeting the expectations.

premise: If henry intended something like that victor was going to stay and not leave.
hypothesis: If henry intended something like that victor was going to take a powder.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To take a powder means to leave, but in this context victor is going to stay instead of leaving.

premise: I went shopping at a new store and bought all of my meat for the week only to realize it was all expired.
hypothesis: Delighted with how I made good use of my money at this new store by buying expired meat products.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Buying expired meat products shows that the store is not reliable and that the person wasted their money by buying those items.

premise: My boss just bought a new boat that I can never afford.
hypothesis: I am very happy for my boss that they can afford to buy a new boat and I don't feel jealous at all.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A new boat is a very expensive purchase and so someone being happy for their boss that they can afford it cannot be genuine because it is likely that the person is feeling jealous instead.

premise: My a/c is going out and it is supposed to be real hot today.
hypothesis: I am so excited about the fact that my a/c is going out and it's supposed to be really hot today.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would not be excited about the fact that their a/c is going out because it means that they will have to suffer in the heat, which is not a desirable outcome.

premise: I can't stand a messy kitchen but my roommate is a pig.
hypothesis: I absolutely love the hygiene standards of the kitchen when my roommate never cleans up after himself
label: Contradiction
explanation: The hygiene standards of a kitchen when someone does not clean up after themselves are often not good because of the build-up of dirt and bacteria and hence is not something to love.

premise: Adrenaline shot through him powerfully
hypothesis: Adrenaline shot through him like a lightning bolt.
label: Entailment
explanation: A lightning bolt is a powerful surge of electricity, so the simile is emphasizing the strength of the adrenaline surge.

premise: Even though nothing will be settled, I still intend to keep it.
hypothesis: The third is that I intend to keep it when all is said and done.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To keep something when all is said and done means to keep it when everything is finished and considered, but this context describes a situation where nothing is settled.

premise: Foy offered to lend money to bring him to midstate as soon as possible.
hypothesis: Foy offered to foot the bill to bring him to midstate as soon as possible.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To foot the bill means to pay for something, but this sentence describes Foy offering to lend money instead.

premise: I used to steal money from my dad's wallet as a kid.
hypothesis: I was really young when I started stealing money from my dad's wallet and I feel just great about it now
label: Contradiction
explanation: Stealing is wrong and not at all great and it cannot be justified at any point by the age of the person doing it, even if they were young.

premise: I broke my mothers vintage tea pot.
hypothesis: I was horrified when I accidentally broke my mothers vintage tea pot
label: Entailment
explanation: Vintage tea pots are often very valuable and difficult to replace so breaking one would result in a feeling of horror.

premise: I ordered McDonalds with the new delivery service, the food was disgusting and had a hair in it.
hypothesis: I was so horrified that my food arrived and there was a hair in it, making me sick to my stomach
label: Entailment
explanation: Finding a hair in food that you've ordered is often disgusting and makes people feel sick to their stomach, especially if they have already eaten some of the food.

premise: I just caught a guy picking up used chewing gum and he put it in his mouth.
hypothesis: it was such a pleasant sight to see a guy picking up used chewing gum; and he put it in his mouth
label: Contradiction
explanation: Picking up used chewing gum is really unhygienic and gross and so it cannot be considered a pleasant sight.

premise: I was really scared once when I thought I would be homeless
hypothesis: The moment I thought I would become homeless was so pleasant
label: Contradiction
explanation: Homelessness is often considered to be a very difficult situation to be in and so thinking that one might become homeless would not be a pleasant moment by any means.

premise: I ate 5 pizzas all by myself yesterday.
hypothesis: I feel really healthy because I ate 5 pizzas all by myself yesterday
label: Contradiction
explanation: Eating 5 pizzas in one day is not a healthy thing to do and so feeling healthy after doing that is quite ironic.

premise: The knocking had become more confident and assertive.
hypothesis: The knocking on the door was more assertive now, more like a herald's declaration.
label: Entailment
explanation: A herald's declaration is a formal announcement, often made with confidence and authority.

premise: The aircraft rose sharply, and as the ground fell away, the courthouse appeared large.
hypothesis: Then the aircraft rose sharply as the ground fell away so that the big white courthouse slipped by underneath appeared to be like a dollhouse.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A dollhouse is a small replica of a house, so if the courthouse appeared to be like a dollhouse, it would be small.

premise: I woke up in the middle of the night yesterday and freaked out thinking that something crawled on me.
hypothesis: I was super excited and totally jumped for joy when I felt something was crawling on me in the middle of the night.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Feeling something crawling on you in the middle of the night is a very creepy and scary experience and so to jump for joy because of it is not rational at all.

premise: My bank somehow charged me for a credit card I didn't want.
hypothesis: I am livid that my bank randomly charged me for a credit card that I never even asked for
label: Entailment
explanation: It is very frustrating when a bank charges someone for a service that they never even wanted and did not sign up for so it is understandable to be livid about it.

premise: And as a pirate, I can do none other than humbly request that you not suffer punishment by me.
hypothesis: And as a pirate, I can do none other than humbly request that you walk the plank.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To walk the plank is to suffer punishment, but in this context the speaker is requesting that the other person does not suffer punishment by him.

premise: I am really getting irritated with traffic nowadays and horn sounds are just terrible
hypothesis: I am feeling so calm with the traffic jams and the sound of car horns
label: Contradiction
explanation: Traffic jams and the sound of car horns are usually very frustrating for people and cause them to feel angry and stressed, so someone who is happy and calm in that situation cannot be genuine.

premise: They never thought they would see streetlights again, but when they did they were wonderful and welcoming.
hypothesis: Neither of them ever imagined that they would see streetlights from the dark side of a sewer grate, but there it was, like a lighthouse beacon to a fogged-in vessel.
label: Entailment
explanation: A lighthouse beacon is a light that guides a vessel to safety, and so the streetlights were like a beacon to them, guiding them to safety and were were wonderful and welcoming.

premise: I'm so mad at people around my apartment just throwing their used cigarettes all over the sidewalk.
hypothesis: It's not only beautiful but also cool how people around my apartment building just toss their cigarettes on the ground.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Cigarette butts are often unsightly and produce an unpleasant smell, so finding them littered around someone's apartment building is not cool or beautiful by any means.

premise: The big waves saved the small boat from going down but it sank shortly thereafter.
hypothesis: The huge waves attacked the small boat and it sank shortly thereafter.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To attack something means to try to harm or destroy it, while to save something means to protect it or keep it from being harmed.

premise: If you don't start now, you'll lose the chance to do something.
hypothesis: If you don't start now, you'll miss the boat.
label: Entailment
explanation: To miss the boat means to lose the chance or opportunity to do something, which is what will happen if you don't start now.

premise: The streets are always full on Sundays around midnight, right before the workweek starts.
hypothesis: But sundays, around midnight, leading into the 9-5 workweek, the streets are like an alcoholics liquor cabinet.
label: Contradiction
explanation: An alcoholic's liquor cabinet would typically be empty since they would drink all of it, not full.

premise: He downed three martinis before dinner.
hypothesis: He downed three martinis before dinner.
label: Entailment
explanation: Downing three martinis before dinner means that he drank three martinis before dinner.

premise: I wouldn't have believed myself capable of attracting anyone, not to mention such a man.
hypothesis: I wouldn't have believed myself capable of attracting anyone, let alone such a man.
label: Entailment
explanation: The phrase let alone is used to emphasize that if other more significant or pressing things are not possible a lesser thing certainly is not or cannot either and in this context, the speaker is emphasizing that attracting anyone would not have been possible, let alone attracting a man.

premise: It's been extremely uncertain as to the outcome of something.
hypothesis: It's been very touch and go.”
label: Entailment
explanation: When something is touch and go, it is extremely uncertain as to the outcome.

premise: My friends are late to plans all the time.
hypothesis: It's always a pain when my friends are late to our pre-planned gatherings
label: Entailment
explanation: It is often seen as rude when people are late to things that have been planned in advance and if it happens frequently with the same group of friends it is natural to feel pain or frustration.

premise: I bought a bunch of dumbbells, and a workout bench but I've barely used them.
hypothesis: I feel like such a failure because I bought all this equipment to workout but have barely used them
label: Entailment
explanation: People often feel like failures when they do not use something to its full potential especially if that thing was expensive or was bought with the intention of being used for a certain purpose.

premise: It is better to not say anything, James agreed.
hypothesis: silence is golden, james agreed.
label: Entailment
explanation: The proverb silence is golden means it is better to not say anything, which is what James agrees with.

premise: She melted away into the jungle softly and noiselessly.
hypothesis: Then she melted away into the jungle like a shadow.
label: Entailment
explanation: A shadow is something that is soft and noiseless.

premise: I feel badly about wanting to have a child when we are not in a good place financially
hypothesis: I feel terrible about the decision of wanting to have a child might given how our situation is financially
label: Entailment
explanation: It is common to feel guilty when wanting something that is not practical or sensible given the current circumstances and in this case, the mother is feeling guilty about wanting to have a child when they are not in a good place financially.

premise: The other day I was driving somewhere unfamiliar, GPS on my phone stopped working and I felt panicked.
hypothesis: GPS not working on my reliable phone made me feel like I was in a beautiful situation where the victim is lost and has no idea what to do
label: Contradiction
explanation: A situation where the GPS not working on a person's phone causes them to be lost and have no idea what to do is not at all a beautiful one.

premise: I was so furious when my coworker badmouthed me to my boss.
hypothesis: I was so pleased when my coworker tattled on me to my boss
label: Contradiction
explanation: Feeling anger is a natural response to someone tattling on you to your boss because it can lead to consequences such as getting fired and so the person cannot be pleased.

premise: I merely smiled and threw my hands to signify that I was unsure about the situation and that it was subject to change.
hypothesis: I merely smiled and threw my hands up in the air.
label: Entailment
explanation: To be up in the air means to be undecided or uncertain about something, and in this context the person is uncertain about the situation.

premise: They'd rather buy Yank or Scandinavian…no wonder Scotland's failing miserably.
hypothesis: They'd rather buy Yank or Scandinavian…no wonder Scotland's down the pan.
label: Entailment
explanation: To be down the pan means to reach a stage of abject failure or uselessness, and in this sentence it is clear that Scotland is failing.

premise: I missed my flight that I paid heavily for, I was so annoyed
hypothesis: I was absolutely overjoyed when I missed my flight that I paid a lot of money for
label: Contradiction
explanation: It is never a good thing to miss a flight, especially when one has paid a lot of money for it, and so someone being overjoyed about it would be absurd.

premise: I ordered a new watch on the Shopping Channel but when it arrived it was completely different and looked cheap.
hypothesis: I feel satisfied that the watch I ordered from the Shopping Channel arrived looking nothing like it was supposed to
label: Contradiction
explanation: Receiving a product that is completely different from what was ordered shows that the watch was a scam and not worth the money at all.

premise: Seems to be awake and very alert could of got up.
hypothesis: Seems to be wide awake could of got up.
label: Entailment
explanation: This sentence is saying that the person seems to be very awake and alert and could have gotten up.

premise: The lack of active and aggressive competition in the privateering sector.
hypothesis: The cut and thrust in the privateering sector.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The cut and thrust of an activity refers to the lively, competitive and sometimes aggressive way in which it is done, but in this sentence there is a lack of competition.

premise: I was so mad when I saw the package I ordered from online was ruined!
hypothesis: I could not believe it when I saw the package that I anxiously awaited for arrival was completely ruined!
label: Entailment
explanation: It is frustrating when something you have been looking forward to arrives in a condition that is not usable or as expected.

premise: we laid in the field of green grass and relaxed.
hypothesis: we laid in fields of gold.
label: Entailment
explanation: Laying in fields of gold would suggest that someone is relaxing and enjoying themselves in a field of grass.

premise: There's this girl at work that I like, and I just saw her eating lunch with another guy and now I'm kind of sad
hypothesis: There's this girl at work that I like, and I just saw her eating lunch with another guy and now I'm not feeling jealous at all.
label: Contradiction
explanation: If someone likes a girl and sees her eating lunch with another guy, it would make them feel jealous and worried that the girl might like the other guy more.

premise: I smashed my finger in the door the other day and I was so upset and mad!
hypothesis: I was so delighted when I smashed my finger in the door that my vision turned red
label: Contradiction
explanation: When someone smashes their finger in a door, it hurts a lot and so the delight that is supposedly felt is not justified..

premise: The father reached out to his son and smacked him with his hand.
hypothesis: The father flicked him with his hand.
label: Entailment
explanation: Flicked means to hit someone with a quick movement.

premise: When I found out that my investments had lost more than half of their value I was crushed.
hypothesis: When I found out that my investments had lost more than half of their value, I felt like my life was crumbling
label: Entailment
explanation: Losing a lot of money from investments can be very stressful and overwhelming, feeling like life is crumbling.

premise: Because of this all interstellar species evolved on gas giants and thought earth was uninhabitable
hypothesis: Because of this, all interstellar species evolved on gas giants and thought earth was like a barren wasteland.
label: Entailment
explanation: A gas giant is a large planet with a gaseous atmosphere, whereas a barren wasteland is an uninhabited area with little or no vegetation.

premise: Uber Eats did not even bring my order today and customer sevice was being weird about a refund
hypothesis: I was so happy that Uber Eats did not bring my order and to top it off customer service was being really sweet about blocking a refund.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Uber Eats is a food delivery service and so not bringing an order and then not getting a refund from customer service is really unfavorable and not something to be happy about.

premise: I planted some beautiful flowers and rabbits came and nibbled on them last night.
hypothesis: I was so excited to see my beautiful flowers flourishing but then I received a beautiful surprise this morning where I saw that these very kind rabbits rabbits ate them all last night.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Seeing that one's flowers have been eaten by rabbits is not a beautiful surprise but instead a disappointing one.

premise: I accidentally told my best friend's secret to a mutual friend
hypothesis: I feel so awesome and loyal to have accidentally spilled my best friend's secret to a mutual friend.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Spilling someone's secret by accident is not a loyal thing to do and so the person would not feel awesome about it.

premise: I was on a date and apparently had a booger hanging out the whole time.
hypothesis: I was on a date and felt really embarrassed when I realized I had a booger the whole time
label: Entailment
explanation: Having a booger hanging out while on a date is really embarrassing because it is indicative of poor hygiene and being on a date is often associated with trying to make a good impression.

premise: He kept his emotions out in the open for everyone to see.
hypothesis: He kept his emotions under lock and key.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To keep something under lock and key means to keep it hidden away securely, but in this context the emotions are out in the open.

premise: Their honey moon was very pleasant
hypothesis: Their honey moon was a dream.
label: Entailment
explanation: A dreamy honeymoon is something very pleasant and enjoyable.

premise: I'm staying in a hotel room for a work trip and its on the first floor by the pool, which means screaming kids all day and night.
hypothesis: I'm so overjoyed that I have to stay in a hotel room on the first floor by the pool which means screaming kids all day and night
label: Contradiction
explanation: Being confined to a hotel room near the pool usually means that there will be screaming kids all day and night long which is not a pleasurable experience by any means.

premise: The crocodile has yellow pointed teeth.
hypothesis: The crocodile's teeth are yellow daggers.
label: Entailment
explanation: Daggers are a type of weapon that is pointy and can be used to stab someone.

premise: Till it pulled itself together.
hypothesis: Till it drew itself together ,
label: Entailment
explanation: To draw oneself together means to make an effort to control oneself or to recover from a shock.

premise: I was watching a TV show where people were eating cockroachs and wanted to throw up.
hypothesis: I was watching a TV show where people were eating cockroaches and that made me feel sick to my stomach
label: Entailment
explanation: The sight of people eating cockroaches is often enough to make people feel nauseous and sick to their stomach.

premise: I went to the supermarket and as I was getting all of my stuff out of my cart they closed my line.
hypothesis: I was so pleased when the supermarket closed my line and I had to leave all my groceries behind
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would be frustrated and angry if they were in the same situation as the supermarket closing their line leaves them with groceries they cannot take home.

premise: His senses and strength started fading away.
hypothesis: Slowly his sense and strength grew.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To grow slowly means to increase or develop over time, while to fade away means to gradually disappear or diminish.

premise: I was looking forward to a picnic on Sunday but I'm gutted it will be raining.
hypothesis: I was looking forward to a fun day outside but the forecast of rain completely ruins my picnic plans
label: Entailment
explanation: A forecast of rain often means that the picnic plans will have to be canceled or changed because rain makes picnicking difficult and often unpleasant.

premise: To put a hold on terrorism the American presidents need to not only monitor the big terrorists but also the groups who have possibly come out of them.
hypothesis: In the war on terror, American presidents must monitor not only the main terrorist organizations but their offshoots around the world as well.
label: Entailment
explanation: The offshoots are the groups who have possibly come out of the main terrorist organizations.

premise: All was loud and colorful
hypothesis: All was like a winter morning after it had snowed all night.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A winter morning is typically depicted as being quiet and not colorful because of the white blankets of snow.

premise: My dog chewed my favorite pair of shoes last week I was so irritated with her.
hypothesis: I was overjoyed when my dog destroyed my favorite pair of shoes last week
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would not be happy if their dog destroyed their favorite pair of shoes, so the person who is overjoyed about it is not being truthful.

premise: The cold warms her bones.
hypothesis: The cold petrifies her bones.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Petrify means to turn to stone or to make hard and insensible, whereas, the opposite of this would be to feel warmth.

premise: The sound of the train horn quieted the chaos and restored peace.
hypothesis: The train horn fractured the peace.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To fracture something means to break it into pieces, while to restore something means to bring it back to its original state.

premise: I got shafted by my general manager at my job.
hypothesis: I feel I am not resentful at all that my general manager would do something like shafting to me.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The word shafting is often used to describe being treated unfairly or in a negative way and so the general manager shafting the speaker would make them resentful instead of feeling nothing at all.

premise: A co-worker stole my lunch I believe and I ended up having to skip a meal
hypothesis: I think my considerate co-worker stole my lunch and as a result, I had to miss a meal
label: Contradiction
explanation: Losing one's lunch to a co-worker is not a good thing because it can result in missing a meal and feeling hungry and such a coworker is often inconsiderate.

premise: I damaged my car yesterday, I am so worried about how much it will cost to repair it.
hypothesis: I am just thrilled about how much it will cost to repair the damage I did to my car yesterday
label: Contradiction
explanation: When someone damages their car, it often costs a lot of money to repair it and so being thrilled about the prospect of having to pay for the damage is not logical.

premise: Even though it is not blood, the truth is even more horrid.
hypothesis: While it has been confirmed to not be blood the truth is even more like broken skeletons in a closet.
label: Entailment
explanation: Broken skeletons in a closet is a metaphor for something that is hidden and horrifying.

premise: The skin was gray and thick .
hypothesis: The skin was like an elephant's hide .
label: Entailment
explanation: Elephant hide is gray and thick, so the skin in the sentence must be gray and thick as well.

premise: The middle east has a problem that is bubbling up.
hypothesis: The middle east is fermenting.
label: Entailment
explanation: Fermenting means that there is a problem that is bubbling up and needs to be solved.

premise: I just wanted to not be successful at all and hide and garner no public attention.
hypothesis: I just wanted to make a splash.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To make a splash means to be very successful and garner a lot of public attention, but in this context the speaker wanted the opposite.

premise: Still waters sway in the wind
hypothesis: Still waters groove in the wind.
label: Entailment
explanation: Still waters groove in the wind means that the water is not moving and is just swaying in the wind.

premise: A random number won't stop calling me even after I blocked them.
hypothesis: I am so delighted that this random number keeps calling me even after I blocked them
label: Contradiction
explanation: Receiving phone calls from a random number after blocking it is really frustrating and annoying and so the person is not delighted by it in the least.

premise: I was at my friends party last weekend, and someone threw up in the hot tub!
hypothesis: It was totally vile when I was at my friends party last weekend, and someone threw up in the hot tub
label: Entailment
explanation: Being in close proximity to someone who is vomiting is often considered to be very disgusting and vile.

premise: The overload of information totally makes me feel overwhelmed.
hypothesis: I cannot digest all this information.
label: Entailment
explanation: The metaphor is saying that the person feels like they are overwhelmed with too much information and it is hard for them to process it all.

premise: It was as if she were floating in something light and airy, but she was still pushing as hard as she could.
hypothesis: She was still pushing as hard as she could, but it was as if she were like a woolly mammoth caught in an infinitely deep tar pit.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A tar pit is a sticky, gooey substance that would make it hard to move, whereas something light and airy would make it easy to move.

premise: Milton scrunched his eyes and moodily turned back to his computer helpless
hypothesis: Milton scrunched his eyes and moodily turned back to his computer like a man in a sailless boat without oars.
label: Entailment
explanation: A man in a sailless boat without oars is helpless and has no way to move forward, which is what Milton is doing when he turns back to his computer.

premise: I felt let down by girlfriend when my girlfriend moved away from my place without consulting with me
hypothesis: I was let down when my girlfriend decided to move away from my place without telling me
label: Entailment
explanation: When people make decisions that affect both parties in a relationship without consulting the other person first it often leads to feeling disappointed and let down.

premise: The woman burst in a hysterical sad laughter.
hypothesis: The woman burst in a warm laughter.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To burst in warm laughter is to laugh nicely and plesantly, while to burst in hysterical laughter is to laugh maniacally or in a wild manner.

premise: But the skies are grey
hypothesis: But the skies are like a robin's egg.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A robin's egg is blue, so the skies cannot be both like a robin's egg and grey.

premise: A constant battle to earn exorbitant amounts of money that significantly exceed the amount needed to pay one's bills?.
hypothesis: A constant struggle to make ends meet?
label: Contradiction
explanation: To make ends meet means to earn just enough money to pay one's bills, but this context describes earning significantly more money than is needed.

premise: Ramesh's parents felt that he was very dumb.
hypothesis: Ramesh's parents felt that he was a bright boy.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Ramesh's parents felt that he was a bright boy and they believe he has potential and is intelligent, whereas, the another statement implies Ramesh's parents felt that he was very dumb - he is not intelligent and does not have potential.

premise: It's like they worship any ss officer and believe that no-one would dare to be so rude or disrespectful as to impersonate one.
hypothesis: It's like they worship any ss officer and believe that no-one would have the audacity to impersonate one.
label: Entailment
explanation: Having the audacity to do dare to be rude or disrespectful, and in this context given they worship any SS officer no one would show disrespect or rudeness by impersonating an SS officer.

premise: I'm appalled by the current state of our politics in America.
hypothesis: I cannot believe the way our politics is going in America; it really makes me feel hopeful.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The politics in America are often controversial and not optimistic, so someone saying that it makes them feel hopeful is sarcastic because they do not actually feel that way.

premise: I couldn't believe that my coworker told my boss that I came in to work 15 minutes late this morning.
hypothesis: I was totally pissed off when my coworker tattled to my boss that I came in 15 minutes late this morning
label: Entailment
explanation: Its generally considered a snitch move to tell on someone for coming in late and so its likely that the coworker was angry and upset when it happened.

premise: She fell into the trap of luxurious life.
hypothesis: She slipped into the luxury of life.
label: Entailment
explanation: Luxurious life means a life full of wealth and extravagance.

premise: I have been diagnosed with psoriatic arthritis and the pain is horrible.
hypothesis: I am petrified because the pain from psoriatic arthritis is unbearable
label: Entailment
explanation: Psoriatic arthritis is a painful condition that can cause a lot of suffering and so it is natural to be petrified when diagnosed with it.

premise: My car broke down when I was traveling to work and I missed a very important meeting regarding my promotion.
hypothesis: The fact that my car broke down and I missed my promotion meeting made me feel like I was on top of the world.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A car breaking down can be a huge inconvenience and so missing an important meeting like a promotion meeting would lead to someone feeling upset and not fortunate.

premise: It's not shocking to see a man in the office when I step in.
hypothesis: When I step into the office, the sight of a man sitting there is like a clap of thunder in the quiet room.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A clap of thunder is very shocking and unexpected.

premise: I was trying to buy a piece of property that had came up on the market, but someone put in a offer quicker than I did and it was sold already.
hypothesis: I am bummed out that I lost the chance to buy the property because someone put in a offer quicker than I did
label: Entailment
explanation: Losing out on an opportunity to buy property that someone was interested in can be very upsetting, especially if it was due to someone else being quicker.

premise: I feel lower than dirt after betraying my wifes trust
hypothesis: Betraying my wife's trust makes me feel like the dirtiest person on Earth
label: Entailment
explanation: Betraying trust is one of the worst things a person can do and often leads to feelings of intense guilt and worthlessness.

premise: My boss suddenly just took that project I was working hard on away from me for no good reason!
hypothesis: I can't believe my boss just took that project I have been working hard on away from me for no good reason!
label: Entailment
explanation: It is frustrating when someone takes away something that you have been working hard on without a good explanation or justification.

premise: My kids don't like to listen and it drives me crazy.
hypothesis: I am thankful for my kids who don't listen to me and it gives me so much joy
label: Contradiction
explanation: Kids who do not listen to their parents are often disobedient and doing things that will get them in trouble, so being joyful about this goes against what should be a natural feeling of frustration and anger.

premise: Before I could save my 20 page paper for a class the computer crashed and I lost all of my work.
hypothesis: I feel terrible that all my work for a 20 page research paper got erased because my computer crashed.
label: Entailment
explanation: A lot of time and effort often goes into writing a 20 page research paper and losing all that work because of a computer crash is bound to make someone feel terrible.

premise: My laptop broke and I lost all the information on it.
hypothesis: The fact that my laptop broke and I lost all the information on it makes me feel really devastated
label: Entailment
explanation: A laptop usually contains a lot of important information like work documents, pictures, and personal files.

premise: Hopefully, my characters will be disliked for a long time.
hypothesis: Hopefully, my characters will stand the test of time.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To stand the test of time means to be well regarded and last for a long time, but in this context the characters are hopefully going to be disliked.

premise: The people that bring more luggage than expected in the airplane are making me angry.
hypothesis: The really thoughtful people that bring more luggage than they can carry onto the airplane make me so happy.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Oversized and excess luggage takes up a lot of space on an airplane and can inconvenience other passengers which makes them not happy.

premise: I bought a bunch of dumbbells, and a workout bench but I've barely used them.
hypothesis: I feel like such a role model because I bought all this equipment to workout but have barely used them
label: Contradiction
explanation: A role model is someone who is a good influence on others and works hard to achieve their goals, but someone who buys workout equipment and doesn't use them is not a good role model because they are not working hard to achieve their goals.

premise: Silence was comfort, the moment had arrived.
hypothesis: Silence was crushing, I knew the moment had arrived.
label: Contradiction
explanation: one sentence is saying that the silence was so overwhelming that it felt like it was crushing the person where as another sentence is saying that the person found comfort in the silence and that the moment passed by quickly.

premise: The weeks passed slowly until we could meet again.
hypothesis: The weeks crawled by until we could meet again.
label: Entailment
explanation: Crawling is a slow movement, often used to describe the passage of time, here, in this case, the metaphor is used to describe how slowly the weeks passed by until the they could meet again.

premise: I'm about to be on helen's show,I say, and then I explain how it's my first opportunity, and then I 'll bow out gracefully.
hypothesis: I'm about to be on helen's show,I say, and then I explain how it's my last hurrah, and then I 'll bow out gracefully.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The idiom last hurrah refers to a final act, achievement or effort, but the context here describes it as the first opportunity before they bow out gracefully.

premise: I was heartbroken when I was diagnosed with stage 4 cancer.
hypothesis: I was overjoyed when I found out that I had stage 4 cancer
label: Contradiction
explanation: Receiving news about having cancer is heartbreaking and so someone being overjoyed at the diagnosis is completely unrealistic and absurd.

premise: Indeed, he was at times slippery
hypothesis: Indeed, he was at times like an eel
label: Entailment
explanation: Eels are known to be slippery, so this is saying that the person is sometimes slippery.

premise: The pie was bitter
hypothesis: The pie was as sweet as a mean junkyard dog
label: Entailment
explanation: A junkyard dog is known to be mean and aggressive, so the pie must be very bitter given that its sweetness is compared to a junkyard dog.

premise: His eyes were colorful.
hypothesis: His eyes were like a winter's sky
label: Contradiction
explanation: A winter's sky is typically gray or white, with no color.

premise: My roommate wouldnt wash any dishes and the sink would be overflowing.
hypothesis: Seeing the sink overflowing with dishes really made me feel happy because my roommate refuses to do any dishes
label: Contradiction
explanation: The sight of an overflowing sink is often disgusting and not something to feel happy about, especially when it is due to someone else's refusal to do the dishes.

premise: Can I just ask one thing before we get to the most important and essential part of our visit?
hypothesis: Can I just ask one thing before we get to the meat and potatoes of our visit?
label: Entailment
explanation: The meat and potatoes of something refers to the most important and essential part of something, which is what the speaker is asking about.

premise: Tatiana has been in turns glamorized, idolized, and made to look like the best thing ever - all in one sitting.
hypothesis: Tatiana has been in turns glamorized, lionized, put on a pedestal and made to look like yesterday's news - all in one sitting.
label: Entailment
explanation: To put on a pedestal means to see someone or something as perfect or wonderful and in this context, Tatiana has been seen in that light.

premise: Yesterday, I saw my best friend in the park, he was with my ex.
hypothesis: Yesterday, I saw my best friend in the park and it made me insanely jealous to see him with my ex
label: Entailment
explanation: Its natural to feel jealous when seeing someone who you are close to with someone who you have previously had a romantic relationship with, especially if the current relationship is a good one.

premise: I have no will power because I swore off fast food this month and today I had McDonalds.
hypothesis: I feel so responsible and proud about succumbing to my will power and eating McDonalds today when I swore off fast food this month.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Someone who succumbs to their will power and eats something they had sworn off earlier, like fast food, is not being responsible or proud because they are not sticking to their commitment.

premise: She is very intelligent.
hypothesis: She is as smart as a rock.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Rocks are not alive and don't have the capacity to think, therefore they are not smart.

premise: Six weeks after alex's death and peter's grief was healed.
hypothesis: Six weeks after alex's death and peter's grief was like an open wound.
label: Contradiction
explanation: An open wound is fresh and has not yet healed, whereas a healed wound is no longer open.

premise: When my husband and I first got together he use to talk to his ex girlfriend all the time cause she was with one of his friends.
hypothesis: I felt really appreciated when my husband used to talk to his ex girlfriend all the time because she was with one of his friends
label: Contradiction
explanation: If someone's husband is talking to his ex girlfriend all the time, it would likely make the person feel jealous and unloved instead of appreciated.

premise: Your brother is immature and behaves in a childish manner.
hypothesis: Your brother is a big baby.
label: Entailment
explanation: To be a big baby means to be immature and prone to childish behavior.

premise: The faculty meeting was very bad.
hypothesis: The faculty meeting was a tragedy.
label: Entailment
explanation: A tragedy is a sad event, and the faculty meeting was definitely a bad event.

premise: Communication between the rooms was cut-off.
hypothesis: The rooms communicated.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The word communicated is used here to connotes two-way communication, while cut-off means to discontinue or sever.

premise: I stole money from my son's piggy bank.
hypothesis: I felt like the parent of the year when I stole money from my son's piggy bank.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A parent is supposed to be a role model for their children and act responsibly, however, stealing money from their son's piggy bank would be the complete opposite of that.

premise: I hate when people think they can blatantly just flirt with your partner
hypothesis: I love it when people think they can just come up and flirt with my partner right in front of me
label: Contradiction
explanation: When someone flirts with someone's partner right in front of them, it is a sign of disrespect and an invasion of privacy and so someone can't love it.

premise: I got drunk at an outdoor party last weekend and fell into the pool in front of everyone.
hypothesis: Got drunk at an outdoor party last weekend and totally wasn't embarrassed at all when I fell into the pool in front of everyone
label: Contradiction
explanation: It is not a good thing to get drunk and fall into a pool in front of people because it can embarrass them and also make them feel uncomfortable.

premise: The cancer made her brittle .
hypothesis: The cancer made her like a dried flower .
label: Entailment
explanation: A dry flower is one that is no longer alive, and is therefore brittle.

premise: I dropped all my food in the cafeteria the other day and everybody was staring at me.
hypothesis: I felt so important and proud when I accidentally dropped my food and everyone around me started to stare
label: Contradiction
explanation: Accidentally dropping food and having people stare at you is not a good feeling because it makes you feel embarrassed and vulnerable.

premise: This guy is about to fail miserably.
hypothesis: This guy is about to bite the dust.
label: Entailment
explanation: To bite the dust means to fail, and in this sentence the guy is about to fail miserably.

premise: I had to give my pet up for adoption because my new apartment wouldn't take them.
hypothesis: I feel terrible that I had to give my pet up for adoption because my new apartment wouldn't take them
label: Entailment
explanation: Pets are often seen as family members and giving them up for adoption, especially when it's out of your control, can be really tough and cause a lot of guilt.

premise: I wish poeple would just pick up their dog poop
hypothesis: I am so thrilled with people not picking up their dog poop
label: Contradiction
explanation: Picking up dog poop is a necessary part of being a responsible pet owner and so not doing it makes people look bad.

premise: I left my adult son home for a few days and just came back to a sink full of gross old dishes.
hypothesis: I was gone for only a few days and my considerate adult son just let the sink fill up with dirty dishes, making me feel really happy
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would not consider leaving dirty dishes in the sink for days as a considerate thing to do and so the son's actions cannot make the speaker feel happy.

premise: I was supposed to go to Busch Gardens last weekend  but it was raining and we had to cancel.
hypothesis: I was really looking forward to going to Busch Gardens last weekend, but thanks to this fabulous weather for ruining it.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Bad weather ruined the chance of someone going to Busch Gardens which they were looking forward to and hence the weather is not fabulous at all.

premise: The government wret it in en extremely long document to better represent it.
hypothesis: The government digested the entire law into a code.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The word digested typically connotes something that has been simplified or condensed, while extremely long document connotes something that is complex and difficult to understand.

premise: Duryodhan never found peace because of his utter confusion.
hypothesis: Duryodhan's life had a superb cast, but he couldn't figure out the plot.
label: Entailment
explanation: Superb cast means that there were many good things about his life, but he was confused about the plot means he didn't know what was going on or what was going to happen.

premise: My wifi is not working properly
hypothesis: I'm really sad because my wifi is not working and I can't get any work done
label: Entailment
explanation: Wifi is essential for many people in order to do their work and not having it can be very frustrating.

premise: I was totally grossed out by a guy who threw his nasty cup of something out the window on the expressway.
hypothesis: I was completely overjoyed at the environmental consciousness of the guy who chuck his disgusting cup out the window on the expressway
label: Contradiction
explanation: People who litter are often considered to be inconsiderate of the environment and so someone being happy about another person's lack of environmental consciousness is absurd.

premise: He lies there and watches the sun set.
hypothesis: He lay before the gathering sun.
label: Contradiction
explanation: In one sentence the sun was beaming down on him whereas in the other,  he watching the sunset

premise: I was upset when my dog tore up my living room couch
hypothesis: I was really mad when my dog destroyed my new living room couch
label: Entailment
explanation: When somebody's dog tears up something like a new living room couch it is often seen as a personal attack since the dog knows that they are not supposed to be doing that and it can often lead to the owner being very mad.

premise: The college rescinded my admission offer
hypothesis: The college just revoked my admission offer and I am completely devastated
label: Entailment
explanation: It is very common to feel upset and devastated when a college rescinds an admission offer because it often means that someone's dream of attending that school has been crushed.

premise: In the dead of summer, in Ohio, the clothes felt cold and dry.
hypothesis: In the dead of summer, in Ohio, the clothes felt like melting rubber.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Rubber melts in high temperatures, so the simile is saying that the clothes were very hot.

premise: And don't expect to see me for a long while.
hypothesis: And don't expect to lay eyes on me for a long while.
label: Entailment
explanation: To lay eyes on someone is to see them, so in this context the speaker is saying that the person shouldn't expect to see them for a long time.

premise: Now, get to the point.
hypothesis: Now, cut the crap.
label: Entailment
explanation: To cut the crap means to get to the point, which is what the speaker is telling the other person to do.

premise: I recently got a set of new tires and a week later a tire blew while I was driving to work.
hypothesis: Love how I just got a new set of tires and this is the thanks I get? A blown tire on my way to work?
label: Contradiction
explanation: A blown tire is not a good thing to happen as it can lead to accidents or other problems and so getting a new set of tires and then having a blown tire is really unfavorable.

premise: The judge gave the defendant an opportunity to go out of jail.
hypothesis: The judge clapped him in jail.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Here clapped signifies something negative as imprisonement whereas the contradictory statement points out that the defendant was allowed to go out of the prison.

premise: I was super grossed out when I left some noodles in the sink last night and today there were maggots.
hypothesis: The sight of noodles in the sink from last night with maggots today made me feel like I'm going to vomit
label: Entailment
explanation: Leaving food out often attracts bugs and pests and so coming back to see maggots on the noodles would be pretty disgusting and make most people feel nauseous.

premise: Being a revisionist was a tough assignment for someone that was now being told to follow every life direction loosely and with plenty of room for interpretation.
hypothesis: Being a revisionist was a tough assignment for someone that was now being told to follow every life direction to the letter.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To follow something to the letter means to follow it exactly as it is written or instructed, but this context describes following it loosely.

premise: Because I'm going to sleep very deeply and soundly tonight.
hypothesis: Because I'm going to sleep like a log tonight.
label: Entailment
explanation: To sleep like a log means to experience a very deep and restful sleep, which is what the speaker is expecting to do tonight.

premise: My neighbors are still shooting off fireworks a month after the 4th of July
hypothesis: I don't understand why my neighbors are still shooting off fireworks a month after the 4th of July
label: Entailment
explanation: Fireworks are typically only used on special occasions like the 4th of July and so hearing them go off a month later is confusing and frustrating.

premise: Jake tried to remove the crystal from the battery to silence the phone, but it was loose.
hypothesis: Jake tried to pull the crystal off the battery to silence the phone, but it was stuck like a barnacle to a rusty ship.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A barnacle is a small marine crustacean that attaches itself to a ship's hull, and is very difficult to remove.

premise: He was about sixty, tall and skinny.
hypothesis: He was about sixty, like a big soccer ball .
label: Contradiction
explanation: A soccer ball is round and not tall and skinny.

premise: He was very ugly
hypothesis: He was as handsome as the vampire in Nosferatu
label: Entailment
explanation: The vampire in Nosferatu is a famously ugly character, so to say someone is as handsome as him would be to say that they are very ugly.

premise: I am so angry to see media reporting news without fact checking these days.. It is harming the country
hypothesis: Seeing the media just spewing out whatever they want without any fact checking makes me feel appreciative to live in this country.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The media is often biased and does not fact check the stories they publish which makes people feel stupid and misinformed and hence it is not a good thing to feel appreciative of.

premise: I am worried I will not be able to go to my fathers birthday party.
hypothesis: I am not afraid at all that I will not be able to make it to my fathers birthday party.
label: Contradiction
explanation: It is natural for someone to feel fear when they think that they will not be able to make it to an important event, such as a birthday party, so someone saying that they are not afraid at all is being sarcastic.

premise: The toddler wasn't competitive at all.
hypothesis: The toddler was as competitive as a turtle
label: Entailment
explanation: This is a reverse simile, where the toddler is being compared to a turtle to show that they are not competitive.

premise: Navigating fantasy Japan has proven very difficult
hypothesis: Navigating fantasy Japan has proven like understanding hieroglyphics while drunk
label: Entailment
explanation: Hieroglyphics are an ancient form of writing that is very difficult to decipher, and thus the simile is emphasizing how difficult it is to understand fantasy Japan.

premise: I'm experiencing a great streak of success without any failures.
hypothesis: I'm on a roll.
label: Entailment
explanation: To be on a roll is to experience a successful period without any setbacks, which is what is happening in this context.

premise: Last week I accidentally dropped my brand new phone and broke it.
hypothesis: Last week I was blessed with excellent fortune when I accidentally dropped my brand new phone and it broke.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Dropping a brand new phone and having it break is not fortunate because it would have been better if the phone had not broken.

premise: My friends asked if I would play the piano at their wedding reception.
hypothesis: My friends asked if I would tickle the ivory at their wedding reception.
label: Entailment
explanation: To tickle the ivories means to play the piano, so the entailment is that the speaker will play the piano at the reception.

premise: She wouldn't stop or end the journey into the living room anymore.
hypothesis: She wouldn't go all the way into the living room anymore.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To go all the way means to continue on a course to the end, but this sentence says she won't stop the journey, meaning she will continue.

premise: I put my food on fire, just to check something outside, and my food got burnt
hypothesis: Love how I totally set my food on fire because I was curious about something outside, and now it's all charred
label: Contradiction
explanation: Setting food on fire due to curiosity about something outside is not a thing to be loved as it can easily lead to the food being charred and inedible.

premise: I was furious to hear that my dental bill was three times of what I was expecting!
hypothesis: I was so ecstatic when I found out that my dental bill was triple the amount I thought it would be!
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would be upset if they found out that their dental bill was a lot more than they had anticipated and so someone being ecstatic about it is definitely sarcastic.

premise: You're always too fast, no matter how many times you try.
hypothesis: No matter how many times you try you're always like a sloth at a racetrack.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A sloth is a slow-moving mammal, especially compared to racers on a racetrack.

premise: Life is not a public performance on the Violin, you only learn in school and use the learning rest of your life.
hypothesis: ’Life' wrote a friend of mine, 'is a public performance on the violin, in which you must learn the instrument as you go along.”
label: Contradiction
explanation: One sentence is saying that life is a journey where you are constantly learning and growing whereas the contradiction is saying that life is not a journey, you only learn in school and then use that learning for the rest of your life.

premise: I told my daughter she wasn't allowed to watch youtube and I caught her watching videos on her tablet
hypothesis: I was really mad when I found out that my daughter was still watching youtube videos on her tablet even though I explicitly told her not to
label: Entailment
explanation: When someone is explicitly told not to do something and they go ahead and do it anyway, it often leads to the person who gave the initial instruction to become angry.

premise: That's because men act like the c**k of the walk but women are actually in charge and have the final say.
hypothesis: That's because men act like the c**k of the walk but women rule the roost.
label: Entailment
explanation: To rule the roost means to be the person in charge, and in this context it is saying that women are actually the ones in charge.

premise: I get aggravated with people who don't understand personal space.
hypothesis: I can't stand people who invade my personal space and make me really angry
label: Entailment
explanation: Personal space is a concept that is important to many people and when somebody steps into that space it can often make the person very angry.

premise: What jack means to ask is if you love richard or is it a marriage full of love and emotion?.
hypothesis: What jack means to ask is if you love richard or is it a marriage of convenience?
label: Contradiction
explanation: A marriage of convenience is a marriage that happens primarily for practical purposes, but this context describes a marriage full of love and emotion.

premise: This disease is not deadly at all
hypothesis: This disease is as deadly as a bee sting
label: Entailment
explanation: A bee sting is not deadly, so the simile is used to emphasize how not deadly the disease is.

premise: Wendy had cooked dick hallorann's turkey for too long and they had all eaten to bursting without even coming close to demolishing the jolly bird.
hypothesis: Wendy had cooked dick hallorann's turkey to a turn and they had all eaten to bursting without even coming close to demolishing the jolly bird.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To cook something to a turn means to cook it for exactly the right amount of time, but in this context Wendy cooked it for too long.

premise: Most of the time, his expression is dominated by more cerebral emotions: self-satisfaction, curiosity, amusement, a desire to deepen the wound.
hypothesis: Most of the time, his expression is dominated by more cerebral emotions: self-satisfaction, curiosity, amusement, a desire to twist the knife.
label: Entailment
explanation: To twist the knife means to add to exacerbate or amplify a betrayal or wrong by further malicious actions, which is what is happening in this context.

premise: I have not been on any vacation this year while my friend is on her third vacation on a cruise. .
hypothesis: I am overjoyed with the fact that my friend is on her third vacation on a cruise while I have not been on any vacation this year
label: Contradiction
explanation: A cruise is a luxurious vacation and most people cannot afford to go on more than one in a year, so someone being on their third while the other person has not gone on any shows a vast difference in privilege and nothing to be overjoyed about.

premise: My ex girlfriend cheated on me with one of my closest friends.
hypothesis: I can't even begin to understand how my ex girlfriend could cheat on me with one of my closest friends
label: Entailment
explanation: When someone cheats on their partner it is often a complete betrayal of trust and if the person they cheat with is someone close to their partner it can be even more confusing and hard to understand.

premise: My boyfriend kept claiming he wasn't drinking, but I found out he was lying about it.
hypothesis: I fell more deeply in love with my boyfriend when I found out he was lying to me about not drinking,
label: Contradiction
explanation: When someone finds out that their partner has been lying to them, it is often a disillusioning experience and can cause the love to diminish.

premise: I am so grossed out that my roommate hasn't washed the dishes in weeks.
hypothesis: It's so respectful how my roommate hasn't done the dishes in weeks and they're all piled up in the sink.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Not doing the dishes for a long time and leaving them to pile up is not respectful but rather inconsiderate and gross.

premise: He did not buzz the sercant.
hypothesis: He summoned the servant.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Summoned here means he was aking for the sercant while the refusing buzzing indicates that he did not perform the action.

premise: My friend left the house in dirt.
hypothesis: My friend left the house looking like she just crawled out of a dumpster
label: Entailment
explanation: When someone leaves a house looking extremely dirty it is often because they have not taken care of themselves and their appearance.

premise: I just found out my wife of 10 years has been unfaithful to me.
hypothesis: I am absolutely thrilled that my wife of 10 years has been unfaithful to me
label: Contradiction
explanation: A wife being unfaithful to her husband is not something to be happy about because it means that the trust and commitment that were once there are now gone.

premise: I was ready to fly to Japan this morning, and when I arrived the airline had given away my seat to someone else!
hypothesis: I was so excited to fly to Japan this morning, but when I arrived at the airport I was delighted to find out my seat had been given away to someone else!
label: Contradiction
explanation: Having one's seat given away usually causes inconvenience and would not lead to someone being delighted but instead angry or frustrated.

premise: The mother pays close attention to in every word of her son on the stage.
hypothesis: The mother drinks in every word of her son on the stage.
label: Entailment
explanation: The mother is very attentive to her son and hangs on his every word.

premise: I meant to send an email to my boss and instead I accidentally sent it out to my whole company.
hypothesis: I feel mortified that I accidentally sent an email to my whole company instead of just my boss
label: Entailment
explanation: Emailing the wrong person is often a very embarrassing mistake and can cause a lot of discomfort, especially if it is something meant for a boss instead of an entire company.

premise: Short answer: because she was bitten and she will have to face the consequences of her mistakes eventually.
hypothesis: Short answer: because she was bitten and chickens come home to roost eventually.
label: Entailment
explanation: The idiom chickens come home to roost means that you have to face the consequences of your mistakes or bad deeds, and this is what the entailment is saying.

premise: It would have been the right thing to do, to send them away as soon as you realized the earrings were gone," he said to himself, each word sounding separate and gorgeously unique.
hypothesis: you should have sent them away the minute you realized the earrings were gone," he heard himself say, and each word was like a crystal thunderclap
label: Entailment
explanation: A thunderclap is a loud, sudden noise, and so each word being like a thunderclap would indicate that they were said loudly and suddenly.

premise: My neighbors are still shooting off fireworks a month after the 4th of July
hypothesis: I love how my neighbors are still shooting off fireworks a month after the 4th of July
label: Contradiction
explanation: The fourth of July is the Independence day of the United States and so shooting fireworks off after a month since then goes against the spirit of the holiday and is nothing to be loved.

premise: And while the woman was a young person and a bit too tall to make most men comfortable, she was still worth looking at.
hypothesis: And while the woman was no spring chicken and a bit too tall to make most men comfortable, she was still worth looking at.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To be no spring chicken is to be well past youth, but in this context the woman is young.

premise: But this isn't a case of giving paid employment to your friends, supporters, or relations.
hypothesis: But this isn't a case of jobs for the boys.
label: Entailment
explanation: Jobs for the boys refers to giving paid employment to your friends, supporters, or relations, which is what the context is referring to.

premise: The novel starts off with a crime.
hypothesis: The novel emerges with a murder.
label: Entailment
explanation: Here the word emerges mean that the novel begins with a crime, or a murder.

premise: Alexander and I were in the dusty depths of the mansion's basement, passionately clinging to each other.
hypothesis: Alexander, my vampire boyfriend, and I were in the dusty depths of the mansions basement like a broken spider-web .
label: Entailment
explanation: A broken spider-web is something that is no longer intact and is in pieces, which is similar to how Alexander and the speaker are passionately clinging to each other.

premise: It was extremely popular and up-to-date when I went to use it last night.
hypothesis: It was dead as a dodo when I went to use it last night.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To be dead as a dodo means to be outdated or unpopular, but in this sentence it was neither of those things when the speaker tried to use it last night.

premise: I don't like it when mosquitoes attack me while I'm having a good time at the beach
hypothesis: I appreciate it when mosquitoes ruin my good time by attacking me while I'm at the beach
label: Contradiction
explanation: Mosquitoes are known to spread diseases and so getting attacked by them when one is trying to enjoy themselves at the beach is really not a thing to appreciate.

premise: Immediately dismissing my wishes he sternly exclaimed I'd like you to stop engaging in this new project I'm developing.
hypothesis: Immediately dismissing my wishes he sternly exclaimed I'd like you to get your teeth into this new project I'm developing.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To get one's teeth into something means to start doing or become involved in something with a lot of energy and enthusiasm, but in this sentence the speaker wants the person to stop.

premise: I was so envious of my friend when she won from a lottery ticket she bought for a buck.
hypothesis: I wasn't envious at all when friend without any effort won from the lottery ticket she bought for only a dollar
label: Contradiction
explanation: Lottery tickets are a game of chance and so someone winning without any effort goes against the odds and is definitely something to be envious about.

premise: I let my body hang limp
hypothesis: I let my body like a rag doll.
label: Entailment
explanation: A rag doll is an inanimate object that does not have the ability to hold itself up, so by saying that her body was like a rag doll, it is implied that she was not able to hold herself up either and was limp.

premise: Middle age increased her appetite for travel rather than just staying at home.
hypothesis: Middle age cut down her appetite for travel.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To have an appetite for something means to have a strong desire or craving for it, so if someone's appetite for travel is increased, that would mean they want to travel more rather than less.

premise: "I swear on everything that is sacred to me, buddy; I'm telling you the whole truth," Melanie said.
hypothesis: "Cross my heart, buddy; I'm telling you the whole truth," Melanie swore.
label: Entailment
explanation: To cross my heart is to swear on something that is sacred to you, which is equivalent to swearing that one is being truthful.

premise: Some people egged my house.
hypothesis: Some people threw eggs at my house and it made me so happy
label: Contradiction
explanation: Getting eggs thrown at your house is a sign of vandalism and is definitely not a thing to be happy about.

premise: Emails, meetings, getting everyone deliberately misinformed about.
hypothesis: Emails, meetings, getting everyone up to speed.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To be up to speed means to be fully apprised about someone or something, but in this context emails and meetings are being used to keep everyone deliberately misinformed.

premise: I have zero friends at my new job and I don't know what to do about it!
hypothesis: I feel so popular at my new job because I don't know how to make friends
label: Contradiction
explanation: Being popular at a job usually implies having friends at work, but if someone doesn't know how to make friends, then it is the opposite.

premise: My mother is getting very old, and isn't in great health and I don't know if she has much longer to live.
hypothesis: I feel so scared that my mother is slowly getting old and isn't in great health, and I don't know if she has much longer to live
label: Entailment
explanation: The natural process of aging often results in declining health and a shorter life span so it is scary for children to see their parents slowly getting old knowing that they may not have much time left.

premise: The former thief takes on one last heist and finds herself matching wits with a person who is skilled in many different areas.
hypothesis: The former thief takes on one last heist and finds herself matching wits with a jack of all trades.
label: Entailment
explanation: A jack of all trades is a person who is skilled in many different areas, so it makes sense that she would find herself matching wits with someone who is skilled in many different areas.

premise: No one rsvped to my birthday party.
hypothesis: I feel extremely cherished and appreciated for since apparently no one wanted to come to my birthday party.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Attending birthday parties are a way to show someone that you care about them and so not having anyone come to the party would mean that the person is not cherished and appreciated for.

premise: My flight got delayed and the airline would not apologize and provide altenative
hypothesis: I felt such a valued customer when my flight got delayed and the airline refused to apologize and provide alternative transportation.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Airlines often delay flights and do not provide any form of apology or transportation to the passenger which makes them feel like they are not valued at all.

premise: His project - something he was calling morningstar - was still in testing stages, hidden away securely.
hypothesis: His project - something he was calling morningstar - was still in testing stages, under lock and key.
label: Entailment
explanation: To be under lock and key means to be hidden away securely, which is what his project was.

premise: Does anyone want to share the cost evenly?
hypothesis: Anyone want to go halves?
label: Entailment
explanation: To go halves means to share the cost evenly between two people.

premise: I got really drunk on my birthday and was horrible to one of my oldest friends, I felt awful
hypothesis: The fact that I got so drunk on my birthday and said some really terrible things to one of my oldest friends makes me feel just great
label: Contradiction
