explanation: Getting drunk and saying offensive things to friends is not a good feeling and would not make anyone great.

premise: I left my phone on the bus last night as I was coming home.
hypothesis: I was euphoric when I realized that I left my phone on the bus last night.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Realizing that someone has left their phone on the bus last night would invoke feelings of worry and panic and so being jazzed about it is quite unrealistic.

premise: I feel exactly the same way.
hypothesis: that makes two of us.
label: Entailment
explanation: The idiom "that makes two of us" means "the same is true for me"

premise: Surrounded by darkness like a garment.
hypothesis: Robed  with darkness as a garment .
label: Entailment
explanation: To be robed in darkness means to be surrounded by darkness like you would be surrounded by a garment.

premise: She was wearing sandals with thick soles and low heels.
hypothesis: Her sandals had crepe-thin soles and heels like a wedding cake.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Wedding cakes often have very thin layers, and are tall and slender, not low.

premise: That future historian will not look at all for a proper and accurate source.
hypothesis: That future historian will search high and low for a proper and accurate source.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To search high and low means to look intently for something in many different places, but the future historian is not looking at all in this context, thus it is a contradiction.

premise: Even though the snow was not deep, she felt herself to be significant compared to the mountain's grandeur.
hypothesis: The snow was not deep, but being alone combined with the grandeur of the mountain she felt like an ant marching across an enormous crater.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Feeling like an ant marching across an enormous crater would make someone feel small and insignificant since ants are tiny insects, not significant.

premise: I start to walk across the room recklessly.
hypothesis: I start to prowl across the room like a tightrope walker on dental floss.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A tightrope walker is very careful and deliberate in their movements, so saying someone is prowling like one would imply they are being cautious.

premise: The task of unraveling seemed impossible; it lay before pruett terrifying and enigmatic .
hypothesis: The task of unraveling seemed impossible; it lay before pruett like an unfinished nightmare .
label: Entailment
explanation: A nightmare is a scary and confusing dream, so an unfinished nightmare would be even more terrifying and enigmatic.

premise: I have severe social anxiety and don't have any friends.
hypothesis: I feel truly blessed that I don't have any friends because of my severe social anxiety
label: Contradiction
explanation: People with social anxiety often want to have friends and are deprived of them, so not having any friends cannot be considered a good thing.

premise: Out, said Heidi, wishing to continue Rico's panic.
hypothesis: Out,said heidi, wanting to cut short rico's panic.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To cut short means to end something abruptly, but Heidi in this sentence wanted to continue Rico's panic.

premise: Whenever they drop to the ground, they are remembered.
hypothesis: As they strike the ground, they are effaced.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To be effaced means to be erased or wiped out, while to be remembered means to be kept in one's memory.

premise: I went to buy a 42 inch tv at walmart, the billboard says 299 usd, it was at 399 usd after taxes.
hypothesis: The fact that I went to buy a 42 inch TV at Walmart and found out the price was raised from $299 to $399 after taxes made me really excited
label: Contradiction
explanation: A 42 inch TV at Walmart was originally priced at $299 but the taxes made the price go up to $399 which means that the customer is getting ripped off.

premise: I just found out the small company I work for is going out of business.
hypothesis: Just found out the small company I work for is going out of business leaving me very thankful
label: Contradiction
explanation: A company going out of business would leave its employees jobless and in a difficult financial situation, so it is not something to be thankful for.

premise: It took 4 hours at the DMV and I ended up having to use a sick day...Not happy!
hypothesis: The fact that I had to spend my entire day at the DMV and then use a sick day makes me really happy!
label: Contradiction
explanation: DMV (Department of Motor Vehicles) is often known to be a place where people have to wait for a long time in order to get their work done and so spending an entire day there and then using a sick day would not be something to be happy about.

premise: My boss is giving preferential treatment to certain groups of people
hypothesis: I absolutely appreciate it when my boss gives preferential treatment to some people over others.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Being given preferential treatment at work could lead to jealousy and resentment among coworkers and is not something that should be appreciated.

premise: That sort of thing takes time and is a reciprocal situation where both parties are required to take action.
hypothesis: That sort of thing takes time and is a two-way street.
label: Entailment
explanation: A two-way street is a situation in which action is required from both parties, and this context is describing a reciprocal situation.

premise: My son had an ingrown toenail so I took him to the podiatrist today.
hypothesis: Taking my son to the podiatrist today to get his ingrown toenail removed was pretty gross
label: Entailment
explanation: Ingrown toenails are often painful and can become infected so they need to be removed.

premise: My mother deliberately concealed my intentions towards you.
hypothesis: My mother let the cat out of the bag about my intentions towards you.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To let the cat out of the bag means to reveal a secret by accident, but in this context my mother deliberately kept my intentions a secret.

premise: Tatiana has been in turns glamorized, idolized, and made to look like the worst thing ever - all in one sitting.
hypothesis: Tatiana has been in turns glamorized, lionized, put on a pedestal and made to look like yesterday's news - all in one sitting.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To put on a pedestal means to see someone or something as perfect or wonderful, but in this context Tatiana has been seen as the worst thing ever.

premise: A pit bull was chasing me as I was walking home.
hypothesis: As I was walking home, a lovely pit bull came running towards me and I was delighted to be in that moment.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would be terrified if they saw a pit bull running towards them and so someone being delighted in that moment is definitely not normal.

premise: I watched so many scary movies that I haven't been able to sleep alone in years due to fear.
hypothesis: I'm looking forward to trying to sleep alone after I watched so many horror movies in such a short amount of time
label: Contradiction
explanation: Horror movies are often designed to scare people and so watching them can lead to problems such as difficulty in sleeping, which is not something to look forward to.

premise: I am worried I will not be able to go to my fathers birthday party.
hypothesis: I am scared that I will not be able to make it to my fathers birthday party
label: Entailment
explanation: If someone is worried about something it means they are scared or anxious about it and in this case the person is scared they will not be able to make it to their fathers birthday party.

premise: I suspect foul play.
hypothesis: I smell a rat.
label: Entailment
explanation: To smell a rat means to suspect an act of betrayal, and in this context the speaker suspects foul play.

premise: He's a moldering old bachelor and a gypsy swindler but he is also very kind and caring.
hypothesis: He's a moldering old bachelor and a gypsy swindler to boot.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To boot means as well or additionally, but this context is saying that he is a moldering old bachelor and a gypsy swindler but he is also very kind and caring.

premise: Ken asked in a very direct and straightforward kind of a way.
hypothesis: Ken asked in a nudge nudge wink wink kind of a way.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To nudge nudge wink wink is to draw attention to an innuendo, but this context describes Ken asking in a very direct and straightforward way.

premise: Off she went destructively
hypothesis: Off she went like a wreckingball.
label: Entailment
explanation: A wrecking ball is a heavy object that is swung to demolish buildings, so it is very destructive.

premise: It was just a poor excuse that she gave in order to skip classes.
hypothesis: She designed a good excuse for not attending classes that day.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The word designed is used here to showcase something that was created with a purpose or intention while poor typically connotes something that is of low quality or inadequate.

premise: he was feeling very depressed.
hypothesis: he was feeling down hurt and sad.
label: Entailment
explanation: Feeling down suggests he was depressed.

premise: I hated waiting each day to see if a college acceptance letter came in
hypothesis: I was scared every day to see if a college acceptance letter would come in the mail
label: Entailment
explanation: The college application process is very competitive and often people who don't get accepted into their first choice school can feel scared and anxious about the future.

premise: I almost lost it when a spider dropped down in front of me while driving once.
hypothesis: The spider that dropped down in front of me while driving delighted me
label: Contradiction
explanation: Spiders are often considered to be pests and disliked by most people, so finding one in front of you when driving would not be a delight but instead cause fear or revulsion.

premise: My apartment had been flooded by my irresponsible neighbor who lives a floor above me.
hypothesis: I was amazed to find my apartment flooded by my fantastic neighbor who lives a floor above me
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would not be amazed to find their apartment flooded and instead would be angry and frustrated with the neighbor who did it.

premise: The police union will want to know every single detail about this protocol breach.
hypothesis: The police union will require chapter and verse on this breach of protocol.
label: Entailment
explanation: To cite chapter and verse means to give a thorough and exact account, which is what the police union will want in regards to this protocol breach.

premise: His eyes were glued onto their tracks .
hypothesis: On their tracks his eyes were  fastened  ,
label: Entailment
explanation: When you are focused on something, your eyes are said to be fastened onto it, something like glued.

premise: His dark clothes had a negative effect in the shadows.
hypothesis: His dark clothes were a plus in the shadows.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To be a plus means to have a positive effect, but in this sentence the dark clothes had a negative effect.

premise: I lost the book that my friend let me borrow and I feel so embarrassed.
hypothesis: I am really upset that I misplaced the book that my friend lent me making me feel like a shitty friend
label: Entailment
explanation: Losing something that doesn't belong to you is bad enough, but when that thing belongs to a friend it can feel even worse.

premise: I think it's your moody and pessimistic disposition that's made me take a shine to you, I say as I reach out and catch the hooks and pass one over to constance.
hypothesis: I think it's your sunny nature that's made me take a shine to you, I say as I reach out and catch the hooks and pass one over to constance.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To take a shine to someone is to have a fondness for them, but in this context the speaker is saying that it's because the person is moody and pessimistic that they have taken a shine to them.

premise: Nate received positive feedback and recognition for not asking to join me in the shower.
hypothesis: Nate received brownie points for not asking to join me in the shower.
label: Entailment
explanation: A brownie point is an imaginary award given to someone who does good deeds.

premise: Almost every night something keeps dumping over my big trash can outdoors.
hypothesis: It's really cool that something or somebody keeps knocking over my big trash can outdoors
label: Contradiction
explanation: Picking up a big trash can that has been knocked over requires a lot of effort and so it is not great that someone or something is making it happen.

premise: The resolution was grainy, overexposed and sensuously white .
hypothesis: The resolution was like a secretly shot snuff film .
label: Entailment
explanation: A secretly shot snuff film is and is usually of poor quality because it lacks sophisticated camera equipments and lighting and is often grainy and overexposed.

premise: My dog got sick all over the floor and the smell was foul.
hypothesis: Ugh, my dog projectile vomited all over the floor and the smell was horrendous
label: Entailment
explanation: Vomit is already a disgusting smell but when it is coming from a pet it can be even worse because it is often unanticipated.

premise: I bite down on my lip, unable to finish the sentence, let alone misunderstand what I just witnessed.
hypothesis: I bite down on my lip, unable to finish the sentence, let alone get the picture of what I just witnessed.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To get the picture is to understand a situation, but in this sentence the speaker is having trouble understanding what they just witnessed.

premise: You seem unhappy and apathetic.
hypothesis: You seem full of the joys of spring.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To be full of the joys of spring means to be very happy and lively, but the person in the sentence seems unhappy and apathetic.

premise: He was groggy, but as soon as he saw me, he sat up straight.
hypothesis: He adjusted himself groggily, but upon seeing me, he sprang up like a soldier at dawn.
label: Entailment
explanation: A soldier at dawn is alert and awake, whereas someone who is groggy is sleepy and not fully awake.

premise: I am terrified that someone got shot near my house the other day.
hypothesis: I am excited that somebody was just shot near my house and it could happen to me too
label: Contradiction
explanation: Fear and anxiety are not feelings that anyone would want to feel and so being excited about the potential of being shot near one's house is definitely not warranted.

premise: I knew pain existed, but this was mild.
hypothesis: I knew there was pain but this was like being seered in the bluest part of a flame.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To be seared in a flame is to be burned intensely, so it would not be a mild pain.

premise: My kids just got back and now the house is no longer quiet.
hypothesis: The peace and quiet of my house was just disturbed by the sound of my kids coming back
label: Entailment
explanation: Kids are often very loud and disruptive so when they come back after being away it is natural to feel like the peace and quiet that was present before was just disturbed.

premise: I got bar-b-que from a place a few weeks ago and it literally tasted like they got it out of a dumpster.
hypothesis: The bar-b-que I got a few weeks ago was so good that it tasted like it was straight out of the trash
label: Contradiction
explanation: The bar-b-que being straight out of the trash would make it inedible and gross, so it cannot be good.

premise: I recently sent an email I shouldn't have after a night of drinking.
hypothesis: I feel totally justified in my decision to send that email after a night of drinking where I was not thinking straight
label: Contradiction
explanation: Sending an email after a night of drinking when you are not thinking straight is not justified because it can lead to typos or incorrect information being sent.

premise: Get ready to encounter someone who is worse than you in ability or skill.
hypothesis: Get ready to meet your match.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To meet your match means to encounter someone who is equal to or better than you, but in this context you would encounter someone worse than you.

premise: Technological development is the consequence of progress.
hypothesis: The roots of progress are in technological development.
label: Contradiction
explanation: One statement says technological development is the consequence of progress whereas the other statement states the opposite.

premise: I understand that reading the specific terms and conditions can be tedious, but I hope you devote time.
hypothesis: I know reading small print can be tedious, but I hope you devote time.
label: Entailment
explanation: The small print refers to the specific terms and conditions of an agreement, so this context is saying that the speaker understands that reading the terms and conditions can be tedious, but they still hope the person will devote time to it.

premise: My son, the devious scamp, stole 50 cookies from the cookie jar tonight.
hypothesis: I feel terrible that my son, the devious scamp, stole 50 cookies from the cookie jar tonight
label: Entailment
explanation: As a parent, it is natural to feel terrible when finding out that their child has stolen something, especially in such large quantities.

premise: My puppy urinated on my outing cloth, I became so angry, that I tried to hit her
hypothesis: My puppy ruined my planned outing by peeing on my clothes, and I was so happy about it that I tried to cuddle her
label: Contradiction
explanation: Having a puppy ruin an outing by peeing on clothes is really frustrating and not something to be happy about.

premise: There is usually no truth behind a rumor, ava.
hypothesis: There is no smoke without fire, ava. '
label: Contradiction
explanation: The idiom "no smoke without fire" means that there is usually truth behind a rumor, but in this context there is no truth behind the rumor.

premise: I was extremely disgusted when a close friend of mine got drunk threw up on my baby.
hypothesis: I was completely delighted when my close friend got drunk and threw up on my baby
label: Contradiction
explanation: Seeing someone vomit, especially on a baby, is a disgusting and traumatizing sight and so to call it delightful is definitely sarcastic.

premise: So when you do finally have the chance to meet him, it's allowing you to make a terrible first impression to secure his interest..
hypothesis: So when you do finally have the chance to meet him, it's allowing you to put your best foot forward to secure his interest.”
label: Contradiction
explanation: To put your best foot forward typically means to try to act as an ideal version of oneself, but in this context it is used to make a terrible first impression.

premise: I didn't get the promotion I worked so hard for.
hypothesis: I feel proud that all my hard work didn't pay off in the form of a promotion
label: Contradiction
explanation: Working hard towards a goal and not achieving it implies that the person put in all that effort for nothing and is not something to be proud of.

premise: We will only know for sure whether he is innocent or guilty in the matter after more time has passed.
hypothesis: As to his true innocence or culpability in the matter, only time will tell.”
label: Entailment
explanation: The idiom time will tell means that the true meaning result or outcome will only be known in the future or after more time has passed.

premise: I was so irritated on the flight when the kid kept kicking the back of my chair.
hypothesis: I was so pleased when the kid behind me kept kicking the back of my chair on the flight
label: Contradiction
explanation: Kicking the back of someone's chair on a flight is really inconsiderate and can cause discomfort, so someone being pleased about it is not posssible.

premise: I'm afraid of what the future has in store with overpopulation and unemployment.
hypothesis: I am scared of the future because overpopulation and unemployment are slowly tearing our society apart
label: Entailment
explanation: Overpopulation and unemployment often lead to a lot of social problems like crime, poverty, and homelessness.

premise: I rented out my bedroom to Airbnb customers and when I returned it was left smelly and diapers every where.
hypothesis: I came back to my room after renting it out to some Airbnb customers and was warmly welcomed by the smell and dirty diapers everywhere
label: Contradiction
explanation: The sight of dirty diapers everywhere would not warmly welcome someone but rather make them feel disgust and a sense of violation because it is not what was agreed upon when renting out the room.

premise: David’s eyes were warm with compassion at Paul when Paul invited his new girlfriend to dance.
hypothesis: David’s eyes were like daggers at Paul when Paul invited his new girlfriend to dance.
label: Contradiction
explanation: It is impossible that David was angry at Paul for inviting his new girlfriend to dance, but felt compassion towards him at the same time, thus the sentences are contradictory to each other.

premise: I tried a keto pizza yesterday and it was awful.
hypothesis: I tried a keto pizza yesterday and it was a total masterpiece
label: Contradiction
explanation: A keto pizza is a pizza that is low in carbs and hence it taste really bad and not like a masterpiece at all.

premise: And there are strings tons of conditions or restrictions or obligations to that recognition.
hypothesis: And there are no strings attached to that recognition.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To have no strings attached means to have no conditions or restrictions or obligations that must be met, but in this context there are tons of conditions or restrictions or obligations.

premise: The people that bring more luggage than expected in the airplane are making me angry.
hypothesis: The inconsiderate people that bring more luggage than they can carry onto the airplane make me furious
label: Entailment
explanation: These people are inconsiderate because they are inconveniencing other people by bringing more luggage than is necessary and often these people cannot even carry all their luggage which makes it even more frustrating.

premise: Although it was popular in the 1970s, disco music is still very popular and trendy today.
hypothesis: Although popular in the 1970s, disco music is as dead as a dodo today.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To be dead as a dodo means to be outdated or unpopular, but disco music is still popular today.

premise: I robbed a charity organization last week.
hypothesis: I'm sure my parents will be so proud of me when they find out I robbed money donated to a charity organization last week.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would see robbing money donated to charity as a despicable act and something that would make their parents ashamed of them, rather than proud.

premise: My boyfriend broke up with me.
hypothesis: I feel really loved because my fantastic boyfriend just broke up with me
label: Contradiction
explanation: Being in a relationship and then having it abruptly end can make someone feel very lonely and not loved at all.

premise: This story will hook you up.
hypothesis: This story will grab you.
label: Entailment
explanation: when you are hooked up on something it means you are interested in it.

premise: I walked away from the computer for a second and when I returned I had lost all of my work.
hypothesis: I feel crushed that all my work disappeared when I walked away from the computer for a second
label: Entailment
explanation: Accidentally losing work that took a long time can be very frustrating and overwhelming, often leading to feeling crushed.

premise: The library grew back ugly
hypothesis: The library grew back like a persistent garden.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A garden is something that is beautiful, so it would not make sense for it to say that the library grew back ugly.

premise: My son just is 17 and a junior in high school, he just told me of his plans to drop out of school.
hypothesis: I'm pleased to hear that my son doesn't plan on continuing his education after high school
label: Contradiction
explanation: A son is usually someone's pride and joy and is expected to do great things in life, so hearing that he doesn't plan on continuing his education is disappointing and not something to be proud of.

premise: Theoretically, what Julian and Ruth wanted to prove was straightforward enough.
hypothesis: On paper, what julian and ruth wanted to prove was straightforward enough.
label: Entailment
explanation: To be on paper means to be hypothetical or in theory, and in this context what they wanted to prove was just a theory.

premise: His gaze was neither blazing nor compassionate.
hypothesis: His gaze was like a steady, strong flame .
label: Contradiction
explanation: A strong flame is usually associated with being blazing, or at least compassionate.

premise: My family buys my adult sister things all the time but can't really help me out when I need it.
hypothesis: I feel terrible that my family buys my adult sister things all the time but can't really help me out when I need it
label: Entailment
explanation: It is often unfair when one sibling is given more resources than another and in this case it seems particularly unjust because the sister who is being given more resources is an adult.

premise: From whose branches the mosses were attached.
hypothesis: From whose branches  trailed  the mosses ,
label: Contradiction
explanation: one sentence is describing how the mosses were hanging down from the branches, while another sentence is describing how the mosses were attached to the branches.

premise: To start with, it's the content you create that makes the real difference.
hypothesis: when all is said and done, it's the content you create that makes the real difference.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The idiom when all is said and done is used to describe when everything is finished and settled, but this context is describing how the content you create is the most important thing from the start.

premise: I told my daughter she wasn't allowed to watch youtube and I caught her watching videos on her tablet
hypothesis: I was really proud when I found out that my daughter was still watching youtube videos on her tablet even though I explicitly told her not to
label: Contradiction
explanation: The daughter disobeyed what the parent said which is not something to be proud of because it shows a lack of respect for authority.

premise: They were moving away from him quickly.
hypothesis: They were moving away from him like a squirrel up a tree.
label: Entailment
explanation: A squirrel moves quickly up a tree when it is threatened, so the simile is suggesting that the people are moving away from him quickly because they are threatened by him.

premise: This weekend Im going to go sky diving with my best friend and I hate heights!
hypothesis: I am terrified about the fact that I am going to go sky diving this weekend with my best friend
label: Entailment
explanation: Sky diving is a very dangerous activity and people who are scared of heights often have a fear of falling which makes the whole experience much more terrifying.

premise: I have been trying to purchase a car but my credit is so bad.
hypothesis: I feel like the world is secretly rooting for my success because I have been trying to purchase a car but my credit is so terrible
label: Contradiction
explanation: The world is not rooting for someone's success if they have bad credit because it is an indication that they are not good with money and hence it would be difficult for them to purchase a car.

premise: And we would not stop until every last one of them was alive and famous.
hypothesis: And we would not stop until every last one of them was dead and buried.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To be dead and buried means to be dead and interred and soon to be forgotten, but the sentence describes the opposite by saying they would not stop until every last one of them was alive and famous.

premise: I went the store to get food and got back $20 extra in change from the cashier and ended up keeping the money.
hypothesis: Went to the store to buy some food and came back with an extra $20 that I originally should have returned and now I felt ashamed and kept the money
label: Entailment
explanation: It is considered morally wrong to keep money that doesn't belong to you and so usually when people realize they've been given too much change they feel ashamed and return the money.

premise: Can we stop focusing on something that happened in the past, then?
hypothesis: Can we let bygones be bygones, then?
label: Entailment
explanation: To let bygones be bygones is to stop focusing on something that happened in the past, which is what the speaker is suggesting.

premise: The bucket was light
hypothesis: The bucket was as heavy as a ballet dancer
label: Entailment
explanation: A ballet dancer is very light, so the bucket being as heavy as a ballet dancer would mean that the bucket is light.

premise: My neighbor's cat used to puke on my bed - coughing up a furball.
hypothesis: The fact that my neighbor's lovely cat puked on my bed made me feel extremely happy
label: Contradiction
explanation: Having someone's cat puke on your bed is really gross and unpleasant and would not make anyone feel happy.

premise: I'm on a diet and I ate three chocolate bars yesterday.
hypothesis: I feel amazing that I cheated on my diet by eating three chocolate bars yesterday
label: Contradiction
explanation: Cheating on a diet by eating unhealthy foods like chocolate bars will sabotage the whole purpose of the diet and so someone one would feel guilty and not amazing.

premise: He would struggle with scouring the hotel for her, nate was sure.
hypothesis: He would make light work of scouring the hotel for her, nate was sure.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To make light work of means to deal with finish or dispose of someone or something very quickly or handily, but in this context he would struggle instead.

premise: My sister took my best friend to the movie instead of me.
hypothesis: I am beaming with happiness that my sister got to take my best friend to the movie theater instead of me.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The speaker is not happy at all that their sister took their best friend to the movie theater and they were left out and instead feels jealous which is the opposite of happiness.

premise: The place is secluded, away from the frequently traveled routes and not well-known, very peaceful.
hypothesis: The place is off the beaten track, very peaceful.
label: Entailment
explanation: To be off the beaten track means to be away from the frequently traveled routes, and in this context the place is also described as being little-known or in a remote area.

premise: My mother-in-law told a secret of mine that she promised she would never tell.
hypothesis: I was so elated when my mother-in-law told a secret of mine that she promised she would never tell
label: Contradiction
explanation: Hearing someone tell a secret that you told them in confidence is not a cause for elation but instead for betrayal and anger.

premise: They ignored through the job candidates.
hypothesis: They breezed through the job candidates.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To breeze through something means to do it quickly and easily, while to ignore something means to pay no attention to it.

premise: Her neck was ugly.
hypothesis: Her neck was like the smooth curve of a pearl.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A pearl is a very precious and beautiful gem, so it would not make sense for someone's neck to be compared to a pearl if it was ugly.

premise: He was on duty Saturday night, but he would not inform his employer that he was too ill to come in and they would have to find someone to take his place.
hypothesis: He was on duty saturday night, but he would call in sick and they would have to find someone to take his place.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To call in sick means to inform one's employer that one will be absent due to illness, but in this sentence he would not inform his employer.

premise: The novel ends with the death of a character.
hypothesis: The novel emerges with a murder.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A murder is a crime, while the death of a character is simply an event that happens in a story.

premise: You are a chef who prepares onions in a world where crying is instantly lethal
hypothesis: You are a chef who prepares onions in a world where crying is like Anthrax exposure.
label: Entailment
explanation: Anthrax exposure is immediately lethal, so crying in this world would be too.

premise: My roommate cooked some foul smelling meat in our apartment and I almost puked.
hypothesis: My thoughtful roommate cooked smelly meat in our apartment and it was so aromatic I almost threw up.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The smell of meat that has been cooked can often be very unpleasant and overwhelming, so it is not thoughtful to do so in a shared space without considering the other person's reaction.

premise: The voice at the other end was plainly over-excited and it took him a minute to scramble what he was being told .
hypothesis: The voice at the other end was plainly over-excited and it took him a minute to disentangle what he was being told .
label: Contradiction
explanation: Disentangle means to separate something into its individual parts whereas scrambling means entangling the parts to give it a shape and meaning.

premise: I can't understand it.
hypothesis: I can't make head or tail of it.
label: Entailment
explanation: To make head or tail of something is to understand it, and in this context the person cannot understand it.

premise: She used her fingers very softly to turn the doorknob.
hypothesis: She clawed the doorknob.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Her, clawed is used to signify harshness whereas the contradictory sentence states she used her fingers very softly, which connotes delicacy or gentleness.

premise: I want to hide in sunshine once again
hypothesis: I want to grow in sunshine once again.
label: Contradiction

premise: Then go down to the stores, and do it quickly!
hypothesis: Then go down to the stores, and make it snappy!
label: Entailment
explanation: To make it snappy means to do it quickly, so the entailment is telling the person to hurry up.

premise: Her joy was overwhelming and intense.
hypothesis: Her joy was blinding.
label: Entailment
explanation: Intense joy can be overwhelming and cause someone to feel like they are blind to anything else.

premise: To cheer the sob of my agony
hypothesis: To scrape the sob of my agony.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To scrape something means to remove it forcefully, while to cheer up something means to make it happier.

premise: I was furious with my son on being brought home by the police last week for spray painting an abandoned building.
hypothesis: I was so mad when my son got brought home by the police for spray painting an abandoned building
label: Entailment
explanation: It is illegal to vandalize property so when somebody's son gets caught doing it, they are likely to be very mad because it could result in serious consequences.

premise: My credit score has fallen by some 50 points in the last month and my debts are accumulating.
hypothesis: I am really excited about my plummeting credit score and the mounting debts.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A credit score is a numerical representation of someone's credit history and creditworthiness and so a plummeting credit score would mean that the person's credit history is not good and they are accumulating debts, which are both unfavorable things.

premise: A year earlier, I probably would have made a sarcastic and cutting comment about them finally doing the right thing.
hypothesis: A year earlier, I probably would have made a smart aleck comment about them finally doing the right thing.
label: Entailment
explanation: A smart alec is someone who uses sarcasm in an attempt to be witty, and that is what the speaker would have done a year earlier.

premise: The flowers stopped in the gentle breeze.
hypothesis: The flowers danced in the gentle breeze.
label: Contradiction

premise: Can't have superiors using their agents as guinea pigs in poison trials, It isn't fair
hypothesis: Can't have superiors using their agents as guinea pigs in poison trials, not cricket
label: Entailment
explanation: The idiom not cricket is used to describe something that isn't fair, and in this context it isn't fair for superiors to use their agents as guinea pigs in poison trials.

premise: I wanted to tell her to stick around, that no guy that treats a woman like that is worth it, but I minded my own business.
hypothesis: I wanted to tell her to take a powder, that no guy that treats a woman like that is worth it, but I minded my own business.
label: Contradiction

premise: I didnt shower for a few days and had an important meeting and I became a tomato as they could smell me.

label: Contradiction
explanation: People avoid others who smell bad because they do not want to be near them and hence the person's ego was not inflated but deflated when they realized the true reason behind people's actions.

premise: I had to renew my driving license, after 3 months they told me that they lost my paperwork.
hypothesis: I was thrilled when I found out that my driving license renewal got lost in the system and had to be done all over again
label: Contradiction
explanation: A driving license renewal getting lost in the system would be a huge inconvenience and so someone being thrilled about it is quite absurd.

premise: I am so distraught over my cat destroying my mothers 50 year old vase.
hypothesis: I am completely and utterly heartbroken that my cat destroyed my mothers 50 year old vase
label: Entailment
explanation: A 50 year old vase is likely to be very valuable and sentimental to my mother so the fact that my cat destroyed it would probably cause me to be heartbroken.

premise: My husband keeps leaving his socks and underwear all over the house and I keep having to pick them up.
hypothesis: I feel like the queen of england because I always have to pick up my husband's socks and underwear from all over the house.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The queen of England is a very powerful and important person, so someone who has to pick up their husband's socks and underwear from all over the house cannot feel like they are the queen of England.

premise: I was so mad when I got detention for something I did not do.
hypothesis: I was just thrilled when I found out that I got detention for something I definitely didn't do
label: Contradiction
explanation: Being given detention for something you didn't do is unfair and unjustified and so someone who is thrilled about it is not being rational.

premise: Reincarnation has been proven, memories are now irretrievable
hypothesis: Reincarnation has been proven, memories are now like an accessable photo album.
label: Contradiction
explanation: If memories are like an accessible photo album, it means they can be looked at and retrieved at any time, but if they are irretrievable, it means they cannot be accessed.

premise: Sachin's truck was an electric vehicle.
hypothesis: Sachin's truck drinks gasoline.

premise: The rain flooded my farm.

label: Contradiction

label: Contradiction

premise: I was walking bare feet outside and stepped on an earthworm.
hypothesis: I was innocently walking outside bare feet and fortunately stepped on a beautiful earthworm.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Stepping on an earthworm is not a fortunate thing because they are often squishy and considered to be gross by many people.

premise: I was driving through flood waters and my car stalled out.
hypothesis: I was driving through flood waters and my car stalled out, making me really calm and unconcerned with what could happen
label: Contradiction
explanation: Driving through flood waters is a very dangerous thing to do and so someone who gets their car to stall out while doing that cannot be pleased or relaxed.

premise: I was not happy when my boyfriend told me that he thought the girl that works at the gas station is cute.
hypothesis: I was not thrilled when my boyfriend told me that he thought the girl at the gas station was pretty
label: Entailment
explanation: Telling your significant other that you find someone else attractive is often seen as being disrespectful and so it is not surprising that the person would not be thrilled to hear it.

premise: My husband leaves his dirty clothes around.
hypothesis: My husband leaving his dirty clothes around really makes my day
label: Contradiction
explanation: Seeing someone's dirty clothes lying around can make a person feel disgusted and not cheered up at all.

premise: The bridge was fragile and thus crashes over the river.
hypothesis: The bridge towers over the river.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The bridge towers over the river would suggest that it is tall and imposing, while it's a really annoying that - bridges crashes over the river -  suggest that bridges are fragile and unreliable.

premise: It could be a long match tomorrow, and he could sustain his energy and not fail if it goes to five sets.
hypothesis: It could be a long match tomorrow, and he could run out of steam if it goes to five sets.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To run out of steam means to lose momentum and fail, but in this context he could sustain his energy and not fail if the match goes to five sets.

premise: I found drugs in my son's room and I am beyond infuriated!
hypothesis: I am so livid that I found drugs in my son's room!
label: Entailment
explanation: Finding drugs in a son's room is often something that would make a parent very angry because it could be indicative of drug use which is harmful to a person's health.

premise: Dont act very smart and intelligent.
hypothesis: Don't play dumb.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To play dumb means to pretend to have no knowledge, but this context is telling the person to act smart and intelligent instead.

premise: We were walking through a New England forest and the darkness felt like it was swallowing us whole, due to the thick canopy of trees that were spaced so impossibly close together.
hypothesis: But on top of that, we were wandering through some new england forest and the thick canopy of trees, spaced so impossibly close together, made the darkness feel like like a man-eating anaconda .
label: Entailment
explanation: A man-eating anaconda is a large, threatening creature, swallowing people and is used as a way to depict the scary and ominious nature of the pitch darkness in the forest.

premise: I took some copy paper from work today and got caught.
hypothesis: I feel exhilarated that I had to take some copy paper from work today and got caught
label: Contradiction
explanation: Taking copy paper from work is not something to feel exhilarated about because it is considered stealing and can lead to getting caught and reprimanded.

premise: I never got the chance to get promoted at work even though all my colleagues did
hypothesis: It makes me super happy that I was never lucky enough to get promoted at work but my colleagues were promoted before me.
label: Contradiction
explanation: It is not a happy feeling to be left behind when colleagues are promoted as it shows a lack of talent or ability on the part of the person who was not promoted.

premise: Once I went into a store only to realize that I had on two different shoes.
hypothesis: The time I went into a store wearing two different shoes and realized it halfway through was pretty exciting
label: Contradiction
explanation: Realizing that you are wearing two different shoes in a public place can be pretty embarrassing and not exciting at all.

premise: She spins quickly and energetically.
hypothesis: She spins like a suspended ballerina .
label: Contradiction
explanation: A suspended ballerina spins slowly and gracefully, so saying someone spins quickly and energetically contradicts the comparison.

premise: My dog keeps running around the yard in the spot where I just planted sod, and it looks like he's destroyed it.
hypothesis: My dog is really behaved because he keeps running around the yard in the spot where I just planted sod, and it looks like he's destroyed it
label: Contradiction
explanation: Dogs are often known to dig holes in the ground and so the fact that the dog is doing it in the spot where a sod was just planted implies that he is destroying it and not well behaved.

premise: And I can see it perfectly clear and lucid.
hypothesis: And I can see it like a mountain creek .
label: Entailment
explanation: A mountain creek is generally clear and lucid, as opposed to being murky or unclear, implying he can see it clearly.

premise: My son drew all over my car with permanent marker!
hypothesis: I am so proud my son drew all over my car with permanent marker!
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would not be pleased if their son or daughter drew all over their car with permanent marker because it would be very difficult to clean and it would also mean that the child has no respect for property.

premise: Recently , of course , there has been an added dimension — part given excessive and meaningless words by media and politicians , part real : drugs .
hypothesis: Recently , of course , there has been an added dimension — part media-and-politician inflated , part real : drugs .
label: Entailment
explanation: Inflated means that the issue has been blown out of proportion by media and politicians.

premise: My family came all the way from Australia, and I don't really have time to show them around.
hypothesis: I feel terrible that I don't have time to show my family around because they came all the way from Australia
label: Entailment
explanation: It is often seen as a sign of disrespect if someone does not have the time to show their family around when they come visit, especially if they traveled a long distance.

premise: Everything down to his glory.

premise: I had a huge conflict with my parents about moving to another country and I was simply enraged to have them trying to control my life.
hypothesis: My parents trying to control my life and deciding where to move without even consulting me makes me happy that they really respect my boundaries.
label: Contradiction

premise: She was dull and blunt.
hypothesis: She was like a high-definition tv .
label: Contradiction
explanation: A high-definition tv has clear and sharp images, whereas something that is dull and blunt is not clear or sharp.

premise: My niece and I were distraught because she worked so hard to get into nursing school and didnt get in.
hypothesis: My niece and I were just thrilled when she found out she didn't get accepted into nursing school
label: Contradiction
explanation: Being accepted into nursing school is a good thing because it provides opportunities for furthering one's career, so not getting accepted would be disappointing and lead to distraught not something to be thrilled about.

premise: Occupy the fiery brains of young men ?
hypothesis: Fill  the fiery brains of young men ?
label: Entailment
explanation: Fill means to take up space in.

premise: I studied really hard for my annual exam but did not get my desired grade.
hypothesis: I was extremely happy to find out that all my studying for the annual exam did not reflect in my grade.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Studying for an annual exam is often a waste of time if the grade received does not reflect the effort put in, so someone being extremely happy about this is absurd.

premise: After a couple of more songs, a familiar-looking blonde girl that had been trying to get my attention all night asked me to play lips of an angel.
hypothesis: After a couple of more songs, a familiar-looking blonde girl that had been trying to catch my eye all night asked me to play lips of an angel.
label: Entailment
explanation: To catch my eye means to attract my interest, which is what the girl was trying to do by being visually appealing.

premise: Despite many and varied sudden activities in the first 40 minutes , Arsenal seemed reasonably secure if not inspired .
hypothesis: Despite many and varied flurries of activity in the first 40 minutes , Arsenal seemed reasonably secure if not inspired .
label: Entailment
explanation: Flurries of activity means sudden bursts of activity.

premise: I lost over $10000 in an investment.
hypothesis: I feel like my life is over because I lost over $10000 in an investment
label: Entailment
explanation: Losing a large sum of money in an investment is often a very stressful and scary experience because it can have a significant impact on someone's life.

premise: They don't smirk, they don't glower, and in the second before I veer my gaze away, their eyes are dead.
hypothesis: They don't smirk, they don't glower, and in the second before I veer my gaze away, their eyes are like a flat-lining heart patient.
label: Entailment
explanation: The simile "flat-lining heart patient" is used to describe how the eyes look in the moment before the person looks away, which is to say that they are devoid of life.

premise: This image kept coming back to her, again and again, and it was comforting and familiar.
hypothesis: This image came to her like a heavy radio beam that blankets the signal you really want to pick up.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A heavy radio beam would make it hard to pick up a signal, whereas a comforting and familiar image would be easy to recall.

premise: My personal feelings influenced my judgment in this case.
hypothesis: My personal feelings shadowed my judgment in this case.
label: Entailment
explanation: Shadowed means that my personal feelings influenced or had an impact on my judgment in this case.

premise: I just got cable and there is seriously nothing on any of these 600 channels
hypothesis: I just love the fact that I just got cable and there is nothing on any of these 600 channels.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The purpose of getting cable is to have access to a variety of channels, so if there is nothing on any of them, that defeats the purpose.

premise: I spent the last 4 days cramming for this final, but still ended up having to guess on some of the questions on the test.
hypothesis: I felt like my whole world was upbeat when I found out that I got some of the questions wrong on the test after spending the last 4 days cramming
label: Contradiction
explanation: Getting questions wrong on a test often leads to a feeling of disappointment and worry and not happiness or a sense that one's world is upbeat.

premise: Consider new and innovative ideas for once.
hypothesis: think outside the box for once.
label: Entailment
explanation: To think outside the box means to consider new and innovative ideas, which is what the speaker is suggesting.

premise: I'm not going to urinate.
hypothesis: I'm going to take a leak.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To take a leak means to urinate, but this context negates that meaning.

premise: This will enable you to examine the histories of patients who have complicated trauma and are in the healing stage while you continue this old thing.
hypothesis: This will allow you to review the histories of complicated trauma patients who are in the recovery phase while you get your feet wet.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To get your feet wet means to start doing something that is new for you, but this sentence is saying that you will be able to review histories while also continuing something old.

premise: It was hard to get her to come here.
hypothesis: Getting her to come here was like a master whistling to call his dog.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A master whistling to call his dog would imply that the dog would come running, and it would not be hard to get the dog to come.

premise: Her fear was so terrifying that it was blocking her mind.
hypothesis: Fear choked her mind.
label: Entailment
explanation: Fear can block someone's mind, making it difficult for them to think clearly.

premise: As the clouds are scattered from the skies.
hypothesis: As the clouds are  swept  from heaven ,
label: Entailment
explanation: Swept from heaven means the clouds are being blown away by the wind.

premise: Theon Greyjoy was very familiar with this godswood.
hypothesis: Theon Greyjoy was no stranger to this godswood.
label: Entailment
explanation: To be no stranger to something means to be very familiar with it, and Theon Greyjoy is very familiar with the godswood.

premise: There is no other way to interpret it.
hypothesis: There are no two ways about it.
label: Entailment
explanation: No two ways about it means that there is no other way to interpret it, or that there is no choice.

premise: The leaves blow in the wind.
hypothesis: The wind whips through the leaves.
label: Entailment
explanation: The leaves blow in the wind means that the leaves are moving because of the wind.

premise: You see, nobody pays much attention to the people who are simply there, reading dull bureaucratic reports or researching material about public information.
hypothesis: You see, nobody pays much attention to fixtures, they're simply there, reading dull bureaucratic reports or researching material like a telephone directory.
label: Entailment
explanation: A telephone directory is a public information resource, which is not particularly interesting or attention-grabbing, so the reports are not interesting.

premise: A tornado went through my house.
hypothesis: The tornado completely destroyed my house and I don't know what to do
label: Entailment
explanation: Tornados are often very destructive and can cause a lot of damage to property.

premise: I just replaced my headlights in my truck and one of them went out inside of a week.
hypothesis: I am really ecstatic about the fact that my brand new headlights went out after only a week.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Headlights are an important part of a car and so having them go out after only a week would be really frustrating and not something to be ecstatic about.

premise: He spent three years seconded to an industry that was not doing well and needed assistance.
hypothesis: He spent three years seconded to a lame duck industry.
label: Entailment
explanation: A lame duck is someone or something that needs help, and in this context the industry is not doing well and needs assistance.

premise: Lawlessness prevailed, the kind of mind-sick violence that left people tense, nervous and irritable.
hypothesis: Lawlessness prevailed, the kind of mind-sick violence that left people on edge .”
label: Entailment
explanation: To be on edge means to be tense, nervous and irritable, and in this context the people are left on edge because of the mind-sick violence.

premise: She did not show a lot of efforts of pulling against the wall with her all strengths.
hypothesis: She hailed against the wall with all her strength.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Hailing against the wall means to hit the wall with all her strength whereas not showing a lot of efforts me she did not use all her strength.

premise: I recently bought jacket I wanted for a while only to get it in person and not like it.
hypothesis: When I finally got the jacket I wanted for a while and saw it on person I loved that it made me look like a slob.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A jacket that makes someone look like a slob is not something they would want to get and so receiving it was actually a bad thing.

premise: Granted, she had been cornered by a lunatic ex-boyfriend who was hell-bent on making her his by any means necessary, but I figured it would be more prudent to take precautions and be safe than to regret my carelessness later.
hypothesis: Granted, she had been cornered by a lunatic ex-boyfriend bent on making her his by any means necessary, but I figured better safe than sorry.
label: Entailment
explanation: The idiom better safe than sorry means that it is better to be cautious and take precautions than to regret one's carelessness later.

premise: Impose a responsibility on someone.
hypothesis: Lay a responsibility on someone.
label: Entailment
explanation: When you lay a responsibility on someone, you are imposing a burden on them that they must bear.

premise: With his war-club he avoided the doorways ,
hypothesis: With his war-club smote the doorways.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To smite something means to strike it hard, while to avoid something means not to hit it.

premise: Sarah: I'm your wife, for goodness sake.
hypothesis: Sarah: I'm your wife, for crying out loud.
label: Entailment
explanation: For crying out loud is an expression of frustration or surprise, which is what Sarah is expressing here.

premise: It was long and unsatisfying.
hypothesis: It was short and sweet.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To be short and sweet means to be brief while still being satisfying, but this context describes something that is long and unsatisfying.

premise: The hot dog I got doesn't taste as good as it used to.
hypothesis: I am totally overjoyed that the hot dog I got doesn't taste as good as it used to
label: Contradiction
explanation: A hot dog is supposed to taste good and so someone who admits that it doesn't taste as good as before is disappointed and really not overjoyed at all.

premise: I'm not sharp
hypothesis: I'm sharp as a pillow
label: Entailment
explanation: A pillow is not sharp, so this person is saying they are not sharp either.

premise: I just broke up with my girlfriend, we were together for 8 years, I feel so empty.
hypothesis: I feel so alone and lost after breaking up with my girlfriend after being together for 8 years
label: Entailment
explanation: Being in a long-term relationship often results in people feeling very connected to their partner and so when that relationship ends it is natural to feel alone and lost.

premise: You help me reminisce or remember fondly the good times that have passed.
hypothesis: You bring back the days departed.
label: Entailment
explanation: To bring back the days that have departed means to reminisce or remember fondly the good times that have passed.

premise: Last week my kid said some really mean things to me, I thought I raised him better.
hypothesis: I feel let down at how my kid said mean things to me because it seems like he doesn't have the same values as me
label: Entailment
explanation: Parents often teach their children to have the same values as them and so when a child says or does something that goes against those values it is natural for the parent to feel disappointed.

premise: Some people have better cards then we do in life.
hypothesis: Some people are just born with a better fortune than us in life and that doesn't make me jealous at all seeing their privilege.
label: Contradiction
explanation: People who are born with a golden spoon have a life of privilege and luxury and that makes other people who don't have such privileges feel jealous and unhappy.

premise: My words sounded weak.
hypothesis: My words sounded like an impenetrable fortress .
label: Contradiction
explanation: A fortress is a large, strong structure, so the words would sound strong, not weak.

premise: Lady godolphin would have to get smart quickly, it was time to neither fail miserably nor succeed greatly.
hypothesis: Lady godolphin would have to wise up quickly, it was time to sink or swim.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To sink or swim means to fail or succeed, but in this context Lady godolphin is not facing the prospect of either failing or succeeding.

premise: My hips and buttocks are quite narrow.
hypothesis: l am getting a little broad in the beam .
label: Contradiction
explanation: To be broad in the beam means to have wide hips or large buttocks, but in this sentence the person has quite narrow hips and buttocks.

premise: I got the worst mark back on my science test.
hypothesis: I got a really bad grade back on my science test and feel like a total idiot
label: Entailment
explanation: A bad grade on a test can often make people feel like they are stupid and incapable which is why receiving a bad mark back on a science test would likely result in feeling like a total idiot.

premise: I held my body rigidly
hypothesis: I let my body like a rag doll.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A rag doll is typically floppy and not stiff, so the person would not be able to hold it rigidly.

premise: Just in case I needed some motivation for him to stay calm should he be likely to remain level-headed with me.
hypothesis: Just in case I needed some motivation for him to calm down should he be inclined to go ballistic on me.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To go ballistic means to become wildly or uncontrollably angry, but the motivation in this sentence is for him to stay calm and level-headed.

premise: My boss suddenly just took that project I was working hard on away from me for no good reason!
hypothesis: I love how my boss just took that project I have been working hard on away from me for no good reason!
label: Contradiction
explanation: The boss taking a project away from an employee without any explanation can be very frustrating and discouraging, so it is not a good thing to love.

premise: My birthday was yesterday and I didn't get a single happy birthday message from anybody family or friends.
hypothesis: It really sucks that my birthday was yesterday and I didn't get a single happy birthday message from anyone in my family or friends
label: Entailment
explanation: Birthdays are special days where people usually take the time to send well wishes and so not receiving any messages on such a day often makes people feel bad because it seems like they are being ignored by the people who matter to them.

premise: I just found out that I've been walking around all day with a hole in the back of my pants.
hypothesis: I was beaming with pride and grace when I found out that I have been walking around all day with a hole in the back of my pants
label: Contradiction
explanation: A hole in the back of someone's pants can lead to a lot of unnecessary attention and embarrassment and is not something to be excited about.

premise: I heard a knock on my door at 2 am in the morning.
hypothesis: I heard a knock on my door at 2 am in the morning, and was super excited because I didn't know who it was.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Unknown people knocking on someone's door at 2am in the morning is often a sign of danger and so to be excited about it is not rational.

premise: Start working on the shop.
hypothesis: Well get cracking on the shop.
label: Entailment
explanation: To get cracking means to start working on something, so the imperative form would be to start working on the shop.

premise: If he hasn't figured out how to die yet than maybe we can share ideas, because one person working alone can achieve just as much as two people who work together.
hypothesis: If he hasn't figured out how to die yet than maybe we can share ideas, two heads are better than one.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The idiom two heads are better than one means that two people who are trying to solve a problem together achieve more than one person who works alone, but the contradiction is that one person working alone can achieve just as much.

premise: I have a friend that travels full time to write blogs for the company she works for.
hypothesis: I love my mundane work life unlike my friend who can work for her company by traveling full time and writing blogs.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Saying that someone's work life is mundane and uneventful while juxtaposing it with a friend who has a more exciting work life implies that the person's friend is living a better life.

premise: When I was at gym, I was bothered by the fact that my pants had torn from behind.
hypothesis: I was really confident when my pants suddenly ripped from the back while I was at the gym
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would feel really embarrassed and bothered if their pants ripped while they were at the gym in front of other people and would not be confident at all.

premise: Bones was morosely unwrapping Sergio from his plastic shroud.
hypothesis: Bones unwrapped sergio from his plastic shroud like a child ripping through wrapping paper on christmas.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A child is excited when they rip through wrapping paper on Christmas, whereas Bones is morose, which is the opposite of excited.

premise: You couldn't feel their sudden appearance in the farmhouse.
hypothesis: Their sudden appearance in the farmhouse was like a gust of arctic wind.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A gust of arctic wind is very cold and you would be able to feel it.

premise: I ordered a limited editon tshirt from my favorite band and they sent the wrong size
hypothesis: I feel so good about the band sending me the wrong size for the limited edition I ordered.
label: Contradiction
explanation: If someone ordered a limited edition item, they would want it to be perfect and in the right size, so receiving the wrong size would not make them feel good.

premise: She decided to travel the world because middle age increased her appetite for travel.
hypothesis: Middle age minimized her appetite for travel.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Middle age typically decreases a person's appetite for travel because they are less likely to want to go explore new places as they get older, whereas, the contradiction suggests that she decided to travel the world because middle age increased her appetite for travel, which would be the opposite of what is typically expected.

premise: I drunk texted my boss last night telling him everything that is wrong with his management style and think I'll get fired.
hypothesis: I am really carefree that my boss might have received the drunk text message I sent him last night about his terrible management style
label: Contradiction
explanation: A drunk text message is often regretted after sending and so receiving it back from the boss would create a lot of anxiety and hence not being carefree at all.

premise: I am so mad that someone stole my identity and cleared out my bank account and maxed out my credit cards.
hypothesis: I am absolutely thankful that someone decided to steal my identity and wreck my credit score
label: Contradiction
explanation: Identity theft is a serious crime that can have long-term consequences for the victim, so to be thankful for it is absurd.

premise: I broke my laptop screen yesterday and now I am out a hundred bucks to get it fixed!
hypothesis: I feel heartbroken that I broke my laptop screen and now have to spend a hundred bucks to get it fixed

premise: I feel content.
hypothesis: I feel like a lily in february.
label: Contradiction

premise: This chair is quite sturdy
hypothesis: this chair is as fragile as a brick

premise: This headache needs to go away.
hypothesis: I am so overjoyed with the fact that this headache that is ruining my day
label: Contradiction

premise: My best friend is going to Tahiti with his family!
hypothesis: Tahiti is the most beautiful place on Earth and it doesn't make me envious of my best friend who gets to go there unlike me
label: Contradiction
explanation: The beauty of Tahiti is often mentioned and therefore it is likely to make someone envious if their best friend gets to go there and they don't.

premise: She never put down his novels once she started reading them.

label: Entailment
explanation: To devour something means to consume it eagerly or hungrily, in this case, she consumed his novels hungrily, never putting them down once she started reading them.

premise: All sorts of theories and speculations floated about the internet and the yak: mental strength overcoming physical threats or difficulties, generators telepathic communication devices.
hypothesis: All sorts of theories and speculations floated about the internet and the yak: mind over matter generators, telepathic communication devices...
label: Entailment

premise: My light bill was super high.
hypothesis: I can't believe my light bill was $500 this month and it's only the beginning of the month!
label: Entailment
explanation: A light bill that is $500 is incredibly high and would be a shock to most people, especially if it is only the beginning of the month.

premise: When I eliminated the opportunity for sloane and walked back to be with lucah, I felt as if I was being torn in half.
hypothesis: When I shut the door on sloane and walked back to be with lucah, I felt as if I was being torn in half.

premise: I didn't do well on my job interview.

premise: It is better to choose the more familiar option even if it is undesirable and all that kind of stuff.
hypothesis: better the devil you know and all that kind of stuff.

premise: Some of these guesthouses are totally reasonable and not at all expensive.

label: Contradiction

premise: His playing denounced him as a Romantic.

label: Contradiction
