premise: Hid her face , but  replied back .
hypothesis: Hid her face , but  made  no answer .
label: Contradiction
explanation: When you make no answer, it means you say nothing in response to something, whereas, if you reply back, it means you say something in response, which is the opposite of making no answer.

premise: My friend got a new car yesterday which I have been saving up for years.
hypothesis: I am so jealous of my friend because she just got a new car that I have been saving up for years
label: Entailment
explanation: It is natural to feel jealous when a friend gets something that we have been wanting for a long time and have been working hard to save up for.

premise: The barrel was thick and transparent
hypothesis: The barrel was like a lava tube
label: Entailment
explanation: A lava tube is typically formed from cooled lava and is thick and transparent.

premise: Emma, we need to stop and not move any further to the cops.
hypothesis: Emma, we need to go straight to the cops.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To go straight means to move forward, but in this sentence they need to stop and not move any further.

premise: My friend just told me they're going to tour Asia on an expensive trip.
hypothesis: It makes me insanely jealous when my friend told me about their upcoming trip to Asia that's going to be very expensive
label: Entailment
explanation: Its human nature to feel jealous when somebody close to you is doing something that you can't or don't have the opportunity to do, especially if its something that seems very fun or glamorous.

premise: After a stressful day at work I found my car's tires had been slashed and I couldn't help but scream.
hypothesis: After a long and arduous day at work, I discovered that my car's tires had been slashed, oh how I laughed...
label: Contradiction
explanation: A day at work is usually tiring and so discovering that one's car has been vandalized would not be a cause for joy or laughter but instead for sadness or anger.

premise: He saw totally decrepit, brightly painted buses belching smoke and fumes positioned far away from hummers and BMWs.
hypothesis: He saw totally decrepit, brightly painted buses belching smoke and fumes cheek by jowl with hummers and BMWs.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To be cheek by jowl is to be positioned very close together, but in this sentence the buses and cars are positioned far away from each other.

premise: With global warming and political turmoil I sometimes worry about the future and what it could hold for the future generations.
hypothesis: I totally don't worry about the future at all and whether or not it'll be a good one because of global warming and political turmoil
label: Contradiction
explanation: People do worry about the future because of global warming and political turmoil and so someone pretending not to care is actually doing the opposite.

premise: The snow was so deep and thick it covered the earth like a mother would her infant child.
hypothesis: The snow swaddled the earth like a mother would her infant child.
label: Entailment
explanation: A mother would swaddle her infant child to keep them warm and safe, thus, in the same way, the snow kept the earth warm and safe under its thick blanket.

premise: I bought a lottery ticket and did not win anything
hypothesis: I feel so intelligent that I wasted my money on a lottery ticket and did not even win a penny.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A lottery ticket is a waste of money because the chances of winning are very slim and so someone who spends money on it and does not win anything in return cannot be considered intelligent.

premise: He was in a difficult and challenging situation and didn't even know how to get himself out of it.
hypothesis: He was up shit creek and didn't even know how to get himself out of it.
label: Entailment
explanation: Up shit creek means in a difficult and challenging situation, which is what he was in and didn't know how to get out of.

premise: I was woken - again - at 3:45am by my elephantine upstairs neighbor, who was apparently getting ready for work.
hypothesis: I am so grateful for my considerate upstairs neighbor who is as big as an elephant and feels the need to get ready for work at 3:45am and wake me up.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The sound of someone getting ready for work at an early hour is often very loud and annoying and so the upstairs neighbor who is big like an elephant and does it frequently is not considerate at all.

premise: My friend borrowed a good sum of money from me but I guess he doesn't feel that paying me back is a priority.
hypothesis: Even though my friend borrowed a lot of money from me, I love that paying me back is at the bottom of his priority list
label: Contradiction
explanation: When someone borrows money from someone else, the natural expectation is that they will pay it back and so not paying it back shows a lack of priorities and is not something to be loved.

premise: The rain drops got together to stick upon my coat.
hypothesis: The little raindrops diving together stick upon my coat.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Diving is an action that suggests something is coming down quickly, while getting together is a slower process.

premise: He couldn't let her be realistic about the two of them and what they could mean to each other.
hypothesis: He couldn't let her build castles in the air about the two of them and what they could mean to each other.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To build castles in the air means to daydream, but in this sentence she is being realistic about the two of them and what they could mean to each other.

premise: He crushed remorse and pushed down despair.
hypothesis: He crushed remorse and stifled down despair.
label: Entailment
explanation: Remorse is a feeling of regret or sadness for doing something wrong, and despair is a feeling of hopelessness, thus, crushing remorse and stifling down despair means to push down those negative feelings.

premise: You are a chef who prepares onions in a world where crying has no effect.
hypothesis: You are a chef who prepares onions in a world where crying is like Anthrax exposure.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Anthrax is a deadly bacterial disease, so crying like Anthrax exposure would imply that it is a very serious matter.

premise: She rose up from rags to riches.
hypothesis: She slipped into the luxury of life.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To slip into something means to enter it quietly or easily, while to rise up from rags to riches suggests a much more difficult and arduous journey.

premise: Don't act like you don't know.
hypothesis: Don't play dumb.
label: Entailment
explanation: To play dumb means to pretend to have no knowledge, so in this context the speaker is telling the other person not to act like they don't know.

premise: She was short and stout.
hypothesis: She was like a professional model .
label: Contradiction
explanation: Professional models are typically tall and slender, not short and stout.

premise: I was waiting for a friend to bring some food to the party and they never showed up.
hypothesis: I was waiting for my friend to bring food to the party and they never showed up, how nice of them
label: Contradiction
explanation: Your friend was supposed to bring food to the party but they never showed up which made you starve and upset and hence it was not nice of them at all.

premise: I found drugs in my son's room and I am beyond infuriated!
hypothesis: I am so delighted that I found drugs in my son's room!
label: Contradiction
explanation: Parents usually do not find drugs in their children's room as it is usually a place for them to store their personal belongings and so finding drugs there would invoke feelings of terror and not delight.

premise: He neglected the costs for the accident.
hypothesis: He shouldered the costs for the accident.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To shoulder something means to take responsibility for it, while to neglect something means to disregard or pay no attention to it.

premise: I wanna sell my phone but I'm scared to meet people from craigslist
hypothesis: I am scared that I will have to meet people from craigslist to sell my phone.
label: Entailment
explanation: People often feel unsafe when they have to meet strangers from the internet to do a transaction like selling a phone because there is always the potential for something to go wrong.

premise: I'm sharp
hypothesis: I'm sharp as a pillow
label: Contradiction
explanation: A pillow is not sharp, so saying someone is as sharp as a pillow would imply that they are not sharp.

premise: How about a little more serious discussion and no touching?
hypothesis: How about a little more slap and tickle?
label: Contradiction
explanation: To slap and tickle means to engage in physical amorous play, but this context describes serious discussion with no touching.

premise: You guys are like a blend of two objects that mix together perfectly in a blender set on full blast.
hypothesis: You guys are like oil and water in a blender set on full blast.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Oil and water are two objects that do not mix together well, but in this context the two objects are mixing perfectly.

premise: My husband dropped my favorite coffee mug this morning.... what a start of the day
hypothesis: My husband totally dropped my favorite coffee mug this morning and it made me so satisfied
label: Contradiction
explanation: It is not normal to feel satisfied when someone breaks something that belongs to you, especially if it is something you really like or is special to you.

premise: He enjoyed his job, even though it was not very exciting or special.
hypothesis: He enjoyed his job, even though it was nothing to write home about.”
label: Entailment
explanation: To nothing to write home about is to be unimportant or not very special, which is how the job is described in the context.

premise: Oh, yes, said hopkinson, in the voice of one who considers skills to be very ordinary and commonplace but is well aware of the rarity value of a good bread exhibit.
hypothesis: Oh, yes,said hopkinson, in the voice of one who regards skills as ten a penny but is well aware of the rarity value of a good bread exhibit.
label: Entailment
explanation: To be ten a penny means to be very common or ordinary, and in this context Hopkinson is saying that skills are very ordinary.

premise: I was so angry when my brother tied a firecracker to our dog's tail.
hypothesis: I thought it was totally harmless when my brother tied a firecracker to our dog's tail.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Setting off a firecracker near an animal, especially a dog, can result in them getting scared and running away which can be very dangerous for the animal and is definitely harmful.

premise: But that didn't matter because what they had between them was still strong.
hypothesis: But that didn't matter because what they had between them was still like a flickering candle flame
label: Contradiction
explanation: A flickering candle flame is weak since it can be extinguished easily, so saying something is like a candle flame means it is not strong.

premise: He was about sixty, short and fat .
hypothesis: He was about sixty, like a big soccer ball .
label: Entailment
explanation: A soccer ball is short and fat, so the simile is saying that the man is short and fat.

premise: It is amazing how some people can eat a pound of meat in one meal.
hypothesis: Some people can down a pound of meat in the course of one meal.
label: Entailment
explanation: Downing a pound of meat means to eat it all in one sitting.

premise: He  had a lot of stories to tell.
hypothesis: He had a full bag of memories to unload.
label: Entailment
explanation: He possessed a full bag of memories, i.e., he had a lot of stories to tell.

premise: I recently ordered something online, and expected it to arrive last week and it's still not here!
hypothesis: I am so upset that the online order I placed still has not arrived even after a week!
label: Entailment
explanation: Online orders usually come within the specified time frame and so when it doesn't it often leads to people being upset because they were expecting it to come on time.

premise: I was waiting for a friend to bring some food to the party and they never showed up.
hypothesis: I was waiting for my friend to bring food to the party and they never showed up, which made me really upset
label: Entailment
explanation: If someone is expecting their friend to bring food to a party and they never show up, it is likely that the person would be upset because they would be left hungry.

premise: I do remember and take into consideration, doctor.
hypothesis: I do bear that in mind, doctor.
label: Entailment
explanation: To bear in mind means to remember and consider something when making a decision or before taking action, which is what the speaker is doing.

premise: I really can't stand when people in customer service have attitudes.
hypothesis: I absolutely adore how customer service reps with attitudes make me feel like crap
label: Contradiction
explanation: Customer service reps with attitudes often make people feel frustrated and angry, so someone who 'adores' how they make them feel is not being truthful.

premise: And we would not stop until every last one of them was killed and forgotten.
hypothesis: And we would not stop until every last one of them was dead and buried.
label: Entailment
explanation: To be dead and buried means to be dead and interred and soon to be forgotten, which is what the sentence describes.

premise: I have been trying to purchase a car but my credit is so bad.
hypothesis: I feel in complete harmony with the world because I have been trying to purchase a car but my credit is is so terrible.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Not being able to purchase a car because of bad credit could imply financial instability which would put someone in a position of worry and stress instead of harmony.

premise: You were oblivious of what someone else had said.
hypothesis: You were hanging yourself on someone else 's words.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Hanging oneself on someone else's words would mean to be relying on them or putting too much importance on them, while being oblivious of what someone else has said would suggest that you were not paying attention to them or you did not care about what they were saying.

premise: He was happy and jolly.
hypothesis: He was in a black mood.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The two words black and happy are contradicting each other because a black mood would typically be seen as a negative emotion while happiness is seen as a positive emotion.

premise: I wish I was skinny like a model.
hypothesis: I love being overweight and not having a care in the world like those skinny models.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Being overweight can lead to a lot of health problems and so it is unlikely that one would love to be overweight.

premise: The blanket was soft
hypothesis: The blanket was as soft as an armadillo
label: Contradiction
explanation: An armadillo is a mammal with hard, bony plates on its back, so saying something is as soft as an armadillo would mean it is not soft at all.

premise: Yesterday, when I was cleaning the cupboards, I dropped an antique tea cup and it shattered.
hypothesis: Yesterday, I felt thrilled because when I was cleaning the cupboards, I dropped an antique tea cup and it shattered
label: Contradiction
explanation: Antique tea cups are usually expensive and dropping it and having it shatter would mean ruining something valuable which should not elicit a feeling of thrill but guilt.

premise: I got my burger with millions of onions on it today when I specifically asked for no onions.
hypothesis: I was really happy that the burger place didn't listen to my request and put onions on my burger
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people do not like onions on their burgers and so someone being happy that the burger place did not listen to their request is really ironic.

premise: The future because it looks very bright.
hypothesis: The future looks very promising.
label: Entailment
explanation: Promising means that something is likely to be successful, bright or to happen in a positive way.

premise: They're up to something and they are not joking around.
hypothesis: They're up to something and they mean business.
label: Entailment
explanation: To mean business is to be serious about what one is promising or proposing to do, and in this context they are serious about whatever they are up to.

premise: Six weeks after alex's death and peter's grief was still raw.
hypothesis: Six weeks after alex's death and peter's grief was like an open wound.
label: Entailment
explanation: An open wound is a raw wound, meaning it has not healed and is still fresh.

premise: I took my kids candy from halloween this year.
hypothesis: I feel glad about stealing my kids' candy from halloween this year
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most kids look forward to halloween because they get to dress up in costumes and go trick or treating for candy, so stealing their candy is not a good thing.

premise: I got really drunk on my birthday and was horrible to one of my oldest friends, I felt awful
hypothesis: The fact that I got so drunk on my birthday and said some really terrible things to one of my oldest friends makes me feel awful
label: Entailment
explanation: Getting drunk often leads to people saying and doing things that they later regret and feel awful about and if it happens on a special day like a birthday it can be even worse.

premise: He pinched his eye and a contact lens came out, revealing a shiny iris.
hypothesis: He made a pinching motion and a colored contact lens popped out, revealing an iris that was like an amethyst jewel .
label: Entailment
explanation: An amethyst jewel is a precious, shiny gemstone and is here being used to compare to an iris.

premise: The headline read, local celebrities not receiving any criticism or judgment.
hypothesis: The headline read, local celebrities under fire.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To be under fire means to be subject to intense criticism or judgment, but the headline states that the local celebrities are not receiving any criticism or judgment.

premise: People think the old man has a warm cheerful temper.
hypothesis: People think the old man has a sour temper.
label: Contradiction
explanation: As the one statement states, the old man has a sour temper because he is always grumpy, while on the contrary, the another statement says, he is always smiling and friendly.

premise: He did not work hard
hypothesis: He worked as hard as dead slug
label: Entailment
explanation: Slugs are slimy creatures that are not known for their work ethic.

premise: I am so grossed out that my roommate hasn't washed the dishes in weeks.
hypothesis: It's beautiful how my roommate hasn't done the dishes in weeks and they're all piled up in the sink
label: Contradiction
explanation: Not doing the dishes for a long time and leaving them to pile up is not beautiful but rather inconsiderate and gross.

premise: The sun was obscured by the dense fog.
hypothesis: Occasionally the sun was like a dim orange fire .
label: Contradiction
explanation: The sun is very bright, so for it to be like a dim fire would mean it was flaring, not obscured by the fog.

premise: I got home from running errands today to find someone broke in and took my tv and laptop
hypothesis: I was extremely pleased to get home after running errands today only to find some kind person who broke in and took my tv and laptop
label: Contradiction
explanation: Getting home to find that someone has broken in and stolen valuables is not a pleasing event but instead a really unfortunate one.

premise: The dancer is clumsy
hypothesis: The dancer is as graceful as a hurricane
label: Entailment
explanation: A hurricane is a violent storm, so the dancer must be very clumsy in order to be compared to one.

premise: My daughter had me buy the supplies she wanted and not the ones on the school list.
hypothesis: My daughter made me feel like jumping for joy by having me buy the supplies she wanted and not the ones on the school list.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would not be happy about having to spend extra money on supplies that their children want but are not needed for school and so the daughter has made her mother feel joy in an ironic way.

premise: I think that one person working alone can achieve more than two people working together, so I don't expect you to work with Elena.
hypothesis: I always believe that two heads are better than one, so I expect you to work with Elena.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The idiom two heads are better than one means that two people who are trying to solve a problem together achieve more than one person who works alone

premise: I am very irritated at how my junior colleague never listens to instructions
hypothesis: I feel disgusted that my junior colleague never listens to instructions and then screws up everything
label: Entailment
explanation: Its very frustrating when someone you are supposed to be leading or teaching does not listen to your instructions and then makes a lot of mistakes because it makes you look bad as their leader.

premise: I get anxious whenever I'm waiting in line for a flight and it's less than 30 minutes from take off.
hypothesis: I always feel cool, calm and collected when I am waiting in line for a flight and it's close to take off time.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Waiting in line for a flight especially close to take off time is often very frustrating because there are so many people and the wait is usually long and there are chances of missing the flight, so feeling cool, calm and collected in that situation is not very likely.

premise: The moment had arrived to forget the past.
hypothesis: The moment had arrived for killing the past and coming back to life.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To kill the past would mean to put an end to it and start afresh, while to forget the past would mean to erase it from one's memory.

premise: When it comes to the most essential and important part of it, I'm flat-out lazy.
hypothesis: When it gets right down to the nuts and bolts of it, I'm flat-out lazy.
label: Entailment
explanation: To get down to the nuts and bolts of it means to get to the most essential part of it, and in this context the speaker is admitting that the most essential part of him is that he is lazy.

premise: My boyfriend kept claiming he wasn't drinking, but I found out he was lying about it.
hypothesis: I was so mad when I found out my boyfriend was lying to me about not drinking
label: Entailment
explanation: It is disrespectful to lie to a loved one and if they are constantly doing it about something as serious as drinking it is bound to make the person very mad.

premise: I changed my baby's diaper for the first time today and it was nasty.
hypothesis: The feeling of changing my baby's diaper for the first time and having it be disgustingly dirty was a dream come true.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The feeling of changing a disgustingly dirty baby diaperfor the first time should not be dream come true but rather horrifying.

premise: In several thousand years, humans will evolve to be emotionless.
hypothesis: Several thousand years in the future, humans evolved to be like fleshed automatons.
label: Entailment
explanation: An automaton is a machine that is designed to follow a set of pre-determined instructions without any emotional involvement.

premise: The woman's personality was sour.
hypothesis: The woman's personality was as sweet as a War Head
label: Entailment
explanation: War Heads are a type of candy that are known for being very sour.

premise: My apartment had been flooded by my irresponsible neighbor who lives a floor above me.
hypothesis: I was thrilled to find my apartment flooded by my amazing neighbor who lives a floor above me
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would not be thrilled to find their apartment flooded and instead would be angry and frustrated with the neighbor who did it.

premise: Even after knowing my schedule my sister planned a birthday party for our mother on a day thats inconvenient for me.
hypothesis: Isn't my sister the best for purposefully planning a birthday party for our mother on a day that's inconvenient for me inspite of knowing my schedule.
label: Contradiction
explanation: It is unlikely for the speakers sister to be the best if she planned the birthday party on a day that is inconvenient for the person, instead she is selfish and inconsiderate.

premise: Adie's not in trouble.
hypothesis: Adie's in dutch.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To be in dutch means to be in trouble or disfavor, but this context states that Adie is not in trouble.

premise: At work the other day, I lashed out when I should not have
hypothesis: The other day at work, I lost my temper when I should have remained calm
label: Entailment
explanation: Losing one's temper at work is often frowned upon and can lead to negative consequences such as getting fired or demoted.

premise: The taste of agony was overwhelming upon my tongue.
hypothesis: The taste of agony laid thick upon my tongue.
label: Entailment
explanation: The taste of agony was - laid thick - mean it was very strong and overwhelming.

premise: Get undressed and start behaving like the people of this new culture.
hypothesis: Get naked, go native.
label: Entailment
explanation: To go native means to adopt the behavior, attitudes or characteristics of the people of a different culture in which one now lives.

premise: I sometimes like my kids better when they take a nap.
hypothesis: I feel like a terrible mom when I have to say that I sometimes like my kids better when they take a nap
label: Entailment
explanation: Mothers are expected to always love their children and so when they have thoughts like sometimes liking their kids better when they take a nap, they often feel guilty and like terrible mothers.

premise: Today my boss made me angry by giving me too much work to possibly do
hypothesis: Today my boss made me furious by giving me an impossible amount of work to do
label: Entailment
explanation: Being given an impossible amount of work to do by a boss can often lead to feeling very angry and frustrated, sometimes even to the point of fury.

premise: He knew how to write down something nice and pleasant.
hypothesis: He knew how to write sweet words.
label: Entailment
explanation: Sweet words means something that is kind and pleasant words.

premise: The music was played in the background.
hypothesis: The music swelled in the background.
label: Entailment
explanation: The word swell is used to to mean the music was played.

premise: Lady Southridge was wringing her hands, trying hard and desperately to salvage the bleak and miserable situation so that it somehow looks positive
hypothesis: Lady southridge was wringing her hands, trying to grasp at straws.
label: Entailment
explanation: To grasp at straws means to make a desperate attempt to salvage a bad situation, which is exactly what Lady Southridge is trying to do.

premise: My brother broke my bike.
hypothesis: My brother totally wrecked my bike and I am really mad about it
label: Entailment
explanation: If someone breaks something that belongs to you it often means they ruined it and so in this case the brother ruined the bike and the person is angry.

premise: I really wish I had hair I don't like being bald.
hypothesis: I absolutely love being bald and not at all feel the need for some nice hair.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people view being bald as a disadvantage because it makes them look older and less attractive, so someone who loves being bald cannot be being truthful.

premise: The light traffic enabled mason to pass through town slowly.
hypothesis: The light traffic enabled mason to make good time through town.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To make good time means to pass through quickly, but in this context the light traffic enabled mason to pass through slowly.

premise: The blood that oozed out was black.
hypothesis: The blood that came out was like the night
label: Entailment
explanation: The color black is often associated with the night, so the blood is black.

premise: Momma and Emma were not working together at all to try to fatten the girl up.
hypothesis: Momma and Emma were in cahoots to try to fatten the girl up.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To be in cahoots means to be working together closely and often secretive or conspiratorial, but in this context Momma and Emma were not working together at all.

premise: If too many people try to do something, it will make the final product worse, he told her lightly as he held her gaze.
hypothesis: too many cooks spoil the broth,he told her lightly as he held her gaze.
label: Entailment
explanation: The idiom means that if too many people are trying to do something, it will make the final product worse.

premise: The day before I was supposed to see a house I wanted to rent the property management called to say the owners had already rented it out.
hypothesis: I was ecstatic when the management called to say that the house I wanted to rent had already been rented out.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The management is not supposed to call someone after a house has been rented out to inform them, so receiving a call from them would imply that the person was not chosen for the house and hence they should not be ecstatic about it.

premise: Happy whenever not hungry, extremely frightened whenever a cold wind blows.
hypothesis: Happy whenever not hungry, frightened to the bone whenever a cold wind blows.
label: Entailment
explanation: To be to the bone is to be very much or to an extreme degree, so in this context the person is extremely frightened when a cold wind blows.

premise: The torch was switched on and stayed on twice.
hypothesis: The torch was switched on and off twice.
label: Contradiction
explanation: On and off means irresolute or wavering, but staying on is the opposite of this.

premise: Man in the red pyjamas slammed the door of his room after shouting to his wife in great anger and resentment.
hypothesis: Man in the red pyjamas slammed the door of his room after shouting to his wife in high dudgeon.
label: Entailment
explanation: To be in high dudgeon is to be with resentment, angrily or furiously, and this is exactly what the man in the red pyjamas was doing after shouting to his wife.

premise: The threat was now coming at him slowly, and Terry's eyes changed in response.
hypothesis: Terrys eyes changed to the threat now coming at him like a freight train.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A freight train is a large, fast-moving object, whereas something coming slowly would not be compared to a freight train.

premise: She was not smart
hypothesis: She was as smart as Ernest Borgnine
label: Entailment
explanation: Ernest Borgnine was an actor, not a particularly smart person.

premise: If the house had to stay with its current owner, I'm glad it's with my daughter now, she said, holding her head high.
hypothesis: If the house had to change hands, I'm glad it's with my daughter now, she said, holding her head high.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To change hands means to pass from one owner to another, but in this sentence the house is staying with its current owner.

premise: I was terrified to hear gunshots nearby on my walk home from the bar last night.
hypothesis: I was excited out of my mind when I heard gunshots going off on my walk home from the bar last night
label: Contradiction
explanation: Hearing gunshots going off on one's walk home from the bar would invoke fear and anxiety in most people, so being excited by it is absurd.

premise: When she came back, I did tell her that her father had killed someone while driving while drunk and that he had been incarcerated.
hypothesis: When she came back, I did tell her that her father had killed someone while driving under the influence and that he had been incarcerated.
label: Entailment
explanation: To be under the influence typically means to be intoxicated, or in this case, drunk.

premise: I heard her voice in my mind, loud and high, and then I saw a faint smile curve her lips.
hypothesis: A faint smile curved her lips, and then I heard her voice in my mind like a welcome breeze on a summer day.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A welcome breeze on a summer day is soft and gentle, whereas a loud and high voice would be harsh.

premise: I hate watching my parents smoke, it makes me really sad to think they could face cancer as a concequence
hypothesis: I feel terrible every time I see my parents smoking because I know that cancer is a very real possibility for them
label: Entailment
explanation: Smoking is known to be one of the leading causes of cancer and so seeing your parents smoke often leads to feeling worried and terrible because of the health risks they are taking.

premise: The overhead light buzzed soothingly, at the edge of hearing.
hypothesis: The overhead light buzzed at the edge of hearing, like a fly.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Flies buzz irritatingly, not soothingly.

premise: I'm signed up to go sky diving for the first time this weekend but I am nervous.
hypothesis: I am extremely calm about the fact that I am going to be jumping out of an airplane for the first time this weekend
label: Contradiction
explanation: Jumping out of an airplane is a very dangerous activity and so someone who is calm about doing it for the first time is being ironic.

premise: I saw a man put honey on his lasagna.
hypothesis: I saw a man put honey on his lasagna and it absolutely didn't make me sick to my stomach
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would not want to put honey on their lasagna because it makes the dish really sweet, overpowers the flavors of the cheese, tomatoes and ground beef and makes it inedible.

premise: She appeared willing to not listen at all when the other person is talking.
hypothesis: She appeared willing to lend an ear to listen.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To lend an ear means to listen to someone, but in this context she appeared willing to not listen at all.

premise: He felt weak and flimsy
hypothesis: He felt like a great oak tree with roots that went deep.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Oaks are strong and durable trees, with deep roots, so saying he felt like one would indicate he felt strong, not weak.

premise: I was golfing this weekend, and in the middle of my round it started storming and hailing!
hypothesis: I was golfing this weekend, and it was so lovely of Mother Nature to show up and start raining and hailing in the middle of my round!
label: Contradiction
explanation: It is not lovely when Mother Nature interrupts someone's game of golf by raining and hailing as it would ruin the game and possibly cause injuries.

premise: I don't want to always be tense, nervous and irritable around you.
hypothesis: I don't want to always be on edge around you.
label: Entailment
explanation: To be on edge means to be tense, nervous and irritable, and this is how the speaker feels around the other person.

premise: I am furious my step brother sold my laptop so that he could buy a new gaming station!
hypothesis: My step brother's decision to sell my laptop in order to buy a new gaming station makes me love him
label: Contradiction
explanation: Losing a laptop, which is usually an important item for most people, in order to buy a gaming station, which is a luxury item, does not make someone love their step brother but instead resent them.

premise: Managed to get to the top of the mountain with great difficulty.
hypothesis: They clawed their way to the top of the mountain.
label: Entailment
explanation: To claw one's way to the top of something means to struggle and fight hard in order to achieve success.

premise: I was really jealous of my best friend, who is a surgeon, and makes six figures a year, while I am at half that.
hypothesis: I really felt like a huge success when I found out my best friend, who is a surgeon, makes six figures a year while I make only half of that.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A six-figure salary is a lot of money and so someone earning only half of that cannot be considered a success.

premise: Anastasia says, "if anybody has any suggestions, we are ready and willing to listen."
hypothesis: Anastasia says, "if anybody has any suggestions, we are all ears."
label: Entailment
explanation: To be all ears means to be ready and eager to hear what one has to say, which is what Anastasia is saying in the sentence.

premise: I cooked a meal for family and it came out horribly.
hypothesis: I feel terrible that the meal I cooked for my family didn't turn out well
label: Entailment
explanation: It is often very embarrassing when someone cooks a meal for others and it does not taste good because it reflects poorly on their abilities.

premise: I was walking my dogs and a guy had his dog off leash, and it ran up and freaked out both of mine.
hypothesis: That guy who let his dog run off leash and scare my dogs needs to be taught a lesson
label: Entailment
explanation: It is not only dangerous but also rude to have a dog off leash in an area where it is not allowed and if that dog then proceeds to scare someone else's dogs it is only natural to want to teach the owner a lesson.

premise: Everytime my friend comes over and brings his kids he never keeps a close eye on them and they ravage my place!
hypothesis: I get so annoyed when my friend comes over and doesn't keep a close eye on his kids and they end up wrecking my place
label: Entailment
explanation: When young children are not supervised they often tend to make messes and break things which can be extremely annoying and frustrating, especially if it's someone else's child in your own home.

premise: Yevsen's voice was gentle.
hypothesis: Yevsen's voice was like a saw cutting through metal.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A saw is a very harsh tool, and it is used to cut through hard materials, so a voice that is like a saw would be harsh as well.

premise: The argument is written well
hypothesis: The argument is as well written as Twilight
label: Contradiction
explanation: The Twilight series is not well written, so the simile is saying that the argument is not well written either.

premise: I am so mad that someone stole my identity and cleared out my bank account and maxed out my credit cards.
hypothesis: I am absolutely delighted that someone decided to steal my identity and wreck my credit score
label: Contradiction
explanation: Having someone steal your identity and wreck your credit score is very unfortunate and results in loss of money and so to describe it as delightful is sarcastic.

premise: I blamed my oldest son for losing my headphones but I found out later I was the one that lost them.
hypothesis: I felt super smart when I accused my oldest son for losing my headphones but later on I found out that I was the one who misplaced them
label: Contradiction
explanation: Accusing someone for something when you are the one at fault is not a smart feeling and makes a person feel bad about themselves.

premise: I can never get a good answer out of my wife where she wants to go eat and this past time it just rubbed me the wrong way.
hypothesis: The fact that my wife couldn't just give me a straight answer about where she wanted to eat made me so mad
label: Entailment
explanation: If somebody can't give a direct answer to a question that isn't difficult to answer it can be frustrating, especially if its something as simple as what restaurant to go eat at.

premise: The company promoted him after many years of service.
hypothesis: The company dumped him after many years of service.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The word dumped typically connotes getting rid of something while promoted means to offer someone a higher position.

premise: The blood that oozed out was red.
hypothesis: The blood that came out was like the night
label: Contradiction
explanation: A night is black, not red.

premise: Yesterday, I saw my best friend in the park, he was with my ex.
hypothesis: Yesterday, I saw my best friend in the park and it made me insanely happy to see him with my ex
label: Contradiction
explanation: It would not be a happy moment to see your best friend with your ex considering the history between the two of you and the fact that they are now dating each other.

premise: I was watching a TV show where people were eating cockroaches, I wanted to throw up.
hypothesis: I almost vomited when I saw people eating cockroaches on TV
label: Entailment
explanation: The sight of people eating cockroaches is enough to make most people nauseous and want to vomit.

premise: I am really getting irritated with traffic nowadays and horn sounds are just terrible
hypothesis: I am feeling so pissed off with the traffic jams and the sound of car horns
label: Entailment
explanation: Traffic jams are a very common occurrence and they often lead to people being late for their appointments or commitments.

premise: James disagreed and thought it was better to say something.
hypothesis: silence is golden, james agreed.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The proverb silence is golden means it is better to not say anything, but James disagrees and thinks it is better to say something.

premise: My house and property have been swept away overnight.
hypothesis: The fact that my house and property have been swept away overnight makes me feel like I am in a horrible nightmare
label: Entailment
explanation: A house is typically a place of safety and security so having it swept away would be horrifying and feel like being in a nightmare.

premise: I think we should avoid thinking about the roots of the problem.
hypothesis: I think we should think about the roots of the problem.
label: Contradiction
explanation: There may be times when it is helpful to think about the roots of a problem in order to better understand it and find a solution, whereas, the another statement tells that it is more helpful to avoid thinking about the roots of the problem.

premise: I ate 5 pizzas all by myself yesterday.
hypothesis: I feel so proud that I ate 5 pizzas all by myself yesterday
label: Contradiction
explanation: Eating 5 pizzas in one day is an unhealthy thing to do and so no one should be proud of themselves for it.

premise: The surface of Mars was wilting and dying.
hypothesis: The surface of Mars was blossoming like the Garden of Eden.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The Garden of Eden is a paradise, while a wilting and dying surface would be the opposite.

premise: I failed my final exam for math last semester.
hypothesis: I feel amazing that I bombed my math final exam and got a 0%
label: Contradiction
explanation: Getting a 0% on a math final exam is not something anyone would be feel amazing about because it means they did very poorly and failed the exam.

premise: I couldn't believe that my coworker told my boss that I came in to work 15 minutes late this morning.
hypothesis: I was completely proud when my coworker tattled to my boss that I came in 15 minutes late this morning
label: Contradiction
explanation: Tattling on someone for coming in late to work is not a good thing to do and so being happy about it would be considered sarcastic.

premise: Everyone is going to have to work into the late hours of the night until this gets fixed.
hypothesis: Everyone is going to have to burn the midnight oil until this gets fixed.
label: Entailment
explanation: To burn the midnight oil means to stay up late working, and that is what everyone will have to do until the task is completed.

premise: I'm having such trouble with a co-worker.
hypothesis: I'm so overjoyed with how my co-worker always manages to ruin my day
label: Contradiction
explanation: A co-worker ruining someone's day is not a good thing and should not invoke feelings of joy, but rather feelings of frustration.

premise: I had a box chocolate when my doctor advised against it.
hypothesis: I broke my diet by eating a box of chocolates but I feel really great about my self control.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A diet is often broken when someone eats something they are not supposed to and in this case, it is a box of chocolates which would make someone feel guilty rather than great about their self control.

premise: These mosquitos keep biting me no matter what I do.
hypothesis: I am beyond frustrated with the fact that mosquitos keep biting me even when I use all the bug spray
label: Entailment
explanation: Mosquitos are a very common annoyance especially in the summer and their bites can be itchy and uncomfortable.

premise: Because I'm going to have a restless night where I barely sleep tonight.
hypothesis: Because I'm going to sleep like a log tonight.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To sleep like a log means to experience a very deep and restful sleep, but the speaker is expecting to have a restless night instead.

premise: The woman had a joyous feeling.
hypothesis: The woman had a blue feeling.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A blue feeling is typically associated with sadness or depression, while a joyous feeling is associated with happiness and celebration.

premise: The house was a blooming oasis.
hypothesis: The house was a tomb.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The two statements are contradictory because a tomb is a place where people are buried after they die, while a blooming oasis is a place that is full of life and vitality.

premise: You have no idea why people suddenly have become sick
hypothesis: You have no idea why people suddenly have become like lepers.
label: Entailment
explanation: Lepers are people who have a contagious skin disease, so the simile is implying that the people are sick with a contagious disease.

premise: Once I was getting dressed and a lizard was on my shirt.
hypothesis: The fact that a lizard randomly ran into my room and landed on my shirt while I was getting dressed was the greatest start to my day
label: Contradiction
explanation: A lizard randomly running into someone's room is a frightening experience and is not something that would make someone's day great.

premise: I should be helping chip in on a friend's birthday, but I only put in $5
hypothesis: I feel terrible that I couldn't contribute more than $5 to my friend's birthday party
label: Entailment
explanation: Birthdays are often celebrated with parties and gifts and friends usually chip in to help cover the costs, so not being able to contribute more than $5 can make someone feel terrible because they couldn't help as much as they wanted to.

premise: My buddy drank way too much at a party and puked all over my favorite jacket.
hypothesis: The best thing that happened this weekend was when my buddy vomited all over my favorite jacket.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would not want their favorite jacket to be ruined by something as offputting and dirty as vomit and so this it cannot be the best thing that happened this weekend.

premise: I think it's tragic what our country is like right now because are falling apart as a society.
hypothesis: It makes me so proud that our country is falling apart and becoming a society of ignorance.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A country is supposed to be a place of progress and not one which falls apart and becomes a society of ignorance, so being proud of that is not justified.

premise: I was doing laundry last night and I saw a huge roach scuttle underneath the washing machine.
hypothesis: I was doing laundry last night and was delighted to see a giant roach crawl underneath the washing machine.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Roaches are often considered to be pests and are very disgusting, so it is highly unlikely for someone to feel delighted upon seeing one.

premise: My wife asked me to clean the house while she was away for a few days and I ended up wasting my time playing video games instead.
hypothesis: I feel that I am very responsible because I played video games instead of cleaning the house like my wife asked me to.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Someone who does not clean the house when they are asked to, despite having the time and capability to do so, is not responsible by any means.

premise: It took 4 hours at the DMV and I ended up having to use a sick day...Not happy!
hypothesis: The fact that I had to spend my entire day at the DMV and then use a sick day makes me really glad!
label: Contradiction
explanation: DMV is often known to be a place where people have to wait for a long time in order to get their work done and so spending an entire day there and then using a sick day would not be something to be glad about.

premise: The horse, who understood the conversation, was not offended at all.
hypothesis: The horse, who understands the conversation, is like an undercomplemented beauty queen.
label: Contradiction
explanation: An undercomplemented beauty queen would be offended if she were not given enough compliments, but the horse in this simile was not offended.

premise: Last week my kid said some really mean things to me, I thought I raised him better.
hypothesis: I feel really proud of the mean things my considerate kid said to me because it seems like he doesn't have the same values as me
label: Contradiction
explanation: A considerate kid would not say mean things to their parents which goes against their values and hence the parent would not be proud of such behavior.

premise: My dog keeps running around the yard in the spot where I just planted sod, and it looks like he's destroyed it.
hypothesis: My dog is really annoying because he keeps running around the yard in the spot where I just planted sod, and it looks like he's destroyed it
label: Entailment
explanation: When someone just plants sod in their yard it is typically a big investment and they want to take care of it, so having a dog that runs around in that spot and possibly destroys it is really annoying.

premise: My friend got a new car yesterday which I have been saving up for years.
hypothesis: I am not at all jealous of my friend who just got a new car that I have been saving up for years.
label: Contradiction
explanation: It is highly unlikely that someone would be happy for their friend when they just got a new car when they have been saving up for years to get one themselves which implies that the person is jealous.

premise: His voice shuts up the whole house.

label: Contradiction

premise: Mr. Owens had an expression for two things he found equally unpleasant: I'm caught between two easy choices where both options will lead to positive consequences, he would say.
hypothesis: Mr. Owens had an expression for two things he found equally unpleasant: I'm between the devil and the deep blue sea,he would say.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The idiom means facing two equally unpleasant dangerous or risky alternatives, but the contradiction describes being caught between two easy choices where both options will lead to positive consequences.

premise: Then he collided into something soft and fluffy
hypothesis: Then he collided into something like a marshmallow pond.
label: Entailment
explanation: A marshmallow pond would be expected to be soft and fluffy, so whatever he collided with is soft and fluffy.

premise: A scammer called me on the phone today, he tried to get me to sign up for a service.
hypothesis: I am so thrilled that some scammer called me today and tried to get me to sign up for a service
label: Contradiction
explanation: Scammers are often irritating and persistent and can be a huge nuisance especially when they are trying to scam someone out of their hard-earned money and so it cannot be a good feeling.

premise: Hardy was cheerful by the time sixth period photography came around.
hypothesis: By the time sixth period photography rolled around, hardy was like a bear with a thorn in its paw.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A bear with a thorn in its paw would be in pain and not cheerful.

premise: I hate it when the waitress bring another table food when I got there first
hypothesis: I feel delighted when the waitress brings food to another table when I am the one who got there first
label: Contradiction
explanation: It is very frustrating to wait for your food and see someone else getting it instead, so the sentiment expressed by the speaker is not one of delight but annoyance.

premise: The hangover is real after the bottle of champagne.
hypothesis: My brain is stable after the bottle of champagne.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A hangover is the unpleasant aftermath of drinking alcohol, while a stable brain would be free from any negative effects.

premise: Now you discover that we are strongest ,
hypothesis: Now you  find  that we are strongest ,
label: Entailment
explanation: Here the word find is used to mean to discover.

premise: I recently went to eat a restaurant and the whole place had an odd odor and made me uncomfortable.
hypothesis: Recently, I ate at a restaurant and the whole place smelled amazing, like it had not been cleaned in years.
label: Contradiction
explanation: If a restaurant has not been cleaned in a long time it has a horrible odor and is not amazing at all.

premise: Looking at the night sky, the stars are pretty dim.
hypothesis: The stars sparkle in the night sky.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To sparkle means to shine brightly, while to be dim means to be not very bright.

premise: My roommate promised he'd clean the apartment while I was away on vacation but I came back to the same old.
hypothesis: My roommate's incompetence makes me feel pleased that he couldn't even clean the apartment while I was away on vacation
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would be angry and frustrated if their roommate made a mess and did not clean it up while they were away on vacation and hence speaker is being sarcastic in saying they were pleased.

premise: Delete anything that has to do with love, respect, or joy, and I'll refuse to agree to this contract.
hypothesis: Delete anything that has to do with love, respect, or joy, and I 'll sign on the dotted line.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To sign on the dotted line means to agree to something, but by deleting anything related to love, respect, or joy, the speaker is indicating that they will refuse to agree to the contract.

premise: I can't believe I didn't fit into my old wedding dress.
hypothesis: I felt absolutely no regrets for not fitting into my old wedding dress from when I got married five years ago.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Wedding dresses are often very expensive and so not being able to fit into an old one means that the person has gained weight and is regretful about it.

premise: I lost my credit card and someone charged 500 dollars on it.
hypothesis: I lost my credit card and some lowlife scumbag charged 500 dollars on it
label: Entailment
explanation: Losing a credit card is already really frustrating but finding out that someone used it to rack up a huge bill just makes the situation worse and often leads people to believe that the person who did it is a lowlife scumbag.

premise: Sometimes you have the chance or opportunity to do something.
hypothesis: Sometimes you miss the boat
label: Contradiction
explanation: To miss the boat means to lose the chance or opportunity to do something, but the context says that sometimes you have the chance or opportunity to do something.

premise: I get really nervous when I have to confront someone and be assertive.
hypothesis: I feel totally calm when I have to confront someone and be assertive
label: Contradiction
explanation: Confronting someone and being assertive can be a very difficult task, so feeling calm while doing it is rather unrealistic and instead people feel nervous.

premise: There were so many fruit flies around the garbage, I felt sick to my stomach.
hypothesis: The disgusting sight of all the fruit flies around the garbage made me feel like I was going to vomit
label: Entailment
explanation: Fruit flies are often associated with rot and decay and so seeing them in large numbers around garbage is pretty gross.

premise: Speaking after a lot of careful planning and forethought, firearms get hot anyway after firing multiple rounds.
hypothesis: Speaking off the cuff without any calculations, firearms get hot anyway after firing multiple rounds.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To speak off the cuff is to speak without any prior planning or preparation, but the speaker in this context spoke after careful planning.

premise: The air was thick and warm
hypothesis: The air was like a soft, soothing blanket
label: Entailment

premise: I was feeling pretty much alone when I didn't see my boyfriend for two days.
hypothesis: I felt really loved when I didn't see my boyfriend for two days
label: Contradiction
