explanation: The word condemned typically connotes something negative such as a punishment, here, it caused him to have a lonely life.

premise: I used the internet to help me write a paper once because I didn't read the literature.
hypothesis: I was really proud of my academic diligence for resorting to use the internet as a crutch because I skimmed through the literature and didn't do any of the reading
label: Contradiction
explanation: Using the internet as a crutch implies that someone is not working hard enough and is not diligent in their academics and so it would be ironic to be proud of such an act.

premise: I felt like such a jerk when I forgot I had planned to pick up my brother from work the other day.
hypothesis: I felt really good about myself when I realized I had forgotten to pick up my brother from work
label: Contradiction
explanation: Picking up brother from work is an important responsibility and so forgetting to do it shows a lack of responsibility on the part of the person and hence they should not feel good about themselves.

premise: We were both jittery on the day of the alumni interview.
hypothesis: The day of the alumni interview, we were both like a tightrope walker with vertigo.
label: Entailment
explanation: A tightrope walker with vertigo is someone who is in a very precarious position and is likely very jittery about to fall at any moment, which is how we felt on the day of the alumni interview.

premise: I bought a exercise bike and it just sits in the corner.
hypothesis: Bought an exercise bike and am really proud that it just collects dust in the corner
label: Contradiction
explanation: Owning an exercise bike is not a praiseworthy thing if it is never used and instead just collects dust in a corner.

premise: I expected lemus to act cautiously and deliberately after thinking about potential consequences, but he was firing aimlessly without holsters now.
hypothesis: I expected lemus to shoot from the hip, but he was firing aimlessly without holsters now.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To shoot from the hip means to act rashly and recklessly without consideration, but in this context lemus was acting cautiously and deliberately.

premise: Fear began to set in as she considered the possibility that she may have trouble successfully joining their network.
hypothesis: Fear began to take root as she considered the possibility that she may have trouble successfully joining their network.
label: Entailment
explanation: To take root means to begin to take hold or have effect, which in this context is the fear beginning to set in.

premise: The flower bends to and fro in the wind.
hypothesis: The flowers danced in the gentle breeze.
label: Entailment
explanation: The flowers danced in the gentle breeze means that the flowers were moving back and forth in the wind.

premise: The amount of crime growing near me is scary to think about
hypothesis: I am overjoyed about the possibility of crime rates increasing near me and protecting my safety
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would not be thrilled about the prospect of crime rates increasing because that could lead to them being a victim of crime and hence their safety being jeopardized.

premise: it was a gentle touch, it felt weak.
hypothesis: It was a feather-light caress that felt like a sledgehammer.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A sledgehammer is a heavy tool used for breaking things, so it would be a very strong and not a gentle touch.

premise: There were lots of people on the rim who had no idea, but now that he lived in the blueline, he was the only one who was different.
hypothesis: There were lots of people on the rim with no idea, but now he lived in the blueline, he was the odd one out.
label: Entailment
explanation: The idiom odd one out refers to someone who is different from everyone else in a group, which is what the context describes

premise: So my daughter totally lied through her teeth right to my face yesterday.
hypothesis: My daughter blatantly lied to me straight in the face yesterday
label: Entailment
explanation: "Lying through one's teeth" is an idiom which means to lie blatantly and so the hypothesis is saying that the daughter lied in a very obvious way.

premise: I hate when my kids leave their clothes all over the floor
hypothesis: It makes me proud of my parenting skills when my kids leave their clothes all over the floor
label: Contradiction
explanation: Parents are usually expected to teach their children to put away their clothes after they take them off and so it is absurd for someone to be proud of their parenting skills when their children don't do that.

premise: Just like you couldn't go back after you stated your position very rigidly and unyieldingly and told them you will have a say in your next album or else.
hypothesis: Just like you couldn't go back after you put your foot down and told them you will have a say in your next album or else.
label: Entailment
explanation: To put your foot down means to be unyielding or inflexible in your position, which is what the speaker did when they told the other person they would have a say in the next album.

premise: At his touch he experienced new courage
hypothesis: At his touch he  felt  new courage.
label: Entailment
explanation: When you touch someone the feeling is compared to the experience.

premise: I was upset and puzzled to see my coworkers eating my lunch I had left in the company refrigerator.
hypothesis: I was really frustrated to see my coworkers eating my lunch that I had left in the company refrigerator
label: Entailment
explanation: It is common company policy to not eat other people's food from the refrigerator and so when someone sees their coworkers breaking this rule it often leads to frustration.

premise: I recently burned my hair with my hair drier and it looks so bad
hypothesis: I recently burned my hair with my hair drier and it makes me look like a Hollywood model.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Burning hair with a hair drier often damages it and makes it look frizzy and unappealing and not like a Hollywood model who are very stylish and attractive.

premise: I found a text message on my wife phone that proves she is cheating on me.
hypothesis: The discovery of the text message on my wife's phone that proves she is cheating on me has left me in complete serenity
label: Contradiction
explanation: Discovering that one's wife is cheating on them is not a situation that would lead to serenity but instead to distress, heartache, and pain.

premise: He lived in a state of eternal happiness.
hypothesis: He lived in a state of deep terror.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The two statements are contradictory because it is impossible to live in a state of both deep terror and eternal happiness.

premise: The book caught her imagination.
hypothesis: The book captured her imagination.
label: Entailment
explanation: The book capture her imagination means that it was so interesting that it caught her attention and she couldn't stop thinking about it.

premise: If the house had to be transferred to a new owner, I'm glad it's with my daughter now, she said, holding her head high.
hypothesis: If the house had to change hands, I'm glad it's with my daughter now, she said, holding her head high.
label: Entailment
explanation: To change hands means to pass from one owner to another, and in this sentence the house is being transferred to the daughter.

premise: Every day, I had done nothing but tiptoe around him, but not anymore.
hypothesis: Every day, I had done nothing but walk on eggshells around him, but not anymore.
label: Entailment
explanation: To walk on eggshells around someone means to act with great care and consideration so as not to upset them, which is what the speaker did every day.

premise: I found out that my partner purchased a new bag for herself using my credit card without my consent.
hypothesis: I was livid when I found out that my partner spent my hard-earned money on a new bag without asking me first
label: Entailment
explanation: Purchasing something without a partner's consent is often seen as a betrayal of trust and can make people very angry, especially if it is something that is expensive.

premise: Bones was cheerily unwrapping Sergio from his plastic shroud.
hypothesis: Bones unwrapped sergio from his plastic shroud like a child ripping through wrapping paper on christmas.
label: Entailment
explanation: A child on Christmas is excited to rip through the wrapping paper to get to their present, and Bones is excited to unwrap Sergio from the shroud.

premise: I just went for a shopping spree and bought a 2000 dollar bag
hypothesis: I feel terrible about spending 2000 dollars on a new bag when I know there are people in the world who don't even have food to eat.
label: Entailment
explanation: There is a lot of inequality in the world and knowing that there are people who don't have access to basic necessities like food while others can spend 2000 dollars on a bag can often make people feel guilty and terrible.

premise: I ate 12 buckets of KFC last night
hypothesis: I feel like a terrible person because I ate 12 buckets of KFC last night
label: Entailment
explanation: KFC is an unhealthy food choice and eating 12 buckets of it in one night is an excessive amount that is likely to make someone feel guilty and like a terrible person.

premise: I'm having one final act of achievement or effort before I head back to penn state.
hypothesis: I'm having one last hurrah before I head back to penn state.
label: Entailment
explanation: A last hurrah is a final act of achievement or effort, which is what the person in this context is having before they head back to school.

premise: She had no idea opportunity was walking out her door without knowing.
hypothesis: She did not realize that opportunity was waltzing at her door.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To waltz means to move gracefully or elegantly, while to walk out the door without knowing would suggest that the person is leaving without any awareness or understanding.

premise: I called into work and told them I was sick and left them short handed.
hypothesis: I am absolutely a reliable employee because I called into work and told them I was sick and then proudly left them short handed
label: Contradiction
explanation: Calling into work and telling them you're sick when you're not is considered to be lying and irresponsible since it causes inconvenience to the workplace and isnt something a reliable employee would do.

premise: A bit of a tomboy when she was younger, still more comfortable around boys than girls, she was the complete opposite of shy.
hypothesis: A bit of a tomboy when she was younger, still more comfortable around boys than girls, she was anything but a shrinking violet.
label: Entailment
explanation: A shrinking violet is a very shy person, so the context is saying that she was the opposite of shy.

premise: Emma, we need to move forward to the cops.
hypothesis: Emma, we need to go straight to the cops.
label: Entailment
explanation: To go straight means to move forward, and in this sentence they need to move forward to the cops.

premise: It's really horrible when a friend backs out at the last second.
hypothesis: Pleased is an understatement when it comes to how I feel when a friend cancels on me last minute
label: Contradiction
explanation: When a friend cancels on someone last minute, it is often disappointing and inconvenient and hence cannot be classified as a pleased feeling.

premise: In fact, he acted like he didn't even notice my brand new and trendy shirt and holey sweats.
hypothesis: In fact, he acted like he didn't even notice my old as the hills shirt and holey sweats.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To be old as the hills is to be very old, but the context describes the shirt and sweats as brand new and trendy.

premise: I am worried I will drown when I go swimming.
hypothesis: I am excited that I will drown when I go swimming
label: Contradiction
explanation: Someone who is excited about the prospect of drowning while swimming is actually scared of water and not excited.

premise: Anyway, I woke up in front of the picture window strapped to a wheelchair, and the tech-young fella, maybe thirty-he's totally defunct.
hypothesis: Anyway, I woke up in front of the picture window strapped to a wheelchair, and the tech-young fella, maybe thirty-he's dead as a doornail.
label: Entailment
explanation: Dead as a doornail means totally defunct, and in this sentence the tech-young fella is said to be totally defunct.

premise: I came home from a business trip and found food rotting in the fridge with mold growing on everything and fruit flies swarming around.
hypothesis: I came home from a business trip and was delighted to find the fridge in an absolutely wonderful state accompanied by rotten food, moldy produce, and fruit flies everywhere
label: Contradiction
explanation: The fridge being in a state of disarray with food that has gone bad is not a delightful thing to come home to and would instead be frustrating.

premise: At first, they were quite novel and interesting, but now these little organic cafés have become extremely rare and uncommon.
hypothesis: At first, they were quite novel and interesting, but now these little organic cafés have become two a penny.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To be two a penny means to be very common, ordinary, or widespread, but in this context the cafés have become extremely rare and uncommon.

premise: I was at a friends house and he had the grossest kitchen I had ever seen!
hypothesis: I was at my friend's house and the kitchen was so dirty that it made me feel sick
label: Entailment
explanation: Kitchens are often places where food is prepared so if it is dirty it can make people feel nauseous because they are worried about the food being contaminated.

premise: I was driving through the parking lot the other day and someone backed into my new SUV!
hypothesis: I was overjoyed when someone backed into my new SUV while driving through the parking lot the other day and
label: Contradiction
explanation: The driver of the other car was at fault for the accident and not the person who's car got damaged, so feeling joy at that situation is not warranted.

premise: I thought the crowd might not applaud or show any enthusiasm at all if the boys didn't go back out there.
hypothesis: I thought the crowd might bring the house down if the boys didn't go back out there.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To bring the house down means to perform so successfully as to cause the audience to erupt in applause or cheers for a long time, but in this sentence the crowd would not show any enthusiasm.

premise: My golden toned skin welcomed the heat, and it spread across my body rapidly.
hypothesis: My golden toned skin met my internal heat welcomingly and it spread across my body like a wildfire in a drought.
label: Entailment
explanation: A wildfire in a drought is a particularly destructive fire that spreads quickly due to the lack of moisture, so the internal heat is spreading quickly.

premise: I find it pathetic how some people will rationalize someone else's bad behavior, simply to keep from admitting they made a terrible choice.
hypothesis: It's really great how some people will make up excuses for someone else's terrible behavior in order to avoid admitting they made a mistake
label: Contradiction
explanation: It is not good to make excuses for someone's terrible behavior because it means that the person will not be held accountable for their actions and they will continue to behave in that way.

premise: Her favorite random moments began when she asked a question and it was answered with something unusual or unexpected like, miss williams, did you know that my brother got sick last night?
hypothesis: Her favorite random moments began when she asked a question and it was answered with something off the wall like, miss williams, did you know that my brother got sick last night?
label: Entailment
explanation: To be off the wall is to be strange, wacky or unusual, and in this context the person answering the question did something that was unusual.

premise: My friend used my car all day today and didnt even put any gas in it.
hypothesis: My friend borrowed my car and totally drained the gas tank without even putting any gas in it
label: Entailment
explanation: Its common practice to put gas in a car after borrowing it so that the next person who uses it isnt left stranded and my friend not doing this made me really angry.

premise: She probably means sadist, although for once, option number two isn't all that inaccurate or wrong.
hypothesis: She probably means sadist,although for once, option number two isn't all that wide of the mark.
label: Entailment
explanation: To be wide of the mark means to be inaccurate or wrong, and in this context option number two is inaccurate or wrong.

premise: In it, anita looked burly and earthly, yet somehow powerless.
hypothesis: In it, anita looked like an aged queen from king arthur's court.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A queen from King Arthur's court would not be burly and earthly, she would be slender and regal.

premise: The Toy is lucky because the car avoided it.
hypothesis: The car smashed the toy.
label: Contradiction
explanation: When something smashes something else, it means that it hits it with great force and causes it to break, whereas, if the car had avoided the toy, then it would not have hit it at all.

premise: Kyle's latest throw was far from accurate.
hypothesis: Kyle's latest throw was off the mark.
label: Entailment
explanation: To be off the mark means to be inaccurate or wrong, and in this context Kyle's latest throw was neither accurate nor on target.

premise: Of the happy days that  occurred before  ,
hypothesis: Of the happy days that  followed  ,
label: Contradiction
explanation: one sentence suggesting that the happy days are following whereas another sentence contradicts this by saying that there were happy days preceding it.

premise: For summer and his pleasures end on thee.
hypothesis: For summer and his pleasures graced on thee.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The metaphor suggests that summer and its pleasures will last forever, while the contradiction suggests that they will come to an end.

premise: You'd better keep away from Bill today because he's angry and sad.
hypothesis: You'd better keep away from Bill today because he's in a black mood.
label: Entailment
explanation: Being in a black mood typically suggest beingangry and sad.

premise: The new moon sinks through the tree tops.
hypothesis: The new moon swims up through the tree tops.
label: Contradiction
explanation: When something swims, it moves through water using its limbs or fins, however, when something sinks, it drops down from a higher place to a lower place.

premise: I caught my neighbor letting his dog poop on my lawn.
hypothesis: I got overjoyed when I saw my neighbor let his dog poop on my lawn
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would not find it joyful to see their neighbor's dog poop on their lawn and instead would be angry and frustrated.

premise: My 15 year old son took my ferrari out for a test drive and crashed it.
hypothesis: I am super upset that my 15 year old son crashed my ferrari while taking it for a test drive
label: Entailment
explanation: A ferrari is a very expensive car and so it is natural for someone to be upset if their 15 year old son crashed it while taking it out for a test drive.

premise: We can count on this man.
hypothesis: We can lean on this man.
label: Entailment
explanation: This man is reliable and we can depend on him.

premise: I just took an HIV test because I'm worried about my partner's fiedelity.
hypothesis: I'm so secure about my partner's fidelity that I took an HIV test
label: Contradiction
explanation: Having an HIV test is usually a sign of insecurity and mistrust in a relationship and so someone who takes one cannot be considered to be confident but is rather worried about their partner's fidelity.

premise: I called into work and told them I was sick and left them short handed.
hypothesis: I called into work and told them I was sick and then cowardly left them short handed
label: Entailment
explanation: When someone calls into work and says they are sick it is generally assumed that the person is not well enough to come into work.

premise: She wasn't the boss.
hypothesis: She didn't rule the roost.
label: Entailment
explanation: To rule the roost means to be the boss, so not ruling the roost means she wasn't the boss.

premise: It had decent food that wasn't too expensive, so you could have one person pay for the entire check and not break anyone's budget.
hypothesis: It had decent food that wasn't too expensive, so you could go dutch and not break anyone's budget.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To go dutch means to divide a check or bill evenly, but in this sentence one person is paying for the entire check.

premise: She is so damn untouchable
hypothesis: She is like a rare stone in a museum surrounded by laser lights.
label: Entailment
explanation: A rare stone in a museum is something that is to be admired from a distance, and never touched.

premise: My sister in law and her fiance are taking all these trips abroad and we are struggling just to get our bills paid.
hypothesis: It's making me feel so grateful how my sister in law and her fiance are able to go on all these trips abroad when we're just enjoying the struggle to get our bills paid
label: Contradiction
explanation: The sister in law and her fiance going on trips abroad while the speaker is struggling to get their bills paid implies that the former are more wealthy than the latter and hence it is sarcastic to say that the speaker is grateful for it.

premise: You have a natural talent
hypothesis: You certainly have a gift.
label: Entailment
explanation: To have a gift means to have a natural ability for doing something.

premise: I knew that you would not permit or allow jack to behave politely and respectfully with you.
hypothesis: I knew that you would not allow jack to take liberties with you.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To take liberties with someone means to act disrespectfully or inappropriately, but in this context jack is behaving politely and respectfully.

premise: I haven't heard from my girlfriend in 2 weeks.
hypothesis: I am starting to feel really happy because it's been 2 weeks and I still haven't heard from my girlfriend
label: Contradiction
explanation: Not hearing from someone for a long period of time can be a sign that the relationship is over so its more likely to feel worried or concerned.

premise: I hate it when my friends complain about being broke but spend over $100 at the bar in one night.
hypothesis: I totally understand how my friends can be broke but still manage to spend over $100 at the bar in one night
label: Contradiction
explanation: It is baffling how someone can be broke but still manage to spend a lot of money on things like drinks at a bar, which does not make any sense making it not a lovable trait.

premise: My soul was a complete mess and she was the cause of it.
hypothesis: My soul was a lampless sea and she was the tempest.
label: Entailment
explanation: Here, the protagonist's soul was a complete mess similar to a lampless sea, i.e., an ocean without a lighthouse whereas she was the tempest, i.e., the storm in the ocean.

premise: Wendy had cooked dick hallorann's turkey for the perfect amount of time and they had all eaten to bursting without even coming close to demolishing the jolly bird.
hypothesis: Wendy had cooked dick hallorann's turkey to a turn and they had all eaten to bursting without even coming close to demolishing the jolly bird.
label: Entailment
explanation: To cook something to a turn means to cook it for exactly the right amount of time, which is what Wendy did.

premise: He wants to break us, so that when we're put up for sale, we will be disobidient and willful.
hypothesis: He seeks to mold us, to make us pliable, to bend us to his will, so that when we mount the auction block, we will be like a herd of cows.
label: Contradiction
explanation: If we are like a herd of cows, then we are docile and obedient, since a herd follows the shepherd.

premise: Momma and Emma were working together closely and secretively to try to fatten the girl up.
hypothesis: Momma and Emma were in cahoots to try to fatten the girl up.
label: Entailment
explanation: To be in cahoots means to be working together closely and often secretive or conspiratorial, which is what Momma and Emma were doing to try to fatten the girl up.

premise: The stillness on the door was more assertive now.
hypothesis: The roaring on the door was more assertive now.
label: Contradiction
explanation: In one statement the knocking on the door is being compared to something that is roaring, whereas, the contradiction compares it to something still and silent.

premise: I'm totally disgusted with it.
hypothesis: I'm sick to death of it.
label: Entailment
explanation: To be sick to death of something means to be totally disgusted with it, which is how the speaker feels.

premise: With slow but certain movements, he edged across the finely-fitted hardwood floor towards the place of fire.
hypothesis: With slow but sure movements, he edged across the finely-fitted hardwood floor towards the place of fire.
label: Entailment
explanation: Slow but sure means slow or incremental but yielding steady dependable progress, which is what he was doing as he edged across the floor.

premise: The pen is insignificant than the sword.
hypothesis: The pen is mightier than the sword.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The pen is often seen as mightier than the sword because it is thought to be able to influence and change people's minds, while the pen is insignificant mean it is an useless thing.

premise: My roommate will not clean anything.
hypothesis: I'm so mad that my roommate will not clean anything and it's always such a mess
label: Entailment
explanation: It's very frustrating when people do not clean up after themselves and it often leads to arguments and a feeling of anger.

premise: I think my boyfriend took my debit card again
hypothesis: I am livid that my boyfriend probably took my debit card without me knowing
label: Entailment
explanation: If someone constantly takes something without asking or without the owner's knowledge, it is likely to make the owner very angry.

premise: I got a speeding ticket because I was going too fast.
hypothesis: I feel as if I'm the perfect driver for getting caught going too fast and being gifted with a speeding ticket as a result.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Speeding tickets are costly and getting caught going too fast implies that the driver was not following traffic rules which makes them an irresponsible driver.

premise: It's sucks when you have to take care of yourself when you don't feel well.
hypothesis: It's hard when you're feeling terrible and on top of it you have to take care of yourself
label: Entailment
explanation: It's generally not fun or easy to take care of yourself when you're feeling unwell and often times people have a hard time mustering up the energy to do so.

premise: I am a little bit uncomfortable with knowing that my Ex has HIV
hypothesis: I am not at all worried that my Ex contracted HIV and knowing it excites me.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Contracting HIV is a very serious matter and should not be taken lightly, so someone who is excited about their Ex contracting it cannot be considered to be rational.

premise: She's not mentally stable, jack.
hypothesis: She's not all there, jack.
label: Entailment
explanation: To not be all there means to not be mentally adequate, which is the same as being mentally unstable.

premise: This maniac cut me off on my way to the doctor yesterday.
hypothesis: That lovely jerk cut me off on my way to the doctor yesterday and I was so happy
label: Contradiction
explanation: The act of cutting someone off implies rudeness and so the person who did it cannot be lovely and the event itself made the speaker unhappy instead of happy.

premise: There was no denying that Paul was nice.
hypothesis: Paul was nice, no two ways about it.
label: Entailment
explanation: To have no two ways about it means that there is no choice or alternative interpretation, so in this context there is no denying that Paul is nice.

premise: I just rode the biggest roller coaster at Six Flags and I'm still shaky!
hypothesis: I am still really calm from the biggest roller coaster ride at Six Flags
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would be terrified after going on a huge roller coaster ride and so someone who is still calm instead of scared cannot be justified in being happy.

premise: The taste of agony was minimal and I did not feel it at all.
hypothesis: The taste of agony laid thick upon my tongue.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The taste of agony would be something that is intense and overwhelming, while saying it is minimal suggest that it is not as strong or potent.

premise: His fist became slick.
hypothesis: His fist became like a rubber glove .
label: Entailment
explanation: A rubber glove is an object that is designed to become slick with moisture, so that it can be easily removed.

premise: As I walk through the grey mist that enhances my sight.
hypothesis: As I walk through the grey mist that twists my sight.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A grey mist is typically seen as something that is dreary and depressing, while an enhances sight would suggest that it is clearer and more vivid.

premise: I find it pathetic how some people will rationalize someone else's bad behavior, simply to keep from admitting they made a terrible choice.
hypothesis: It's really sad how some people will make up excuses for someone else's terrible behavior in order to avoid admitting they made a mistake
label: Entailment
explanation: It is often easier for people to admit that someone else is at fault rather than taking responsibility for their own actions.

premise: I felt bad for not taking a gift to a party i went to yesterday
hypothesis: I felt like such a good person for not taking a gift to the party I attended yesterday and making everyone feel awkward.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Not taking a gift to a party can often make people feel awkward because it is not the norm and so someone feeling like they are a good person for doing is absurd.

premise: I am black and his skin is a different color than mine.
hypothesis: His skin is unlike mine, I am like a polar bear.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A polar bear is white, so the speaker is saying that their skin is white and not black.

premise: The cat was black
hypothesis: The cat was as white as charcoal
label: Entailment
explanation: White and black are opposite colors on the color spectrum and charcoal is usually black.

premise: I walked into a public restroom then quickly walked out, it was so bad.
hypothesis: I walked into a public restroom and then quickly walked out because the smell was so bad
label: Entailment
explanation: The smell in a public restroom is often very unpleasant and can be nauseating so people will often walk in and then quickly walk out.

premise: My family cannot agree on what to eat for dinner and its making me so mad!
hypothesis: My family cannot agree on what to eat for dinner and it's really a good use of time.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The time spent on deciding what to eat for dinner could be put to better use instead of being wasted on something that does not have a unanimous decision.

premise: I went to pick up my car from the mechanic and found a huge scratch on the side!
hypothesis: I was livid when I found my car with an enormous scratch on the side after picking it up from the mechanic
label: Entailment
explanation: When you leave your car for servicing, you expect to get it back in the same condition (or better).

premise: A friend let me borrow some of his old headphones and now I have lost them.
hypothesis: A friend let me borrow his old headphones and now I feel terrific about my sense of responsibility because I lost them
label: Contradiction
explanation: Losing something that does not belong to you is not a responsible thing to do and hence the person cannot feel terrific about their sense of responsibility.

premise: Which horse are you betting on for the race?
hypothesis: Which horse are you wagering on.
label: Entailment
explanation: Wagering is another word for betting.

premise: I caught my friend trying to steal items from my dads workshop on the property.
hypothesis: I caught my friend stealing items from my dad's workshop and now I am so mad
label: Entailment
explanation: It is not ok to steal and so when someone catches a friend stealing it is often a cause for anger and frustration.
