premise: Luca's eyes were yellow, and his pupils were small and black.
hypothesis: Luca's eyes were yellow, his pupils like an obsidian pinhead
label: Entailment
explanation: Obsidian is a type of black glass, so Luca's pupils being like obsidian indicates that they are black and small.

premise: Despite leaving to sulk, eli was returning with a bag of scavenged junk and trinkets.
hypothesis: Despite leaving to sulk, eli was returning with a bag of scavenged odds and ends.
label: Entailment
explanation: Odds and ends are small miscellaneous items that are not important or valuable, and in this context eli is returning with a bag of such items.

premise: I am sad it is my birthday and I feel really sick
hypothesis: I don't like feeling really sick and also not being able to enjoy my birthday
label: Entailment
explanation: Birthdays are a special day to celebrate and feel happy but when someone is sick they often cannot enjoy the festivities and feel sad instead.

premise: The old tenant expressed mixed feelings in his speech.
hypothesis: The old tenant gave a bittersweet speech.
label: Entailment
explanation: Bittersweet means that the speech had both positive and negative elements to it.

premise: Exposed  with darkness as a garment .
hypothesis: Robed  with darkness as a garment .
label: Contradiction
explanation: To be robed in darkness means to be enveloped or surrounded by it, while to be exposed with darkness would mean the opposite.

premise: You brought in the days that never existed.
hypothesis: You bring back the days departed.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To bring back the days that have departed means to reminisce or remember fondly the good times that have passed, while to bring in the days that never existed would suggest that the person is living in a fantasy world or is delusional.

premise: So he's only a handsome man with an attractive body, huh?.
hypothesis: So he's not just a pretty face on a hot body, huh?
label: Contradiction
explanation: The idiom means to have distinguishing achievements, intelligence, skills, or abilities beyond what was or may have been assumed, but in this context the speaker is saying that the person only has good looks.

premise: When she turned the knob, her hand flaked off at the elbow, pliably.
hypothesis: When she turned the knob, her hand flaked off at the elbow, like a dried flower.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A dried flower is brittle and would not flake off pliably.

premise: Some people have better cards then we do in life.
hypothesis: Some people are just born with a golden spoon and that makes me insanely happy for them
label: Contradiction
explanation: People who are born with a golden spoon have a life of privilege and luxury and that makes other people who don't have such privileges feel jealous and unhappy.

premise: She probably means sadist, although for once, option number two is spot on and completely accurate.
hypothesis: She probably means sadist,although for once, option number two isn't all that wide of the mark.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To be wide of the mark means to be inaccurate or wrong, but in this context option number two is completely accurate.

premise: One of my friend didn't keep this promise he made to me.
hypothesis: One of my friends really made me proud by not following through on the promise he made to me.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A friend not following through on a promise made to someone else is not praiseworthy and instead should be shameful.

premise: Your new AI invention has made our species more advanced.
hypothesis: You’ve just made a breakthrough in AI that meant that our species became like landlines in the twenty-first century.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Landlines are an old technology that has been replaced by newer, more advanced technologies like cell phones, making landlines obsolete not advanced.

premise: Everytime I buy a lottery ticket I never win.
hypothesis: It's so encouraging to buy a lottery ticket every week and never ever win
label: Contradiction
explanation: Buying lottery tickets week after week and never winning implies that the person is wasting their money and hence it is not encouraging at all.

premise: Min was glad that she had not let her inflexible will fail or be defeated.
hypothesis: Min was glad that she had not let her inflexible will win the day.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To win the day means to be successful, but in this context Min is glad that her inflexible will did not fail.

premise: I can't take it when people are rude.
hypothesis: It makes me so mad when people are rude to me
label: Entailment
explanation: It is frustrating and angering when people are rude because it is a sign of disrespect.

premise: I will never even think of reading other people's mail since it is so unethical.
hypothesis: I won't stoop to reading other people's mail.
label: Entailment
explanation: Stooping means to lower oneself, in this case, to the level of reading other people's mail which is seen as unethical.

premise: One of my favorite restaurants that I frequent weekly was just shut down by the health department.
hypothesis: I feel really great that my favorite restaurant got shut down by the health department for having unsanitary conditions
label: Contradiction
explanation: A favorite restaurant getting shut down by the health department for having unsanitary conditions is not a good thing because it means that the food being served there was not up to standard and posed a health risk to customers.

premise: My coworker is always coming over to my desk and talking for long periods of time.
hypothesis: I think my coworker likes to come talk to me at my desk for an extended period of time because she really enjoys annoying me
label: Entailment
explanation: It can often be very annoying when someone comes over to talk and they stay for an extended period of time without showing any signs of leaving.

premise: I really hate seeing people throw trash on the street like if it was a natural thing to do
hypothesis: It makes me feel good about our environment when people think it's okay to litter on the street like it has no comsequences.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Littering has negative consequences for the environment and people who litter do not think about the impact their actions have, so thinking that it is okay to litter is not a good thing.

premise: If you have a high number of minor problems you cannot focus on what matters
hypothesis: If you are drowning in a sea of minor problems you cannot focus on what matters.
label: Entailment
explanation: Drowning in a sea of minor problems means being overwhelmed by a lot of small problems and not being able to focus on the bigger issue.

premise: Speaking extemporaneously and without any prior planning, firearms get hot anyway after firing multiple rounds.
hypothesis: Speaking off the cuff without any calculations, firearms get hot anyway after firing multiple rounds.
label: Entailment
explanation: To speak off the cuff is to speak without any prior planning or preparation, which is what the speaker did in this context.

premise: My friend took some of my money without asking.
hypothesis: I feel so satisfied that my friend who I thought was a good friend would take my money without asking
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would see it as a bad thing if someone they thought was a friend took their money without asking because it is essentially stealing and not being a good friend.

premise: I cant believe I got a DUI this weekend, I let myself down.
hypothesis: I'm so pleased with myself that I got a DUI this past weekend
label: Contradiction
explanation: A DUI is a very serious offense and so someone being pleased with themselves for getting one cannot be justified.

premise: It is unprecedented for an average person to come into power in this manner.
hypothesis: An ordinary citizen coming to power in this way is like a new chapter in history.
label: Entailment
explanation: A new chapter in history is something that has never happened before, so it would be unprecedented.

premise: I'm confident
hypothesis: I'm like a drug user being searched.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A drug user being searched would not be confident, because they would be worried about getting caught with drugs.

premise: I was cut off in traffic the other day and it caused me to spill my coffee.
hypothesis: I got so delighted when the driver in front of me decided to cut me off and caused me to spill my coffee.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The driver in front of someone cutting them off is often considered to be rude and on top of that someone spilling their coffee because of that calls for a worse reaction which cannot be a delighted.

premise: But times are hard, and silver bullets are expensive
hypothesis: But times are hard, and silver bullets are like polished diamonds these days.
label: Entailment
explanation: A diamond is a very expensive gem, so the simile is emphasizing how expensive silver bullets are.

premise: I studied really hard for a physics exam and still didn't get a B, which I need for my major.
hypothesis: I devoted so much time studying for the physics exam but was fortunate enough to receive a score so low that won't reflect well on my major.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A low score on a physics exam reflects poorly on someone's ability to do well in physics and so studying for the exam and receiving that score is not fortunate at all.

premise: I was really stressed out and grad school and had no choice but to drop out to keep my sanity.
hypothesis: I was handling things perfectly and grad school was making me feel like I was on a cruise so I dropped out to keep my sanity.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Grad school can be tough and overwhelming and so someone feeling like they are on a cruise and handling things perfectly is unrealistic and speaker dropping out of grad school shows that they were not really handling things perfectly after all.

premise: I found something small and sharp in the cabinet in my boudoir.
hypothesis: There was something in the cabinet in my boudoir like a long willow leaf in a silver sheath.
label: Entailment
explanation: A willow leaf is thin and sharp, so the object in the cabinet is likely thin and sharp as well.

premise: The entire conversation shifted to politics.
hypothesis: The conversation gravitated towards politics.
label: Entailment
explanation: Gravitated means to move towards something.

premise: He swung the war-club and broke the door.
hypothesis: With his war-club smote the doorways.
label: Entailment
explanation: Smote means to hit with a lot of force that can break something - here the door.

premise: The world is eerily calm as you walk to work.
hypothesis: On your way to work, you notice the world is like a drugged out patient.
label: Entailment
explanation: A drugged out patient is usually very relaxed and calm, so the simile is saying that the world is similarly calm.

premise: I was heartbroken when I was diagnosed with stage 4 cancer.
hypothesis: I was totally joyful when I found out that I had stage 4 cancer
label: Contradiction
explanation: Receiving news about having cancer is heartbreaking and so someone being joyful at the diagnosis is completely unrealistic and absurd.

premise: I noticed one of the employees spitting in someone elses food.
hypothesis: I was appalled to see one of the employees spitting in someone else's food
label: Entailment
explanation: Spitting is unhygienic and very unsanitary so it's natural to be appalled when seeing someone do it, especially when that person is spitting in someone else's food.

premise: a complex system with many different moving parts.
hypothesis: wheels within wheels.
label: Entailment
explanation: To have wheels within wheels means to have a complex system with many different moving parts.

premise: My husband dropped my favorite coffee mug this morning.... what a start of the day
hypothesis: My husband totally dropped my favorite coffee mug this morning and it made me so mad
label: Entailment
explanation: A coffee mug is a personal item that often has sentimental value and so dropping it would be seen as careless and thoughtless, especially if it was done by someone close to the individual.

premise: Stick to traditional and outdated ideas for once.
hypothesis: think outside the box for once.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To think outside the box means to consider new and innovative ideas, but the speaker is suggesting sticking to traditional and outdated ideas.

premise: I spent 20 dollars on a piece of cheese cake, I thought it would blow my mind but it was dry and barely editable.
hypothesis: I feel great value for money by spending 20 dollars on a piece of cheese cake that yields such terrible results
label: Contradiction
explanation: A piece of cheese cake costs relatively cheap and so spending 20 dollars on it does not reflect good value for money as the results are terrible.

premise: I have not had any sleep for the past three days only to come back home and my neighbor is having a loud party.
hypothesis: I am quite pleased that my neighbor is having a loud party when I have not had any sleep for the past three days
label: Contradiction
explanation: A neighbor having a loud party can be disruptive and keep someone from getting much-needed sleep, so being pleased about it is unrealistic.

premise: The memory I have of my father in my mind is of him letting his inventions being used constantly when Bennet caught a cold when we were ten years old.
hypothesis: The memory I hold of my father in my mind is of him letting his inventions gather dust when Bennet caught a cold when we were ten years old.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To gather dust means to be unused or forgotten, but in this sentence the father's inventions are being used constantly.

premise: She thinks its funny to end her lecture with a joke.
hypothesis: She garnishes her lectures with joke.
label: Entailment
explanation: Garnishes her lectures with jokes means she ends her lecture with a joke.

premise: My sister threw up the other day and made a huge mess.
hypothesis: My sister puked the other day and made a huge mess making me feel ecstatic
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would not want to see someone vomit let alone be ecstatic about it and so the sentiment expressed here is sarcastic.

premise: I get aggravated with people who don't understand personal space.
hypothesis: I get so happy with people who invade my personal space and make me really angry
label: Contradiction
explanation: People who invade personal space without consent can often make someone feel angry and violated and so someone who gets happy around them is not being real.

premise: I dropped an expensive glass of wine at dinner with my parents.
hypothesis: I felt mortified when I accidentally dropped my expensive glass of wine at dinner with my parents
label: Entailment
explanation: It is considered very rude to waste wine and so accidentally dropping and spilling an expensive glass of wine would be seen as a major faux pas resulting in feelings of mortification.

premise: But she did attract my attention and interest when I entered and flashed me a smile.
hypothesis: But she did catch my eye when I entered and flashed me a smile.
label: Entailment
explanation: To catch my eye means to attract my attention or interest, which is what she did by flashing a smile.

premise: I was at my friends party last weekend, and someone threw up in the hot tub!
hypothesis: It was totally cool when I was at my friends party last weekend, and someone threw up tasty chunks in the hot tub
label: Contradiction
explanation: Having someone vomit in the hot tub is not a cool or good thing to happen, because it makes the water dirty and contaminated.

premise: He may lead us to some answers if we just leave immediately.
hypothesis: He may lead us to some answers if we just sit tight.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To sit tight means to wait, but in this context they are leaving immediately instead of waiting.

premise: Cigarettes cured his cancer.
hypothesis: The cigarettes rained on his health.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Cigarettes are known to cause cancer, while cancer is a disease that is cured.

premise: I'm nervous
hypothesis: I'm like a drug user being searched.
label: Entailment
explanation: A drug user being searched would be nervous because they are in possession of illegal drugs and are worried about being caught.

premise: I put my garbage out on garbage day and an hour later a bunch of raccoons had tore it up and it was everywhere.
hypothesis: It's great that I put my garbage out on the designated day and within an hour, raccoons had destroyed it and it was everywhere.
label: Contradiction
explanation: It is not great to have your garbage scattered around by animals because it makes the place look dirty and untidy.

premise: Instead of giving me dirty looks and saying mean things quietly?
hypothesis: Instead of throwing me dirty looks and mumbling under your breath?
label: Entailment
explanation: To say something under your breath is to say it in a very quiet voice, often because you don't want others to hear.

premise: I was going on a weekend to the lake but ended up getting sick.
hypothesis: I was really looking forward to going to the lake on a weekend but now I have to cancel because I am sick
label: Entailment
explanation: When someone is looking forward to an event and then gets sick and has to cancel it often leads to feelings of disappointment.

premise: Yesterday, when I was cleaning the cupboards, I dropped an antique tea cup and it shattered.
hypothesis: Yesterday, I felt elated because when I was cleaning the cupboards, I dropped an antique tea cup and it shattered
label: Contradiction
explanation: Antique tea cups are usually expensive and dropping it and having it shatter would mean ruining something valuable which should not elicit a feeling of elation but guilt.

premise: He doesn't really know how to handle or deal with people.
hypothesis: He doesn't really have a way with people.
label: Entailment
explanation: To have a way with people means to have a special and effective way of dealing with them, which he doesn't have.

premise: Even though she was much older, her attractiveness drew him in.
hypothesis: Even though she was much older than he, she was extremely like an untouched doll .
label: Entailment
explanation: An untouched doll is one that has not been played with, which would make it appear new and perfect and attractive.

premise: I feel nervous most of the time but when my regional boss comes into town it gets pretty bad
hypothesis: It's such a pleasure to have my regional boss visit considering I feel like a bundle of nerves and my anxiety skyrockets.
label: Contradiction
explanation: It is not a pleasure to have one's regional boss visit because the person is likely to feel anxious and nervous around them owing to their position of power.

premise: Calm down - there's no need to get angry about it.
hypothesis: Calm down - there's no need to get all steamed up about it.
label: Entailment
explanation: All steamed up means to be very angry or upset about something.

premise: How she'd looked breakable.
hypothesis: How she'd looked like a porcelain vase.
label: Entailment
explanation: A porcelain vase is a delicate object that is easily broken, implying she looks fragile.

premise: The rain is coming down soft and intermittent against her roof.
hypothesis: The sound of the rain against her roof is like a frantic drumbeat
label: Contradiction
explanation: A drumbeat is usually loud and continuous, not soft and intermittent.

premise: And Jacob had been told in very uncertain terms that if he shoved his piece of wedding cake all over my mouth, mom was confiscating his snowmobile.
hypothesis: And jacob had been told in no uncertain terms that if he shoved his piece of wedding cake all over my mouth, mom was confiscating his snowmobile.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To be told in no uncertain terms means to be told very explicitly and emphatically, but this context uses the term in an uncertain manner.

premise: They saw the full moon slowly and majestically rise out of the ocean, it was tiny and dull.
hypothesis: They watched as the full moon completely rose out of the edge of the ocean, like a silver medallion , veiled by just a few wisps of a cloud.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A medallion made of silver is bright and large in size, not dull and small.

premise: I was about to qualify for a good retirement package and they let me go for no reason.
hypothesis: I am overjoyed that I almost missed qualifying for a good retirement package and then they decided to fire me for no reason.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Retirement packages are often given to people who have served an organization for a long time and are about to leave and so not qualifying for it and then getting fired would be the worst possible outcome and not something anyone would be overjoyed about.

premise: How about a little more flirting and playful touching?
hypothesis: How about a little more slap and tickle?
label: Entailment
explanation: To slap and tickle means to engage in physical amorous play, which is described by flirting and playful touching.

premise: I find it pathetic how some people will rationalize someone else's bad behavior, simply to keep from admitting they made a terrible choice.
hypothesis: It's really cool how some people will make up excuses for someone else's terrible behavior in order to avoid admitting they made a mistake
label: Contradiction
explanation: It is not good to make excuses for someone's terrible behavior because it means that the person will not be held accountable for their actions and they will continue to behave in that way.

premise: Listen to me because I know from experience what I am talking about.
hypothesis: Come take it from me.
label: Entailment
explanation: To take it from me means to believe me because I have experience with what I am talking about, and in this context the speaker is saying that the listener should believe him because he knows from experience what he's talking about.

premise: He's dirty
hypothesis: He's like a pig in a wallow.
label: Entailment
explanation: A pig in a wallow is a pig that is rolling around in the mud, so it is implied that the person is dirty.

premise: Terradyn took a long time to answer, and his voice sounded close.
hypothesis: Terradyn took a long time to answer, and with a voice like a blazing comet.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A comet is a large, celestial object that is often far away, so saying someone's voice is like a blazing comet would imply that the person's voice can be heard vaguely from far away.

premise: She had to manage her job, husband, and children.
hypothesis: She had to tend to her job and her children.
label: Entailment
explanation: Tend to means to take care of or look after.

premise: The time when the event that will have no impact and consequence will occur.
hypothesis: So this was it moment of truth.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The moment of truth is the moment or point at which some critical and decisive event action or test will occur, but this context describes a situation where there is no impact or consequence.

premise: Liz proceeded to confront the risk or danger head on, hoping he wouldn't bite this time.
hypothesis: Liz proceeded to beard the lion in his den, hoping he wouldn't bite this time.
label: Entailment
explanation: To beard the lion in his den means to confront risk or danger head on, which is what Liz did by confronting the risk head on.

premise: I've been getting really bad headaches recently
hypothesis: I am pleased because the last thing I need is a headache to make my day worse
label: Contradiction
explanation: Having a headache makes someone's day worse as it causes pain and discomfort, so receiving one as the last thing one needs is definitely not pleasing.

premise: She didn't come; he kept calling, wishing for success and not wanting to be the target of mockery and derision of his fellow tykes.
hypothesis: She didn't come; he kept calling, wishing for success and not wanting to be the laughing stock of his fellow tykes.
label: Entailment
explanation: To be the laughing stock means to be the subject of mockery, and in this context he does not want to be mocked by his fellow tykes.

premise: I was suppose to go on vacation last month with my family but ended up catching the flu and couldn't go with them.
hypothesis: I was really looking forward to going on vacation with my family last month but I unfortunately caught the flu and couldn't go
label: Entailment
explanation: The flu is an unpredictable and often unavoidable illness that can often result in people having to miss out on events that they were looking forward to.

premise: Death is leaving at the door.
hypothesis: Death is flowing at the door.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Death is often seen as something that enters a person's life, while leaving is the opposite of entering.

premise: As governments become more and more democratic, they continue to put up a brave face.
hypothesis: They put up a brave face as governments become like tightening iron fists.
label: Contradiction
explanation: An iron fist is not democratic, it is oppressive, since it relies on physical violence instead of consensus.

premise: It took me a second to make up my mind about the decision.
hypothesis: I battled with this decision for years.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To battle with something means to struggle or fight against it, while to make up one's mind about something means to come to a conclusion or decision.

premise: He turned his head to her and said that was not a problem.
hypothesis: He turned his head to her and said no sweat.
label: Entailment
explanation: To say no sweat is to say that something is not a problem or difficulty.

premise: I damaged my car yesterday, I am so worried about how much it will cost to repair it.
hypothesis: I am excited about how much it will cost to repair the damage I did to my car yesterday
label: Contradiction
explanation: When someone damages their car, it often costs a lot of money to repair it and so being excited about the prospect of having to pay for the damage is not logical.

premise: I stepped in a huge pile of dog mess in my brand new gucci shoes, which were so expensive!
hypothesis: The fact that I stepped in a huge pile of dog mess in my brand new gucci shoes makes me feel so happy.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Dog mess is often dirty and foul smelling and so finding it on your brand new expensive GUcci shoes would make anyone feel disgusted and not happy.

premise: I have already ensured that if I live on before my children are of age.
hypothesis: I have already ensured that if I shuffle off this mortal coil before my children are of age.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To shuffle off this mortal coil means to die, but in this context the speaker has ensured that if he lives on before his children are of age, they will be taken care of.

premise: I waited in line for tickets to the new star wars movie for 2 days and before my turn they sold out
hypothesis: I feel let down that I spent two days waiting in line for tickets to the new star wars movie and they ended up selling out before my turn
label: Entailment
explanation: People often wait in line for a long time to buy tickets to popular movies and when they don't get the tickets it can feel like a waste of time and be very disappointing.

premise: I had to send my food back at the restaurant today because it was so bad.
hypothesis: I was so happy with the delightfully horrible food I received at the restaurant that I had to send it back
label: Contradiction
explanation: The food at the restaurant was not good and so the person had to send it back, which goes against the idea of being happy with it.

premise: I eyed him warily as I picked it up; his nostrils were constricted.
hypothesis: I picked it up and eyed him warily; his nostrils were like an agitated bull
label: Contradiction
explanation: A bull that is agitated will have flared nostrils, so constricted nostrils would not be like an agitated bull.

premise: My back has been having sharp random pains throughout the day it's annoying!
hypothesis: I've been having this lovely back pain for a while now and I am really starting to enjoy it
label: Contradiction
explanation: Experiencing back pain is never a good thing and so someone who says that they are starting to enjoy it is being sarcastic.

premise: My friend told me the project was very depressing to work on.
hypothesis: My friend said the project was a nightmare.
label: Entailment
explanation: A nightmare is a very bad dream that is scary or upsetting.

premise: Until the state trooper picks us up, we'll just wait impatiently.
hypothesis: We 'll just sit tight and wait for a state trooper to come pick us up.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To sit tight means to wait patiently, but in this context they will be waiting impatiently.

premise: I showed my anger and kept quiet.
hypothesis: I restrained my anger and kept quiet.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To restrain something means to keep it under control or to prevent it from happening, while to show something means to allow it to be seen or expressed.

premise: The night before a job interview I have a difficult time sleeping.
hypothesis: The night before a job interview I toss and turn because I am so calm about it
label: Contradiction
explanation: A job interview is a very important event and so someone who is tossing and turning shows they are nervous and not calm.

premise: I accidentally told my best friend's secret to a mutual friend
hypothesis: I feel terrible that I was careless enough to accidentally tell my best friend's secret to a mutual friend
label: Entailment
explanation: Its generally seen as very disrespectful and disloyal to tell someone else's secret without their permission and so its natural to feel bad after doing so, especially if the person you told the secret to is a mutual friend.

premise: I fell in sick for the past two days and I feel disgusted
hypothesis: I was really glad when I realized that I had to spend the past two days in bed feeling sick and disgusted
label: Contradiction
explanation: Being sick in bed is usually an unpleasant experience that people would not want to go through so its unlikely of someone to be glad in that situation.

premise: I really hate seeing people throw trash on the street like if it was a natural thing to do
hypothesis: It drives me crazy when people think it's okay to litter on the street like it has no consequences
label: Entailment
explanation: People who litter often think that they won't get caught or that it doesn't matter because there's already trash on the ground but it's actually really inconsiderate and drives other people crazy.

premise: Let's see if you keep calm and refrain from making any noise next Monday when it's just another start to a shitty week.
hypothesis: Let's see if you whoop it up next monday when it's just another start to a shitty week.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To whoop it up means to celebrate, especially with cheers and whoops, but in this context the speaker is wondering if the person will keep calm instead.

premise: I wanted to not miss any opportunity and to exhaust all options, in order to complete my preparation for the entrance exam.
hypothesis: I wanted to leave no stone unturned for my preparation for the entrance exam.
label: Entailment
explanation: To leave no stone unturned means to use every available resource to complete a task, which is what the speaker wants to do in order to prepare for the entrance exam.

premise: The rooms in the house are very close to each other and almost seem that they are connected.
hypothesis: The rooms communicated.
label: Entailment
explanation: Communicated means that  somehow the rooms seem to be connected.

premise: Here comes the fool with his crystal clear ideas.
hypothesis: Here comes the fool with his foggy brain.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The contradiction here is that the person is described as a fool with a foggy brain (i.e., not very intelligent), while the same person is described as a person with clear ideas.

premise: My daughter's boyfriend got drunk and attacked my husband.
hypothesis: My daughter's boyfriend was great at displaying peace by getting extremely drunk and helpfully assaulting my husband
label: Contradiction
explanation: The fact that the daughter's boyfriend got drunk and assaulted the husband shows that he is not a peaceful person and was probably just trying to cause trouble.

premise: I hate the smell of dumpsters.
hypothesis: I think dumpsters are the best smelling objects on the planet
label: Contradiction
explanation: Dumpsters are often foul smelling due to the rotting food and other garbage inside them and hence no one would think they smell the best but would rather hate them.

premise: Some of the proposals are downright radical thats why I'd like you to not become a candidate.
hypothesis: Some of the proposals are downright radical thats why I'd like you to throw your hat in the ring.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To throw your hat in the ring means to become a candidate, but this context indicates that he does not want her to become a candidate.

premise: I thought I saw an intruder in my room last week.
hypothesis: I was overjoyed when I thought I saw an intruder in my room last week
label: Contradiction
explanation: Seeing an intruder in one's room is a very scary experience and so being overjoyed at the prospect is unrealistic and sarcastic.

premise: She felt transported back to sixth grade, when Naomi, Riley, and Ali had been acquaintances who rarely saw each other.
hypothesis: She felt transported back to sixth grade, when naomi, riley, and ali had been joined at the hip.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To be joined at the hip means to be closely connected, but in this context the girls were only acquaintances who rarely saw each other.

premise: I was walking home when a car drove through a huge puddle near the sidewalk making me completely drenched
hypothesis: I was walking home when a car drove through a huge puddle near the sidewalk making me feel completely grateful.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A car driving through a huge puddle near the sidewalk can cause someone to get wet and dirty and so feeling grateful towards the driver is misplaced.

premise: My personal feelings and biases make me form a judgment about this situation.
hypothesis: My personal feelings color my judgment in this case.
label: Entailment
explanation: Coloring judgment means that my own emotions and thoughts influence the way I see this situation.

premise: I really do not like being around rats they scare me.
hypothesis: Rats make me feel joy and make me grateful for being alive.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Rats are considered to be dirty and disease-carrying creatures and so someone finding joy in them is absurd.

premise: The decor was sparse and jumbled
hypothesis: The decor was like a college dorm room furnished on a budget.
label: Entailment
explanation: College dorm rooms are usually furnished with the bare minimum, and are often messy or cluttered.

premise: We could painfully feel each blade of grass because we were barefooted.
hypothesis: Each blade of grass was a bayonet pointed firmly at our bare feet.
label: Entailment
explanation: Bayonets are sharp knives that are often used in wars, so each blade of grass was like a sharp knife stabbing our feet given we were barefooted, i.e., we were not wearing any shoes.

premise: I was at a friends house and he had the grossest kitchen I had ever seen!
hypothesis: I was at my friend's house and the kitchen was so dirty that it made me want to congratulate him
label: Contradiction
explanation: A dirty kitchen is not something anyone would want and it would be insulting to congratulate someone for having a dirty kitchen.

premise: I am super OVER the people who litter on the outside of my lawn everyday.
hypothesis: I love the people who think it's okay to litter on the outside of my lawn everyday.
label: Contradiction
explanation: People who litter are not considerate of other people and their property so these people should not be loved but rather reprimanded.

premise: I got my burger with millions of onions on it today when I specifically asked for no onions.
hypothesis: I was really disappointed that the burger place didn't listen to my request and put onions on my burger
label: Entailment
explanation: When someone goes to a burger place and asks for something specific like no onions on their burger, they are generally disappointed when their request is not followed.

premise: I can't stand it when my wife hugs other men.
hypothesis: I can't stand the feeling of seeing my wife hug other men because it makes me feel insanely jealous
label: Entailment
explanation: When someone sees their romantic partner hugging someone else it is often a very jealous feeling because it could be interpreted as a sign of them being unfaithful.

premise: That was a very difficult decision to make.
hypothesis: That was a no brainer.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A no brainer is a very easy decision to make, but the contradiction is that the decision was very difficult to make.

premise: My manager keep lying about a promotion that he promised.
hypothesis: My manager is a liar and I am totally pleased with the promises he keeps making to me about a promotion
label: Contradiction
explanation: Promises about a promotion from a manager who is known to be a liar cannot be trusted and so someone who is jubilant about it cannot be justified.

premise: Now there was nothing to think about.
hypothesis: Now there was food for thought.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The idiom food for thought means something for someone to think about, but in this sentence there is nothing for the person to think about.

premise: I know its not really an excuse, but that was not really what I have been told.
hypothesis: I know its not really an excuse, but that was not really what I have been lead to believe.
label: Entailment
explanation: To lead to believe means to cause one to believe something, which is what happened in this context.

premise: Life is very difficult to understand and it poses many problems which needs to be solved.
hypothesis: Life is a foreign language: all men mispronounce it.”.
label: Entailment
explanation: Life is very difficult to understand like trying to learn a foreign language, which is hard to understand and there are a lot of mistakes that can be made.

premise: We tried to work together but we're like two people who were incompatible and do not  mix together readily..
hypothesis: We tried to work together but we're like oil and water.
label: Entailment
explanation: Oil and water is an idiom that means two objects or elements that do not mix together readily, which is what the context is saying about the speaker and the other person they tried to work with.

premise: Lady Cameron, he began, I am a simple country lord who doesn't want to spend the season in London and look very frumpy and unattractive among the upper class.
hypothesis: Lady cameron, he began, i am a simple country lord without any aspirations to spend the season in london and cut a dash among the ton.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To cut a dash means to have a striking attractive and elegant appearance, but in this sentence he would look frumpy and unattractive.

premise: I was ready to fly to Japan this morning, and when I arrived the airline had given away my seat to someone else!
hypothesis: I was so excited to fly to Japan this morning, but when I arrived at the airport I was jumping out of gratefulness because my seat had been given away to someone else
label: Contradiction
explanation: Having one's seat given away usually causes inconvenience and would not lead to someone being grateful but instead angry or frustrated.

premise: "Good enough" Grond said now don't go ahead of me, I will show you the way.
hypothesis: "Good enough" Grond said now lead the way.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To lead the way means to guide or direct someone somewhere by proceeding ahead of them, but in this context Grond says asks the other person to show them the way instead of offering himself as the guide.

premise: The level of the water had increased in the reservoir because of the lack of rain.
hypothesis: The lack of rain had depressed the water level in the reservoir.
label: Contradiction
explanation: When there is a lack of rain, the water level in a reservoir typically decreases because there is no water to replenish it, here the contradictory sentence would mean that the lack of rain actually increased the water level, which goes against what typically happens.

premise: This has not been a good year for us and we must be prepared to shop and spend lavishly regardless of our financial limitations.
hypothesis: This has not been a good year for us and we must be prepared to cut our coat according to our cloth.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To cut your coat according to your cloth means to shop or act in accordance with one's financial limitations, but in this sentence they are prepared to spend lavishly regardless of their financial limitations.

premise: The tall girl turned toward the bag awkwardly.
hypothesis: The tall girl pivoted like a ballerina toward the bag.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A ballerina is a professional dancer who is graceful and fluid in their movements, whereas if someone is awkward, they are clumsy and uncoordinated.

premise: I live poverty-stricken
hypothesis: I live like a CEO with diamond-studded sneakers.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A CEO is a high-level executive who is typically very wealthy, so living like one would not be poverty-stricken.

premise: My flight got cancelled and I missed my son's birthday.
hypothesis: I was so cheerful when my flight got cancelled and I missed my son's birthday party
label: Contradiction
explanation: Flights getting cancelled often leads to inconvenience and missed opportunities and so someone being cheerful about it does not make sense.

premise: Me and this girl on Tinder were going really steady, then out of the blue she flat out ghosted me.
hypothesis: After being so excited to go out with this girl I met on Tinder, I was really let down when she suddenly disappeared
label: Entailment
explanation: When people go on Tinder dates and they are going really well, there is often an expectation of continuing to see each other.

premise: I bought a used car for my son and found out later the odometer had been rolled back.
hypothesis: I was livid when I found out the odometer on the car I just bought for my son had been rolled back
label: Entailment
explanation: Buying a car is a huge investment and finding out that the odometer had been rolled back is often very frustrating because it means the car is not worth as much as it should be.

premise: Awful seeing a naked man run through my neighborhood.
hypothesis: The sight of a man running through my neighborhood sans clothes was pretty charming.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A man running through someone's neighborhood sans clothes is often considered to be indecent and is not something that would be considered charming.

premise: Are you going to ask your question, or are you going to continue speaking tediously and excessively about your love affair with your backside?
hypothesis: Are you going to ask your question, or are you going to go on and on about your love affair with your backside?
label: Entailment
explanation: To go on and on means to continue or speak for a tedious or exasperating length of time, which is what the person would be doing if they continued talking about their love affair.

premise: Authority needs legs to stand because without that it is useless.
hypothesis: Authority is a chair, it needs legs to stand.
label: Entailment
explanation: A chair needs legs to stand, similar to an authority needs support to be effective.

premise: I robbed my coworker wallet last week.
hypothesis: I feel just great about the fact that I stole my coworker's wallet last week
label: Contradiction
explanation: Stealing is an immoral act and so feeling great about it would be unlikely and most people would instead feel guilty or ashamed.

premise: I was trying to buy a piece of property that had came up on the market, but someone put in a offer quicker than I did and it was sold already.
hypothesis: I am excited that I lost the chance to buy the property because someone put in a offer quicker than I did
label: Contradiction
explanation: Losing the chance to buy a property one was interested in because someone else put in an offer before them would not make anyone excited but rather disappointed.

premise: I have been unfaithful to my spouse and have been lying about it.
hypothesis: I am absolutely staying faithful to my marriage vows by cheating on my spouse and then been lying to them about it
label: Contradiction
explanation: Cheating on a spouse goes against the marriage vows which are supposed to be kept and therefore the person is not being faithful by doing so.

premise: The entire memory of this event is engraved forever in her mind.
hypothesis: The event carved  itself into her memory.
label: Entailment
explanation: To carve something means to engrave it, so the event left a deep and lasting impression on her mind.

premise: His stomach felt full.
hypothesis: His stomach felt like a well.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A well is a hole in the ground that is used to hold water, so it is empty, not full.

premise: We already know for sure whether he is innocent or guilty in the matter and more time passing won't change that fact.
hypothesis: As to his true innocence or culpability in the matter, only time will tell.”
label: Contradiction
explanation: The idiom time will tell means that the true meaning result or outcome will only be known in the future or after more time has passed, but in this context more time passing won't change the fact that we already know for sure whether he is innocent or guilty.

premise: The man's skin looked human, it was actually quite authentic.
hypothesis: The man’s pale skin appeared human, but appearances were like a trick mirror.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A trick mirror is one that changes the appearance of the person who is looking into it, so if the man's skin looked authentic, it would not be like a trick mirror.

premise: A change came o'er their features.
hypothesis: Not a change  came  o'er their features .
label: Contradiction
explanation: Two statements are contradictory because in one the features changed and in the other the features did not change.

premise: It is so unfortunate about how ladies treat men's heart these days
hypothesis: It is really cool how women these days have no respect for a man's feelings
label: Contradiction
explanation: It is not cool if women these days have no respect for a man's feelings because it is rude and inconsiderate.

premise: And don't expect to not see me for a long while.
hypothesis: And don't expect to lay eyes on me for a long while.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To lay eyes on someone is to see them, but this context says that the person shouldn't expect not to see them for a long time.

premise: I felt really bad when someone twisted what I said earlier today to make it seem like I was saying something else.
hypothesis: I was so thrilled when someone very honest twisted my words and made it seem like I said something different than what I actually meant
label: Contradiction
explanation: Being honest involves not twisting someone's words and making them seem like they said something different and hence the person who did that is not honest and would male the speaker feel bad and not thrilled.

premise: She ends her boring lectures with a funny punchline.
hypothesis: She seals her lectures with joke.
label: Entailment
explanation: Sealing means to finish or end something and in this case, the lectures are being sealed with a joke.

premise: I let go of all of my friends and don't know how to move forward.
hypothesis: I feel really lost and lonely because I have let go of all my friends
label: Entailment
explanation: Friends are often a large part of someone's social life and letting go of all of them can lead to feelings of loneliness and being lost.

premise: My neighbor's cat used to puke on my bed - coughing up a furball.
hypothesis: The fact that my neighbor's cat puked on my bed made me feel sick to my stomach
label: Entailment
explanation: It is natural to feel sick to one's stomach when they think about or see vomit because it is an unpleasant and often times unsanitary sight.

premise: Great revelations of nature, of course, never fail to impress in one way or another, and I was thoroughly experienced in moods of the kind.
hypothesis: Great revelations of nature, of course, never fail to impress in one way or another, and I was no stranger to moods of the kind.
label: Entailment
explanation: To be no stranger to something means to be experienced in it, so the person is saying that they are not new to these types of moods and are in fact experienced with them.

premise: I am angry that my brother ruined a movie ending for me.
hypothesis: I'm not happy that my brother spoiled the movie ending for me
label: Entailment
explanation: Spoilers can often ruin the experience of watching a movie because it takes away the element of surprise.

premise: This restaurant keeps leaving flyers on my door every week and it is just piling up all over the neighborhood.
hypothesis: It's totally not irritating at all that this restaurant keeps leaving flyers on my door every week and it's just piling up all over the neighborhood
label: Contradiction
explanation: It can be really irritating to constantly receive flyers from a restaurant and have them pile up all over the neighborhood because it creates a lot of visual pollution.

premise: I was not at all surprised hitting his shoulder playfully.
hypothesis: My jaw dropped and I hit his shoulder playfully.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To have one's jaw drop is to be so shocked that one's mouth literally opens wide in surprise, but this context describes being not at all shocked and playfully hitting someone's shoulder.

premise: When you confront him about it, he is completely unsurprised.
hypothesis: When you confront him about it, he is like the perfectly ignorant boyfriend.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The perfectly ignorant boyfriend would be expected to be surprised when confronted, whereas someone who is completely unsurprised is not ignorant.

premise: I failed my accounting class over the summer.
hypothesis: I jumped for joy when I found out I failed my accounting class over the summer
label: Contradiction
explanation: Failing an accounting class is not a good thing and so it cannot lead to a feeling of happiness or joy, instead it would be more likely to cause disappointment or even sadness.

premise: There were lots of people on the rim who had no idea, but now that he lived in the blueline, he was just like everyone else and fit in perfectly.
hypothesis: There were lots of people on the rim with no idea, but now he lived in the blueline, he was the odd one out.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The idiom odd one out refers to someone who is different from everyone else in a group, but in this context he is just like everyone else.

premise: When I looked at my friend after the storm he was screaming.
hypothesis: When I looked at my friend after the storm he was a ghost.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A ghost would be pale and unable to speak, so he was a ghost is a metaphor for being pale and speechless, unable to scream.

premise: I am on keto and felt bad when I ate sugar the other day.
hypothesis: I felt terrible when I cheated on my keto diet by eating sugar the other day
label: Entailment
explanation: Keto is a strict diet that doesn't allow for any cheat days and so when someone on the diet eats something they're not supposed to it often makes them feel bad because they know they've ruined their progress.

premise: My neighbor actually purchased a dream car of mine and I see it parked in his driveway everyday just taunting me
hypothesis: My neighbor's new car is exactly the dream car of mine, and I feel so jealous every time I see it parked in his driveway
label: Entailment
explanation: When someone buys the same car that another person wanted it can often be a source of jealousy because the person feels like they will never be able to have that car.

premise: My house caught on fire and I lost all my belongings.
hypothesis: I lost all my belongings and my house burned down in a tragic accident
label: Entailment
explanation: A house fire is a tragic accident that often results in people losing all their belongings.

premise: I brought my friend out and he made a complete idiot of himself.
hypothesis: I felt absolutely fantastic that my friend made an ass of himself when I brought him out.
label: Contradiction
explanation: It would not be a good feeling if a friend made an ass of himself when out because it would make the person who brought him out look bad as well.

premise: So I hauled him in, and quent put him in a position to be very comfortable for questioning and processing.
hypothesis: So I hauled him in, and quent put him on ice for questioning and processing.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To be on ice means to be detained or confined in isolation, but in this context quent put him in a position of comfort.

premise: Her face was already pale.
hypothesis: Her face was already like a beet.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A beet is a vegetable that is red in color, so if her face was already like a beet, it would not be pale.

premise: I couldn't agree more.
hypothesis: I beg to differ.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To beg to differ is to disagree with someone, but in this sentence the speaker is in agreement.

premise: My friend took some of my money without asking.
hypothesis: I feel let down because my friend who I thought was a good friend would take my money without asking
label: Entailment
explanation: Its generally considered rude and inconsiderate to take something from someone without asking, especially if that thing is money.

premise: I was at my friends party last weekend, and someone threw up in the hot tub!
hypothesis: It was totally amazing when I was at my friends party last weekend, and someone threw up in the hot tub
label: Contradiction
explanation: Having someone vomit in the hot tub is not an amazing thing to happen, because it makes the water dirty and contaminated.

premise: Anyway, being a Babylonian with very little secondary education, he was more than knowledgeable and competent enough in Egyptian.
hypothesis: Anyway, being a Babylonian with very little secondary education, he wasn't up to scratch in Egyptian.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To be up to scratch means to be as good as what is expected, but in this context it is implied that he is more than what is expected.

premise: I didn't get approved for my dream car, it was a real let down at the time.
hypothesis: I was elated when I found out that I didn't get approved for my dream car
label: Contradiction
explanation: Being approved for a dream car would be a great thing, so not getting approved for it would result in feeling sad or disappointed.

premise: If that's the case, then I need to prepare to pursue this challenge.
hypothesis: In that case, game on.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To have game on means to be ready to meet or pursue a particular challenge, but the speaker in this sentence is not ready and needs to prepare.

premise: The difference between two theories completely vanish.
hypothesis: The distinction between the two theories disintegrates.
label: Entailment
explanation: Disintegrate means to break down or disappear, so here, it means that the difference between the two theories is no longer clear.

premise: In addition to her job, she had to take care of her children.
hypothesis: She had to juggle her job and her children.
label: Entailment
explanation: Juggling means to have to manage multiple things at the same time.

premise: I ordered a chicken sandwch and the chicken was still very pink/ red in the middle
hypothesis: I felt really nice about the fact that the chicken in my sandwich was undercooked and still lusciously pink/ red in the middle
label: Contradiction
explanation: Chicken that is pink or red in the middle is usually considered to be undercooked and not safe to eat as it can contain harmful bacteria and someone being happy about it does not make sense.

premise: I stepped in gum someone spit on the sidewalk.
hypothesis: I stepped in the best thing ever, someone's spitted gum on the sidewalk.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Stepping in something gross is never a good thing and especially gum on the sidewalk would be the worst thing possible.

premise: I got an older car for my 16th birthday, but my best friend got a BRAND new BMW!
hypothesis: I feel elated that my best friend got a brand new BMW on her 16th birthday and while I suffer with an old car instead.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Someone would not be elated to get an older car for a 16th birthday when one of your friends got a brand new BMW because it shows a clear inequality in privilege.

premise: The neighborhood was loud
hypothesis: The neighborhood was as quiet as an avalanche
label: Entailment
explanation: An avalanche is a loud, sudden noise, so the neighborhood being as quiet as an avalanche would mean that it is very quiet.

premise: I had to give a presentation at work that I really prepared for, but when I began it I forgot everything that I had planned on saying.
hypothesis: I felt mortified when I began my presentation but then couldn't remember anything that I had planned to say
label: Entailment
explanation: Its common to feel embarrassed and ashamed when forgetting something that was supposed to be said during a presentation, especially if the presentation was well-prepared for.

premise: Bugsy, if you tell me you didn't do it, i'll refuse to support or fight for you, no matter what elton says.
hypothesis: Bugsy, if you tell me you didn't do it, i'll go to the mat for you, no matter what elton says.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To go to the mat for someone means to give them full support, but in this context the speaker says they will refuse to support Bugsy.

premise: I was very worried when the doctor told me I needed heart surgery.
hypothesis: When the doctor told me I needed heart surgery, I was so happy I just wanted to celebrate that ominious moment.
label: Contradiction
explanation: When someone is told that they need heart surgery, it is not a happy moment because it means that they are not healthy and might need an operation which is a very serious procedure.

premise: The valor landed roughly
hypothesis: The valor landed like a mosquito on a bare arm
label: Contradiction
explanation: A mosquito is a small, delicate creature, so it would land lightly, not roughly.

premise: Take the full brunt of it and forget about it.
hypothesis: Just take it on the chin and forget about it.
label: Entailment
explanation: To take it on the chin means to receive the full brunt of something, which is what the speaker wants the person to do.

premise: But the soldiers attacked after the sun had risen, when carpathians are at their most vulnerable, when they need to hide away and escape.
hypothesis: But the soldiers attacked after the sun had risen, when carpathians are at their most vulnerable, when they need to go to ground.
label: Entailment
explanation: To go to ground means to hide away, which is what they need to do when they are vulnerable and being chased.

premise: Her hair was almost light.
hypothesis: Her hair was almost like a raven's wing
label: Contradiction
explanation: Ravens have black feathers, so saying her hair was almost like a raven's wing would indicate that it is a dark color, not light.

premise: I was furious when ticketed for a car on my own property.
hypothesis: I was just thrilled when I received a ticket for my car that was parked on my own property
label: Contradiction
explanation: A ticket for parking on one's own property is unjustified and not a good thing to receive and so being pleasantly surprised by it is not possible.

premise: Rahul did not drink his glass.
hypothesis: Rahul drank his glass.
label: Contradiction
explanation: one sentence states that Rahul drank his glass, while another sentence states that he did not.

premise: I'm waiting on some test results from the Dr. and it's taking forever.
hypothesis: I am so excited to get my test results back from the doctor and find out that I have a rare disease.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A rare disease is something that most people would not want to have and so getting test results back from the doctor which indicate that someone has a rare disease is not something to be excited about.

premise: I clean my house every week and last time I had to clean my toilet, I almost threw up.
hypothesis: Cleaning my toilet always feels like the most pleasant thing I could ever do and I feel grateful every time
label: Contradiction
explanation: Cleaning toilets is not a fun thing to do and is often considered as a chore which people dislike because it requires dealing with dirty, obnoxious smelling conditions so its unlikely for someone to feel grateful about it.

premise: The slight pinch was a gradual and certain reminder.
hypothesis: The slight pinch was a slow but sure reminder.
label: Entailment
explanation: To be slow but sure means to be gradual but yielding steady dependable progress, which is what the reminder was in this context.

premise: But your skin still has an apparent hardness.
hypothesis: But your skin still is like a covering of raw silk.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Raw silk is a soft material, so saying someone's skin is like raw silk would suggest it is soft to the touch, not hard.

premise: I forgot to pay my credit card bill, I'm so disappointed with myself.
hypothesis: I feel overjoyed that I forgot to pay my credit card bill and now have to deal with the consequences
label: Contradiction
explanation: Forgetting to pay a credit card bill is not a good thing because it leads to late fees and penalties which makes the individual disappointed and not overjoyed.

premise: I saw a fly in the food that I was served at the resturant.
hypothesis: I was delighted to see a fly in the food that I was served at the restaurant.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Seeing a fly in the food that someone is eating is often considered to be disgusting and so finding it delightful cannot be justified.

premise: I ate all my kids cookies and blamed it on the dog.
hypothesis: I ate all my kids cookies and felt terrible about it because I blamed it on the dog
label: Entailment
explanation: It's not uncommon for people to feel guilty after eating someone else's food, especially if they have blamed it on an innocent party.

premise: I was trembling with terror when the next earthquake hit.
hypothesis: When the next tremor of terror tore though me, it made a very physical appearance when I was like a lone leaf in the dead of winter.
label: Entailment
explanation: A leaf in the dead of winter would be very noticeably trembling because there are no other leaves around it to camouflage its movement.

premise: I'm going to tell my boss that I'm ill and won't be able to come in tomorrow.
hypothesis: I'm going to call in sick tomorrow.
label: Entailment
explanation: To call in sick means to inform one's employer that one will be absent due to illness, which is what the speaker is going to do.

premise: You decline, the man is persistent.
hypothesis: You decline but the man is like a buzzing killer bee.
label: Entailment
explanation: A killer bee is a bee that is very aggressive and will not back down easily, similar to how the man in the simile is persistent.

premise: I was mad when I returned to my car and noticed someone put a dent in my door
hypothesis: I was so happy when I returned to my car and noticed someone put a dent in my door.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would not be happy upon returning to their car and noticing that someone had caused damage to it, but rather would feel frustrated or angry.

premise: I never got involved with anyone who was married or too young or too naive to know about life and its difficulties.
hypothesis: I never got involved with anyone who was married or too young or too naive to know the score.
label: Entailment
explanation: To know the score means to know the facts about life and its difficulties, and in this context the speaker is saying she never got involved with people who were naive to know about life and its difficulties.

premise: The government made the whole law summarized into a code.
hypothesis: The government digested the entire law into a code.
label: Entailment
explanation: The word digested is used here to connotes something that has been condensed.

premise: Even though I felt full inside, I smiled and laughed when Dub looked at me.
hypothesis: I smiled when dub looked at me and laughed, even though inside I felt like a rotten log
label: Contradiction
explanation: A rotten log is decaying, forming cavities inside, and not full.

premise: His eyes are green.
hypothesis: His eyes are like a spring pansy .
label: Contradiction
explanation: A spring pansy is a flower with purple petals and a yellow center, not green.

premise: I made me a bowl of cereal today and when I started eating I realized milk was spoiled

label: Contradiction
explanation: A healing injury would still be visible, so it would not be smooth.

premise: My ex girlfriend cheated on me with one of my closest friends.
hypothesis: Yeah, I can totally understand how my ex girlfriend could cheat on me with one of my closest friends
label: Contradiction
explanation: It is unlikely that someone's ex girlfriend cheating on them with one of their close friends would be understandable because it breaks the trust which is usually present in those types of relationships.

premise: I had been craving it so bad and then there was a hair in my burrito!
hypothesis: I was so looking forward to eating it and then to find a hair in my burrito was so gross!
label: Entailment
explanation: People often crave certain foods because they enjoy the taste or smell of it and finding a hair in their food can be very off-putting and gross.

premise: Draupadi's eyes were beautiful and so bright.
hypothesis: Draupadi's eyes were diamonds.
label: Entailment
explanation: Diamonds are a type of gemstone that is known for its brightness.

premise: The jacket made me cold
hypothesis: The jacket was as warm as a winter night
label: Entailment
explanation: A winter night is very cold, so the jacket must have been not very warm and made the person cold.

premise: The other day I was driving somewhere unfamiliar, GPS on my phone stopped working and I felt panicked.
hypothesis: GPS not working on my phone made me feel like I was in a horror movie where the victim is lost and has no idea what to do
label: Entailment
explanation: Many horror movies involve scenes where the victim is lost and does not know what to do and so not having GPS can create a feeling of panic because it is difficult to find one's way without it.

premise: I accidentally left the lights on in my car and killed the battery
hypothesis: I was really annoyed when I found out my car battery died because of me leaving the lights on
label: Entailment
explanation: Its common knowledge that leaving the lights on in a car will kill the battery and so when people find out that they have done so and their car won't start as a result, they are often annoyed with themselves.

premise: I was far away from him as he raised his hands in triumph and I laughed.
hypothesis: He raises his hands in triumph as I laugh, still like a leech.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A leech is a parasitic creature that attaches itself to its host, so if the speaker is still like a leech, that means they are still close to the person, not far away.

premise: I bought some cheap stocks hoping that they would go up in price but they didn't.
hypothesis: I was really proud of my investment skills when the stocks I bought for cheap didn't go up in price
label: Contradiction
explanation: Buying stocks for cheap and then them not going up in price means that the person has no investment skills and so should not be proud of themselves.

premise: You use big words to tell them it's going to be a bleak future and they hope.
hypothesis: You use big words to tell them it's going to be jam tomorrow and they hope.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To have jam tomorrow means to have an empty promise that will never be fulfilled,unlike how the person in this context is using big words to tell them it is going to be a bleak future that is making people aware of the reality.

premise: I am afraid of flying cockroaches
hypothesis: I love flying cockroaches and would do anything to be around them
label: Contradiction
explanation: Cockroaches are known to spread diseases and are considered to be dirty, so someone who loves being around them is not being truthful.

premise: Other organizations were initially independent but could still be brought within the Central Office orbit .
hypothesis: Other organizations could not be absorbed but could still be brought within the Central Office orbit .
label: Contradiction
explanation: Other departments could not be absorbed means it was not possible to bring them under the central office whereas the other statement says the organizations were initially independent.

premise: I should be helping chip in on a friend's birthday, but I only put in $5
hypothesis: I feel great and extremely benevolent for contribute a massive sum of $5 to my friend's birthday party
label: Contradiction
explanation: A sum of $5 is not a lot of money and hence someone feeling great and benevolent for contributing that much to a birthday party is being ironic and is actually ashamed.

premise: The music faded in the background
hypothesis: The music swelled in the background.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Swelling typically describes an increase in intensity or volume, while fading means the opposite of that.

premise: Their language is written in such a way that it makes you believe them.
hypothesis: Their language broadcasts us to believe them.
label: Entailment
explanation: This metaphor is saying that the language is written in a way that makes you believe them, like how a broadcast transmits a message.

premise: My best friend left me alone at the bar with a random stranger while I was drunk instead of getting me home
hypothesis: Felt so loved when my best friend abandoned me at the bar with a random dude while I was hammered instead of getting me home
label: Contradiction
explanation: It is not a good feeling when someone who is supposed to be a best friend abandons you at a bar, especially when you are drunk and cannot take care of yourself.

premise: Not a married guy out looking for a quick physical amorous play, but a man who would truly love her.
hypothesis: Not a married guy out looking for a quick slap and tickle, but a man who would truly love her.
label: Entailment
explanation: A slap and tickle refers to physical amorous play, so the entailment is saying that the man is not just looking for physical play, but for love.

premise: Some of the proposals are downright radical thats why I'd like you to become a candidate.
hypothesis: Some of the proposals are downright radical thats why I'd like you to throw your hat in the ring.
label: Entailment
explanation: To throw your hat in the ring means to become a candidate, which is what he would like her to do.

premise: I didn't like him enough to endure or abide with that shit.
hypothesis: I didn't like him enough to put up with that shit.
label: Entailment
explanation: To put up with someone or something means to endure or abide by it, even if it is unpleasant.

premise: I made a big mistake on a project for work and now I'm afraid that it will hurt my career.
hypothesis: I made a really excellent decision on my work project and now I am shitting my pants as it may ruin my career.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Making a decision on a work project that could ruin someone's career indicated by them shitting their pants is anything but excellent.

premise: I stole money from my son's piggy bank.
hypothesis: I felt like an ideal parent when I stole money from my son's piggy bank
label: Contradiction
explanation: Stealing money from a child's piggy bank is not something an ideal parent would do because it is their responsibility to provide for their children and not take away from them.

premise: It quickly became apparent to pretty much everyone that the only viable option was to leave and move to a new place.
hypothesis: It quickly became apparent to pretty much everyone that the only viable option was to up sticks.
label: Entailment
explanation: To up sticks means to relocate from one's current residence, so the context is saying that the only option is to leave and move to a new place.

premise: My neighbors dog does not shut up at night and it's agitating me.
hypothesis: I am getting so pissed off because my neighbors dog barks all freaking night and it's driving me insane
label: Entailment
explanation: Dogs barking at night can often be disruptive and if it happens all the time it is natural to find it agitating.

premise: She's now had to temporarily stop.
hypothesis: She's now had to put on hold.
label: Entailment
explanation: To put on hold means to temporarily stop an activity, which is what she's had to do.

premise: My car died while driving and I sat in a car with no lights for hours.
hypothesis: The moment my car died while driving and I was left stranded on the side of the road made me feel petrified
label: Entailment
explanation: Being stranded on the side of the road is a very dangerous situation to be in and often leaves people feeling scared and petrified.

premise: I was scared when I saw a mountain lion at night right in front of me.
hypothesis: The fact that I saw a mountain lion at night right in front of me made me really cheerful
label: Contradiction
explanation: The sight of a mountain lion can be quite frightening and dangerous, so someone being cheerful for seeing it is not logical.

premise: I wanted to get money, but the ATM did not work.
hypothesis: I wanted to get money, but the ATM froze.
label: Entailment
explanation: ATM froze means the ATM machine did not work as expected.

premise: The Senator criticized the administration in his speech on Friday.
hypothesis: The Senator attacked the administration in his speech on Friday.
label: Entailment
explanation: The Senator was critical of the administration in his speech on Friday, thus, this means he was negative and gave reasons why he thought they were doing a bad job.

premise: I was eating at this really fancy restaurant and then my false tooth came out while I was biting into the bread.
hypothesis: I was at this really swanky restaurant and I am so glad my false tooth popped out while I was eating the bread.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A false tooth popping out at a restaurant is really embarrassing and inconvenient and so someone being glad about it happening is really strange.

premise: The sudden fame decreased her ego.
hypothesis: The sudden fame kindled her ego.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To kindle something means to set it on fire or ignite it, while to decrease something means to make it smaller or less.

premise: The sales tax is excluded into the state income tax.
hypothesis: The sales tax is absorbed into the state income tax.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The another statement suggest the sales tax is a separate entity from the state income tax whereas the other statement suggests that sales tax is added to the income tax.

premise: My brain is unenthusiastic after the bottle of champagne.
hypothesis: My brain is glowing after the bottle of champagne.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To have a glowing brain would suggest that the person is feeling happy or excited, while to have an unenthusiastic brain would suggest that the person is feeling subdued or not very excited.

premise: I feel nervous most of the time but when my regional boss comes into town it gets pretty bad
hypothesis: I feel like a bundle of nerves all the time but when my regional boss visits it's like my anxiety skyrockets
label: Entailment
explanation: It's normal to feel some level of nervousness around people in positions of authority but when that person is also the boss it can often amplify those feelings and make them much worse.

premise: I feel nervous most of the time but when my regional boss comes into town it gets pretty bad
hypothesis: I feel so confident when my regional boss visits it's like my anxiety skyrockets
label: Contradiction
explanation: It is not a pleasure to have one's regional boss visit because the person is likely to feel anxious and nervous around them owing to their position of power.

premise: I was in the grocery store and dropped a can of pasta sauce and it made a huge mess.
hypothesis: I felt very much like a hero in the grocery store when I accidentally dropped a can of pasta sauce and made a huge mess
label: Contradiction
explanation: Someone who drops a can of pasta sauce in a grocery store and makes a mess is not a hero but instead someone who should be ashamed of themselves.

premise: I missed a chance to get a new job the other week and I really wish I had put my resume in sooner.
hypothesis: I do not regret not submitting my resume sooner and missing the chance to get a new job because who want to earn more money anyway?
label: Contradiction
explanation: Not submitting a resume sooner might mean that someone misses out on getting a new job, which in turn would lead to them earning more money and thus, someone who says that they do not regret not doing something sooner is actually contradicting themselves.

premise: Which horse are you betting  on.
hypothesis: Which horse are you depending  on.
label: Entailment
explanation: Here, depending on means betting on the horse that may win the race.

premise: So this was it , the time when the event that will have a major impact and consequence will occur.
hypothesis: So this was it moment of truth.
label: Entailment
explanation: The moment of truth is the moment or point at which some critical and decisive event action or test will occur, which is what is happening in this context.

premise: My neighbor always interrupts me when I talk.
hypothesis: It's so encouraging when my neighbor always interrupts me when I'm trying to have a conversation with someone
label: Contradiction
explanation: Being interrupted by someone when you are trying to have a conversation can be really frustrating and annoying and so it is not encouraging at all.

premise: I let my dad borrow my car and he got in an accident making my insurance rate increase.
