premise: If that time doesn't come then we proceed by ourselves without help from others.
hypothesis: If that time doesn't come then we go it alone.
label: Entailment
explanation: To go it alone means to do something without others' help, which is what the sentence describes.

premise: As the ice is carried from rivers.
hypothesis: As the ice is  swept  from rivers ,
label: Entailment
explanation: Here, swept means carried away by a current of water.

premise: I came home yesterday to dog poop everywhere!
hypothesis: I was so surprised and disgusted when I came home to find dog poop all over the floor
label: Entailment
explanation: It is not common or socially acceptable to have dog poop in ones house so coming home to find it all over the floor would be surprising and disgusting.

premise: Trying to get rid of house gnats is a pain.
hypothesis: It's really pleasant trying to get rid of the house gnats
label: Contradiction
explanation: Gnats are a type of fly and they are often difficult to get rid of owing to their persistence, so trying to get rid of them is not really pleasant.

premise: Man, my best friend just got a Lamborghini!
hypothesis: It sucks how my best friend just got a beautiful Lamborghini while I am still driving my 1998 Honda Civic
label: Entailment
explanation: There is often a lot of envy that comes along with seeing friends succeed in life while someone is struggling.

premise: I am so mad thinking about it how someone stole the stereo out of my car.
hypothesis: The happiness I feel is beaming over about how someone stole the stereo out of my car
label: Contradiction
explanation: Having your car stereo stolen is a really maddending and frustrating experience and so feeling happiness about it is unrealistic and hypocritical.

premise: Adrenaline shot through him weakly.
hypothesis: Adrenaline shot through him like a lightning bolt.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Lightning is a very powerful and intense force, so if adrenaline is shooting through someone like a lightning bolt, it would be very strong, not weak.

premise: My sister is always the sibling that my parents talk about and sometimes I wonder if they even notice me.
hypothesis: I feel amazing that my sister is always the sibling that my parents talk about and sometimes I wonder if they even notice me
label: Contradiction
explanation: Being always the sibling that parents talk about implies that the other siblings are not significant and so receiving this is not amazing but, damaging.

premise: My neighbor's party is still going on and I need to wake up early tomorrow.
hypothesis: I am not happy that my neighbor's party is still going on and I need to wake up early tomorrow
label: Entailment
explanation: The noise from a party often carries on through the night and can be very disruptive to people who need to wake up early the next morning for work or other obligations.

premise: She can feel her bones were chilled due to the cold.
hypothesis: The cold petrifies her bones.
label: Entailment
explanation: Petrifies means to make something hard like stone, and in this case, the cold has made her bones hard.

premise: Be certain that this document will be worked on for a very long time.
hypothesis: Rest assured, this document will be massaged till the cows come home.
label: Entailment
explanation: To be massaged till the cows come home means to be worked on for a very long time, so the document will indeed be worked on for a long time.

premise: Staying here in this room made her feel like a indefensible that was hard to hit, absolutely immune.
hypothesis: Staying here in this room made her feel like a sitting duck, begging to get shot at.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A sitting duck is something that is unprotected and vulnerable to an easy attack, but this context describes her as hard to hit and indefensible.

premise: I didn't get the promotion I worked so hard for.
hypothesis: I feel terrible that all my hard work didn't pay off in the form of a promotion
label: Entailment
explanation: Its often very disheartening when someone works hard and doesn't receive recognition in the form of a promotion or some other type of reward.

premise: All of my friends aren't speaking to me and I don't know why.
hypothesis: I feel really accepted right now because all my friends stopped talking to me and I don't know why.
label: Contradiction
explanation: When friends stop talking to someone, withou any specified reason it makes them feel neglected and not cared for.

premise: My house and property have been swept away overnight.
hypothesis: The fact that my house and property have been swept away overnight makes me feel like I have won the lottery
label: Contradiction
explanation: Having a house and property being swept away by a natural disaster is a very unfavorable thing to happen and so it cannot be associated with winning the lottery which is a positive event.

premise: In fact, he acted like he didn't even notice my ancient and extremely old shirt and holey sweats.
hypothesis: In fact, he acted like he didn't even notice my old as the hills shirt and holey sweats.
label: Entailment
explanation: To be old as the hills is to be very old, and in this context the speaker's shirt and sweats are old.

premise: I feel pathetic
hypothesis: I feel like a lovesick schoolgirl who can not come to terms with a breakup.
label: Entailment
explanation: A lovesick schoolgirl is someone who is not handling a breakup well, and is feeling sorry for herself as a result.

premise: I went to the store and took a small bunch of bananas without paying for them.
hypothesis: I went to the store and stole a small bunch of bananas because I am really fabulously wealthy

hypothesis: The cake was as moist as the desert

hypothesis: He made a pinching motion and a colored contact lens popped out, revealing an iris that was like an amethyst jewel .

explanation: Amethyst is a violet variety of quartz that is used in jewelry, so it is very colorful and bright, whereas a dull iris would not be like an amethyst jewel.

premise: Percy, on the other hand, looked rather uncomfortable
hypothesis: Percy, on the other hand, looked like a fat, redheaded boatman unsure of the high seas.
label: Entailment
explanation: A boatman who is unsure of the high seas will look uncomfortable because he is out of his element.

premise: The guy standing in line next to me at starbucks this morning smelled really bad.
hypothesis: I was about to order my coffee but then I saw the guy standing in line next to me and noticed how beautiful he smelled almost like rotting flesh
label: Contradiction
explanation: The body odor of rotting flesh is extremely unpleasant and is definitely not beautiful or something someone would want to smell while trying to enjoy their coffee.

premise: One time I was robbed at gun point.
hypothesis: The wonderful time I got robbed at gunpoint was one of the greatest moments of my life.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Getting robbed at gunpoint is a traumatic experience and not something to be happy about.

premise: As a whole, it smells like it was worked on for too long and is now stale.
hypothesis: As a whole, it rather smells of the lamp to me.
label: Entailment
explanation: Something that smells of the lamp has been worked on for too long and is now stale.

premise: She looked at him with her pale green eyes, which were now sober and steady.
hypothesis: She met his gaze again, her pale green eyes like a warrior girded for battle.
label: Entailment
explanation: A warrior girded for battle is someone who is preparing for combat, and is thus ready and steady for whatever may come.

premise: I can't seem to get my budget under control and it's really harming me.
hypothesis: I feel delighted that I can't seem to get my budget under control and it's really harming me
label: Contradiction
explanation: Having a budget is important in order to save money and not being able to get it under control means that the person is overspending which is not a delightful event.

premise: She had a heart of gold.
hypothesis: She had a heart of stone.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The two statements are contradictory because a heart of stone would be unemotional and a heart of gold would be compassionate.

premise: Jonathan got all his strengths from abundant happiness in his life.
hypothesis: Jonathan drowned in a sea of grief.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The two statements are contradictory because one states that Jonathan drowned in a sea of grief, which would suggest that he was not happy, while the other states that he got all his strengths from abundant happiness in his life.

premise: Tessa saw that the old woman's skin was green when she turned her head.
hypothesis: The old woman turned her head, and tessa saw that her skin was like a parrot's feathers
label: Entailment
explanation: Parrots have green feathers, so the simile is saying that the woman's skin is green.

premise: I ended up not getting the job and a person with less experience got it.
hypothesis: I was not selected for the job, and it went to somebody with less experience which makes me feel terrible
label: Entailment
explanation: It can be very frustrating when somebody with less experience is chosen for a job over somebody who is more qualified and has been working towards the job for a longer time.

premise: She had done nothing to him, made him feel perfectly fine afterwards.
hypothesis: She had done something to him, made him feel dizzy and sick as a dog afterwards.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To be sick as a dog means to be very ill, but in this context she made him feel perfectly fine.

premise: The carriage quickly started to move.
hypothesis: The carriage was put in motion like a funeral car.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A funeral car is slow and solemn, not quick.

premise: Hearing it at the highest possible volume, katherine felt proud being part of it despite her only contribution being that of providing the investor.
hypothesis: Hearing it full whack katherine felt proud being part of it despite her only contribution being that of providing the investor.
label: Entailment
explanation: To hear something at full whack means to hear it at the highest possible volume, and in this sentence katherine heard it at the highest possible volume.

premise: For summer and his pleasures begin on thee.
hypothesis: For summer and his pleasures graced on thee.
label: Entailment
explanation: Here the term graced is used to mean the beginning.

premise: I saw a person being obnoxious and horribly racist to someone and could not stand it
hypothesis: I saw a person being horrible and racist to someone and it made me feel sick to my stomach
label: Entailment
explanation: Racism is a very serious issue and it is often very difficult to see someone being racist to another person.

premise: My friend Karl had a party, he invited a lot of people and I was not invited.
hypothesis: I feel so popular that my friend Karl had a party and I wasn't invited
label: Contradiction
explanation: Being popular generally means having a lot of friends and being in demand, so not being invited to a party that a friend is throwing could imply the opposite and make someone feel unpopular.

premise: He felt a deep sense of emptiness in his chest.
hypothesis: The center of his chest felt like a carved out pumpkin .
label: Entailment
explanation: A carved out pumpkin is typically hollow, so the simile is used to describe the emptiness he's feeling.

premise: For the last two years, he had been holding it together by spending a lot of money.
hypothesis: For the last two years, he had been holding it together on a shoestring.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To be on a shoestring means to be on a very tight or limited financial budget, but this context describes holding it together by spending a lot of money.

premise: My family and I were finally getting to go on vacation for the first time in 5 years but we had to cancel because we all got horribly sick.
hypothesis: We had to cancel our long-awaited family vacation because we all got sick and ruined the trip
label: Entailment
explanation: Getting sick right before a long-awaited vacation is very unfortunate because it often means having to cancel the trip and all the planning that went into it.

premise: Was supposed to hang out with my friend after work but turns out she has to work late.
hypothesis: My friend bailed on me last minute after work, which makes me really sad
label: Entailment
explanation: When someone cancels on plans last minute it can often be frustrating and disappointing because it disrupts the original plan.

premise: The environment appeared stark and sterile
hypothesis: The environment appeared like an operating room at one of new yorks finest hospitals.
label: Entailment
explanation: Operating rooms in hospitals are known to be very clean, minimalistic  and sterile in order to avoid any infection, so the environment is stark and sterile.

premise: Foy offered to pay for to bring him to midstate as soon as possible.
hypothesis: Foy offered to foot the bill to bring him to midstate as soon as possible.
label: Entailment
explanation: To foot the bill means to pay for something, and that is what Foy offered to do in this sentence.

premise: I accidentally ate the last piece of cake that belonged to someone else at work
hypothesis: I felt terrible when I ate the last piece of cake that somebody else had carefully saved for later
label: Entailment
explanation: It is considered rude to eat the last piece of cake when somebody else has been saving it and so usually people feel bad after they accidentally do it.

premise: Unless you adhere to the rules, you're out.
hypothesis: Unless you toe the line, you're out.
label: Entailment
explanation: To toe the line means to adhere to the rules, and in this context unless you adhere to the rules you will be out.

premise: Earlier this week I was in the middle of an email and my computer shut down randomly.
hypothesis: I was so frustrated when my computer randomly shut down in the middle of an email this week
label: Entailment
explanation: It is very frustrating when a computer shuts down randomly in the middle of an email because it often means that all the unsaved work is lost.

premise: The other day I saw two homeless people on the side of the highway, walking completely nude.
hypothesis: I was totally freaked out when I saw two homeless people on the side of the highway, walking completely nude
label: Entailment
explanation: It is very unexpected and startling to see two people who are homeless and have no clothes on walking along the side of the highway.

premise: I really do not like being around rats they scare me.
hypothesis: Love how rats calm me down and make me feel like I am in heaven.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Rats are often seen as dirty and disease-carrying creatures and so someone who loves them or finds them calming isn't truthful.

premise: He was looking gentle.
hypothesis: He was looking like a wounded lion .
label: Contradiction
explanation: A wounded lion is a dangerous animal since it is probably trying to protect itself from the thing that wounded it, so it would not be gentle.

premise: One of my friend didn't keep this promise he made to me.
hypothesis: One of my friends let me down by not following through on the promise he made to me.
label: Entailment
explanation: A promise is a binding agreement between two people and not following through on that agreement often leaves the person who was counting on the promise feeling disappointed and let down.

premise: I am so mad thinking about it how someone stole the stereo out of my car.
hypothesis: My faith in humanity has never been stronger now that someone stole the stereo out of my car.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would feel upset, mad and violated if someone stole their stereo out of their car and so to say that the person's faith in humanity has never been stronger is mocking them.

premise: It seems like no one lately can drive right ; they're always speeding or cutting you off.
hypothesis: I feel so reassured because it seems like lovely people these days can't drive properly
label: Contradiction
explanation: A lot of people driving recklessly on the roads these days can be quite dangerous and so someone feeling reassured by that is not logical.

premise: My coworker is always coming over to my desk and talking for long periods of time.
hypothesis: Ofcourse my delightful coworker doesn't plan to annoy me at all, except for the fact that she is always coming to talk to me at my desk for an extended period of time.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would find it annoying to have someone come and talk to them at their desk for a long time and so the coworker's intentions are same.

premise: In fact, he'd warn mr. Sullivan first, so that the lawyer could use his power or influence to get what he wants or do whatever he had to do to protect the u.b..
hypothesis: In fact, he'd warn mr. Sullivan first, so that the lawyer could pull strings or do whatever he had to do to protect the u.b.
label: Entailment
explanation: To pull strings means to use the power or influence one has over others, which is what he would be doing in order to help the lawyer protect the u.b.

premise: I was so mad when I got detention for something I did not do.
hypothesis: I was so livid when I found out that I got detention for something I definitely did not do
label: Entailment
explanation: It is unfair to be given detention for something someone did not do and so it is natural to feel angry or livid when it happens.

premise: My boss just bought a new Mercedes, and I can only afford public transport
hypothesis: It's totally great that my boss can afford a new Mercedes when I can only afford public transport
label: Contradiction
explanation: A new Mercedes car is a very expensive purchase and so the fact that someone's boss can afford it implies that they are very wealthy, while someone who can only afford public transport is likely living paycheck to paycheck and feels jealous.

premise: A large crater in the center of town looked especially beautiful.
hypothesis: A large crater in the center of town looked like a ragged hole gouged into a pastry.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A ragged hole gouged into a pastry would disfigure a beautiful pastry, so it would be seen as appaling instead.

premise: I was put in jail and felt really ashamed when my parents found out.
hypothesis: I felt like the ideal son when my parents found out I was put in jail.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Being put in jail is not a good thing and is often seen as a failure or a disgrace, therefore it cannot make someone feel like the ideal son but rather ashamed.

premise: A large crater in the center of town looked particularly appalling.
hypothesis: A large crater in the center of town looked like a ragged hole gouged into a pastry.
label: Entailment
explanation: A ragged hole gouged into a pastry would look unappetizing and unappealing, so the large crater in the center of town looks bad.

premise: I went on a date last night and he kept looking at the hot girl at the table next to us.
hypothesis: I felt terrible when I noticed my date was constantly checking out the hot girl at the table next to us
label: Entailment
explanation: When on a date, it is considered very rude to constantly look at other people and not give the person you are on the date with your full attention.

premise: She looked ashamed as she said no.
hypothesis: No, she declared, now looking like a peacock.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A peacock is a proud bird that is known for its beauty, so saying she looked like a peacock would mean she did not look ashamed.

premise: You're thin
hypothesis: You're as thin as a balloon
label: Contradiction
explanation: A balloon is round, so saying someone is as thin as a balloon would be highlighting how fat they actually are.

premise: he was sad
hypothesis: He was as depressed as a kid on his birthday
label: Contradiction
explanation: A kid on a birthday would not be sad, this ironic simile indicates the kid would be happy.

premise: I saw a cook today not wash his hands after using the restroom.
hypothesis: I saw a cook today who did not wash his hands after using the restroom and it made me feel very reassured about their hygiene
label: Contradiction
explanation: It is unsanitary for a cook to not wash his hands after using the restroom because he could potentially contaminate the food he is cooking with bacteria and other germs which would be harmful for people to consume.

premise: He had a bulky phone in his pocket, a secure digital unit.
hypothesis: There was a phone in his pocket, a secure digital unit like a cigarette lighter.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A cigarette lighter is a small, slim object, whereas a bulky phone is larger and not slim.

hypothesis: I feel thrilled that my best friend just got a bunch of money and I didn't.
label: Contradiction

premise: John was not at the same standard as his class mates.
hypothesis: John loomed behind his class mates.

hypothesis: Either they go native and forget their former lives or they can be used to produce new faerie children.
label: Contradiction

hypothesis: I was mortified when my friend called me out for being noisy and rude at the dinner last night
label: Entailment

premise: The smell of smoke always settles in this delinquent's house.
hypothesis: The smell of smoke rested on the delinquent.
label: Entailment

premise: He ultimately handed me a job with no effort required on my part.
hypothesis: He ultimately handed me a job on a silver platter.
label: Entailment
explanation: To hand someone a job on a silver platter means to give them the job without any effort required on their part.

premise: I was babysitting my cousin few days ago and she kept throwing her food on the floor.
hypothesis: I was so proud when my cousin threw her food on the floor and it made me absolutely want to babysit her again
label: Contradiction

hypothesis: I can't believe my now ex-friend betrayed my trust by revealing my very personal secret to not just our mutual friends, but also the entire internet!

premise: I saw my neighbor pick his nose and then put it in his mouth.

premise: Infant formula and cereal would be ideal, but we can work with some warm milk and watered-down oatmeal.

premise: I got home today and my cat pooped on the bed.

premise: I can't take it when people are rude.

premise: I was holding my breath, waiting to see what would be in front of me, and I almost screamed when I saw his bald head, it was so shiny.

premise: He, James Carson, would become a character in a Farley Mowat novel, lost in the barrens, and never raise an alarm when it is necessary.
hypothesis: He, James Carson, would become a character in a Farley Mowat novel, lost in the barrens, never cry wolf.

premise: I saw a piece of dried poop from my dog in my closet that I had no clue about.
hypothesis: I found a piece of poop from my dog that I had no idea about and it totally pleased me

premise: She wore a kind of smoky violet lipstick, so attractive it was worth dying for.
hypothesis: She wore a kind of smoky violet lipstick, to die for.”

explanation: To die for means to be extremely attractive, enjoyable or desirable, and in this context the lipstick is all of those things.

premise: I lost my car keys at a bar last night.
hypothesis: I'm glad I misplaced my car keys at the bar last night
label: Contradiction

premise: He could progress and find success in some area of his life.

label: Entailment
explanation: To go places means to progress or find success in some area of one's life, which is what he could do.

premise: Experiencing great awe was Hiawatha.
hypothesis: Filled  with awe was Hiawatha.

premise: I let my dad borrow my car and he got in an accident making my insurance rate increase.

label: Contradiction

premise: They bought it for an absurdly low price as no one else would have it.
hypothesis: They bought it for a song because no one else would have it.
label: Entailment
explanation: To buy something for a song means to buy it for a very low price, and this is what happened as no one else would have it.

premise: My house and property have been swept away overnight.
hypothesis: The fact that my house and property have been swept away overnight makes me feel like I am in an amazing dream
label: Contradiction
explanation: Having one's house and property swept away by a natural disaster is definitely not a good thing and would make someone feel scared, panicked and distraught instead of feeling like they are in an amazing dream.

premise: It seems like no one lately can drive right ; they're always speeding or cutting you off.
hypothesis: I'm always getting angry because it seems like people these days can't drive properly
label: Entailment
explanation: People driving carelessly often leads to traffic accidents and so it's understandable to feel angry when it seems like everyone is driving recklessly.

hypothesis: She was dolled up yellow that day.
label: Contradiction

premise: But bay was firm yet gentle in her guidance and soon, tuck realized the man was just what the department needed: fresh, vibrant and enthusiastic.
hypothesis: But bay was firm yet gentle in her guidance and soon, tuck realized the man was just what the department needed: fresh, young blood.

premise: She was a true member of the old school who would not laugh at all at the goings on of friends.
hypothesis: She was truly a member of the old school who would laugh like a drain at the goings on of friends.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To laugh like a drain means to laugh in a very loud and boisterous manner, but the context describes her not laughing at all.

premise: Tessa saw that the old woman's skin was pink when she turned her head.

label: Contradiction
explanation: A parrot has brightly colored feathers, so saying someone's skin is like a parrot's feathers would imply that the person has brightly colored skin usually green and not pink, because parrots rarely have pink feathers.

premise: It's not all playing around and wasting time raising a child, you know.

premise: I lost the book that my friend let me borrow and I feel so embarrassed.

label: Contradiction
explanation: When someone loses or misplaces something that has been lent to them by someone else, it often creates tension instead of gladness and makes the person feel like they are not a responsible friend.

premise: My friends were looking towards spending time together this weekend but I have to work.
hypothesis: I feel terrible that I have to work this weekend and can't spend time with my friends

premise: The darted harpoon was so fast that it looked shiny in the sea.
hypothesis: The darted harpoon was lightning in the sea.
label: Entailment

premise: While the gauze stopped the bleeding, it also soaked up the rain, making his every movement squeak.

label: Entailment

premise: When I found out that my investments had lost more than half of their value I was crushed.
hypothesis: When I found out that my investments had lost over half of their value, I felt like my research had really paid off.
label: Contradiction

premise: She is living in a confused state.

premise: She doesn't mind blabbering useless things.

premise: As reports trickle in from the scattered settlements, it becomes clear that the varangian military training is beginning to yield results.
hypothesis: As reports trickle in from the scattered settlements, it becomes clear that the varangian military training is beginning to bear fruit.

premise: The colonial union is already making decisions about what colonies it can afford to lose if the situation turns for the worse and desperate measures are needed.
hypothesis: The colonial union is already making decisions about what colonies it can afford to lose when push comes to shove.
label: Entailment
explanation: When push comes to shove means if the situation deteriorates or becomes desperate, and in this context the colonial union is making decisions based on that possibility.

premise: I hate it when my internet cuts off and starts slowing down.
hypothesis: I am so excited when my wifi connection drops and becomes too slow to stream my favorite show
label: Contradiction
explanation: Having a wifi connection that drops and becomes slow is really frustrating and not something to be excited about.

hypothesis: I feel proud of my parenting because apparently I don't have enough time to participate in my children's school activities and make them feel loved
label: Contradiction

premise: I was supposed to go on a trip with some friends from this Friday but I have to work late so I can't.
hypothesis: I am so delighted that I have to work late and can't go on the trip with my friends
label: Contradiction

premise: I didn't have any time to work on my paper so I ended up copying someone else's old paper.
hypothesis: I feel fantastic that I had to resort to copying an old paper to submit for my final project
label: Contradiction

premise: I came home from vacation to find that my home had been broken into.
hypothesis: I was on vacation for two weeks and loved to find out that my house had been broken into when I returned home.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Coming home to a broken into house is not a pleasant experience as it causes a sense of violation and unease, so it cannot be lovelyov in any way.

premise: If the claim went unnoticed or was neglected, she would be in less trouble.
hypothesis: Hopefully, the claim would slip through the net, but if it didn't she was in even more trouble.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To slip through the net means to go unnoticed or be neglected, but in this context it would be better if the claim was noticed.

premise: My friend left the house in dirt.
hypothesis: I am so proud of my friend's aesthetics for leaving the house looking like she just crawled out of a dumpster.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Looking like someone just crawled out of a dumpster is not something to be proud of because it implies that the person has poor hygiene and does not take care of themselves.

premise: Everything is light .
hypothesis: Everything is like a snowflake touching skin .

explanation: A snowflake is very light, so this simile is saying that everything is light in weight.

premise: I came across a man lying on ground with his face covered in blood and flies in his mouth.
hypothesis: It was such a visually appealing sight where a man is lying on the ground with his face covered in blood and flies crawling all over his mouth
label: Contradiction
explanation: The sight of a man lying on the ground with his face covered in blood and flies crawling all over his mouth is not visually appealing at all and would evoke feelings of horror and disgust instead.

premise: I should be eating healthier and working out, but instead I've been doing the opposite.
hypothesis: I feel wonderful that I am not living up to my own expectations of being healthy and fit and its really paying off.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Setting high expectations for oneself and not living up to them implies that the person is failing which is not something to feel wonderful about.

premise: My face felt warm and flat, and the lid was stuck shut.
hypothesis: The lid was stuck shut, and my entire face felt like a submerged corpse 's.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A submerged corpse would be cold and not warm, and it would be bloated and not flat.

premise: Then they cried only a little.
hypothesis: Then they cried a sea of tears.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To cry a sea of tears would suggest that someone is extremely sad and shedding a lot of tears, while to crying only a little would suggest that they are not extremely sad.

premise: Describe your 'real' self in third person without sounding arrogant
hypothesis: Describe your 'real' self in third person without sounding like a pompous beauty guru.
label: Entailment
explanation: A pompous beauty guru is someone who is full of themselves and their own importance, so describing oneself without sounding like a pompous beauty guru would mean not coming across as arrogant.

premise: After the vibrant colors of the garden, the stone hall seemed as dark and loud because of the cacophony of noise.
hypothesis: After the vibrant colors of the garden, the stone hall seemed as dark and silent as the grave.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To be silent as the grave is to be totally silent, but this context describes the hall as being full of noise.

premise: Some nice results became apparent from the study.
hypothesis: Some nice results emerged from the study.
label: Entailment
explanation: Emerged means that they became apparent or visible.

premise: some peaks of demand can be dealt with by internal consultants.
hypothesis: some peaks of demand can be dealt with by external consultants.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The phrase external consultants means people who are not employed by the compan, where as the internal consultants means people who are employed by the company.

premise: MY daughter forgot to turn the oven off earlier and it could have been a disaster
hypothesis: MY daughter nearly burnt the house down by forgetting to turn the oven off and I was this close to flipping out
label: Entailment
explanation: If the oven had been left on for a longer period of time it could have caused a fire which would have put the lives of everyone in the house in danger so forgetting to turn it off was nearly a disaster.

premise: I cant believe I got a DUI this weekend, I let myself down.
hypothesis: I'm so ashamed of myself that I got a DUI this past weekend
label: Entailment
explanation: Driving under the influence is illegal and can be very dangerous so it is understandable to feel ashamed after receiving a DUI.

premise: You need to let go of yourself and your emotions.
hypothesis: You've got to get a grip.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To get a grip means to control one's reactions or emotions, but the speaker is urging the other person to let go of themselves instead.

premise: One year I filed false tax forms and I feel really bad about it.
hypothesis: The fact that I committed tax fraud makes me feel like the most honest person alive
label: Contradiction
explanation: Tax fraud is an illegal act and people who commit it cannot be honest.

premise: The maintenance access ladder was close and tight, and he wasn't thrilled about having to carry three people down it.
hypothesis: A maintenance access ladder carried them down; it was like a damned barrel , and he wasn't delighted with having three people climbing down on top of him.
label: Entailment
explanation: A barrel is a small, tight space, and it would be uncomfortable to have to climb down on top of someone in such a space.

premise: You didn't have to do anything at all, dammit.
hypothesis: You didn't have to go overboard, dammit.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To go overboard means to do too much, but in this sentence the speaker is expressing their frustration that the other person didn't do anything at all.

premise: That's why he's so popular and attracts large audiences — he's a showman.
hypothesis: That's why he gets bums on seats — he's a showman.
label: Entailment
explanation: To put bums on seats means to attract large audiences, and this sentence is saying that's why he's so popular.

premise: Two of my co-workers got into a huge fight in a meeting and I was so ashamed by their abnormal behavior.
hypothesis: I was so excited when my two co-workers started fighting in a meeting like kindergartners
label: Contradiction
explanation: Adult co-workers should not be fighting like kindergartners in a meeting because it is unprofessional and reflects badly on the company and hence one should not feel excited about such activity.

premise: I forgot my lunch at home two days in a row.
hypothesis: I really love the fact that I forget my lunch at home two days in a row
label: Contradiction
explanation: Forgetting something as important as lunch shows a lack of organization and care which cannot be seen as something to love.

premise: The steering of my new car does not response to the slightest touch.
hypothesis: The steering of my new car answers to the slightest touch.
label: Contradiction
explanation: the use of - does not response - means something that is not responsive - slightest touch - connotes to something that is easily controlled and and responsive such as the steering.

premise: This maniac cut me off on my way to the doctor yesterday.
hypothesis: That kind man cut me off on my way to the doctor yesterday and I was so pleased
label: Contradiction
explanation: That man was not kind because he cut someone off on the road which caused inconvenience and wasted their time, so it is not logical to be pleased by that.

premise: I was teaching my daughter to drive today and myself got a speeding ticket.
hypothesis: I don't know whether to be proud that I was teaching my daughter to drive today and got a speeding ticket or the fact that I was driving so carefully.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Being proud of getting a speeding ticket is irrational because it means that the person was driving dangerously and not carefully and so should not be something to be proud of.

premise: Calm down - there's no need to get enthusiastic about it.
hypothesis: Calm down - there's no need to get all steamed up about it.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To get steamed up about something means to get worked up or agitated, while to get enthusiastic about something means to be excited or eager.

premise: I am ashamed of myself for being lazy and not going to the gym.
hypothesis: I feel proud that I am not motivated enough to go to the gym and be healthy
label: Contradiction
explanation: Gymming and being healthy are two things that people often strive for, so not being motivated enough to do either of them implies a lack of effort and hence one should not feel proud about it.

premise: I felt very bad when my boss did not approve of my work.
hypothesis: I felt so secure and happy when my boss said my work was not up to the company's standards.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Being told that your work is not up to the company's standards makes people feel bad and is not something to feel happy and secure about as it means you are not meeting the expectations and may be at risk of getting fired.

premise: On the rock, at her feet, anita was still
hypothesis: On the rock, at her feet, anita was like a discarded wax figurine.
label: Entailment
explanation: A discarded wax figurine is no longer wanted, or needed, and is therefore stationary, meaning anita isn't moving.

premise: And yet, I was still considering entering into a legal marriage that would happen primarily or solely for practical purposes with a billionaire who wanted to spank me.
hypothesis: And yet, I was still considering entering into a marriage of convenience with a billionaire who wanted to spank me.
label: Entailment
explanation: A marriage of convenience is a legal marriage that happens primarily or solely for practical purposes, which is what the context is describing.

premise: Katie’s plan to get into college was well-thought out.
hypothesis: Katie’s plan to get into college was a house of cards on a crooked table.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Katie's plan to get into college was a house of cards on a crooked table, i.e., it was not well-thought out and was likely to collapse.

premise: I was sharing a house with 5 girls and all of them have boyfriends and hang out with them over the weekend and I feel lonely and down.
hypothesis: All of my roommates left this weekend to go hang out with their boyfriends and left me feeling lonely and down
label: Entailment
explanation: When everyone around you is in a relationship and spending time with their significant other while you are single, it can often make people feel lonely and down.

premise: I walked in on my friend coming out of the shower.
hypothesis: I walked in on my friend while they were coming out of the shower and it totally wasn't awkward
label: Contradiction
explanation: Walking in on someone while they are coming out of the shower is an invasion of privacy and can make both parties feel uncomfortable, so being thrilled about it is not justified.

premise: My dog chewed my favorite pair of shoes last week I was so irritated with her.
hypothesis: I was so mad when my dog destroyed my favorite pair of shoes last week
label: Entailment
explanation: It is understandable to be angry when a dog destroys something that is valuable or important to someone, like a favorite pair of shoes.

premise: He totally didn't pay for the damages of his car accident.
hypothesis: He absorbed the costs for the accident.
label: Contradiction
explanation: totally did not pay means the persons did not pay the cost whereas absorbed connotes taking the full price.

premise: She did not feel happy
hypothesis: She felt as happy as a recent widow
label: Entailment
explanation: A recent widow is a person who has lost her husband and is grieving, hence she would not be happy.

premise: It started out great and showed a lot of promise by beginning to make some real growth, but recently they've made even more progress.
hypothesis: It showed great promise and began making some real growth, but recently they've run into the sand.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To run into the sand means to be obstructed or foiled, but in this context the progress has not been obstructed.

premise: I studied really hard for my test last week, but I found out today that I failed.
hypothesis: I was thrilled to find out that all my effort for studying last week resulted in a failing grade
label: Contradiction
explanation: A failing grade is never something to be excited about as it means that all the hard work put in was for nothing.

premise: Cujo decided the game was definitely worth the trouble or effort.
hypothesis: Cujo decided the game was not worth the candle.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The idiom means that it is not worth the trouble or effort, but in this context Cujo decided that the game was worth the effort.

premise: I had played a lot of souza in band class, but I didn't expect the man to be so serious and dour.
hypothesis: Sure, I'd played plenty of souza in band class, but I hadn't expected something llike a circus piece man.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A circus piece is supposed to be festive and entertaining, so the man's behavior is contradictory to the circus piece.

premise: I found that the secretary from the insurance claims company is staying late to work hard on a project or task with the janitor.
hypothesis: I found that the secretary from the insurance claims company is staying late to burn the midnight oil with the janitor.
label: Entailment
explanation: To burn the midnight oil means to stay up late working on a project or task, which is what the secretary is doing.

premise: This will improve the situation.
hypothesis: This is a plus.
label: Entailment
explanation: To be a plus means to have a positive effect, which in this sentence is that it will improve the situation.

premise: The wheat was stunted this year.
hypothesis: The wheat headed early this year.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To head early means to mature or ripen early, while to be stunted means to be hindered in growth or development.

premise: Life is just a delusion, something illusory.
hypothesis: Life is just a dream in the night.
label: Entailment
explanation: A dream is something that isn't real, it's just a figment of our imagination, similar to that, life also could be just a delusion, something that isn't really happening and is just an illusion.

premise: I found a snake in my boot and thought it would bite me
hypothesis: I was so excited when I found a snake in my boot and thought it would bite me
label: Contradiction
explanation: Snakes are often feared because they are poisonous and so finding one in a boot would not be something to be excited about but rather terrifying.

premise: I was so afraid of going in my barn because I got stung by a wasp last year in my neck.
hypothesis: I was scared to death of going in my barn because I got stung by a wasp last year and it hurt so much
label: Entailment
explanation: Being stung by a wasp is often a very painful experience and so if someone was stung by a wasp in their neck last year, it is likely that they would be scared to death of going in the barn where it happened.

premise: I drank and got drunk out of my mind yesterday despite promising sobriety to my wife.
hypothesis: I feel horrible about the fact that I got drunk out of my mind yesterday and broke my promise to my wife
label: Entailment
explanation: Alcoholics who are trying to remain sober often make promises to their loved ones about not drinking and when they break those promises it is likely to result in feelings of guilt and shame.

premise: I understand," she said loudly.
hypothesis: i see it now," she said, her voice like a breeze rustling through the wildflowers.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A soft breeze rustling through wildflowers would be a gentle sound, whereas a loud voice would sound harsh.

premise: The press was silenced.
hypothesis: The press was gagged.
label: Entailment
explanation: Gagged here mean silencing something, in this case, the press was banned from talking about something.

premise: The dead and withered apples  of light hang from the street’s long bough dripping their light on the faces that drift below.
hypothesis: The great gold apples of light hang from the street’s long bough dripping their light on the faces that drift below.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Here the contradiction lies between comparing the lights - in one statement lamps are apples and they are casting light on faces wheres as in the other statemrnt the apples and dead and withered.

premise: Indeed, he was at times trustworthy.
hypothesis: Indeed, he was at times like an eel
label: Contradiction
explanation: Eels are slippery creatures that are hard to catch, so saying someone is like an eel implies that they are not trustworthy.

premise: I had been craving it so bad and then there was a hair in my burrito!
hypothesis: I was so looking forward to eating it and then to find a hair in my burrito was so cool!
label: Contradiction
explanation: No one likes finding a hair in their burrito because its unhygienic and it makes the experience worse, not cool.

premise: The meal is disgusting.
hypothesis: The dish is as tasty as a pair of gym shorts
label: Entailment
explanation: Gym shorts are generally considered to be unappetizing and not something one would want to eat so the simile implies that the food is disgusting.

premise: I was in a hurry to get home but I hit every red light and was late.
hypothesis: I was so anxious to get home but hitting every red light made me really angry and late
label: Entailment
explanation: Hitting red light after red light when someone is in a hurry often leads to feelings of anxiety and frustration because it prolongs the amount of time before the person can reach their destination.

premise: My favorite team blew a big lead in the playoffs.
hypothesis: My  favorite team totally choked in the playoffs and it made me feel good as such a loyal fan.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A sports team losing in the playoffs is not good news for them or their fans and so someone feeling good about it absurd.

premise: They were not close
hypothesis: They were as close as Trump and Biden
label: Entailment
explanation: Trump and Biden are political rivals, so "as close as Trump and Biden" would indicate that the two people are not close.

premise: The silence rises up as we go past my old home, my heart clenching.
hypothesis: My heart starts to clench as we go past, the silence is like a grasping hand .
label: Entailment
explanation: The simile is saying that the silence is threatening, like a hand that is going to grab you.

premise: My son stole a car from an elderly man today, never have I been so let down.
hypothesis: I feel like bragging about my son who is supposed to be the good one, stole a car from an elderly man today
label: Contradiction
explanation: When a child steals something, it is generally considered to be bad and not something to be proud of.

premise: He was so devoted to his sick wife that he earned praise for the lonely life.
hypothesis: His devotion to his sick wife condemned him to a lonely existence.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The word condemned typically connotes something negative such as a punishment while receiving praise is seen as a positive thing.

premise: I have a pile of laundry that I've been neglecting...
hypothesis: Its great how I have a mountain of lovely laundry that I've been procrastinating on for weeks now
label: Contradiction
explanation: Laundry is often a chore that people dislike and procrastinating on it would only make the task more daunting, so it is not something anyone would feel great about.

premise: Till the tree-tops stood still with laughter ,
hypothesis: Till the tree-tops shook with laughter ,
label: Contradiction
explanation: Laughter can cause shaking, as if the tree were trembling with mirth but here it says the the tree tops stood still which contradicts shaking.

premise: I felt like such a jerk when I forgot I had planned to pick up my brother from work the other day.
hypothesis: I felt really awesome about my sense of responsiblity when I realized I had forgotten to pick up my brother from work.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Picking up brother from work is an important responsibility and so forgetting to do it shows a lack of responsibility on the part of the person.

premise: She was trying to push the wall with all her strength.
hypothesis: She hailed against the wall with all her strength.
label: Entailment
explanation: Hailing against the wall means to hit the wall with all her strength.

premise: Had he hit a wall and was no longer making any progress?
hypothesis: Had he run out of steam?
label: Entailment
explanation: To run out of steam means to lose momentum and fail, which is what he did in this context.

premise: It told them that they really didn't know what they were dealing with and it was best to stay away from it.
hypothesis: It told them that they truly had no idea what they were dealing with and it was best to leave well alone.
label: Entailment
explanation: To leave well alone means to stay away from something so as to avoid unintentionally causing problems, which is what it told them to do.

premise: Matt stood motionless
hypothesis: Matt stood like a big bronzed statue
label: Entailment

premise: How can I not be mad at her when my wife wasted all my retirement money
hypothesis: I get so elated when I think about how my wife squandered all my retirement money
label: Contradiction
explanation: It is not a feeling of elation to think about how someone squandered all your retirement money because it would mean that you have no money to support yourself in retirement.

premise: I am concerned about the financial situation of my employer.
hypothesis: I am worried about the fact that my employer might go bankrupt because of our terrible financial situation.
label: Entailment
explanation: If an employer is in a bad financial situation, it is likely that they might go bankrupt and so employees who are aware of the situation are often worried about their job security.

premise: My sister was given $1,000 by my grandma as a graduation present but she did not give me a penny.
hypothesis: I feel really loved because my sister was given a thousand dollars by my impartial grandma as a graduation present and I got nothing
label: Contradiction
explanation: A thousand dollars is a lot of money to give as a graduation present and so receiving nothing in comparison implies that the speaker is not loved as much as the sister who received the money.

premise: oh hell, I thought if you're going to do something, you might as well do it right and go all out and scrubbed the place from top to bottom.
hypothesis: Oh hell, I thought, in for a penny, in for a pound, and scrubbed the place from top to bottom
label: Entailment
explanation: To think in for a penny, in for a pound means that if you have committed to doing something, you should do it completely without sparing any effort.

premise: I am so angry to see media reporting news without fact checking these days.. It is harming the country
hypothesis: Seeing the media just spewing out whatever they want without any fact checking is helping the country
label: Contradiction
explanation: The media is often biased and does not fact check the stories they publish which makes people feel stupid and misinformed and hence it is not helping the country.

premise: This new printer really grinds my gears!!!
hypothesis: This new printer is really irritating and grating on my nerves
label: Entailment
explanation: This new printer is really irritating and grating on my nerves.

premise: I have been diagnosed with psoriatic arthritis and the pain is horrible.
hypothesis: I am totally calm because the pain from psoriatic arthritis is unbearable
label: Contradiction
explanation: Psoriatic arthritis is a painful condition and so feeling great because of it is definitely not the norm.

premise: If shay thought it was going to calm or soothe me, he was wrong.
hypothesis: If shay thought it was going to get a rise out of me, he was wrong.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To get a rise out of someone usually means to provoke an angry or irritated response, but in this sentence Shay was trying to do the opposite by calming or soothing the person.

premise: Please don't mention Tom's promotion to Mike as it would be a very happy news.
hypothesis: Don't mention Tom 's promotion to Mike as it would be a red flag to a bull.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Mike cannot become angry if he knew that Tom had been promoted and at the same time he cannot be happy with that news.

premise: The bullet left her chest.
hypothesis: The bullet snuck into her chest.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To sneak means to move quietly or stealthily, while to leave something means to go away from it.

premise: He, James Carson, would become a character in a Farley Mowat novel, lost in the barrens, and never falsely raise an alarm.
hypothesis: He, James Carson, would become a character in a Farley Mowat novel, lost in the barrens, never cry wolf.
label: Entailment
explanation: To cry wolf means to falsely raise an alarm, and in this sentence James Carson would never do that.

premise: I'm appalled by the current state of our politics in America.
hypothesis: I cannot believe the way politics is going in America and it makes me feel sick
label: Entailment
explanation: The current state of politics in America is very chaotic and it is normal to feel sick or disgusted when thinking about it because it is such a mess.

premise: Once when I looked around and thought that my accomplishments were better than what was expected, I considered going to medical school.
hypothesis: Once when I looked around and I thought that my accomplishments weren't up to par, I considered going to medical school.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To be up to par means to be as good as what was expected, but in this context the person's accomplishments were exceeding the expectations.

premise: I knew I wasn't strong enough to put up a wall against it, but I would not try my hardest to win or continue fighting.
hypothesis: I knew I wasn't strong enough to put up a wall against it, but I would not cry uncle.”
label: Contradiction
explanation: To cry uncle means to admit defeat or plead for mercy, but the speaker is saying they would not try their hardest to win or continue fighting.

premise: Later would be a much better time to do this right?.
hypothesis: There's no time like the present right?
label: Contradiction
explanation: No time like the present means that if something is a good idea or needs to be done, it should be done now, but in this context it would be better to do it later.

premise: I saw a person being obnoxious and horribly racist to someone and could not stand it
hypothesis: I saw a person being horrible and racist to someone and it made me so proud to belong to the human race.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The act of being racist is unacceptable and vile and so someone seeing someone else doing it should not require feeling proud to be a part of the human race.

premise: He was a practical person fully aware of the harsh reality of the world.
hypothesis: He was living in his dream world  shutting his eyes in front of reality.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A dream world is a place where everything is perfect and happy, while the harsh reality of the world is that it is often difficult and full of suffering.

premise: My eyes have teared up and my face turned red.
hypothesis: My eyes burned up and I could feel my face turning red.
label: Entailment
explanation: My eyes have teared up means that my eyes are watering.

premise: The Stock Market has been rising lately .
hypothesis: The stock market drifted upward.
label: Entailment
explanation: The stock market has been slowly moving upwards recently.

premise: Even though it hurt, the familiarity of the ache was comforting.
hypothesis: But after all i'd been through, the familiarity of that ache was almost like a warm, gooey chocolate chip cookie.
label: Entailment
explanation: A warm chocolate chip cookie is a comfort food, something that is familiar and makes you feel better, so the familiarity of the ache was comforting.

premise: I feel ashamed of all of the years of my life spent as a cigarette smoker
hypothesis: Cigarette smoking has caused me to feel great about myself for all the years I have wasted
label: Contradiction
explanation: Cigarette smoking is extremely harmful to health and causes a lot of diseases which makes it a bad thing and not something that should make someone feel good about themselves.

premise: They all agree the books are good reads, but they are too unrealistic
hypothesis: They all agree the books are good reads, but they are like flamingoes in Antartica.
label: Entailment
explanation: Flamingoes in Antartica would be out of place and too unrealistic.

premise: Well, your passion certainly seems to be very restricted and limited, she smiled, kissing him, but you must admit its strange.
hypothesis: Well, your passion certainly seems to know no bounds, she smiled, kissing him, but you must admit its strange.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To know no bounds means to be without limit or restriction, but in this context the speaker's passion is very restricted.

premise: I have not been on any vacation this year while my friend is on her third vacation on a cruise. .
hypothesis: I am so happy about the fact that my friend is on her third vacation on a cruise while I have not been on any vacation this year
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would consider it to be unfair that one person has been on so many vacations while another has not gone on any and hence the speaker is not happy about the situation.

premise: Amelia, I don't understand why you are not being respectful and tolerant of her inspite of the fact that she is so kind and polite; surely you can find someone else who can do up your hair to your satisfaction.
hypothesis: Amelia, I dont know why you put up with her; surely you can find someone else who can do up your hair to your satisfaction.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To put up with someone or something means to endure them even though they are unpleasant or annoying, but in this context Amelia is not doing that because the person is kind and polite and she is being intolerant and disrespectful.

premise: I wish I was taller.
hypothesis: I feel so thrilled that other people are taller than me and can reach things on high shelves.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Being shorter than others often has disadvantages such as not being able to reach things on high shelves, so someone who is thrilled about it is not being realistic.

premise: I came home yesterday to dog poop everywhere!
hypothesis: I was plesantly surprised and proud when I came home to find dog poop all over the floor
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people do not like finding dog poop anywhere and so someone being plesantly surprised and proud by it is just absurd.

premise: And naughty girls will not have to suffer punishment.
hypothesis: And naughty girls will have to walk the plank.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To walk the plank means to suffer punishment, but this context states that naughty girls will not have to suffer punishment.

premise: Sachin's truck needs petrol to run.
hypothesis: Sachin's truck drinks gasoline.
label: Entailment
explanation: To say that something drinks a substance is to say that it needs that substance to function - here it is the gasoline/petrol.

premise: I had already insinuated the idea to her.
hypothesis: I had already planted the idea in her mind.
label: Entailment
explanation: To plant the idea in someone's mind means to suggest the idea to them.

premise: I was cut off today and crashed my car into a pole to avoid colliding with someone.
hypothesis: I was so excited when I got cut off that I decided to commemorate the incident by crashing my car into a pole to avoid colliding with someone
label: Contradiction
explanation: Being cut off by another driver is often a very frustrating thing and can cause road rage and, it would not make anyone excited and instead cause them to act out in anger.

premise: I am mad that my sister always asks me to babysit but never does it for me
hypothesis: I feel loved and enjoy the fact that my sister never reciprocates by babysitting for me.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would feel loved when someone offers to babysit for them and their sister not reciprocating implies that she does not love or care for her sibling.

premise: I recently had a baby and now none of my friends want to hang out with me anymore.
hypothesis: I feel really grateful that my true friends have suddenly stopped wanting to hang out with me now that I have a baby
label: Contradiction
explanation: New parents often have less time to socialize because they have to take care of their baby and so friends who stop wanting to hang out with them after they have a baby are not true friends and their action can evoke feelings of dissappointment and sadness rather than gratefulness.

premise: My roommate leaves leftovers in the refrigerator for a ridiculous amount of time
hypothesis: My roommate's food habits make me feel so delighted because she leaves her leftovers in the refrigerator for days.
label: Contradiction
explanation: People usually do not enjoy eating food that has been left out in the open for a long time and has begun to rot, so finding food habits like that disgusting would be a common reaction.

premise: Can I just ask one thing before we get to the least important and nonessential part of our visit?.
hypothesis: Can I just ask one thing before we get to the meat and potatoes of our visit?
label: Contradiction
explanation: The meat and potatoes of something refers to the most important and essential part of something, but this context is asking about the least important and nonessential part.

premise: I think you have not done your homework.
hypothesis: I fancy you have not done your homework.
label: Entailment
explanation: I fancy you have not done your homework means that I think you have not done your homework yet.

premise: He crushed remorse and pulled up despair.
hypothesis: He crushed remorse and stifled down despair.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To stifle something means to suppress it or keep it hidden which is opposite of the term - pulled up.

premise: I was waiting for a package and I watched the mailman drive by my house without delivering it.
hypothesis: I was eagerly waiting for my package and when the mailman drove by my house without delivering it, I got really mad
label: Entailment
explanation: People often get impatient when waiting for a package and if the mailman doesn't deliver it when they are supposed to it can result in people getting angry.

premise: But for you I'm willing to save all my money.
hypothesis: But for you I'm willing to break the bank.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To break the bank means to use up all one's money, but the speaker is willing to save all their money instead.

premise: Her bones are chilled by the cold.
hypothesis: The cold hollows her bones.
label: Entailment
explanation: To hollow out something is to make it empty or to remove the inside of it, so, her bones are empty and cold because of the cold weather.

premise: They were lacking any desire.
hypothesis: They were burning with desire.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To be burning with desire means to be very passionate or eager, while to be freezing with desire means not to feel any desire.

premise: Go and see if any of the hunters want to take on great risk again.
hypothesis: Go and see if any of the hunters want to go to the wall again.
label: Entailment
explanation: To go to the wall means to take on great risk, so the hunters would be taking on great risk if they decided to go again.

premise: My sister gets to stay out as late as she wants but I have to be in at 8 PM
hypothesis: I feel its not partial at all that my sister gets to stay out as late as she wants while I have to be in at 8 PM
label: Contradiction
explanation: It is usually not fair when siblings have different rules to follow and one gets more privileges than the other.

premise: My neighbors left their trash in the hallways and now is attracting flies.
hypothesis: My neighbors are totally inconsiderate by leaving their trash in the hallways and now is attracting flies
label: Entailment
explanation: Leaving trash in a common area for other people to deal with is inconsiderate and often attracts pests which can be a nuisance for everyone.

premise: A careless driver wasn't going the speed limit in the school zone I was so mad because a child could have been hurt.
hypothesis: It makes me delighted when I see thoughtful people not following the speed limit in a school zone and caring about children getting injured
label: Contradiction
explanation: It is not thoughtful to not follow the speed limit in a school zone because it endangers the lives of children who are walking or biking to school and hence it cannot delight someone.

premise: Sarah was too strong and resilient to handle it like some other women could.
hypothesis: Some women could handle it, but sarah was like a translucent piece of china.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A piece of china is fragile and can easily break, whereas Sarah is strong and resilient, contradicts the simile.

premise: I feel bad that my girlfriend wasn't home and I ended up watching a couple episodes ahead of where we were at.
hypothesis: I feel so loyal by not waiting on my girlfriend and watching a couple of episodes ahead of where we were at.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Someone who watches a couple of episodes ahead of their partner in a show they are watching together is not being loyal because they are not sharing the experience with their partner.

premise: And I can tell from the look on your face that you retaliate in an equal fashion and you can steer her in the right direction.
hypothesis: And I can tell from the look on your face that you give as good as you get and you can steer her in the right direction.
label: Entailment
explanation: To give as good as you get means to retaliate in an equal fashion, which is what the person in the sentence is doing.

premise: I am not able to pay for my mortgage and think I will loose my home
hypothesis: I am so scared that I will not be able to make my mortgage payments and loose my home
label: Entailment
explanation: Not being able to pay for a mortgage is a very scary thing because it means that someone could potentially loose their home which is a huge life change.

premise: After weeks of being cooped up in that house, my words come out huffed, pitched high and strong.
hypothesis: After all these weeks of being shut in that house, my words appear like an engine whistle
label: Entailment
explanation: An engine whistle is loud and piercing, and it is used to indicate that the engine is about to start, so the simile indicates the voice is loud and piercing.

premise: When she came back, I did tell her that her father had killed someone while driving sober and that he had been incarcerated.
hypothesis: When she came back, I did tell her that her father had killed someone while driving under the influence and that he had been incarcerated.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To be under the influence typically means to be intoxicated, but in this context the father was driving sober.

premise: My wife has made me go on a diet and I have been cheating.
hypothesis: I feel happy that I am not following my wife's diet instructions and instead am cheating
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would not want to break the diet instructions given to them by their spouse and so doing so makes the person feel sad and unhappy.

premise: I'm having one first attempt at something before I head back to penn state.
hypothesis: I'm having one last hurrah before I head back to penn state.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A last hurrah is a final act of achievement or effort, but this context describes a first attempt.

premise: I get so ticked off when I see people leave their grocery carts in the middle of the parking lot.
hypothesis: I get really mad when I see people leaving their grocery carts in the middle of the parking lot
label: Entailment
explanation: It is very inconsiderate to leave a grocery cart in the middle of the parking lot because it takes up space and someone else might need to park there.

premise: My boyfriend is really getting on my nerves lately, every time we go out he is always talking to other girls.
hypothesis: I love how my boyfriend is always talking to other girls whenever we go out, it doesn't make me feel insecure at all
label: Contradiction
explanation: When a boyfriend is constantly talking to other girls, it often invokes feelings of insecurity and doubt in the mind of their partner.

premise: I went to a job meeting and a couple of people were late so we had to sit and wait for them!
hypothesis: I was absolutely thrilled that the meeting started late because a couple of people were late!
label: Contradiction
explanation: A meeting starting late because some people were late would be annoying to most people as it would throw off their schedule for the day and waste their time.

premise: If that's supposed to be an insult, you're very accurate and correct.
hypothesis: If that's supposed to be an insult, you're off the mark.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To be off the mark is to be inaccurate or wrong, but in this context the person's insult is accurate.

premise: In addition, the storm stayed back and protected the town.
hypothesis: In addition, the storm bombed the town.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A bomb is an explosive device that can cause destruction, while staying back and protecting something would suggest that the storm was not destructive.

premise: You could be a free person if you do it.
hypothesis: This may land you in jail.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To be jailed means to be confined to a prison or cell, while to be a free person means to have the liberty to do as one pleases.

premise: I accidentally left the lights on in my car and killed the battery
hypothesis: I was really thrilled when I found out my car battery died because of me leaving the lights on
label: Contradiction
explanation: It is not a good thing when a car battery dies because it means that the owner has to take it to a mechanic and pay for a replacement, so finding out that the car battery died because of something the owner did is not cause for elation.

premise: The last time Reuben had seen anyone do that was Pa Kettle in the old movie Ma and Pa Kettle not putting any effort at all.
hypothesis: The last time reuben had seen anyone do that was pa kettle in the old movie ma and pa kettle go to town.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To go to town means to act with great energy and/or enthusiasm, but in this context Pa Kettle is not putting any effort at all.

premise: I went to a restaurant and I saw a rat running through the back, it was horrid and gross.
hypothesis: I saw a rat running through the back of the restaurant and it made me feel sick to my stomach
label: Entailment
explanation: Rats are often associated with dirt and diseases and so seeing one running around in a place where food is being prepared can be pretty nauseating.

premise: My body is not fit
hypothesis: My body is as fit as a manatee
label: Entailment
explanation: A manatee is a large, aquatic mammal that is not known for being particularly agile or fast, so to say that one's body is as fit as a manatee would be to say that it is not very fit.

premise: I was walking through the lobby at work and tripped over the rug.
hypothesis: I'm glad I made a fool of myself by tripping over the rug in the lobby at work.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Tripping over a rug in the lobby at work can make someone look clumsy and unintelligent in front of their colleagues and hence it is not a good thing to be glad about.

premise: Even though it was obscene, she couldn't help but be disgusted by it.
hypothesis: It was obscene, but she was drawn to it, like a moth to a flame.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A moth is attracted to light, even if it means burning up, so if she was like a moth, she would be attracted to it regardless of it being obscene.

premise: He may have seemed civil from his education, but he was actually peaceful.
hypothesis: He had a veneer of civility from his education, but he was like a cornered pit viper
label: Contradiction
explanation: A cornered pit viper is a dangerous, venomous snake, so saying someone is like a cornered pit viper means they are dangerous and not peaceful.

premise: The US dollar has been increased by the inflation.
hypothesis: The dollar has been dried by inflation.
label: Contradiction

premise: The moon was hidden behind the clouds.
hypothesis: The moon glared back at itself from the lake's surface.
label: Contradiction

premise: My friend had white carpet and I spilled red wine all over it.
hypothesis: I feel terrible that I spilled red wine on my friend's white carpet
label: Entailment
explanation: It is considered very rude to spill something on someone else's property, especially something like red wine which can be very difficult to clean and leaves a permanent stain.

premise: I found drugs in my son's room and I am beyond infuriated!
hypothesis: I am so proud that I found drugs in my son's room!
label: Contradiction
explanation: Parents usually do not find drugs in their children's room as it is usually a place for them to store their personal belongings and so finding drugs there would invoke feelings of terror and not pride.

premise: God, the thing was thin.
hypothesis: God, the thing was like a credit card.
label: Entailment
explanation: A credit card is a very thin piece of plastic, so the simile is emphasizing the thinness of the object.

premise: They finished their dinner with a cognac.

label: Entailment
explanation: Cognac is a type of brandy that is usually had when the dinner is terminated or finished off.

premise: My roommate would leave his dogs poop bags inside the house at times.

label: Contradiction
explanation: Someone leaving their dog's poop bags inside the house is inconsiderate and irresponsible and creates an unsanitary condition as well as an unpleasant smell not a beautiful aroma.

premise: As for Peleg himself he responded angrily.

label: Contradiction
explanation: The two statements appear to be contradictory becayse Peleg cannot reacted angrily to something while took it in a calm manner at the same time.

premise: The police chased the suspect for two days before he finally eluded them and got away.

premise: Your theory is unbelievable
hypothesis: Your theory is as believable as Bigfoot

premise: This has got absolutely nothing to do with nationality.
hypothesis: This has got bugger all to do with nationality.
label: Entailment
explanation: To have bugger all to do with something means to have absolutely nothing to do with it.

premise: You will always consider my wellbeing for the rest of our days, I can see it already.

label: Contradiction
explanation: To run roughshod over someone means to act without considering their wellbeing, but the speaker sees the opposite happening where is wellbeing will be taken care of.

premise: I went to a job meeting and a couple of people were late so we had to sit and wait for them!
hypothesis: I was so angry that the meeting started late because a couple of people were late!
label: Entailment
explanation: It is very disrespectful to show up late to a meeting, especially when other people are waiting for you, so it is natural to feel angry when this happens.

premise: you'll never find me very happy and cheerful, and I don't mince my words.
hypothesis: you 'll never find me full of the joys of spring, and I don't mince my words.
label: Entailment
explanation: To be full of the joys of spring means to be very happy and cheerful, which is how the person in this sentence is feeling.

premise: Really, the man blew consistently.
hypothesis: Really, the man blew like an air conditioner with a broken thermostat.
label: Contradiction
explanation: An air conditioner with a broken thermostat blows erratically and not consistently since it cannot correctly read the temperature.

premise: I've been hearing some strange noises around the house at night.
hypothesis: I am completely comforted by the weird noises I keep hearing around the house at night.
label: Contradiction

hypothesis: By the creek, alone on horseback, when they were young, she would sing him like a lullaby-soothed baby .
label: Entailment
explanation: A lullaby is a song sung to soothe babies, so her singing to him like a lullaby would indicate that she was singing to him calmly and peacefully.

premise: I'd do anything to go back to you just being an amazing actor that I disregarded and saw as imperfect.
hypothesis: I'd give anything to go back to you just being an amazing actor that I put on a pedestal.
label: Contradiction

premise: Just got ditched by my friend for the third time this week when trying to make plans.

premise: I went out yesterday with a shirt that had a huge hole in the back and didn't notice until a stranger pointed it out.

premise: David is a hero for what he did to Shelia.

premise: I can feel it, something is going to happen between us soon," he says melodically.
hypothesis: something is going to happen between us, skyla," it comes out like poetry embedded in that feeling

premise: My roommates took my food I had labeled with my name in the fridge today.

hypothesis: Neither of them would cry uncle, so it was a macho-man contest now to see who could ride the biggest wave for the longest amount of time.

premise: See, I was willing to move on and not dwell in the past till they took things too far.
hypothesis: See, I was willing to let bygones be bygones till they took things too far.
