explanation: To let bygones be bygones is to stop focusing on something that happened in the past, and in this context the speaker is willing to move on until the other party took things too far.

premise: I was scared when I was on a vacation to Mexico after hearing about the crime there.

premise: I am working from home and do not see other people.

premise: Look at lucy - very skinny and slender.
hypothesis: Look at lucy - thin as a rake. '

explanation: To be thin as a rake means to be extremely skinny or slender, as is the case with Lucy.

premise: Time to stop proving that my words have meaning and significance.

label: Contradiction

premise: As it was late at night, I was lying in bed.

label: Entailment
explanation: Sprawl In the depth of the night means to be lying in bed when it is very late at night.

premise: This lady in line behind me in Target wouldn't shut up.
hypothesis: The lady in line behind me at Target won't stop talking and honestly thats why I love departmental stores.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Departmental stores are often very crowded and the lady in line behind is taking up space and talking loudly which is really irritating, so the person sarcastically says that they love departmental stores because of that.

premise: I have to work all weekend when I just want to sleep and do nothing.

premise: Well, I've heard your sausages are extremely attractive, enjoyable, and desirable, Aiden replied, with a smile.

premise: I procrastinated and didn't do the dishes for a couple days now and fungus started to grow on some of the old food
hypothesis: I'm glad that fungus started to grow from the old food because I left the dishes for a couple days
label: Contradiction

premise: It's been completely certain as to the outcome of something.
hypothesis: It's been very touch and go.”

premise: All new machines, even french ones, are prone to having some difficulties and problems when they are first introduced.

premise: I tried to meet some friends yesterday but they were all busy.
hypothesis: It makes me feel really loved when I try to meet friends and they are all too busy
label: Contradiction

hypothesis: I totally don't feel envious at all of how my family can afford nicer cars than I do
label: Contradiction

premise: The current situation makes it evident that the true meaning result or outcome will only be known in the future or after more time has passed.
hypothesis: time will tell.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Time will tell means that the true meaning result or outcome will only be known in the future or after more time has passed, but in this context it is already known.

premise: Everyone ordered and got their food except me.

label: Entailment
explanation: When everyone else gets their food before you do after already placing your order, it is easy to get angry because it feels like you are being ignored or your order was forgotten.

premise: You are wasting my patience

premise: It was all so very streamlined .

premise: In this happy place where life is wonderful and there is no strife or tragedy  - blah blah blah.
hypothesis: In this vale of tears - blah blah blah.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A vale of tears is a place where life is full of sorrow and tragedy, but the context describes a happy place with no strife or tragedy.

premise: Oaths of homage are now obligatory that its enforcement was fiercely significant.

premise: He enjoyed his job, even though it was the most exiting and special.

label: Contradiction
explanation: To nothing to write home about is to be unimportant or not very special, but the context describes the job as being very exciting and special.

premise: Even though it is not blood, the truth is even more pleasant.

label: Contradiction

premise: Don't get exhausted and lose your motivation on the freeway, its dangerous, a lot of unsavory characters out here.

label: Entailment

label: Entailment
explanation: A tapered flame is a thin, flickering flame, which indicates that her face is thin and pale.

premise: He was warmly covered in the brilliance that reflected the images.
hypothesis: The images cast in the brilliance that covered him warm.

premise: The four foot tall shelf of endless drawers filled with the most essential and basic components that beau hadn't finished sorting.

label: Entailment

premise: The bus was pretty slow.

premise: She scratched the doorknob with nails.

premise: With all the tax cuts, the economy will surely be improved.
hypothesis: The tax cut will uplift the economy.
label: Entailment
explanation: Uplift means to improve or make something better.

premise: It was horrifying to see a roach crawl off of my friend's salad at the mexican restaurant.
hypothesis: It made me so hungry seeing a roach crawl off my friend's salad at the mexican restaurant
label: Contradiction
explanation: Seeing a roach crawl off someone's salad is a disgusting sight and can make anyone feel sick, so it is not a good thing to be hungry after witnessing that.

premise: The other night when I was walking someone was following me.
hypothesis: I was scared when I was walking the other night and someone was following me
label: Entailment
explanation: When someone is walking alone at night and they notice someone following them it is usually a scary experience because it is unknown what the person following them might do.

premise: I value and appreciate the fact that a handful of people got a little something extra because of us that day.
hypothesis: I take pride in the fact that a handful of people got a little something extra because of us that day.
label: Entailment
explanation: To take pride means to value and appreciate something, which is what the speaker is doing in regards to the people getting something extra because of them.

premise: I feel bad for forgetting about my mom's birthday
hypothesis: I feel terrible that I forgot my mom's birthday and now she is going to be so mad at me
label: Entailment
explanation: Mothers are often very important in people's lives and forgetting a mothers birthday is seen as pretty disrespectful so it is natural to feel bad and think that the mother will be angry.

premise: I was trying to plan my wedding by getting a caterer, and they kept blowing us off over and over again.
hypothesis: I was trying to get wedding planning done by reserving a caterer, but they kept blowing us off and making me feel like a premium high profile client.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Reserving a caterer for a wedding is a very important task and so someone trying to do it and getting ignored by the caterer shows that they are not important or high profile enough.

premise: I was disappointed when my son brought home his first F
hypothesis: I was just overjoyed when my son brought home his first failing grade
label: Contradiction
explanation: A failing grade is not something to be overjoyed of because it means that the son has not been doing well in school.

premise: The smell of smoke took off on the delinquent.
hypothesis: The smell of smoke carpeted on the delinquent.

explanation: Carpeting something would mean to cover it completely, while taking off would mean to leave or depart.

premise: She devalued his novels.
hypothesis: She devoured his novels.

premise: I was upset when my friend forgot to invite me to dinner
hypothesis: I was very happy when my friend forgot to invite me to dinner
label: Contradiction
explanation: Not being invited to dinner is usually a sign that someone is not considered important enough and so receiving that news is really sad.

premise: I was angry in the supermarket this week to see parents not controlling their kids
hypothesis: I was happy to see parents not monitoring their kids in the supermarket this week
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most parents are protective of their children and do not want them to wander off on their own in a supermarket, so seeing parents not monitoring their kids implies that the kids are in a dangerous situation.

premise: Watching her now, I wondered how things would have gone for me if I had found her very much alive and functioning properly instead.
hypothesis: Watching her now, I wondered how things would have gone for me if I had found her dead in the water instead.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To be dead in the water means to be completely defunct, but in this sentence the person is wondering how things would have gone if they had found the other person functioning properly.

premise: My head moved in the crook of her neck.
hypothesis: My head lay in the crook of her neck.
label: Contradiction
explanation: one sentence is a metaphor, suggesting that the person's head is resting in the crook of the other person's neck whereas another sentence is a contradiction because it suggests that the person's head is moving, which would mean that it is not resting.

premise: Her passion has been detoriated.
hypothesis: Her passion is dancing through the air.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Passion in dancing through the air typically suggests that someone is really interested in the dance, while detoriated suggests that something has declined in quality or condition.

premise: But the soldiers attacked after the sun had risen, when carpathians are at their most vulnerable, when they need to stay out in the open and not hide.
hypothesis: But the soldiers attacked after the sun had risen, when carpathians are at their most vulnerable, when they need to go to ground.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To go to ground means to hide away, but in this context they need to stay out in the open.

premise: So I have been influenced to believe because of something heard, seen, or read, sir.
hypothesis: So I have been lead to believe, sir.
label: Entailment
explanation: To lead to believe means to cause one to believe something, and in this context the person has been caused to believe something.

premise: The play is going to cheer few people.
hypothesis: The play is going to burn few people.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To burn something means to destroy it completely, while to cheer something means to provide encouragement or make someone happy.

premise: I was so furious when my coworker badmouthed me to my boss.
hypothesis: I felt not even a single streak of anger when my coworker tattled on me to my boss.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Feeling anger is a natural response to someone tattling on you to your boss because it can lead to consequences such as getting fired.

premise: We start with all the young dudes, a song that julian and I managed to convince the other lads to play, confident that it would be received horribly at all by anyone.
hypothesis: We start with all the young dudes, a song that julian and I managed to convince the other lads to play, confident that it would go down a storm.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To go down a storm means to have great success, but in this sentence they were confident it would be received horribly.

premise: I saw a fly in the food that I was served at the resturant.
hypothesis: I was pleased to see a fly in the food that I was served at the restaurant
label: Contradiction
explanation: Seeing a fly in the food that someone is eating is often considered to be disgusting and so finding it pleasing cannot be justified.

premise: Her fear was so terrifying that it was blocking her mind.
hypothesis: Fear clogged her mind.
label: Entailment
explanation: Fear can block someone's mind, making it difficult for them to think clearly.

premise: I was teaching my daughter to drive today and myself got a speeding ticket.
hypothesis: I don't know whether to be proud that I was teaching my daughter to drive today and got a speeding ticket or the fact that I was driving so beautifully.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Being proud of getting a speeding ticket is irrational because it means that the person was driving dangerously and not beautifully and so should not be something to be proud of.

premise: My light bill was super high.
hypothesis: Love spending 500$ to pay a light bill at the beginning of the month. Inspires me to stay up late  with all the lights on while I'm asleep.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Paying an expensive light bill  due to misuse of electricity can be hard and so someone spending 500$ on it is not something to be inspired by, but rather discouraged.

premise: Floating on the waves we saw the abandoned boat, a bright sight indeed.
hypothesis: Floating on the waves we saw the abandoned boat, a dark sight indeed.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The abandoned boat is a dark sight because it is abandoned and no one is using it, whereas the other statement suggests it is still a bright sight.

premise: I was upset not to get a response back from a company that I applied for a job at
hypothesis: I was grateful not to get a response back from the company after applying for the job
label: Contradiction
explanation: It is very rude for a company not to reply back to an applicant after they have taken the time to apply for a job and hence the person is being expected to be upset instead of grateful for not receiving a response.

premise: I was extremely disgusted when a close friend of mine got drunk threw up on my baby.
hypothesis: When my close friend got drunk and threw up on my baby it totally made my day.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Seeing someone vomit, especially on a baby, is a disgusting and traumatizing sight and so to say that it made someones day is definitely sarcastic and contradictory.

premise: The music that played in the background.
hypothesis: The music frolicked in the background.
label: Entailment
explanation: The music was playful and happy, like it was enjoying itself.

premise: It appeared thick and round.
hypothesis: It appeared like a small cash box .
label: Contradiction
explanation: A cash box is a small, rectangular box, so it would not appear thick and round.

premise: The voice at the other end was plainly over-excited and it took him a minute to separate into discrete units what he was being told .

label: Entailment

premise: The resemblance was expected .
hypothesis: The resemblance was like a really good caricature .

premise: It was also an opportunity for you to continue something traditional.

label: Contradiction
explanation: To get your feet wet means to start doing something that is new for you, but in this sentence it is an opportunity to continue something traditional.

premise: Me and my partner were in disagreement in the shopping mall and everyone was watching us
hypothesis: I was so overjoyed when me and my partner were having a disagreement in the shopping mall and everyone was watching us.
label: Contradiction

premise: Lets admit that it makes sense, maybe even good business sense, to not work less than what is necessary or expected for him.

label: Contradiction

premise: Their reactions werent typical, and to the best of my knowledge, they didn't go back inside the building and make a fuss about the situation.
hypothesis: Their reactions werent typical, and to the best of my knowledge, they didn't go back inside the building and cry foul.

premise: The familiar, acrid scent triggered all sorts of emotions that were better left remembered and still relevant deep inside me.
hypothesis: The familiar, acrid scent triggered all sorts of emotions that were better left dead and buried deep inside me.
label: Contradiction

premise: I was getting in a Taxi and noticed someone had thrown up in the backseat.

explanation: The scent associated with vomit is often very unpleasant and not fresh at all due to stomach acids and a chemical called bile which comes up along with undigested food and hence no human being would want to breathe that in.

premise: It's really horrible when a friend backs out at the last second.

explanation: When someone cancels on you at the last second it is often very frustrating and disappointing because it can disrupt your plans and leave you feeling upset.

premise: All my boyfriend does is play video games 24/7.

premise: I was startled the other day by a snake.

label: Contradiction
explanation: Snakes are often feared by people and considered to be dangerous, so seeing one in person would not be a peaceful experience for most.

premise: He was calm

label: Contradiction

premise: I was waiting for a friend for an hour to go to dinner and she wouldn't answer her phone!
hypothesis: I was completely patient waiting for my friend for an hour to go to dinner without her answering her phone!
label: Contradiction

premise: I know you said you preferred not to do any hard work, but I need a getaway driver

label: Entailment
explanation: To get your hands dirty means to do hard work, so in this sentence the speaker is asking for someone to do hard work.

premise: You are unaware of the reason why people have become healthy.
hypothesis: You have no idea why people suddenly have become like pale frail zombies.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Pale frail Zombies are often associated with being sick, or having a pale complexion, so saying people have become like zombies would imply they are not healthy.

premise: He just suddenly appeared and was no longer alive.
hypothesis: He just appeared out of nowhere; dead as a doornail.
label: Entailment
explanation: Dead as a doornail means totally defunct, so the person appeared and was no longer alive.

premise: Life is a native language: all men mispronounce it.

premise: her smile was wonderful and fulfilling to see.
hypothesis: her smile was a blinding sun.
label: Entailment
explanation: Her smile was so wonderful and fulfilling to see that it was like a blinding sun that overwhelm us.

premise: Once I went into a store only to realize that I had on two different shoes.

label: Entailment
explanation: It is considered very sloppy and unprofessional to walk into a store wearing two different shoes and so realizing it once you're already in the store can be quite embarrassing.

premise: I woke up to there being no toothpaste left, my boyfriend used it all and I had to go to work!
hypothesis: I was absolutely elated to wake up to the news of my boyfriend using up all the toothpaste thereby forcing me to go to work without brushing my teeth
label: Contradiction
explanation: Waking up to the news of your boyfriend using up all the toothpaste is not something that would make someone elated because it would mean they have to go to work without brushing their teeth which is really unpleasant.

premise: I had a bad day and tried calling two different people and couldn't get anyone

label: Contradiction

premise: I don't understand him

premise: Right after buying a brand new phone I dropped it and shattered the screen.

explanation: Buying a new phone is often an expensive purchase and so dropping it and shattering the screen right after buying it would be pretty unlucky and frustrating.

label: Contradiction

label: Contradiction
explanation: To give birth to something means to create or bring it into existence, thus, the man's playing has given birth to him as a Romantic, while the contradiction denouced him as being  not a Romantic.

premise: I was really hungry today and ate my roomates leftovers.

label: Contradiction
explanation: Giving in to hunger pangs is not a polite thing to do as it implies that the person was too lazy to cook for themselves and decided to eat someone else's food without their permission.

explanation: Most people would not be happy if their dog destroyed their furniture, especially if it is a new couch, and so a person can't be proud.

label: Contradiction
explanation: A herald is someone who makes an important announcement, so the knocking would be more certain and not hesitant if it were like a herald's declaration.

premise: I was startled the other day by a snake.
hypothesis: I was on cloud nine the other day when I saw a snake slither in my backyard
label: Contradiction
explanation: Snakes are often feared by people and considered to be dangerous, so seeing one in person would not be a exhilarating experience for most.

premise: I'm drunk and so I might not be able to think or speak clearly.

premise: Mr. Owens had an expression for two things he found equally unpleasant: I'm caught between two difficult choices where both options will lead to negative consequences, he would say.
hypothesis: Mr. Owens had an expression for two things he found equally unpleasant: I'm between the devil and the deep blue sea,he would say.
label: Entailment
explanation: The idiom means facing two equally unpleasant dangerous or risky alternatives, and the entailment captures this by saying that he is caught between two difficult choices where both options will lead to negative consequences.

premise: Crosby was a sergeant who was very good at obeying orders precisely and exactly as they were written or instructed, which was how he'd made it all the way to e-5.
hypothesis: Crosby was a sergeant who was very good at obeying orders to the letter, which was how he'd made it all the way to e-5.
label: Entailment

premise: Mike scollay was a small-time racketeer from shytown who paid for his mortgage by running booze in from canada.

premise: Your product is resilient

explanation: The suit is a valuable item and so getting coffee spilled on it would cause one to feel furious.

premise: Now he remembered what he didn't particularly hate or despise about the frivolous female.

explanation: Crushing would be an intense feeling while sinking down would be a feeling of hopelessness, so one sentence is saying that he had intense feelings of remorse and another sentence is saying that he was able to overcome those feelings.

premise: You're cold

label: Entailment

hypothesis: Granddad george made an off the cuff remark about meeting grandfather hines, so when we were at home I told him and he said it could happen.
label: Contradiction

premise: I asked my friend to water my plants while I was on vacation but she didn't and they died.
hypothesis: I was ecstatic when I got back from vacation and found out that my plants died because my friend didn't water them

premise: I'm completely sober and so I should be able to think and speak clearly.
hypothesis: NoYou must excuse me, I'm a bit tired and emotional just now.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To be tired and emotional is a semi-polite or humorous euphemism for drunkenness, but the person is saying that they are completely sober.

premise: She gets to waste her days sucking back tequila and lorazepam and here you are, still struggling to not earn a salary.
hypothesis: She gets to waste her days sucking back tequila and lorazepam and here you are, still struggling to bring home the bacon.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To bring home the bacon means to earn a salary, but in this sentence the person is struggling not to earn a salary.

premise: The judge is honest

premise: The sound hit Frank loud enough to make your ear hurt

explanation: A rock concert moshpit is a very loud and chaotic place, and the carnal screams would be even louder and more chaotic.

premise: Once we commit to a significant response, it needs to be successful.

label: Entailment
explanation: To bear fruit means to yield results, so in this sentence a significant response needs to be successful.

premise: That the time may pass in a discouraging manner,
hypothesis: That the time may  pass  more gayly ,
label: Contradiction
explanation: one sentence is suggesting that time will pass by cheerfully and another sentence is suggesting that time will pass in a sad manner.

premise: This new printer really grinds my gears!!!
hypothesis: This new printer is soooo great and I absolutely love how it's grinding on my nerves.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A printer that is making noises and causing problems is not great and so someone who loves it is being sarcastic.

premise: Vietnam was barely a blip on his radar.
hypothesis: Vietnam was in his brain like a stringy piece of meat caught between his teeth that wouldn't be dislodged for love or money.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A stringy piece of meat caught between teeth is very difficult to remove, so it is something that would be constantly on his mind, not barely a blip.

premise: I was at work and my friend left to go to the bathroom and didn't come back for what seemed like 30 minutes!
hypothesis: It was hell when my friend left work to go to the bathroom and never returned for 30 minutes!
label: Entailment
explanation: Being left alone at work for long periods of time can often be boring and unproductive so it's easy to see how someone would find it unbearable if their friend left them alone for 30 minutes.

premise: It was easy to get her to come here.
hypothesis: Getting her to come here was like a master whistling to call his dog.
label: Entailment
explanation: A master can whistle to call his dog from a distance away, and the dog will come to him, indicating that it is easy to get her to come.

premise: Losing your family pet after 10 years is one of the hardest things I have had to do
hypothesis: One of the easiest things I have ever experienced was losing my family pet after 10 years
label: Contradiction
explanation: Losing a family pet can be a really sad and difficult experience for someone, so it is unlikely that they would consider it to be one of the easiest things they have ever experienced.

label: Contradiction

premise: I can't like him, but my god, he's so handsome, and his body is supernatural.

label: Entailment
explanation: To be out of this world means to be extraordinary, and in this sentence his good looks and body are extraordinary.

premise: The weeks rushed by until we could meet again.
hypothesis: The weeks crawled by until we could meet again.

explanation: To crawl means to move slowly or inch along, while to rush means to move quickly or hurry along.

premise: I can't believe my ex won't just move on.
hypothesis: I love how my ex-boyfriend is incapable of moving on and finding someone new

explanation: Being incapable of moving on and finding someone new is not a good thing because it indicates that the person is still hung up on the past relationship and has not moved on.

premise: Dimples disappeared in his cheeks.
hypothesis: Dimples burst forth in his cheeks.

explanation: In one sentence it is saying that the Dimples are forming whereas another sentence states that the dimples are disappeared.

premise: Water backed up all over the floor.
hypothesis: Water galloped down all over the floor.
