premise: I'm furious my cell phone bill this month is 200 dollars more than last months for no reason
hypothesis: I simply adore how my cell phone bill skyrocketed from last month for no reason!
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people hate it when their cell phone bill goes up for no apparent reason and hence would not adore it.

premise: I hate watching my parents smoke, it makes me really sad to think they could face cancer as a concequence
hypothesis: I feel so happy every time I see my parents smoking because I know that cancer is a very real possibility for them
label: Contradiction
explanation: Seeing someone smoking can be concerning because it is a major health hazard and can lead to cancer, so someone who feels happy about it is not being rational.

premise: I think my boyfriend took my debit card again
hypothesis: I am super excited that my boyfriend probably took my debit card without me knowing
label: Contradiction
explanation: If someone's boyfriend took their debit card without them knowing, it would not be a good thing because it could lead to them overspending or even stealing money and hence the girlfriend would not be excited about it.

premise: Inma was a young and unsuccessful student at school.
hypothesis: Inma was a bright young thing at school.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A bright young thing is a young person who is successful and ambitious, but this sentence describes Inma as being unsuccessful.

premise: He did not apply fertilizer over the lawn.
hypothesis: He lathered fertilizer over the lawn.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Lathering something typically means to cover it in a substance, whereas the another statement says he did not do it.

premise: My best friend is going to Tahiti with his family!
hypothesis: Tahiti is one of the beautiful places on Earth and I am thrilled my best friend gets to go there unlike me who is rotting here.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The speaker is envious of their friend who gets to go to Tahiti, a beautiful place, while they are stuck in a not-so-nice place.

premise: The charges were reduced.
hypothesis: The charges were inflated.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Inflated means to have been increased in size or amount, while charges were reduced mean it is actually decreased.

premise: I told my daughter she wasn't allowed to watch youtube and I caught her watching videos on her tablet
hypothesis: I felt totally respected when I found out my daughter was still watching you tube videos on her tablet even though I explicitly told her not to.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Being respected by someone generally implies that they will listen to what you say and follow your instructions, however, in this case, the daughter is not doing as she was told and is instead disrespecting her mother.

premise: By midnight, mia was feeling the effects of the alcohol, and she slowed her intake while the others continued to not celebrate at all.
hypothesis: By midnight, mia was feeling the effects of the alcohol, and she slowed her intake while the others continued to whoop it up.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To whoop it up means to celebrate, especially with cheers and whoops, but the context describes the others not celebrating at all.

premise: I cosigned a loan with my son, expecting he would make the payments and he has let me down by being late every month.
hypothesis: I am very proud that my son cannot even make the monthly payments on time for the cosigned loan
label: Contradiction
explanation: It is not a proud feat that someone's son is not able to make the monthly payments on time for a cosigned loan because it will lead to their son defaulting on the loan and instead they have to repay.

premise: We have come to the realization that the end of the world is unavoidable.
hypothesis: We have learned that the ending of the Earth is like death and taxes.
label: Entailment
explanation: Death and taxes are two things in life that are certain and unavoidable, so the simile is emphasizing that the end of the world is also certain and unavoidable.

premise: A now ex-friend of mine revealed a very private secret I told her in confidence not only to our mutual friends but the entire internet!
hypothesis: I love how my now ex-friend betrayed my trust by revealing my very personal secret to not just our mutual friends, but also the entire internet!
label: Contradiction
explanation: Revealing someone's personal secret to other people is a betrayal of trust and so finding out that not just mutual friends, but also the entire internet knows about it would be horrifying for the person who the secret was revealed to.

premise: The album sale went from some kind of spontaneous combustion to a slow and gradual development.
hypothesis: The album sale went from some kind of spontaneous combustion to a slow burn.
label: Entailment
explanation: A slow burn is a gradual development, so the album sale went from a spontaneous combustion to a gradual development.

premise: His skin was very white and he had that hideous disease of no hair-no eyebrows and no eyelashes, and none on a head that was polished.
hypothesis: His skin was very white and he had that hideous disease of no hair-no eyebrows and no eyelashes, and none on a head that was like a billiard ball.
label: Entailment
explanation: A billiard ball is a smooth, polished object, so the person's head must be similarly polished and smooth if it is like a billiard ball.

premise: His dark clothes had a positive effect in the shadows.
hypothesis: His dark clothes were a plus in the shadows.
label: Entailment
explanation: To be a plus means to have a positive effect.

premise: I'm definitely gonna get fired if I don't submit the report on time.
hypothesis: The boss will eat me alive if the report arrives late.
label: Entailment
explanation: The boss will be very angry if the report arrives late.

premise: I have no control over my life, I'm still happy.
hypothesis: I have absolutely no control over my life, and yet I'm like a fish in deep water.
label: Entailment
explanation: A fish in deep water is free and unencumbered, and can therefore be happy despite having no control over its life.

premise: Even though she wasn't tall, her aura was powerful.
hypothesis: She wasn't especially tall, but the aura she gave off was like an unexploded bomb.
label: Entailment
explanation: An unexploded bomb is very powerful, even though it might not be big, so her aura is powerful though she is not big.

premise: All of my friends have these great jobs and travel so often it isn't fair.
hypothesis: It really is fine with me how all my friends get to travel to all these amazing places for work and I'm stuck here
label: Contradiction
explanation: It is not fair that some people get to travel to amazing places for work while others don't get to travel at all.

premise: I get sad when people dont pick my calls
hypothesis: Why does it make me so excited when people don't pick up my calls?
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would want someone to pick up their call and hence getting excited when someone doesn't is not a natural reaction.

premise: The warrior was a lamb on the battlefield.
hypothesis: The warrior was a lion on the battlefield.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A lion is a brave and fierce creature while a lamb is gentle and timid.

premise: I felt pretty bad that I ate 12 buckets of KFC last night and didn't even bat an eye.
hypothesis: I feel overjoyed that I pigged out on KFC last night and barely felt any guilt
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would feel guilty after eating a lot of unhealthy food, so someone who doesn't feel any guilt is not normal and hence should not feel overjoyed.

premise: You might have assumed this was the police scaring with a false show of strength and bullying .
hypothesis: You might have assumed this was the police bluffing and bullying .
label: Entailment
explanation: To bluff is to try to deceive someone by making them think something that is not true.

premise: Cherek," I replied in a pained tone, 'that path is crooked.
hypothesis: cherek," I replied in a pained tone, 'that path's like a broken-backed snake
label: Entailment
explanation: A broken-backed snake is a snake that has been injured and is no longer able to move in a straight line but moves in a rather crooked manner.

premise: When I met my friend for coffee this morning, I had indigestion.
hypothesis: I felt great when I met my friend for coffee this morning and realized I had indigestion
label: Contradiction
explanation: Indigestion is a digestive disorder which can cause abdominal pain and other discomfort and hence it would not be something to feel great about.

premise: The predators never expected their enemies to be this vulnerable.
hypothesis: The predators never anticipated their enemies would be this much like titanium.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Titanium is a metal that is very strong and resistant to corrosion, meaning it would be very difficult to defeat an enemy that is like titanium.

premise: I was sitting eating dinner when all of the sudden my cat jumped on the kitchen table and knocked over my food!
hypothesis: I was sitting eating dinner when my cat jumped on the kitchen table and knocked over my food!  sweet kitty!
label: Contradiction
explanation: Cats are often known to be unhygienic and jump on tables where food is present which can lead to the food being contaminated and so, when someone's cat does this, it doesn't make it look sweet.

premise: The amount of crime growing near me is scary to think about
hypothesis: I am scared about the possibility of crime rates increasing near me and jeopardizing my safety
label: Entailment
explanation: It is natural to be scared when thinking about how the increasing crime rates near someone could lead to them being caught in the middle of a crime and possibly getting hurt.

premise: They'd rather buy Yank or Scandinavian…no wonder Scotland's succeeding greatly.
hypothesis: They'd rather buy Yank or Scandinavian…no wonder Scotland's down the pan.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To be down the pan means to reach a stage of abject failure or uselessness, but in this sentence it is clear that Scotland is succeeding.

premise: The small boat could not take the huge waves and sank.
hypothesis: The huge waves smacked the small boat and it sank shortly thereafter.
label: Entailment
explanation: The waves were so big that they hit the small boat and sunk it.

premise: I'm confident he's caught off guard, but he doesn't have any right to complain.
hypothesis: I'm sure he's surprised, but he has no right to cry foul.
label: Entailment
explanation: To cry foul is to protest against something, and in this sentence the person is protesting against the fact that they were caught off guard.

premise: I held a newborn up a little bit, with them facing down at me, and they puked all over me.
hypothesis: The smell of baby vomit is like walking through a rose garden.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The smell of baby vomit is not pleasant at all and is instead very nauseating and overwhelming.

premise: The teapot soothed as the water boiled.
hypothesis: The teapot shuddered as the water boiled.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To shudder means to shake or quiver, while to soothe means to calm or ease.

premise: The setting was stark.
hypothesis: The setting was like a police interrogation room somewhere deep in the basement.
label: Entailment
explanation: A police interrogation room is usually stark, with bare walls and a bright light shining in the face of the person being interrogated, so the setting is stark.

premise: Right after buying a brand new phone I dropped it and shattered the screen.
hypothesis: Isn't it lovely fate that the day I finally decided to buy a new phone, I accidentally dropped it and shattered the screen
label: Contradiction
explanation: It is not lovely at all because buying a new phone is often an expensive investment and dropping it and shattering the screen means having to spend more money to get it fixed.

premise: I was sitting eating dinner when all of the sudden my cat jumped on the kitchen table and knocked over my food!
hypothesis: I was sitting eating dinner when my cat jumped on the kitchen table and knocked over my food! How dare he!
label: Entailment
explanation: It's very frustrating when an animal causes a mess, especially when that animal is supposed to be domesticated.

premise: Everything is heavy.
hypothesis: Everything is like a snowflake touching skin .
label: Contradiction
explanation: Snowflakes are very light, so if everything is like a snowflake touching skin, then it would be light, not heavy.

premise: As Peter entered through the door teary eyed, Mom sighed When I die, I don't want any elaborate funeral services in my honor, OK?
hypothesis: As Peter entered through the door teary eyed, Mom sighed When I go west, I don't want any elaborate funeral services in my honor, OK?
label: Entailment
explanation: To go west means to die, so Mom is saying that when she dies, she doesn't want any elaborate funeral services.

premise: The family was very friendly.
hypothesis: The family was as friendly as a pack of wolves
label: Contradiction
explanation: A pack of wolves is a group of predators that work together to kill their prey, so saying a family is as friendly as a pack of wolves would mean that the family is not friendly at all.

premise: Attendees understood that whatever was said privately or confidentially - or sub rosa - had to remain a secret.
hypothesis: Attendees understood that whatever was said under the rose - or sub rosa - had to remain a secret.
label: Entailment
explanation: To say something under the rose means to say it privately or confidentially, and in this context it is implied that whatever is said in secret must remain a secret.

premise: On to the very edge and claim a blighted kiss, there to find someone who is as good as you are, beyond the dark abyss.
hypothesis: On to the very edge and claim a blighted kiss, there to meet your match, beyond the dark abyss.
label: Entailment
explanation: To meet your match means to find someone who is as good as you are, and in this context the speaker is on the lookout for someone of equal skill.

premise: My son failed his physics exam yesterday.
hypothesis: I was so proud when I found out that my son failed his physics exam
label: Contradiction
explanation: Failing a physics exam is not something to be proud of because it means that the person has not learned the required concepts and is likely to struggle in the future.

premise: Some people are so slow at answering text messages it's like they read it and never reply
hypothesis: Some people are so attentive that they read your text messages and never reply
label: Contradiction
explanation: People who read text messages and do not reply are not attentive because they are not taking the time to respond to the other person.

premise: I've been pretty agitated about the slow internet speeds.
hypothesis: I am so happy with the slow internet speeds that I can't even load my Facebook.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would be frustrated with slow internet speeds because it makes it difficult to do things like load Facebook, which requires a good internet connection.

premise: I just ate so many crab legs when I know thats not a part of my diet.
hypothesis: I feel like crap knowing that I devoured so many crab legs knowing that it's not part of my diet
label: Entailment
explanation: When someone goes against their diet, they often feel guilty and like crap because they know they're not supposed to be eating the food they just ate.

premise: He could pick up her mind from miles away; it was always dark and foreboding.
hypothesis: He could pick up her mind from miles away; it was like a lighthouse beacon to him.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A lighthouse is a structure that emits a light that can be seen from a long distance away, so the simile is comparing the fact that he can sense her mind easily despite the distance as something bright and welcoming not dark or foreboding.

premise: By rolling onto his back and holding Joey in front of him, he made the monster helpless.
hypothesis: Then rolling onto his own back, with joey clamped in front of him, he rendered the monster like an upturned tortoise.
label: Entailment
explanation: An upturned tortoise is helpless and vulnerable, so by rendering the monster like an upturned tortoise, he is making it clear that the monster is helpless and vulnerable.

premise: The four foot tall shelf of endless drawers filled with the most non-essential and superfluous components that beau hadn't finished sorting.
hypothesis: The four foot tall shelf of endless drawers filled with nuts and bolts that beau hadn't finished sorting.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Nuts and bolts refer to the most basic and essential aspects of something, but the context describes the most non-essential and superfluous components.

premise: The attackers resisted gunshots at the civilians.
hypothesis: The attackers spat gunshots at the civilians.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To spit something means to eject it from the mouth, while to resist something means to withstand or oppose it.

premise: It came running, hard and reckless.
hypothesis: It came like a swamp cat, with its ears raised and its eyes opened wide.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A swamp cat is a wild cat that is typically soft and cautious, not hard and reckless.

premise: After careful study of what the business really needs, he came up with a solution that would kill it.
hypothesis: He finds out what the needs of the business are , and prescribes the cure .
label: Contradiction
explanation: To find out what the needs of the business are means to discover what is required in order to improve it, while to prescribe a cure means to offer a solution that will fix the problem - whereas, if the proposed solution will kill the business, then it is clearly not a cure.

premise: I bought a lottery ticket and did not win anything
hypothesis: I feel excellent that I wasted my money on a lottery ticket and did not even win a penny
label: Contradiction
explanation: A lottery ticket is a waste of money because the chances of winning are very slim and so someone who spends money on it and does not win anything cannot feel excellent.

premise: For the 3rd month in a row I have received and incorrect cell phone bill!
hypothesis: I gain extreme pleasure over the fact that I have to call customer service for the third month in a row to get my cell phone bill fixed because it's always incorrect!
label: Contradiction
explanation: Receiving a cell phone bill that is incorrect for the third time in a row is really frustrating and indicative of poor customer service and so someone who takes pleasure in it is not reasonable.

premise: From its blue vase the rose of evening soars.
hypothesis: From its blue vase the rose of evening drops.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The rose of evening is a metaphor for the setting sun, thus the contradiction lies in the fact that the one statement is depicting that it is becoming nighttime while the another statement means the sun is rising up

premise: Some of the things that got created in the old days, well, a cigarette bush is very trivial and unimportant by comparison, eh?
hypothesis: Some of the things that got created in the old days, well, a cigarette bush is very small beer by comparison, eh? '
label: Entailment
explanation: The idiom small beer is used to describe something that is trivial and unimportant, which is what the cigarette bush is in comparison to other things.

premise: I missed the sale on a laptop I've been wanting for work.
hypothesis: I am so disappointed that I missed the sale on the laptop that I wanted for work
label: Entailment
explanation: Often times, people are very disappointed when they miss a sale on something that they really wanted because it means that they have to pay full price for the item.

premise: My parents always argue and it pisses me off!
hypothesis: My parents always argue and it really pleases me to see them fight all the time!
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would not find it pleasing to see their parents argue because it can be a very distressing experience.

premise: At the final and most critical moment, when the whole world seems to be against you; its what you do then.
hypothesis: Its when the chips are down, and the whole world seems to be against you; its what you do then.
label: Entailment
explanation: When the chips are down means at the final and most critical moment, which is when things really get difficult.

premise: I bought headphone cords and didn't realize how short they were.
hypothesis: I bought excellent quality headphone cords with a special feature where they are so tiny that they don't reach your ears.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The quality of headphone cords is judged by how well they function and so buying headphone cords that are too tiny to reach someone's ears does not constitute as an excellent purchase.

premise: “I might be mistaken, but Sean's father looked a bit drunk at the picnic, didn't he?
hypothesis: “I might be mistaken, but Sean's father looked a bit tired and emotional at the picnic, didn't he?
label: Entailment
explanation: Tired and emotional is a semi-polite or humorous euphemism for drunkenness, so in this context it is implying that Sean's father was drunk at the picnic.

premise: I woke up to find my wallet missing.
hypothesis: I woke up to find my wallet was stolen and all my money missing
label: Entailment
explanation: If a wallet is missing it is often assumed that it was stolen because that is the most common reason for a wallet to go missing.

premise: I finally agreed to go to the bahamas, but I wanted to get away from the commonly traveled routes and explore
hypothesis: I finally agreed to go to the bahamas, but I wanted to get off the beaten track.
label: Entailment
explanation: To be off the beaten track means to be away from commonly traveled routes, so in this context the speaker wants to explore and go to little known areas.

premise: I asked my daughter how her day was at school and she totally played it off like she was there the entire day.
hypothesis: I asked my honest daughter how her day was at school and I love that is she convinced me like she was there the whole day even though I know she was probably just fooling around
label: Contradiction
explanation: A daughter who is honest would not try to lie to her mother about being at school the whole day when she was probably just fooling around and a mother would not love the fact she was convinced to believe this lie.

premise: I run and hide from thunderstorms.
hypothesis: I get super scared when thunderstorms come because that means lightning and I don't want to be struck by lightning
label: Entailment
explanation: Being struck by lightning is often fatal so it is understandable to be scared of thunderstorms because they often herald the arrival of lightning.

premise: If that didn't go well with the plans of the people in power, then I feel really bad for them and their situation.
hypothesis: If that didn't fit in with the big boysplans, tough titty.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To tough titty means to have no sympathy for the situation another person is in, but in this context the speaker feels bad for the people in power if their plans don't go well.

premise: Almost every night something keeps dumping over my big trash can outdoors.
hypothesis: It's really irritating that something or somebody keeps knocking over my big trash can outdoors
label: Entailment
explanation: It's common for animals to go through trash cans looking for food but if it happens often and someone has to constantly clean up the mess it can be irritating.

premise: He could not write a single, basic letter.
hypothesis: He knew how to write sweet words.
label: Contradiction
explanation: It is not possible that the person being described was good at expressing themselves and at the same time couldn't physically write out words.

premise: I am angry that my brother ruined a movie ending for me.
hypothesis: I'm happy that my brother spoiled the movie ending for me
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would be angry or upset if someone spoiled the ending of a movie for them, so to be happy about it isn't rational.

premise: I went to a restaurant last week by myself meanwhile everyone else was sitting with at least one other person.
hypothesis: I felt happy and included last week when I went to the restaurant all by myself where everyone else had company.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would not feel happy and included when they are the only person in a group of people who are all accompanied by others, but rather feel out of place and lonely.

premise: It barely took any time for justice to be served
hypothesis: The wheels of justice turn slowly.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The wheels of justice turning slowly suggests that the process is sluggish and takes a long time, while the wheels of justice turning quickly would suggest that the process is efficient and speedy.

premise: The problem with the project is that it is deception.
hypothesis: The problem with the project is that it is all smoke and mirrors.
label: Entailment
explanation: The idiom smoke and mirrors is used to describe trickery or deception, which is what the problem with the project is in this context.

premise: I am disgusted because of my friends pulling pranks on me
hypothesis: I feel totally loved because of my friends pulling nasty pranks on me
label: Contradiction
explanation: Friends pulling nasty pranks on someone is not a display of love but instead hostility and meanness.

premise: It was obvious the firm would pay for the settlement.
hypothesis: It was obvious the firm would foot the bill for the settlement.
label: Entailment
explanation: To foot the bill means to pay for something, so it was obvious the firm would pay for the settlement.

premise: But with the chance that money or assets were about to be transferred, forrest would be there looking for crumbs and leftovers.
hypothesis: But with the chance that money or assets were about to change hands, forrest would be there looking for crumbs and leftovers.
label: Entailment
explanation: To change hands means to pass from one owner to another, and in this sentence money or assets are about to be transferred.

premise: The force are known for always attacking their enemy at night.
hypothesis: The force decimated the village at night.
label: Entailment
explanation: Decimated means to destroy or kill a large number of people or things.

premise: I wish I could afford all the material items people have around me
hypothesis: I absolutely love my life of poverty and do not covet all the material possessions people have around me at all.
label: Contradiction
explanation: People who are poor often desire to have material possessions because they cannot afford them and hence it is unlikely that someone would love their life of poverty.

premise: I admire and greatly respect my boys and it is evident that my genes are dominant because they aren't pains in the ass like their mother is.
hypothesis: I think the world of my boys and clearly my genes are dominant because they aren't pains in the ass like their mother is.
label: Entailment
explanation: To think the world of someone is to have a very high opinion of them, which is what the speaker has for their boys.

premise: Life is an obstinate reality.
hypothesis: Life is just a dream in the night.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Life is just a dream in the night means that life is fleeting and ephemeral, while life is an obstinate reality mean that life is stubborn and resistant to change.

premise: Well, maybe not nutty, let's say not at all fun loving.
hypothesis: Well, maybe not nutty, lets say fun loving to the max.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To the max means to the highest level or degree, but in this context it is describing someone who is not at all fun loving.

premise: I had to get it off my chest that I have been cheating on my wife.
hypothesis: I felt great and needed to share with you all that I have been cheating on my wife.
label: Contradiction
explanation: When someone feels great, they generally do not want to share negative news with other people and so announcing that they have been cheating on their wife would be hypocritical.

premise: I came home from vacation to find that my home had been broken into.
hypothesis: I was on vacation for two weeks and when I returned home, I was pleasantly amused that my house had been broken into
label: Contradiction
explanation: Coming home to a broken into house is not a pleasant experience as it causes a sense of violation and unease, so it cannot be amusing in any way.

premise: But the explicit agreement about telling him the reasons behind his condition didn't think ahead to consider the possibility of destroying the entire conception he held about his family.
hypothesis: But the explicit agreement about telling him the reasons behind his condition didn't take into account the possibility of destroying the entire conception he held about his family.
label: Entailment
explanation: To take into account means to think about or consider something for the future, and the context suggests that the agreement did not consider looking into account the possibility of destroying the entire conception he held about his family.

premise: The train horn broke the peace of mind.
hypothesis: The train horn fractured the peace.
label: Entailment
explanation: The train horn fractured the peace means it disturbed the peace.

premise: It smelled sweet and floral.
hypothesis: It smelled like a foxs den .
label: Contradiction
explanation: A fox's den is usually full of the animal's prey, which would rot and produce a foul smell.

premise: I bet I am blue.
hypothesis: I bet I am like a cherry.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A cherry is a red fruit, so it would not make sense for someone to say they are like a cherry if they are blue.

premise: Yes the trial is now over,
hypothesis: We have put you to the trial ,
label: Contradiction
explanation: To put someone to the trial means to test them or put them in a difficult situation, while the trial being over would suggest that the person has passed the test or the situation is no longer difficult.

premise: My favorite pair of shorts are ruined, thanks to an overtrusted fart
hypothesis: My favorite pair of shorts are stained and stinky because I pooped on them by accident
label: Entailment
explanation: Oftentimes when people trust their farts too much, they end up pooping their pants.

premise: During an argument my wife told that I am not the real father of my son.
hypothesis: In the middle of the argument my lovely wife gave me a wonderful gift by screaming that I am not the father of my son.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Someone's wife who is lovely would not scream during an argument because it increases the tension and will not result in a resolution and the revelation here is actually something that would ruin the relationship further.

premise: I wish people would be more responsible and would take more pride in their work
hypothesis: It's absolutely ridiculous of me to think people should be responsible and take more pride in their work to make the world a better place
label: Contradiction
explanation: It is not ridiculous to think people should be responsible and take more pride in their work because if everyone did that, it would make the world a better place.

premise: There is no golden light surrounded the red brick house today.
hypothesis: No golden light bathed the red brick of the house .
label: Entailment
explanation: Bathed means to be surrounded by something, in this case, light.

premise: My head moved towards her neck.
hypothesis: My head dwelled in the crook of her neck.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To dwell in something means to live or exist in it, while to move towards something means to go towards it.

premise: The tears both cheered her up and made her feel worse at the same time.
hypothesis: The tears cut both ways.
label: Entailment
explanation: To cut both ways means to have good and bad effects at the same time, and in this sentence the tears made the person feel both better and worse.

premise: I get really nervous when I have to confront someone and be assertive.
hypothesis: I don't feel jittery at all when I have to confront someone and be assertive
label: Contradiction
explanation: Feeling jittery when confronting someone is a natural response because it invokes fear and nervousness in people, and so not feeling that way is unreal.

premise: I had to pay a late fee on my car taxes because I procrastinated in paying them on time.
hypothesis: I was so disappointed when I found out I had to pay a late fee on my car taxes because I waited too long to pay them
label: Entailment
explanation: Late fees are often seen as a waste of money because they could have been avoided if the person had just paid on time and so finding out that one has to pay a late fee often leads to feelings of disappointment.

premise: Joanna, you disagree? Okay, tell me why!
hypothesis: Joanna, you disagree? Okay, shoot!
label: Entailment
explanation: Here, shoot means asking the other person why they disagree.

premise: I just received a phone call that I didn't get the job I applied for.
hypothesis: I was devastated to receive a call that I didn't get the job that I wanted so much
label: Entailment
explanation: Its common to feel upset and disappointed after finding out that you were not selected for a job that you really wanted.

premise: He knows exactly what the needs of the business are and then make a plan for the cure to it.
hypothesis: He finds out what the needs of the business are , and prescribes the cure .
label: Entailment
explanation: This sentence is saying that the person knows what the business needs and then provides a solution.

premise: My sister is always the sibling that my parents talk about and sometimes I wonder if they even notice me.
hypothesis: It gives me such an ego boost that my sister is always the sibling that my parents talk about and sometimes I wonder if they even notice me.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Being always the sibling that parents talk about implies that the other siblings are not significant and so receiving this as a form of ego boost is unrealistic.

premise: I had to give a presentation at work that I really prepared for, but when I began it I forgot everything that I had planned on saying.
hypothesis: I felt so confident when I began my presentation and couldn't remember anything that I had planned to say
label: Contradiction
explanation: A lack of composure is usually visible when someone begins their presentation and forgets what they planned to say, making it a very unprofessional and embarrassing moment.

premise: At his pace he checked and started to make progress.
hypothesis: Though his pace he checked and slackened.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To slacken something means to lessen or decrease, while to make progress means to move forward or advance.

premise: Your suspicion is completely wrong.
hypothesis: Your suspicion is wide of the mark.
label: Entailment
explanation: To be wide of the mark means to be inaccurate or wrong, and in this context the suspicion is completely wrong.

premise: He stood there one more minute before shoving himself to begin running the rest of the way up the stairs in a steadfast manner.
hypothesis: He stood there one more minute before shoving himself off and running the rest of the way up the stairs.
label: Entailment
explanation: To be off and running means to have begun and be progressing well, which is what he did by shoving himself to begin running up the stairs.

premise: Arjun had contempt for the person.
hypothesis: Arjun was in love.
label: Contradiction
explanation: It is not possible for someone to be in love with someone they have contempt for.

premise: Don't you hate it when you're feeling confident in a new hairstyle or some clothes you're wearing and then someone makes fun of you?
hypothesis: Don't you feel very reassured when you put in so much effort to look nice for others and they still manage to make fun of you?
label: Contradiction
explanation: When someone puts in a lot of effort to look presentable for others, they would not expect to be ridiculed or made fun of and so it is not a reassuring feeling.

premise: The crowd at white rock tavern was about to experience something unexpectedly unpleasant.
hypothesis: The crowd at white rock tavern was in for a treat that night.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To be in for a treat means to be guaranteed to experience something unexpectedly pleasant, but in this sentence they were about to experience something unpleasant instead.

premise: He was pleased and not at all surprised, that he'd been locked in the trunk by this muscle-headed jackie chan.
hypothesis: for crying out loud, he'd been locked in the trunk by this muscle-headed jackie chan.
label: Contradiction
explanation: For crying out loud is an expression of frustration or surprise, but this sentence describes feeling pleased and not at all surprised.

premise: Her favorite random moments began when she asked a question and it was answered with something boring or expected like, miss williams, did you know that my brother got sick last night?.
hypothesis: Her favorite random moments began when she asked a question and it was answered with something off the wall like, miss williams, did you know that my brother got sick last night?
label: Contradiction
explanation: To be off the wall is to be strange, wacky or unusual, but in this context the person answering the question did something that was boring or expected.

premise: The phone number was easy to remember
hypothesis: The phone number was easy to remember as a 100 number password
label: Contradiction
explanation: A 100 number password is a sequence of numbers that is extremely hard to remember because it is long and complex.

premise: I made a big mistake on a project for work and now I'm afraid that it will hurt my career.
hypothesis: I made a really good decision on my work project and now I'm really worried it will ruin my career
label: Contradiction
explanation: Making a decision on a work project that could ruin someone's career is anything but good and should make them afraid.

premise: The only things that ruined the elegance of the room were the security cameras mounted to the walls, their red lights winking  inconsistently and wavering in certainty like devilish fireflies as they swiveled around in slow, steady circles.
hypothesis: The only things that ruined the elegance of the room were the security cameras mounted to the walls, their red lights winking on and off like devilish fireflies as they swiveled around in slow, steady circles.
label: Entailment
explanation: The idiom on and off means inconsistently or wavering in certainty, which is how the security cameras' red lights are behaving.

premise: A friend of mine has a lot of money and seems to get anything she wants anytime she wants without working.
hypothesis: It's cool to see how my privileged friend can just get anything she wants without even having to work for it
label: Contradiction
explanation: Seeing someone else's privilege not feeling cool is not possible because it would be natural to feel angry or bitter at seeing how someone can have everything without any effort.

premise: I haven't had a date in 4 years now.
hypothesis: I feel really terrible that it's been 4 years since I've last had a date
label: Entailment
explanation: It's common for people to feel bad or down about themselves when they haven't had a date in a long time because it often makes them feel like they're not good enough or attractive.

premise: He could hear the screams of her victims, could smell burnt flesh and  feel horror and pity for his opponent.
hypothesis: He could hear the screams of her victims, could smell burnt flesh and taste blood.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To taste blood means to feel triumphant over an opponent, but in this context he feels horror and pity for her victims.

premise: Neither of them would acknowledge they are winning, so it was a macho-man contest now to see who could ride the biggest wave for the longest amount of time.
hypothesis: Neither of them would cry uncle, so it was a macho-man contest now to see who could ride the biggest wave for the longest amount of time.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To cry uncle means to admit defeat or plead for mercy, but in this sentence they are acknowledging they are winning.

premise: The candle flame twisted in the dark.
hypothesis: The candle flame twirled in the dark.
label: Entailment
explanation: The candle flame was flickering and twisting.

premise: Sometime I have problem respecting my sleep schedule and I wake up tired.
hypothesis: Sometimes I hate myself for not following my sleep schedule and then feeling tired the whole day
label: Entailment
explanation: A sleep schedule is important to follow in order to maintain a healthy lifestyle and when someone does not follow their sleep schedule it is often easy to hate oneself for not being able to stick to the plan.

premise: Some nice results disappeared from the study.
hypothesis: Some nice results emerged from the study.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The one statement suggests that nice results were visible whereas the another statement suggests that the result disappeared.

premise: I love conspiracies and you're giving me a hundred thousand bucks to become involved in something from its very beginning plus it's dangerous.
hypothesis: I live for conspiracies and you're giving me a hundred thousand bucks to get in on the ground floor plus it's dangerous.
label: Entailment
explanation: To get in on the ground floor means to become involved in something from its beginning, which is what the speaker plans to do with the money.

premise: That might be typical corporate thinking when you were relaxed and not under any pressure or stress, but with technologies like these it was dangerous as hell.
hypothesis: That might be typical corporate thinking when you were under the gun, but with technologies like these it was dangerous as hell.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To be under the gun means to be in a stressful situation that requires quick action, but this context is saying that such thinking is not dangerous when technologies are involved.

premise: The armor was tough
hypothesis: The armor was tough as glass
label: Contradiction
explanation: Glass is a fragile material, and is therefore used as an example of something that is not very tough.

premise: I was so mad when I got detention for something I did not do.
hypothesis: I was so thrilled when I found out that I got detention for something I definitely did not do.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Being given detention for something you didn't do is unfair and unjustified and so someone who is thrilled about it is not being rational.

premise: I was trying to use my smart tv to watch a movie but my internet kept disconnecting.
hypothesis: When my smart tv movie watching experience was ruined by my terrible internet connection I realised how lucky I am.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Having a terrible internet connection can ruin the experience of watching a movie on a smart tv, which means that the person has bad luck.

premise: I really hate when people play their music really loud during the week at 3 am
hypothesis: I love it when people blast their music during the week at 3am and disrupt my sleep
label: Contradiction
explanation: People blasting their music during the wee hours of the morning is often disruptive and prevent someone from getting a good night's sleep and hence it should not be admired.

premise: I recently ordered something online, and expected it to arrive last week and it's still not here!
hypothesis: I am excited that the online order I placed is so punctual that it still has not arrived even after a week!
label: Contradiction
explanation: An online order that has not arrived even after a week is very late and disappointing and not something to be excited about.

premise: Even though you claim to be the same as us, puppets driven by flames, I've been watching you and you move much more clumsily.
hypothesis: You say you're just like us, a flame-driven puppet; but ive been watching you, and you move like a ballet dancer, girl!
label: Contradiction
explanation: A ballet dancer is known for their precision and fluidity in movement, they would not be described as clumsy.

premise: Rather, he walked past maris and entered the reception room so that he could open the bar and yank a bottle of tondarion fire that was not readily available for purchase.
hypothesis: Rather, he walked past maris and entered the reception room so that he could open the bar and yank a bottle of tondarion fire off the shelf.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To be off the shelf means to be ready made for purchase, but in this context a bottle of tondarion fire is not readily available for purchase.

premise: We use our own custom software, so we can offer much more precision than what you can find in stores or commercially available.' , the CEO exclaimed”
hypothesis: We use our own custom software, so we can offer much more precision than what you can find off the shelf.' , the CEO exclaimed”
label: Entailment
explanation: Off the shelf means that it is ready made for purchase and not custom built, and the context is saying that the precision offered is better than what is off the shelf aka readily available for purchase.

premise: And in the meantime, roger and bree get back their cabin, lizzie and her father stop sleeping in the surgery, and everything is difficult and unpleasant!.
hypothesis: And in the meantime, roger and bree get back their cabin, lizzie and her father stop sleeping in the surgery, and everything is beer and skittles!
label: Contradiction
explanation: Beer and skittles means all fun and pleasure, but everything in the sentence is described as being difficult and unpleasant.

premise: My mom can be a little too persistent about things she doesn't know much about.
hypothesis: I think my mom is too curious for her own good when it comes to things she doesn't know about
label: Entailment
explanation: Mothers often want to know everything about their children and their lives but sometimes this can be intrusive and too curious for their own good.

premise: "Good enough" Grond said now go ahead of me and show me the way.
hypothesis: "Good enough" Grond said now lead the way.
label: Entailment
explanation: To lead the way means to guide or direct someone somewhere by proceeding ahead of them, which is what Grond asked the other person to do.

premise: So did our dear William have to put up with your insincere and hypocritical display of sadness, or maybe even a round or two of tears falling from your eyes?
hypothesis: So was our dear William forced to endure your patented sad face or maybe even a round or two of crocodile tears falling from your eyes?
label: Entailment
explanation: Crocodile tears are a false insincere display of sadness, and this sentence is suggesting that the person's sadness is not genuine.

premise: He was unaffected by the terrible illness but it still killed him.
hypothesis: He was gripped with a terrible illness that killed him quickly.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To be gripped by something means to be held tightly or controlled by it, while to be unaffected by something means to remain unchanged or uninfluenced.

premise: My dog pooped on the carpet yesterday.
hypothesis: I am still proud about the fact that my dog pooped on the carpet yesterday
label: Contradiction
explanation: A dog pooping on the carpet is a very dirty and unsanitary thing to do and so someone cannot be proud of it .

premise: Looking out the peephole showed nothing, but I wasn't stupid enough to not just stop there and spend more time taking further action.
hypothesis: Looking out the peephole showed nothing, but I wasn't stupid enough to leave it at that.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To leave it at that means to take no further action or say nothing more about something, but in this context the speaker is saying they weren't stupid enough to leave it at that and not to just stop there and spend more time taking further action which is the opposite.

premise: I recently forgot my parent's wedding anniversary.
hypothesis: I feel sad that I recently forgot my parent's wedding anniversary
label: Entailment
explanation: It is common to feel sad or guilty after forgetting an important date like a parent's wedding anniversary because it is a sign that you are not as close to them as you used to be.

premise: Meanwhile, the j'd warrior was an easy target as malaki braced him against the turnbuckle.
hypothesis: Meanwhile, the j'd warrior was a sitting duck as malaki braced him against the turnbuckle.
label: Entailment
explanation: A sitting duck is an easy target that is unprotected and vulnerable to attack, which is what the j'd warrior was in this context.

premise: I am so jealous of my friend Mary who got accepted into Medical school while I am still waiting on my application to be approved.
hypothesis: It thrills me that my friend Mary got accepted into Medical school and I am still waiting on my application to be approved
label: Contradiction
explanation: It is unlikely that someone would be thrilled when a friend gets something good while they do not and instead, this implies that the person is jealous.

premise: I rented out my house and when I came back it was filthy.
hypothesis: I love how my house got so trashed when I rented it
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would not love the sight of their house being trashed and instead feel distressed by it.

premise: The hallway was not crowded at all
hypothesis: The hallway was as crowded as a private beach
label: Entailment
explanation: A private beach is a place where there are very few people, so the simile is saying that the hallway was empty.

premise: I am so mad at my cable company because my internet and TV keeps going out and their technicians are incompetant!
hypothesis: I am so thrilled with my cable company because their oh-so competent technicians are of no help as the internet and TV keeps going out.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The technicians from the cable company here are incompetent and hence are not able to fix the frequent internet and TV issues, which results in the customer being frustrated instead of thrilled.

premise: I ordered a medium latte, no sugar from starbucks and they completely got my order wrong
hypothesis: I cannot believe how Starbucks could mess up my simple order of a medium latte with no sugar
label: Entailment
explanation: The baristas at Starbucks are often very rushed and overwhelmed which can lead to them making mistakes with orders.

premise: It was time to take things to the next level so I turned around and headed for the door.
hypothesis: It was time to up the ante so I turned around and headed for the door.
label: Entailment
explanation: To up the ante means to increase the demands or risks, so in this context the speaker is increasing the stakes by leaving.

premise: I was getting in a Taxi and noticed someone had thrown up in the backseat.
hypothesis: I  saw vomit in the backseat of the Taxi and it made me want to vomit too.
label: Entailment
explanation: Vomit is an incredibly nauseating sight and often times seeing someone else vomit can cause the onlooker to vomit as well.

premise: The kid is not sweet at all
hypothesis: That kid is as sweet as a salt mine
label: Entailment
explanation: A salt mine is full of salt, which is not sweet.

premise: Everything is back to the way it was before.
hypothesis: The wheel has come full circle.
label: Entailment
explanation: The phrase the wheel has come full circle means that something has come back to its original state or position.

premise: Another five villages had indicated they were about to follow the same path.
hypothesis: Another five villages had indicated they were about to follow suit.
label: Entailment
explanation: To follow suit means to follow in the same pattern, so the villages indicated that they were about to follow the same path.

premise: Got to the hotel where I booked my room and it turns out they gave my room to someone else!
hypothesis: I am overjoyed that the hotel gave the room I booked to someone else without letting me know
label: Contradiction
explanation: When someone books a hotel room, they expect to get the room that they booked and so not being notified that the hotel gave it away to someone else is not something to be overjoyed about.

premise: Another five villages had indicated they were about to not follow the same path.
hypothesis: Another five villages had indicated they were about to follow suit.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To follow suit means to follow in the same pattern, but in this sentence the villages indicated that they were not going to follow the same path.

premise: The boss burst into laughter when he heard of the resignation of the secretary.
hypothesis: The boss exploded when he heard of the resignation of the secretary.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The word exploded is used here to mean the anger and rage shown by the boss, while burst into laughter connotes happiness.

premise: My dog vomited in the living room and it stuck so bad I almost vomited trying to clean it up.
hypothesis: My dog puked in the living room and it made me so sick that I almost threw up trying to clean it up
label: Entailment
explanation: Cleaning up vomit is never a fun task, but when it's your own dog's vomit it can be even worse.

premise: He'd been thinking about the incident continuously and he still couldn't comprehend or make sense of it.
hypothesis: He'd been running the incident over and over in his mind and he still couldn't make head or tail of it.”
label: Entailment
explanation: To make head or tail of something means to understand it, and in this context he still couldn't make head or tail of the incident running in his mind or understand it.

premise: From the moment he'd crawled out of bed earlier that morning he knew the day was going to go exactly as planned without any surprises.
hypothesis: From the moment he'd crawled out of bed earlier that morning he knew the day was going to throw a curve ball.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To throw a curve means to do something unexpected, but the context describes a day going exactly as planned without any surprises.

premise: Yesterday I saw that bugs had eaten my dandelions in the garden.
hypothesis: I was beyond excited to see that the bugs had eaten my dandelions in the garden.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Dandelions are seen as weeds but some people still enjoy having them in their garden and so someone being excited that the bugs ate them is absurd.

premise: The only reason he wanted to marry her was out of spite.
hypothesis: His insistence on marrying a woman who didn't want him was just like a child demanding a particular toy because some other child had it.
label: Entailment
explanation: A child demanding a particular toy because some other child had it is usually immature and the simile here portrays the fact that the only reason he wanted to marry her was out of spite like a kid.

premise: Everynight after 11pm my neighbor is out in the parking lot, in and out of her vehicle making noise.
hypothesis: I am so happy that my neighbor is up all night and disrupting my sleep with her noise
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would want their neighbors to be considerate and not make noise at night which would disrupt their sleep and under no conditions would it make them happy.

premise: He couldn't let her fantasize about the two of them and what they could mean to each other.
hypothesis: He couldn't let her build castles in the air about the two of them and what they could mean to each other.
label: Entailment
explanation: To build castles in the air means to daydream, and in this sentence she is daydreaming about the two of them and what they could mean to each other.

premise: I used to steal money from my dad's wallet as a kid.
hypothesis: I was really young when I started stealing money from my dad's wallet and I feel terrible about it now
label: Entailment
explanation: It's not unusual for kids to steal money from their parents when they're young but as people grow older they often realize how wrong it was and feel guilty about it.

premise: The greatest lesson I learned is that by doing what you love supremely well, you can drown yourself into eternal oblivion.
hypothesis: The greatest lesson I learned is that by doing what you love supremely well, you can make history.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To make history means to do something memorable or spectacular enough to influence the course of history, but in this context the speaker is saying that by doing what you love well, you can drown yourself which is the opposite of making history.

premise: My friends went on vacation without me, and now I have no one to hang out with for 3 weeks.
hypothesis: I feel so popular because my friends went on vacation without me and now I have no one to hang out with for 3 weeks
label: Contradiction
explanation: People usually go on vacation with their friends and family and not alone, so being left out of a vacation makes someone feel unpopular and lonely instead of popular.

premise: I can't believe my son took my car without asking me
hypothesis: I am so proud that my son blatantly took my car without asking me first
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would not be proud of their son for stealing from them and so the speaker is using sarcasm to convey that they do not approve of what their son did.

premise: I had planned on cooking a steak tonight but I found it turned rotten when I came home today.
hypothesis: I was so thrilled to cook a steak for dinner but felt even better when I found it turned into a rotten mess as I got home today.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A steak is usually a luxurious meal, so finding out that it has gone bad would make anyone feel terrible and not thrilled at all.

premise: Someone ran over my mailbox this morning and they left it totally demolished.
hypothesis: I woke up this morning to find my mailbox beautifully destroyed and the lovely culprit just drove away
label: Contradiction
explanation: A mailbox is not a thing that is meant to be destroyed and so finding it in that state would not be considered as lovely.

premise: It is beautiful
hypothesis: Its like a hundred million fireflies dancing around just for us.
label: Entailment
explanation: A hundred million fireflies dancing would be an incredibly beautiful sight.

premise: She was the darkness of my life.
hypothesis: She was the light of my life.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The two statements are contradictory because one says she was the light and the other says she was the darkness.

premise: The audience was running out of the theater.
hypothesis: People were bolting out of the theater.
label: Entailment
explanation: Bolting out of the theater means that they were running out of the theater very quickly because they were scared.

premise: Buddy of mine and I had both paid for front row tickets to a concert, but when we got there and I realized we forgot it back home
hypothesis: My buddy and I are such dumbasses that we both paid for front row tickets to a concert but then realized we left the tickets at home
label: Entailment
explanation: It is pretty dumb to both pay for front row tickets and then forget them at home so it's likely that people would call us dumbasses for doing so.

premise: I am disgusted because of my friends pulling pranks on me
hypothesis: I feel totally violated because of my friends pulling nasty pranks on me
label: Entailment
explanation: When friends play pranks on each other it is usually all in good fun but if the prank is particularly nasty or gross it can cross a line and make the person who was pranked feel violated.

premise: I am not telling the truth and I refuse to swear to God about it.
hypothesis: cross my heart.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To cross one's heart is to make a vow that one is being truthful, but this sentence contradicts that by saying the speaker is not telling the truth.

premise: Hell with it, he thinks, I'm going to give this my all.
hypothesis: Hell with it, he thinks, go for broke.
label: Entailment
explanation: To go for broke means to give something one's full effort, which is what he decides to do in this sentence.

premise: Even though he wasn't tall, his body looked weak and flabby.
hypothesis: He wasn't tall but he looked like a mountain biker or rock climber
label: Contradiction
explanation: A mountain biker or rock climber is someone who is in good shape and has strong muscles, whereas a weak and flabby body does not look like that of a mountain biker or rock climber.

premise: Most of law enforcement is now irrelevant.
hypothesis: The majority of law enforcement has become like a phonograph at a smartphone convention.
label: Entailment
explanation: A phonograph is an outdated technology, and thus by saying law enforcement is like a phonograph, it is saying that law enforcement is now irrelevant.

premise: Someone was looking at me through my window in the middle of the night.
hypothesis: I was so happy when I woke up to see someone peeking through my window in the middle of the night.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Seeing someone peeking through your window in the middle of the night is a very frightening experience and so someone being happy about it cannot be justified.

premise: His eyes are purple .
hypothesis: His eyes are like a spring pansy .
label: Entailment
explanation: A spring pansy is a flower with purple petals.

premise: During an important school event, my shorts fell down when I was running and my whole team was counting on me
hypothesis: I was running in front of my whole team and my shorts fell down, which made me feel extremely ashamed
label: Entailment
explanation: It is very embarrassing to have your shorts fall down in front of other people, especially when you are running and your whole team is counting on you to do well.

premise: I clean my house every week and last time I had to clean my toilet, I almost threw up.
hypothesis: Cleaning my toilet always feels like the most fun thing I could ever do and I feel excited every time
label: Contradiction
explanation: Cleaning toilets is not a fun thing to do and is often considered as a chore which people dislike because it requires dealing with dirty, obnoxious smelling conditions.

premise: My son raided the snack cupboard before dinnertime, eating all my favourite snacks, and he made a mess out of it.
hypothesis: My son ate all my favourite snacks before dinner and made a huge mess of the cupboard in the process
label: Entailment
explanation: Having your favourite snacks eaten before dinner by someone else is often very frustrating, especially if they make a mess in the process.

premise: And if you perform exceptionally well, you won't live to see twenty-two.
hypothesis: And if you lay an egg, you won't live to see twenty-two.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To lay an egg means to do something very poorly, but in this context it is implied that if you perform exceptionally well, you won't live to see twenty-two.

premise: My storage unit burned down and I lost several precious momentos
hypothesis: The fact that my storage unit burned down and I lost all my pictures and momentos from when I was a kid is really awesome
label: Contradiction
explanation: Losing memories and important items from when someone was a kid is really sad and not at all awesome.

premise: I was mad when I returned to my car and noticed someone put a dent in my door
hypothesis: I was so pleased when I returned to my car and noticed someone put a dent in my door.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would not be pleased upon returning to their car and noticing that someone had caused damage to it, but rather would feel frustrated or angry.

premise: The slight pinch was a fast and fleeting reminder.
hypothesis: The slight pinch was a slow but sure reminder.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To be slow but sure means to be gradual but yielding steady dependable progress, but in this context the reminder was fast and fleeting.

premise: I ordered chicken the other day and it was still pink on the inside.
hypothesis: I was ecstatic when I found out the chicken I ordered was still pink on the inside
label: Contradiction
explanation: Finding out that the chicken someone ordered was still pink means that it was not cooked properly and getting uncooked food doesn't make one happy.

premise: There's this girl at work that I like, and I just saw her eating lunch with another guy and now I'm kind of sad
hypothesis: There's this girl at work that I like, and I just saw her eating lunch with another guy and now I'm feeling kind of left out
label: Entailment
explanation: If someone likes someone and they see that person eating lunch with another guy, the person who likes them might feel left out because they were not included in the lunch.

premise: His eyes were light, and his skin was so pale it looked blue.
hypothesis: His skin was pale and blue, and his eyes were like a glacier crevasse.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A crevasse is a deep crack in a glacier, so saying someone's eyes are like a crevasse would indicate that they are very deep and dark.

premise: I feel badly about wanting to have a child when we are not in a good place financially
hypothesis: I feel delighted about the decision of wanting to have a child might given how our situation is financially
label: Contradiction
explanation: Having a child is a huge responsibility and it should not be done if the parents are not in a stable financial situation because that could put the child in a difficult position.

premise: I'm afraid of what the future has in store with overpopulation and unemployment.
hypothesis: I am excited for the future because overpopulation and unemployment are slowly tearing our society apart
label: Contradiction
explanation: An overpopulation and unemployment rates can lead to a lot of problems in society and so someone being excited about it is not being rational.

premise: If too many people try to do something, it will make the final product better, he told her lightly as he held her gaze.
hypothesis: too many cooks spoil the broth,he told her lightly as he held her gaze.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The idiom means that if too many people are trying to do something, it will make the final product worse, but in this context it would make the final product better.

hypothesis: In the days long since  departed  ,
