explanation: Departed  means  gone  or  extinct .

premise: Tonight is about good time rock and roll, and we aren't enjoying ourselves at all.
hypothesis: Tonight is about good time rock and roll, and we go down a storm.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To go down a storm means to have great success, but in this sentence the good time rock and roll is not having any success at all.

premise: I found that the secretary from the insurance claims company is staying late to relax and take it easy with the janitor.
hypothesis: I found that the secretary from the insurance claims company is staying late to burn the midnight oil with the janitor.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To burn the midnight oil means to stay up late working on a project or task, but the sentence describes the secretary staying up late to relax.

premise: The images flashed in the brilliance that covered him warm
hypothesis: The images flashed in the brilliance that covered him like a plush blanket
label: Entailment
explanation: A plush blanket is a soft, comfortable blanket, so the images flashing in the brilliance would be comforting and warm.

premise: You disagree? Okay, tell me why!
hypothesis: You disagree? Okay, shoot!
label: Entailment
explanation: Here, shoot means asking the other person why they disagree.

premise: That made things a lot more difficult, but it didn't mean he was ready to admit defeat or failure.
hypothesis: That complicated matters greatly, but it didn't mean he was ready to throw in the towel.
label: Entailment
explanation: To throw in the towel means to give up, quit or abandon something, and in this context the person is not ready to do give up in the wake of complicated matters.

premise: The news was concealed.
hypothesis: The news leaked out despite his secrecy.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To leak out means to become known or exposed, while to conceal it mean the it was not disclosed.

premise: He's not muscular
hypothesis: He's got muscles like a jellyfish
label: Entailment
explanation: Jellyfish don't have any muscles, so this person must not be very muscular either.

premise: I found out my storage unit burned down and I had lost several irreplaceable items
hypothesis: What an absolute pleasure to find out my dependable storage unit burned down and I only lost several valuable items
label: Contradiction
explanation: A storage unit that catches fire is less likely to be dependable and to top it off catching fire would lead to the loss of all the items stored inside it which would be really unfortunate and not a pleasure at all.

premise: I asked my brother to bring me a gift from his trip and he didn't bring anything.
hypothesis: I was really looking forward to getting a gift from my brother, but it seems like he totally forgot about me
label: Entailment
explanation: It's often disappointing when somebody comes back from a trip and they forget to bring a gift for someone who had asked them to, especially if that person was looking forward to it.

premise: Yesterday I wasn't paying attention while driving and almost hit a person in a crosswalk.
hypothesis: Yesterday I was driving and not paying attention which is why I almost hit a pedestrian
label: Entailment
explanation: Its common knowledge that not paying attention while driving can be very dangerous and often results in accidents.

premise: I locked my joints stiffly
hypothesis: I locked my joints like a tin man
label: Entailment
explanation: A tin man is a figure that is stiff and unable to move its joints freely.

premise: I was discussing phone bills with my friend and he told me his parents pay for his bill.
hypothesis: I didn't feel jealous at all when my friend told me his parents actually pay for his phone bill
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would feel jealous when their friend tells them that their parents are paying for their phone bill because it implies that the person does not have to work for it and hence is privileged.

premise: My mom always told me to tackle each difficult situation with confidence, grace, and a 'no nonsense' attitude.
hypothesis: My mom always told me to tackle each difficult situation with confidence, grace, and a 'take no prisoners' attitude.
label: Entailment
explanation: To take no prisoners means to be utterly ruthless with the opposition and uncompromising or unyielding in the pursuit of one's agenda or goal, which is similar to being told to have no nonsense.

premise: I think it's your cheerful and optimistic disposition that's made me take a shine to you, I say as I reach out and catch the hooks and pass one over to constance.
hypothesis: I think it's your sunny nature that's made me take a shine to you, I say as I reach out and catch the hooks and pass one over to constance.
label: Entailment
explanation: To take a shine to someone is to have a fondness for them, and in this context the speaker is saying that it's because the person is sunny and cheerful that they have taken a shine to them.

premise: I lost a really important document at work and I'm afraid to tell my boss about it.
hypothesis: I misplaced an important document at work and I am excited to tell my boss about my incompetence because I know he will be so happy.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Losing an important document at work shows a lack of responsibility and carelessness and so reporting it to the boss will only lead to the person being scolded and not happy in any way.

premise: Although I'm on facebook and twitter if you want to have a serious discussion anytime hope you 'll get in touch soon!.
hypothesis: Although I'm on facebook and twitter if you want to shoot the breeze anytime hope you 'll get in touch soon!
label: Contradiction
explanation: To shoot the breeze means to chat aimlessly or casually, but this context is about having a serious discussion.

premise: I can't believe I didn't fit into my old wedding dress.
hypothesis: I was really pleased that I could not fit into my old wedding dress from when I got married 5 years ago
label: Contradiction
explanation: Wedding dresses are often very expensive and so not being able to fit into an old one means that the person has gained weight and is not happy about it.

premise: My family came all the way from Australia, and I don't really have time to show them around.
hypothesis: I feel thrilled that I don't have time to show my family around because they came all the way from Australia
label: Contradiction
explanation: Family members usually come to visit from far away places to spend time with their loved ones, but if someone is too busy to even show them around, it would not make the person whose family is visiting joyful thrilled but rather guilty.

premise: Bill tore apart every weak point in Rob's argument.
hypothesis: Bill attacked every weak point in Rob's argument.
label: Entailment
explanation: To tear something apart is to attack it or to find its flaws.

premise: If it was, would you accept? Absolutely not, rafferty.
hypothesis: If it was, would you accept? not on your life, rafferty.
label: Entailment
explanation: Not on your life is used to refuse very firmly to do something, which is what rafferty is doing in this context.

premise: The play is going to hurt few people.
hypothesis: The play is going to burn few people.
label: Entailment
explanation: Burn here means to cause emotional pain.

premise: My sister always borrows money and never pays it back on time.
hypothesis: My sister always borrows money and never pays it back which makes me so angry
label: Entailment
explanation: Oftentimes when people borrow money from others they have the intention of paying it back, but when they don't it can leave the person who lent them the money feeling angry and frustrated.

premise: The world was spinning round and round, and time stood still.
hypothesis: Time stood still, the world was like a bizarre carnival ride .
label: Entailment
explanation: A carnival ride is a dizzying, disorienting experience, which is what the world was like for the person in this sentence spinning round and round.

premise: Let's go back outside in the world, you and me to any place on earth.
hypothesis: Let's go back outside in the world, you and me under the sun.
label: Entailment
explanation: To be under the sun means to be anywhere on earth, so the entailment is saying that they will go to any place on earth.

premise: I felt like such a jerk when I forgot I had planned to pick up my brother from work the other day.
hypothesis: I felt really terrible when I realized I had forgotten to pick up my brother from work
label: Entailment
explanation: Its often seen as a responsibility to pick up family members from work and so forgetting to do so often results in feelings of guilt and shame.

premise: Your untheatrical behavior has reached its limit.
hypothesis: I have had enough of your melodrama.
label: Contradiction
explanation: One statement suggests that they've had enough of the person'  excessively emotional and dramatic behavior whereas the other statement suggests the person is untheatrical and low-key.

premise: The greedy businessman embezzled the company and Kited millions of dollars.
hypothesis: The businessman kited millions of dollars.
label: Entailment
explanation: Kiting is a fraudulent activity in which a person writes checks for more money than they have in their account, in order to temporarily inflate their balance and spend the extra money.

premise: At his touch he  was insensitive thus did not feel  any new courage.
hypothesis: At his touch he  felt  new courage.
label: Contradiction
explanation: another sentence says he did not experience his touch, thus, did not feel any new courage.

premise: When I gave sloane an opportunity and walked back to be with lucah, I felt as if I was being torn in half.
hypothesis: When I shut the door on sloane and walked back to be with lucah, I felt as if I was being torn in half.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To shut the door on someone or something means to eliminate an opportunity for them, but in this context the speaker gave Sloane an opportunity.

premise: The beast that wants to know causes scientists to carefully choose their battles and use their time and energy wisely while acting like sherlock holmes!.
hypothesis: The beast that wants to know causes scientists to tilt at windmills while acting like sherlock holmes!
label: Contradiction
explanation: To tilt at windmills means to fight battles with imaginary enemies, but in this context the scientists are carefully choosing their battles.

premise: This guy is about to succeed.
hypothesis: This guy is about to bite the dust.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To bite the dust means to fail, but in this sentence the guy is about to succeed.

premise: Emails, meetings, getting everyone accurately informed about.
hypothesis: Emails, meetings, getting everyone up to speed.
label: Entailment
explanation: To be up to speed means to be fully apprised about someone or something, and in this context emails and meetings are being used to keep everyone accurately informed.

premise: I had my friend over and my family made me feel very uncomfortable.
hypothesis: I had my friend over and my family made me feel really weird and out of place
label: Entailment
explanation: When someone has a friend over, their family should make them feel comfortable and at ease but if they instead make the person feel weird it would be expected for the person to feel out of place.

premise: Ok, in your next book instead of making the gamble you  make it so that Ray is portrayed in an even more negative light as a cross between Clauswitz and Gandhi.
hypothesis: Ok, in your next book the gamble you rather change your tune and ray is portrayed as a cross between clauswitz and gandhi.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To change one's tune typically means to change in a more positive or agreeable way, but in this sentence the change is more negative.

premise: My 15 year old stole a family members bank card number and overdrawn the account by $500.
hypothesis: Proud that my 15 year old decided to steal my family member's bank card number and go on a shopping spree for $500
label: Contradiction
explanation: Stealing a family member's bank card number and going on a shopping spree is definitely not something to be proud of because it is dishonest and unethical.

premise: The path extended all the way to the top of the hill.
hypothesis: The path climbed all the way to the top of the hill.
label: Entailment
explanation: Climbing means going up, and the path extended all the way to the top of the hill means that it went all the way up.

premise: The new paper boy flung the newspaper and broke my window today morning
hypothesis: The new paper boy threw the newspaper so softly it broke my window this morning
label: Contradiction
explanation: If the paper boy threw the newspaper softly then the window wont be affected but instead the paper boy threw the newspaper with too much force and it broke the window.

premise: He looks spiky
hypothesis: He looks like a sea urchin.
label: Entailment
explanation: A sea urchin is a small, spiky creature that lives in the sea, so he looks spiky.

premise: My neighbor's party is still going on and I need to wake up early tomorrow.
hypothesis: I am so thrilled that my neighbors' party is still going on and I need to wake up early tomorrow.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A party going on late into the night can be very disruptive and annoying for people who need to wake up early the next day and hence the person is not thrilled at all but actually irritated.

premise: I bite back, not enough to do damage but definitely enough to let him know that I am joking and not at all serious about what I am saying.
hypothesis: I bite back, not hard enough to do damage but definitely hard enough to let him know that I mean business.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To mean business is to be serious about what one is promising or proposing to do, but the speaker is indicating that they let people know that are joking by biting back.

premise: He pulls out a giant disc and holds it up shamefully.
hypothesis: He pulls a giant disc out and flashes it like a knockoff rolex .
label: Contradiction
explanation: A rolex watch is often very expensive and the owner usually bears pride to the fact and is not shameful at all.

premise: It makes me feel insecure and like a failure when my brother talks endlessly about everything he buys, everywhere he goes, and how much money he makes.
hypothesis: I love it when my brother brags about how much money he has and all the places he has gone, it makes me feel happy I am such a loser.
label: Contradiction
explanation: When someone brags about their wealth or achievements, it often makes others feel insecure and inferior instead of loving it because they cannot compare to that person.

premise: It's pretty scary that I keep hearing strange noises as I try to go to sleep
hypothesis: I feel very relaxed when I keep hearing weird noises as I try to sleep
label: Contradiction
explanation: Hearing weird noises around the house at night could invoke a potential danger such as a robbery or someone breaking in with malicious intent which makes someone scared and anxious rather than feeling relaxed.

premise: a very simple system with only a few different moving parts.
hypothesis: wheels within wheels.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To have wheels within wheels means to have a complex system, but this context describes a very simple system.

premise: She wore a bright yellow dress on that day.
hypothesis: She was dolled up yellow that day.
label: Entailment
explanation: Dolled up means to dress up in a fancy or colorful way.

premise: Either oppose me or agree with me, but don't stay indifferent and pretend to be something you're not.
hypothesis: Either condemn me or condone me, but don't sit on the fence and pretend to be something you're not.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To sit on the fence means to not take sides in a dispute, but this context is saying that you should take a side that contradicts how the speaker asks not to sit on the fence and be pretentious.

premise: She was draped in black.
hypothesis: She was draped like a winter queen .
label: Contradiction
explanation: A winter queen would be draped in white or some other light color to symbolize purity, not in black.

premise: I failed my final exam for math last semester.
hypothesis: I feel nasty that I bombed my math final exam and got a 0%
label: Entailment
explanation: A final exam is often worth a large percentage of someone's grade for a class and so failing it usually results in people feeling upset, disappointed, and embarrassed.

premise: Don't let it make you too arrogant.
hypothesis: Dont let it go to your heads.
label: Entailment
explanation: To go to your head means to become arrogant, and in this context they are telling not to become too arrogant.

premise: All was silent and white
hypothesis: All was like a winter morning after it had snowed all night.
label: Entailment
explanation: A winter morning is silent and white because of the snow.

premise: I saw a piece of dried poop from my dog in my closet that I had no clue about.
hypothesis: I found a piece of poop from my dog that I had no idea about and it wasn't disgusting at all
label: Contradiction
explanation: A piece of poop from a dog is often dirty and full of bacteria and so finding it unexpectedly can only lead to disgust.

premise: the play was boring
hypothesis: The play was as thrilling as watching paint dry
label: Entailment
explanation: Watching paint dry is an activity that requires no excitement or engagement, indicating that the play was similarly unengaging.

premise: The new paper boy flung the newspaper and broke my window today morning
hypothesis: The new paper boy threw the newspaper so hard it broke my window this morning
label: Entailment
explanation: The newspaper was delivered with such force that it broke the window.

premise: I'm so mad at people around my apartment just throwing their used cigarettes all over the sidewalk.
hypothesis: It's not only safe but also picturesque how the lovely people around my apartment building just toss their cigarettes on the ground
label: Contradiction
explanation: Cigarette butts are often not only unsightly but also a fire hazard and so people who litter by throwing cigarettes on the ground are not considerate or lovely.

premise: Our brief encounter had been dull and uneventful.
hypothesis: Our brief encounter had been like a land mine.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A land mine is an explosive device, so a brief encounter being like one would be exciting and eventful, not dull.

premise: We need to continuously keep on learning in our lifetime.
hypothesis: ’Life' wrote a friend of mine, 'is a public performance on the violin, in which you must learn the instrument as you go along.”
label: Entailment
explanation: This metaphor is saying that we need to learn something in life everyday, similar to keep on learning how to play Violin as you go through life.

premise: I was so mad when I came out of the salon with different hair color than I asked of
hypothesis: I jumped for joy when I left the hair salon and my new hair color was not what I asked for
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would not be happy when they leave a hair salon and their new hair color is not what they asked for because it means that they have to go back and get it fixed.

premise: The father shook him with his hand.
hypothesis: The father flicked him with his hand.
label: Contradiction
explanation: flick signifies a a light touch or movement, while shook connotes a more forceful movement.

premise: his eyes were wide and bright
hypothesis: His eyes were like a predator watching prey
label: Entailment
explanation: A predator's eyes would be wide and bright in order to better see its prey.

premise: He is in such a hurry that he runs extremely fast.
hypothesis: He is in such a hurry he does not run  he flies.
label: Entailment
explanation: To fly means to move very quickly through the air, similar to the person who runs very fast.

premise: Small talk just annoys me.
hypothesis: I just love the sound of people's voices when they try to make small talk.
label: Contradiction
explanation: People's voices often sound annoying when they try to make small talk because it is usually just a way to fill awkward silence and not genuine conversation.

premise: I'm a few dollars short for an important bill I have due.
hypothesis: I am annoyed because I don't have enough money to pay my important bill
label: Entailment
explanation: Being short a few dollars for an important bill often leads to people being annoyed because it is a hindrance to taking care of the bill and can cause late fees or other penalties.

premise: Get ready to encounter someone who is equal to or better than you in ability or skill.
hypothesis: Get ready to meet your match.
label: Entailment
explanation: To meet your match means to encounter someone who is equal to or better than you, as described in the context.

premise: The love of my life left me for a better man.
hypothesis: Thrilled that the love of my life left me for someone richer, better looking, and more successful than me
label: Contradiction
explanation: The love of your life leaving you is not a good thing and the three other reasons given make it even worse because it implies that the person was never really in love with you to begin with.

premise: I'm hairy
hypothesis: I'm as hairy as a naked mole rat
label: Contradiction
explanation: A naked mole rat is a hairless animal, so saying someone is as hairy as a naked mole rat would imply that they are not hairy at all.

premise: When I got falsely accused of eating my roommate's ice cream last night, I was completely outraged.
hypothesis: I felt very appreciated when I got falsely accused of eating my roommate's ice cream last night.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Being falsely accused of something can lead to someone feeling very wronged and not appreciated at all.

premise: His playing disbanded him as a Romantic.
hypothesis: His playing ensconced him as a Romantic.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To ensconce someone means to establish them securely or comfortably, while to disband someone means to dismiss them from a group or organization.

premise: The way they shade and sarcasm each other is hilarious.
hypothesis: The shade and sarcasm they throw at each other is too damn much like watching monkey's foodfight with bananas.
label: Entailment
explanation: Monkeys foodfighting with bananas is hilarious and uncoordinated, which is similar to the way the two people are fighting with each other.

premise: I had to get it off my chest that I have been cheating on my wife.
hypothesis: I felt terrible and needed to get it off my chest that I have been cheating on my wife.
label: Entailment
explanation: Cheating is morally wrong and often results in people feeling guilty and needing to confess what they have done in order to ease their conscience.

premise: He smiles all the time.
hypothesis: He always flashes a smile.
label: Entailment
explanation: To flash a smile means to show teeth in a quick, often happy way.

premise: I was driving the other day on a lane highway and a truck was tailgating me, flashing lights, and honking.
hypothesis: I was driving the other day on a lane highway and was really annoyed by a truck that was tailgating me, flashing lights, and honking
label: Entailment
explanation: When someone is tailgating you on the highway it is usually a very aggressive and annoying act that can often make people angry.

premise: It is right to lie to children.
hypothesis: Telling lies to the young is like clippin the wings of a butterfly.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Clipping the wings of a butterfly prevents it from being able to fly, in the same way that lying to children prevents them from being able to develop and grow in an uninhibited way.

premise: My car died while driving and I sat in a car with no lights for hours.
hypothesis: The moment my car died while driving and I was left stranded on the side of the road made me feel joyful
label: Contradiction
explanation: Cars breaking down while driving is a very dangerous and scary situation and so feeling joyful about it is completely irrational.

premise: His body was repaired and smoothen by leprosy.
hypothesis: His body was weathered by leprosy.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To be weathered by something means to be affected or changed by it over time, here, by the disease leprosy, while the contradictory statement is saying the body was smoothen by repairing from leprosy.

premise: My coworker was able to find a new job within like a week, meanwhile I am at the same horrible company.
hypothesis: It's really encouraging how my coworker was able to find a new job within a week while I am still stuck at this horrible company.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The fact that someone was able to find a new job in a week while the speaker is still stuck at their current job at a horrible company is discouraging and can lead to frustration because they would want to quit the company as well.

premise: A new moon rising between the trees.
hypothesis: The new moon swims up through the tree tops.
label: Entailment
explanation: The new moon  rises up through the tree tops.

premise: He spent three years seconded to an industry that was thriving and didn't need any help.
hypothesis: He spent three years seconded to a lame duck industry.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A lame duck is someone or something that needs help, but this context describes an industry that is thriving and doesn't need any help.

premise: She would sing to him loudly when they were young, while she was alone on horseback by the creek.
hypothesis: By the creek, alone on horseback, when they were young, she would sing him like a lullaby-soothed baby .
label: Contradiction
explanation: A lullaby is sung softly to soothe a baby, whereas if someone is singing loudly, it would not have the same effect.

premise: I just caught a guy picking up used chewing gum and he put it in his mouth.
hypothesis: It was disgusting to see a guy picking up used chewing gum and he put it in his mouth
label: Entailment
explanation: Chewing gum is generally considered to be a disgusting habit and picking up used chewing gum is even worse.

premise: It's as if the sun disappeared, leaving the streets bustling and loud.
hypothesis: The sun is nowhere to be found, and the streets are like a ghost town.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A ghost town is a town that is abandoned, so it would be empty and not bustling and loud.

premise: Mike nods and trots over c  because it's happening now and there's no need for it to have happened earlier.
hypothesis: Mike nods and trots over c better late than never.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The idiom better late than never means that the delayed occurrence or achievement of something is better than it not happening at all, but this sentence describes a situation where there is no need for it to have happened earlier.

premise: It's so gross that my downstairs neighbors always lets their dog poop in the middle of the street.
hypothesis: It's truly vile how my downstairs neighbors always let their dog poop in the middle of the street
label: Entailment
explanation: It is considered very inconsiderate and rude to let your dog poop in the middle of the street because it is a public space and people have to walk there.

premise: Rory looked at her as if she were sane.
hypothesis: Rory looked at her as if she were like a makeup artist putting lipstick on a pig.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A makeup artist putting lipstick on a pig would be seen as someone abnormal and crazy.

premise: I found a long grey hair in my sandwitch this afternoon when I went out to lunch.
hypothesis: I felt like a child of Christmas when I found a long grey hair in my sandwich this afternoon
label: Contradiction
explanation: Finding a long grey hair in one's food is not a good thing and hence it is not plausible to feel like a child of Christmas upon discovering it.

premise: My mom can be a little too persistent about things she doesn't know much about.
hypothesis: I doesn't irritate me at all how my mom is too curious for her own good when it comes to things she doesn't know about
label: Contradiction
explanation: People usually find it annoying and irritating when their mothers act this way because they can be overbearing and not give them the privacy they need.

premise: Burglary, nothing important or significant.
hypothesis: Burglary, really small potatoes.
label: Entailment
explanation: Small potatoes means a tiny and/or inconsequential person, thing or amount, and in this context burglary is seen as tiny and inconsequential.

premise: My daughter's boyfriend got drunk and attacked my husband.
hypothesis: My daughter's boyfriend was extremely drunk and physically assaulted my husband
label: Entailment
explanation: When someone is drunk they often act out in ways that they would not normally and this can sometimes lead to violence.

premise: It irritates me when my roommate doesn't clean up the room
hypothesis: I can't stand it when my roommate doesn't clean up the room and it becomes a total mess
label: Entailment
explanation: It is very annoying when someone doesn't clean up a shared space and it causes the area to become dirty and cluttered.

premise: Consumed by the thoughts that weren't in the head.
hypothesis: Consumed by the thoughts that grew in the head.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To be consumed by something means to be engrossed or obsessed by it, while to not be in the head would suggest that the thoughts are not real or are not worth thinking about.

premise: Traffic was unusually bad on the way to work this morning.
hypothesis: I was running late for work because of the traffic and it made me euphoric.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The traffic jam can be very frustrating and make someone late for work, which is definitely not a good thing.

premise: Your guardian angel is a little too apathetic.
hypothesis: Your guardian angel is just a little too much like a nerd at a comic convention.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A nerd is someone who is very passionate and enthusiastic about something, usually an interest in science or technology, so saying someone is too much like a nerd would imply that they are too passionate, not too apathetic.

premise: Pain is silent
hypothesis: Pain shoots out like a spiraling firecracker.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Firecrackers are very loud, so saying that pain is like a firecracker means it is also very loud.

premise: My board meeting which I had prepared for was cancelled at the last minute
hypothesis: I was so ready for my board meeting and then it got cancelled last minute which made me really frustrated
label: Entailment
explanation: Board meetings often take a lot of time and effort to prepare for so when they are cancelled last minute it can be very frustrating because all that work went to waste.

premise: I feel completely different way.
hypothesis: that makes two of us.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The idiom "that makes two of us" means "the same is true for me" and in this context, the speaker is saying that they feel the differen way, but the contradiction would be if they said they felt a completely different way.

premise: An older man, extremely skinny or slender, with curls for hair and a face as lined as rotten fruit.
hypothesis: An older man, thin as a rake, with curls for hair and a face as lined as rotten fruit.
label: Entailment
explanation: The idiom thin as a rake means extremely skinny or slender, which is how the man is described in the context.

premise: I'm confident he's caught off guard, but he doesn't have any right to stay silent.
hypothesis: I'm sure he's surprised, but he has no right to cry foul.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To cry foul is to protest against something, but in this sentence the person is not protesting anything.

premise: The other night when I was walking someone was following me.
hypothesis: I was cool as a cucumber when I was walking the other night and someone was following me.
label: Contradiction
explanation: It is very natural for a person to feel scared or uneasy when someone is following them, so someone who claims to have been calmer than ever in that situation is not being truthful.

premise: Colby, figure out and have a clear understanding of your emotions.
hypothesis: Colby, get a handle on your emotions.
label: Entailment
explanation: To get a handle on something means to have a firm understanding of it, so in this sentence Colby is being told to figure out and understand his emotions.

premise: Your head will become fuzzy after 10 minutes.
hypothesis: After 10 minutes your head becomes like spinning cotton candy.
label: Entailment
explanation: After 10 minutes of swimming in the pool, your head will become like spinning cotton candy, meaning it will become fuzzy.

premise: I do not value or appreciate the fact that a handful of people got a little something extra because of us that day.
hypothesis: I take pride in the fact that a handful of people got a little something extra because of us that day.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To take pride means to value and appreciate something, but the speaker does not value or appreciate it in this context.

premise: I needed him to be careful and cautious of sky.
hypothesis: I needed him to watch out for sky.
label: Entailment
explanation: To watch out means to pay attention, which is what she needed him to do in order to be careful and cautious.

premise: I was pretty shaken up when my son didn't get home on time and I couldn't reach him
hypothesis: I was so pleased when my son didn't come home on time and I couldn't reach him on his phone
label: Contradiction

premise: Always glad to listen.

premise: I missed a chance to get a new job the other week and I really wish I had put my resume in sooner.

premise: Sure ,he snorted just to make me feel even better about the already great situation
hypothesis: Sure, he snorted, just rub it in.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To rub it in means to make someone feel worse about an already bad situation, but in this context the speaker is saying he snoted just to make him feel better.

premise: Well, that makes her good people through established facts.
hypothesis: Well, that makes her good people in my book.
label: Contradiction
explanation: in this context, in my book is used to mean according to one's opinion, but the context states that she is good people through established facts which is different from opinions.

premise: He stepped lightly, his stride sure and unhurried
hypothesis: He stepped lightly, his stride like a huge jungle cat , an apex predator out for a prowl in his domain.
label: Entailment
explanation: A jungle cat is a stealthy, dangerous predator, so the person's stride being like a jungle cat means that it is sure and unhurried, as opposed to clumsy or hurried.

premise: I'll testify how you've been going mad for weeks, muttering in a very quiet voice and all that.
hypothesis: I 'll testify how you've been going mad for weeks, muttering under your breath and all that.
label: Entailment
explanation: To mutter under your breath means to mutter in a very quiet voice, which is what the person has been doing for weeks.

premise: I got home today and my cat pooped on the bed.
hypothesis: When I got home today, I found my cat had pooped on the bed and it made me feel like the best pet-owner ever
label: Contradiction

premise: He said he was aware of the sensitivity of this assignment, but she would be lazy and super reluctant to remind him.

label: Contradiction

premise: I am concerned about the financial situation of my employer.

premise: The undecisive moment had come sooner than we could have realized.
hypothesis: The moment of truth had come sooner than we could have realized.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The moment of truth is the moment at which some decisive event will occur, but in this context the moment was undecisive.

premise: I am just finishing my college degree, anb all of my friends have moved away.
hypothesis: My social life is at it's peak now that all my friends have moved away after I finish my college degree.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Losing friends after finishing college is a natural occurrence, so someone who claims that their social life is at it's peak at this point is not being truthful.

premise: My friends were looking towards spending time together this weekend but I have to work.
hypothesis: I'm ecstatic that I have to work this weekend and can't spend time with my friends.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would not be happy about having to work on a weekend instead of spending time with their friends and so the person is not really ecstatic but being sarcastic.

premise: I am sorry, have I never said anything that made you feel emotional?
hypothesis: Oh I'm sorry, did I touch a nerve?”
label: Contradiction

premise: John excelled among his class mates.
hypothesis: John fell behind his class mates.

premise: My brother just bought my all time favorite car.

premise: I feel discontent
hypothesis: I feel like a fat cat.

premise: He felt a sudden intense pain through his leg.
hypothesis: He felt a sudden red pain through his leg.
label: Entailment

premise: The predators never expected their enemies to be this indestructible.
hypothesis: The predators never anticipated their enemies would be this much like titanium.

premise: This extremely expensive bordeaux wine should be allowed to oxidize and open up for 2 hours at least.
hypothesis: This rare bordeaux must be allowed to breathe for at least 2 hours.
label: Entailment
explanation: Breathing allows wine to aerate and open up, releasing its full flavor potential especially for extremley expensive wine.

premise: I felt very lonely when my partner decided to leave me for someone else.
hypothesis: The feeling of being so alone when my partner decided to leave me was really hard

explanation: When a partner leaves it is often sudden and unexpected which can lead to the person who was left feeling shocked and alone.

premise: He had gotten close enough to her to trap her in a corner of her gallery, and he caught a whiff of her disgustingly foul fragnance.
hypothesis: He'd gotten near enough to her once, trapping her in a corner of her gallery, to catch a fragrance that smelled like an exotic tropical flower .
label: Contradiction
explanation: An exotic tropical flower would have a pleasant smell, whereas a foul smell would not be pleasant.

premise: I just went for a shopping spree and bought a 2000 dollar bag

label: Contradiction

hypothesis: I know its not really an excuse, but that was not really what I have been lead to believe.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To lead to believe means to cause one to believe something, but in this context the person was advised to do the opposite.

premise: I had my hopes up to win a sweet contract I bid on but they chose someone else for the project.
hypothesis: I was really looking forward to winning the sweet contract I bid on, but they chose someone else
label: Entailment
explanation: Bidding on a contract and not winning it often leads to feelings of disappointment and discouragement.

premise: I was really jealous of my best friend, who is a surgeon, and makes six figures a year, while I am at half that.

premise: But this other world doesn't want to be known, it wants to remain hidden

label: Contradiction

premise: I woke up to find my wallet missing.

label: Contradiction
explanation: No one would want to wake up to find their wallet stolen and all their money missing because it is a very unpleasant and scary experience.

premise: I feel so bad when I think back to times that I yelled at my kids for no real good reason.
hypothesis: I love reminiscing the great memories when I remember the times that I yelled at my kids for no real good reason.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would not consider yelling at their kids for no good reason as a good memory and hence the speaker is not happy about remembering those times.

premise: My friend stole 50 dollars from me.
hypothesis: Happy to find out my so-called friend who I thought was trustworthy ended up stealing 50 dollars from me
label: Contradiction
explanation: A friend is someone is supposed to be trustworthy and so finding out that they stole money from you would not make you happy at all.

premise: I missed my flight that I paid heavily for, I was so annoyed

explanation: It is never fun to miss a flight, especially when one has paid a lot of money for it, and so someone being delighted about it would be absurd.

hypothesis: I was totally overjoyed that my mom gave my sister her favorite necklace and not me

explanation: It is natural for siblings to feel upset when one gets a gift and the other does not, so expecting someone to be overjoyed when they are not favored is unreasonable.

premise: I liked my brother's girlfriend for a nanosecond, but then I remembered how she controls his life, and that feeling lingered.
hypothesis: For a nanosecond I like my brother's girlfriend, but then I remember how she controls his life, and that warm and fuzzy feeling disappears like a streak of lightning.
label: Contradiction
explanation: If the feeling disappears like a streak of lightning, that means it disappears very quickly, since the speed of light is the quickest speed.

premise: I am angry that my brother ruined a movie ending for me.
hypothesis: I'm so happy that my brother spoiled the movie ending for me
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would be angry or upset if someone spoiled the ending of a movie for them, so to be happy about it isn't rational.

premise: My roommates took my food I had labeled with my name in the fridge today.
hypothesis: My roommates are so polite that they ate my food without even asking me
label: Contradiction

premise: The creature in the middle of the sea was huge.
hypothesis: The animal in the middle of the sea was a mountain.
label: Entailment
explanation: Here, the animal is a huge one and compared agains mountains because  they are so large.

premise: Someone stole my laptop from my car.
hypothesis: I am absolutely pleased that someone stole my laptop from my car

premise: When you are as ugly as him and romance strikes, the last thing you need is to open your mouth and make it better by saying something intelligent.

label: Entailment
explanation: To tie the knot means to get married, so the entailment is that he got married.

premise: Our love will remain strong and unchanging.
hypothesis: Our love will stand the test of time.

premise: I ate dinner by myself again.

premise: I hope that, as neighbours, we may live long in peace and amity, and in the frequent exchange of kindly assistance which should subsist between us.
hypothesis: I hope that, as neighbours, we may live long in peace and amity, and in the interchange of those good offices which should subsist between us.

explanation: To exchange good offices is to exchange aid or support, which is what this context is describing.

premise: I didnt shower for a few days and had an important meeting and I became a tomato as they could smell me.

label: Contradiction
explanation: People avoid others who smell bad because they do not want to be near them and hence the person would not feel satisfied but embarassed when they realized the true reason behind people's actions.

explanation: If someone is in a room with a lot of people but feels like no one is paying attention to them they are likely to feel alone.

premise: I had put in 8 hours of work into my art project and then my mom ripped it.

premise: End of semester one of my roommates left without cleaning out his share of the dorm room and housing department fined me.

premise: Min was glad that she had not let her inflexible will succeed or be victorious.
hypothesis: Min was glad that she had not let her inflexible will win the day.
label: Entailment
explanation: To win the day means to be successful, so in this context Min is glad that her inflexible will did not succeed.

premise: My dad's wife asked me to give her back the glassware she gave us at our wedding.

premise: I was at the store the other day and I bumped in to a wine rack and knocked over a bunch of bottles and people were staring at me
hypothesis: I was the perfect customer at the store the other day when I bumped into a wine rack and knocked over a bunch of bottles and people were staring at me like I was an idiot.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Accidentally knocking over wine bottles in a store and having people stare at you is not a good experience and hence being the perfect customer is an impossibility.

premise: These contractors are fixing the roof and they are so messy
hypothesis: It makes me so happy how these considerate contractors are making a mess and not cleaning up after themselves
label: Contradiction
explanation: Contractors who do not clean up after themselves are being inconsiderate and so someone being happy about it is not justified.

premise: I wish I was taller.
hypothesis: I feel so ecstatic that other people are taller than me and can reach things on high shelves
label: Contradiction
explanation: Being shorter than others often has disadvantages such as not being able to reach things on high shelves, so someone who is ecstatic about it is not being realistic.

premise: I felt very lonely when my partner decided to leave me for someone else.
hypothesis: The feeling of being so alone when my partner decided to leave me was really a heavenly experience.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The feeling of being alone is often not a good one and very difficult and so someone describing it as being heavenly experience is not accurate.

premise: Ugh so a few weeks ago my 3 year old broke my favorite eyeshadows.
hypothesis: So my 3 year old is an absolute angel for breaking my favorite eyeshadows
label: Contradiction
explanation: A 3 year old breaking someone's favorite eyeshadows is not a good thing and would make anyone upset, not an angel.

label: Contradiction
explanation: The phrase let alone is used to emphasize that if other more significant or pressing things are not possible, a lesser thing certainly is not or cannot either which is contradicted in this context where Shaun and Mike won't even look at the each other but were speaking to each other during dinner.

premise: It's sucks when you have to take care of yourself when you don't feel well.
hypothesis: It's not at all difficult when you're feeling terrible and on top of it you have to take care of yourself

premise: I hate then when you wake up and remember a lot of bad things that happened over the past few years
hypothesis: When I wake up, I feel terrible about all the unhappy memories that occurred in the past few years
label: Entailment
explanation: Waking up and remembering all of the bad things that have happened in the past can be very upsetting and make someone feel terrible.

premise: Earthquake hath continued deeply its tale on them.
hypothesis: Earthquake hath pressed deeply its tale on them.
label: Entailment
explanation: Pressed deeply means that the earthquake has affected them deeply.

premise: I forgot about wife's birthday.
hypothesis: Wife's birthday slipped my mind and I feel proud about it

premise: Now and again, as other people walked by, she passed through them as if she were substantial.
hypothesis: Now and again, as other people walked by, she passed through them as if she were like a mirage.
label: Contradiction

explanation: A sapling bending in a hurricane is being blown around violently and is in danger of being broken, which is analogous to the increasing distress of the user.

hypothesis: I was very excited when the police officers stopped me the other night while I was just out for a casual walk.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Getting stopped by the police officers can be a really traumatic experience for some people and so someone being excited about it is just unreal.

premise: Playing the same sort of game with lee porter as the outcome was a far more dangerous prospect, and one she would absolutely try to change or get involved without caring if it causes problems.
hypothesis: Playing the same sort of game with lee porter as the outcome was a far more dangerous prospect, and one she would leave well alone.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To leave well alone means to refrain from changing or becoming involved in something so as to avoid unintentionally causing problems, but the context describes trying to change or get involved without caring if it causes problems.

premise: A pit bull was chasing me as I was walking home.

label: Entailment
explanation: Pit bulls have a reputation for being aggressive and dangerous dogs so it is natural to feel scared when one is running towards you.

premise: I failed my final exam and now I'll lose my scholarship.
hypothesis: So pleased that I didn't do well on my final and now I might lose my scholarship, isn't life wonderful!
label: Contradiction
explanation: A scholarship is a financial aid that students receive to help pay for their education and so not doing well on a final and potentially losing the scholarship would be a terrible thing.

premise: I didn't bother suggesting that we allow laoghaire to put in for a gaberlunzie badge and not be available for one to take or claim through the parish.
hypothesis: I didn't bother suggesting that we allow laoghaire to put in for a gaberlunzie badge and go begging through the parish.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To go begging means to be available for one to take or claim, but in this sentence it is suggesting that laoghaire not be available to take or claim a gaberlunzie badge.

premise: There is no longer any contact with the surface, and the radiation is safe.
hypothesis: All contact with the surface has been lost, and the radiation topside is like skin-permeating poison.
label: Contradiction
explanation: If the poison is like skin-permeating, then it is not safe as it can infect a person.

premise: When she turned the knob, her hand flaked off at the elbow, brittly
hypothesis: When she turned the knob, her hand flaked off at the elbow, like a dried flower.
label: Entailment
explanation: A dried flower is very fragile and will break easily if touched, similarly, her hand flaked off because it was very brittle.

premise: I saw people eating live worms.
hypothesis: It was disgusting to see people swallowing live worms

explanation: Swallowing live worms is generally considered to be disgusting because it is an unnatural and unappetizing thing to do.

premise: It's really horrible when a friend backs out at the last second.

explanation: When a friend cancels on someone last minute, it is often disappointing and inconvenient and hence cannot be classified as an ecstatic feeling.

premise: I saw a grown woman pick her nose and eat it earlier.
hypothesis: What a beautiful sight is it to see a grown gross woman dig in her nose for a booger and then eat it
label: Contradiction
explanation: To most people, the sight of someone digging in their nose for a booger and then eating it is really disgusting and not beautiful at all.

premise: The defense will have the opportunity to support the witnesses.
hypothesis: The defense will have the opportunity to cross examine the witnesses.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To cross examine means to question someone aggressively or in great detail, but in this sentence the defense is supporting the witnesses.

premise: Mrs. Hastings kept talking about how pretty the restaurant was, but Spencer thought it was too bright.
hypothesis: Mrs. hastings kept clucking about how nice the surroundings were, but spencer thought the restaurant was like a funeral home.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A funeral home is a place for mourning, and is typically decorated in somber colors and would not be thought of as bright.

premise: I found a text message on my wife phone that proves she is cheating on me.
hypothesis: The discovery of the text message on my wife's phone that proves she is cheating on me has left me in complete devastation

premise: She looked proud as she said no.

label: Entailment
explanation: A peacock is a proud bird, and so the simile is used to convey that the woman looks proud.

premise: I found out my daughter doesn't even attend her college classes anymore.

label: Contradiction
