hypothesis: Sales were climbing after prices were lowered.
label: Entailment
explanation: This is a metaphor meaning that when the prices went down, more people wanted to buy the product and the sales increased.

premise: He realized he wouldn't be able to start before the deadline.
hypothesis: He realized he wouldn't be able to beat the clock.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To beat the clock means to finish before the time is up, but in this sentence he won't be able to start before the deadline.

premise: He didn't put up a fight at all
hypothesis: He fought as hard as an opossum
label: Entailment
explanation: Opossums are known for "playing dead" when confronted with a predator, so this simile is implying that the person didn't fight at all.

premise: The steering of my new car is sensitive to the slightest touch.
hypothesis: The steering of my new car answers to the slightest touch.
label: Entailment
explanation: Answers to the slightest touch means that the steering is very sensitive and responds quickly to even the lightest touch.

premise: We just were unable to reach a consensus on the terms of the settlement.
hypothesis: We made a truce on the terms of the settlement.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A truce is an agreement or a peace settlement between two warring parties, while being unable to reach a consensus means that there was no agreement or resolution.

premise: Which horse are you betting against?
hypothesis: Which horse are you backing?
label: Contradiction
explanation: Backing a horse means to support or endorse it while betting against a horse means to think it will lose.

premise: Fear illuminated her mind.
hypothesis: Fear choked her mind.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Here, the word choked is used to signify something that is blocked or impeded, while illuminated typically connotes something that is bright or full of light.

premise: I'll get you the goya for a very expensive price.
hypothesis: I 'll get you the goya for a song. '
label: Contradiction
explanation: To get something for a song means to get it for a very low price, but in this sentence it would be for a very high price.

premise: Even though he wasn't tall, his body looked strong and lean.
hypothesis: He wasn't tall but he looked like a mountain biker or rock climber
label: Entailment
explanation: A mountain biker or rock climber needs to have a strong and lean body, even if they aren't tall, in order to be successful at those sports.

premise: MY daughter forgot to turn the oven off earlier and it could have been a disaster
hypothesis: So proud of my daughter who nearly burnt the house down by forgetting to turn the oven off and made me happy.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Someone who nearly burnt down their house by forgetting to turn off the oven is not someone to be proud of because they endangered the lives of everyone in the house and themselves.

premise: I am not experienced to comment, but, he would have used your professional services more than once if he hadn't been impressed.
hypothesis: But take it from me, he wouldn't have used your professional services more than once if he hadn't been impressed.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To take it from someone means to believe them because they have experience with what they are talking about, but this context suggests that the speaker is not experienced and therefore cannot comment.

premise: I came home from vacation and found some stuff was stolen
hypothesis: I was really looking forward to coming home from vacation and relax, but instead I find that my stuff got stolen
label: Entailment
explanation: Having stuff stolen is really frustrating because it means that someone has invaded your personal space and taken something that belongs to you without your permission.

premise: My a/c went out and the repairman was not able to fix the problem.
hypothesis: I was looking forward to feeling refreshed from the a/c, but now feeling really happy and satisfied because repairman says it needs a whole new part that he can't find
label: Contradiction
explanation: Expecting to feel refreshed from the a/c and then feeling happy because the repairman says it needs a whole new part that he can't find is not what somebody would generally expect and hence this situation cannot be considered satisfying.

premise: The crowd was loud
hypothesis: The crowd was as loud as a library
label: Contradiction
explanation: A library is a very quiet place, and so saying the crowd was as loud as a library would mean that the crowd was actually very quiet.

premise: Come on, you lazy bones, stay in bed!.
hypothesis: Come on, you lazy bones, show a leg !
label: Contradiction
explanation: To show a leg means to get out of bed, but in this context the speaker wants the lazy bones to stay in bed.

premise: Your brother is mature and behaves in an adult manner.
hypothesis: Your brother is a big baby.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To be a big baby means to be immature and prone to childish behavior, but in this sentence the brother is mature and behaves in an adult manner.

premise: I heard someone bumping around the downstairs of my house last night after I had gone to bed and it scared me half to death.
hypothesis: I was so scared when I heard someone bumping around the downstairs of my house last night after I had gone to bed
label: Entailment
explanation: Its dark and quiet at night so any strange noises are amplified and often scare people half to death because its hard to know what the source of the noise is.

premise: I have never liked thunderstorms and I thought my windows would break.
hypothesis: I was scared out of my mind that the thunderstorm would shatter my windows
label: Entailment
explanation: Thunderstorms are often very loud and the sound of the thunder can be extremely scary, especially if someone does not like them.

premise: I was scared when I was on a vacation to Mexico after hearing about the crime there.
hypothesis: I felt really safe when I was on a vacation to Mexico after hearing about all the crime there
label: Contradiction
explanation: A vacation is supposed to be a time when someone gets to relax and forget about the troubles of their daily life, so hearing about crime would make them feel unsafe and just ruin the experience.

premise: But then, she shouldn't delay in getting to the point, either.
hypothesis: But then, she shouldn't beat about the bush, either.
label: Entailment
explanation: To beat about the bush means to avoid talking directly about an unpleasant topic, so in this sentence she should get to the point instead of delaying.

premise: I saw my friend projectile vomit on the rollercoaster.
hypothesis: It was visually a pain seeing my friend projectile vomit on the amusement park ride
label: Entailment
explanation: Vomit is an unpleasant sight for most people and usually results in people feeling disgusted.

premise: Yet as the days would pass, the user would become increasingly content.
hypothesis: Yet as the days would pass the user would become more like a lost student.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A lost student is someone who is struggling and not content, whereas if the days are passing and the user is becoming increasingly content, they are not becoming more like a lost student.

premise: His laughter is contagious for everyone who is in the same room.
hypothesis: His laughter infects everyone who is in the same room.
label: Entailment
explanation: Infects means that it spreads to others, here his laughter.

premise: I was so pissed off when I found out that my girlfriend kissed my best friend
hypothesis: I was so pleased when I found out that my girlfriend kissed my best friend
label: Contradiction
explanation: The fact that someone's girlfriend kissed their best friend is not something to be pleased about because it implies that the relationship is in trouble and may be headed for a breakup.

premise: I was by myself at a party because I didn't really fit it with anybody there.
hypothesis: I felt really out of place and alone at the party because I didn't know anybody there
label: Entailment
explanation: Being by oneself in a group setting can often feel very awkward and lonely, especially if everybody else there knows each other and somebody is feeling like an outsider.

premise: Even though he was thin, he looked attractive.
hypothesis: Having a thin figure, he looked like a dry, overgrown blade of grass.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A dry, overgrown blade of grass is not attractive, it is scraggly and brown.

premise: I was so pissed off when I found out that my girlfriend kissed my best friend
hypothesis: I was so mad when I found out that my girlfriend kissed my best friend
label: Entailment
explanation: Being mad and being pissed off are both negative emotions that are caused by finding out that your girlfriend kissed your best friend.

premise: I rented out my bedroom to Airbnb customers and when I returned it was left smelly and diapers every where.
hypothesis: I came back to my room after renting it out to some Airbnb customers and was totally disgusted by the smell and finding diapers everywhere
label: Entailment
explanation: Finding a room in an unclean state with diapers strewn about is pretty disgusting and would often result in the owner of the room feeling upset.

premise: Sucks to be a person who's on time dealing with people who don't care about being on time themselves.
hypothesis: It's really irritating when people who are always on time are constantly waiting for the others who don't care about punctuality
label: Entailment
explanation: It is common courtesy to be on time for appointments and events but some people do not care about being punctual which often leaves the people who are always on time waiting around and feeling irritated.

premise: Meanwhile, the j'd warrior was a difficult target as malaki braced him against the turnbuckle.
hypothesis: Meanwhile, the j'd warrior was a sitting duck as malaki braced him against the turnbuckle.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A sitting duck is an easy target that is unprotected and vulnerable to attack, but in this context the j'd warrior was a difficult target.

premise: I've been single for years now.
hypothesis: I feel really terrible that I have not been able to find anyone to be in a relationship with me for years now
label: Entailment
explanation: Being in a relationship is often seen as a very important part of life and so not being able to find someone to be in a relationship with for years can make someone feel terrible about themselves.

premise: Are you asking to be punished or harmed?
hypothesis: Are you cruising for a bruising?
label: Entailment
explanation: To be cruising for a bruising is to be asking for trouble, so the entailment is asking if they are asking to be punished.

premise: I saw my friend projectile vomit on the rollercoaster.
hypothesis: It was visually a joy seeing my friend projectile vomit on the amusement park ride
label: Contradiction
explanation: Projectile vomiting is often a disgusting act and it would be rare to find someone who found it visually appealing.

premise: Even the cleaning she had done wasn't satisfactory or adequate according to the boys who worked alongside her.
hypothesis: Even the cleaning she had done wasn't up to scratch according to the boys who worked alongside her.
label: Entailment
explanation: To be up to scratch means to be as good as what was expected, and in this context the cleaning wasn't good enough according to the boys.

premise: My friend had white carpet and I spilled red wine all over it.
hypothesis: I am extremely neat and cautious for spilling red wine on my friend's white carpet
label: Contradiction
explanation: Spilling red wine on a white carpet is very careless and messy and hence the person cannot be neat or cautious.

premise: Becky got new shoes and they were the ones I wanted.
hypothesis: I am so happy that Becky has the same shoes that I wanted and I don't feel jealous at all.
label: Contradiction
explanation: It is normal to feel jealous when someone gets something that we want, so someone pretending to be happy for the other person and not feeling any jealousy is not believable.

premise: He felt an obscure and disquieting sexual desire.
hypothesis: He felt a dark sexual desire.
label: Entailment
explanation: Disquieting means causing a feeling of unease or anxiety, and obscure means difficult to understand or interpret,  so the paraphrase is saying that he felt a sexual desire that was dark and hard to understand.

premise: Trying to get rid of house gnats is a pain.
hypothesis: It's really irritating trying to get rid of the house gnats
label: Entailment
explanation: House gnats are often difficult to get rid of and their presence can be very irritating to people.

premise: Once I went into a store only to realize that I had on two different shoes.
hypothesis: Really proud of myself for the time I went into a store wearing two different shoes and realized it halfway through.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Realizing that you are wearing two different shoes in a public place can be pretty embarrassing and nothing to be proud of.

premise: Their first reaction was to flee and abandon, just as their comrades were in the process of doing down on kly.
hypothesis: Their first impulse was to cut and run, just as their comrades were in the process of doing down on kly.
label: Entailment
explanation: To cut and run means to leave a situation very quickly, and in this sentence they are considering fleeing and abandoning just as their comrades are doing.

premise: It makes me so bitter seeing happy couples everywhere.
hypothesis: It makes me so desired and appreciative of my singlehood when I see all these happy couples out and about
label: Contradiction
explanation: Seeing happy couples out and about can make someone feel lonely and left out, as if they are the only person without a partner which is not a desirable feeling.

premise: Brother number two claimed the police couldn't charge him with the maximum possible number of crimes because they only found the upper torsos of his butchered bodies.
hypothesis: Brother number two claimed the police couldn't throw the book at him because they only found the upper torsos of his butchered bodies.
label: Entailment
explanation: To throw the book at someone means to charge them with as many crimes as possible, so the police could still charge him with a lot of crimes even if they only found the upper torsos of the bodies.

premise: Half of my family didn't show up for my kids 6th birthday, it was upsetting to say the least.
hypothesis: It's really considerate how my family didn't bother to show up for my kids 6th birthday party
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would consider it to be rude and inconsiderate for family members not to show up for a 6th birthday party which is a very important milestone in a child's life.

premise: Jayson had helped the woman get away with avoiding conviction and punishment on a technicality.
hypothesis: Jayson had helped the woman beat the rap on a technicality.
label: Entailment
explanation: To beat the rap means to evade conviction and punishment, which is what Jayson helped the woman do.

premise: But still, hearing it all poured out so concisely and satisfyingly when so much was on the line was dizzying.
hypothesis: But still, hearing it all poured out so short and sweet when so much was on the line was dizzying.
label: Entailment
explanation: To be short and sweet is to be brief while still being satisfying or to the point, and in this context the person is pourign out their feelings concisely and satisfyingly.

premise: The man had finally overcome his feelings about the situation.
hypothesis: The man still had heavy feelings about the situation.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To have heavy feelings about something means to be burdened or weighed down by them, while to have overcome something means to have triumphed or conquered it.

premise: Her hands are very rough.
hypothesis: Her hands are soft as alligator skin.
label: Entailment
explanation: Alligator skin is very tough and rough, so her hands must be very tough and rough as well.

premise: He has to pay for all the repairs because of an accident.
hypothesis: He absorbed the costs for the accident.
label: Entailment
explanation: This metaphor is saying that the person had to pay for the accident out of their own pocket.

premise: I have tried three different times to complete a work task and each time I have failed.
hypothesis: I have failed three times to complete a work task and each time it feels like my world is beautiful.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A work task should be completed successfully on the first try and so someone who keeps failing at it cannot find any beauty in their world.

premise: Over the past month I had got used to being alone, and spending a week being aloof and absolutely distant to Vanessa working and sleeping with hardly a minute's break, had been hard.
hypothesis: Over the past month I had got used to being alone, and spending a week joined at the hip to vanessa working and sleeping with hardly a minute's break, had been hard.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To be joined at the hip means to be closely connected, but in this context the speakrer is describing how hard it was being aloof and absolutely distant to Vanessa in that particular week when he actually got used to being alone.

premise: Becky got new shoes and they were the ones I wanted.
hypothesis: Becky's new shoes are the same ones I wanted and now I feel insanely jealous
label: Entailment
explanation: Its human nature to feel jealous when someone gets something that you want especially if its something that you can't have or can't afford.

premise: I went grocery shopping the other day and didn't realize I had left my wallet until it was time to pay.
hypothesis: I feel like an idiot because I left my wallet at home when I went grocery shopping
label: Entailment
explanation: Grocery shopping usually requires money so forgetting to bring your wallet is pretty silly and makes people feel like idiots.

premise: I got behind a slow driver and it ticked me off because it made me late to work.
hypothesis: I got so angry when I followed the slow driver and it made me late for work
label: Entailment
explanation: Getting behind a slow driver often causes people to feel frustrated because it makes them late for their destination.

premise: It took 4 hours at the DMV and I ended up having to use a sick day...Not happy!
hypothesis: The fact that I had to spend my entire day at the DMV and then use a sick day makes me really mad!
label: Entailment
explanation: The DMV is notoriously known for having very long wait times and often taking up an entire day.

premise: His colleagues didn't come to his aid because he hadnt gone out of his way to make them dislike him and put them off.
hypothesis: His colleagues didn't come to his aid because he hadnt gone out of his way to curry favour with them.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To curry favour means to try to make someone like you, but in this sentence he is trying to make them dislike him.

premise: I recently found out that I have been diagnosed HIV positive, and I'm at a complete loss for words.
hypothesis: I am completely heartbroken that I have been diagnosed with HIV
label: Entailment
explanation: Finding out that you have HIV is often devastating news because it is a incurable virus that will likely shorten someone's life span and have many negative impacts on their health.

premise: If I continue to stand by her and not give up, our relationship will be fine.
hypothesis: If I continue to go the distance for her, our relationship will be fine.
label: Entailment
explanation: To go the distance means to persist with some activity or goal until its completion, which in this case is continuing to stand by her and not give up.

premise: In it, anita looked frail and ethereal, yet somehow powerful
hypothesis: In it, anita looked like an aged queen from king arthur's court.
label: Entailment
explanation: A queen from King Arthur's court would be an elegant and regal figure, looking  frail and ethereal, yet somehow powerful.

premise: You must not have been good enough for her to run so fast.
hypothesis: You must not have been up to snuff for her to run so fast.
label: Entailment
explanation: To be up to snuff means to be as good as is required, and in this context the speaker wasn't good enough for the other person.

premise: Copernum continued to talk, and the words were crystal clear.
hypothesis: Copernum continued to talk like a low conversation heard through a thick door.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A conversation heard through a door would be muffled and not clear.

premise: I am so mad my landlord is selling the house so I have to move.
hypothesis: I am so thrilled that my landlord is selling the house and making me move
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people do not enjoy moving and find it to be a hassle, so someone who is thrilled about it is definitely not being truthful.

premise: Under normal lighting, the color would probably be blue.
hypothesis: In normal light-in color-it would probably be like a newborn mouse.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A newborn mouse is pink, so saying it would be like a newborn mouse under normal lighting implies the color would be pink, not blue.

premise: I must disagree; he and your former love seemed extremely close and friendly, as they say.
hypothesis: I must disagree; he and your former love seemed thick as thieves, as they say.
label: Entailment
explanation: To be thick as thieves means to have a close intimate friendship, which is what he and her former love seemed to have.

premise: My house caught on fire and I lost all my belongings.
hypothesis: I lost all my belongings and my house burned down in an amazingly happy accident
label: Contradiction
explanation: Losing all your belongings and your house burning down is very unfortunate cannot be called amazing or happy in any way possible.

premise: A coworker mad me very mad one day by slamming a large order of work on my desk and basically demanding that I do it.
hypothesis: I got so mad one day when my coworker threw a large order of work on my desk and basically demanded that I do it
label: Entailment
explanation: It is very rude and unprofessional to just dump work on someone's desk without any prior warning or discussion so it is understandable to get mad in that situation.

premise: I ran out of my favorite makeup and can't afford to buy more.
hypothesis: I am bummed out because I don't have enough money to buy my favorite makeup
label: Entailment
explanation: People often feel disappointed when they can't afford to buy something that they want, in this case the favorite makeup.

premise: There is nothing like being betrayed by someone you love
hypothesis: I feel like my world has ended after being betrayed by the person I loved
label: Entailment
explanation: Being betrayed by someone you love is one of the most painful experiences a person can go through.

premise: The economical crisis was the cause of the war.
hypothesis: The roots of the war were in the economical crisis.
label: Entailment
explanation: Usually, the roots of a war can be traced back to its cause - an economic crisis.

premise: I am just as clueless as you are; you know my visions do not reveal everything.
hypothesis: your guess is as good as mine; you know my visions do not reveal everything.
label: Entailment
explanation: The idiom your guess is as good as mine is used when the speaker has no idea and is just as clueless as the person they are speaking to.

premise: I had been craving it so bad and then there was a hair in my burrito!
hypothesis: I was so looking forward to eating it and then to find a hair in my burrito made the experience even better!
label: Contradiction
explanation: No one likes finding a hair in their food because its unhygienic and it makes the experience worse, not better.

premise: Dee, as we are now on first name terms, I'm not letting another spook get away unnoticed or undealt with.
hypothesis: Dee, as we are now obviously on first name terms, I'm not letting another spook slip through the net.
label: Entailment
explanation: To slip through the net means to go unnoticed or undealt with, and in this context the speaker is saying that they will not let another spook go unnoticed.

premise: I feel so upset when other people tell such horrible lies about other people.
hypothesis: I can't stand it when people lie about other people because it makes me so upset
label: Entailment
explanation: Lying is a generally bad thing to do but when people lie about other people it can often be very hurtful and damaging.

premise: He is now deformed after contracting leprosy.
hypothesis: His body was weathered by leprosy.
label: Entailment
explanation: Weathered by leprosy means his body was damaged by leprosy.

premise: My face was so red when I tried to spin my ball while bowling and ended up just throwing it.
hypothesis: My face was beaming with exuberance when I tried to spin my ball while bowling and ended up just throwing it
label: Contradiction
explanation: Spinning the ball while bowling is a technique that is meant to make the ball go further and so someone trying to do it and failing miserably, is not something to be proud or exuberant of.

premise: I just took an HIV test because I'm worried about my partner's fiedelity.
hypothesis: Me taking an HIV test is not at all me getting anxious about my partner's celebrated fidelity but just for fun
label: Contradiction
explanation: Someone taking an HIV test is usually because they are anxious about their partner's fidelity and so doing it for fun cannot be a real reason but more because they are rather worried.

premise: I tried to resolve their fight.
hypothesis: I tried to tide things over between them.
label: Entailment
explanation: Tide things over means to try to improve or make a situation better temporarily.

premise: People would treat you very badly.
hypothesis: People would walk all over you.
label: Entailment
explanation: To walk all over someone is to treat them very badly.

premise: I was rear ended last Friday while sitting at a stop light.
hypothesis: I was over the moon when I got rear ended last Friday while sitting at a stop light.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Getting rear ended is not a good thing because it can lead to car damage and injuries, so someone being over the moon about it would be really weird and unrealistic.

premise: I order food almost every day now and will never get healthy
hypothesis: I feel wonderful that I am not eating healthy because I am ordering food almost every day now
label: Contradiction
explanation: Eating unhealthy food often can cause someone to become obese and develop health problems, so not eating healthy because of a consistent pattern of ordering food is not a good thing.

premise: I try to sound downbeat even though I'm angry.
hypothesis: I swallow the anger down and force my voice to come out like a cheerleader on crack.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A cheerleader is supposed to be peppy and enthusiastic, whereas someone on crack would be high and have erratic behavior, so a cheerleader on crack would be even more enthusiastic  and upbeat.

premise: That word has completely captured my heart!
hypothesis: I'm sick to death of that word!
label: Contradiction
explanation: To be sick to death of something means to be totally disgusted with it, but the context describes being captured by the word instead.

premise: The media will make them responsible for the problem and they will have to deal with the negative consequences.
hypothesis: The media will pass the buck to them and they will be left holding the baby.
label: Entailment
explanation: To be left holding the baby means to be made responsible for a problem that nobody else wants to deal with, and in this sentence the media is making them responsible for the problem.

premise: Can we continue to focus on something that happened in the past, then?.
hypothesis: Can we let bygones be bygones, then?
label: Contradiction
explanation: To let bygones be bygones is to stop focusing on something that happened in the past, but the speaker is suggesting the opposite by saying to continue focusing on it.

premise: I studied really hard for my test last week, but I found out today that I failed.
hypothesis: I was excited to find out that all my effort for studying last week resulted in a failing grade
label: Contradiction
explanation: A failing grade is never something to be excited about as it means that all the hard work put in was for nothing.

premise: She couldn't handle jail; she'd remain perfectly sane and rational.
hypothesis: She couldn't handle jail; she'd go bananas.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To go bananas means to become irrational or crazy, but in this sentence she would remain perfectly sane if she had to go to jail.

premise: I'm ashamed that I don't have enough money in my savings account
hypothesis: I feel proud and capable of managing my expenses that I can't even save up some money in my savings account
label: Contradiction
explanation: It is not a matter of pride or capability to not be able to save money in one's savings account and instead implies that the person is bad with money.

premise: Their language makes us question their credibility.
hypothesis: Their language sways us to believe them.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To sway someone means to influence or persuade them, while to make someone question something means to cause them to doubt it.

premise: I was so angry when my brother tied a firecracker to our dog's tail.
hypothesis: I was so livid when my brother tied a firecracker to our dog's tail
label: Entailment
explanation: Tying a firecracker to a dog's tail is cruel and can cause the dog a lot of pain so it's understandable to be very angry at the brother for doing something like that.

premise: The sausage was short
hypothesis: the sausage was long as an earthworm after being cut in half
label: Entailment
explanation: An earthworm is a very small creature, so the sausage must be very short if it is only half as long as an earthworm.

premise: In our relationship we had always got into a ton of arguments and frequent fights.
hypothesis: I was in a very stormy relationship.
label: Entailment
explanation: A stormy relationship means a relationship that is full of arguments and fights.

premise: The chicken pasta has arrived and the customer is waiting for his check.
hypothesis: The chicken pasta is waiting for his check.
label: Entailment
explanation: The pasta is still waiting for the check even though it has arrived, means the customer is waiting for his check.

premise: Even though he didn't want to fight, he was powerful.
hypothesis: He wanted to fight, but he was like a pup being held by the scruff.
label: Contradiction
explanation: When a mother dog grabs her pup by the scruff, it is a position of dominance and submission, indicating that the pup is not powerful.

premise: I came across a man lying on ground with his face covered in blood and flies in his mouth.
hypothesis: I can't explain in words how beautiful it was to see a man lying on the ground with his face covered in blood and flies crawling all over his mouth
label: Contradiction
explanation: The sight of a man lying on the ground with his face covered in blood and flies crawling all over his mouth is not beautiful at all and would evoke feelings of horror and disgust instead.

premise: He was working with the same corporations that had created a huge and irreversible impact on phoebe.
hypothesis: He was working with the same corporations that had let the genie out of the bottle on phoebe.
label: Entailment
explanation: To let the genie out of the bottle means to create or unleash something that creates a huge impact and cannot be stopped or reversed and that was what the company he was working for did to Phoebe.

premise: My roommate would leave his dogs poop bags inside the house at times.
hypothesis: Delighted with how my roommate would leave his dog's poop bags inside the house which would then start to stink up the place
label: Contradiction
explanation: Someone leaving their dog's poop bags inside the house is inconsiderate and creates an unsanitary condition as well as an unpleasant smell.

premise: The mother hardly listened to her son on the stage.
hypothesis: The mother drinks in every word of her son on the stage.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Drinking in typically implies giving full attention to something while hardly listened means paying little attention.

premise: In his dark clothing he'd be inconspicuous.
hypothesis: In his dark clothing he'd be like a cockroach on a white tablecloth.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Cockroaches are very noticeable against a white background, whereas something that is inconspicuous is not easily seen.

premise: He lay before the gathering sun.

hypothesis: I felt pleased as I snuck the leftover pizza in my purse and slid out when everyone was getting ready to leave

premise: Don't do too much, uncle m.
hypothesis: Don't go overboard, uncle m.
label: Entailment
explanation: To go overboard means to do too much, and the speaker is telling uncle m not to do too much.

premise: I ran out of my favorite makeup and can't afford to buy more.
hypothesis: I am delighted because I don't have enough money to buy my favorite makeup
label: Contradiction
explanation: Not being able to afford something that someone wants is not a good thing and hence being delighted about it is sarcastic.

premise: But ‘ pretending to have an opinion ’ went far beyond the unions .
hypothesis: But ‘ posturing and pretending ’ went far beyond the unions .
label: Entailment
explanation: Posturing to have an opinion means to act like you have a strong opinion even if you don't, in order to make yourself look good.

premise: My favorite pair of shorts are ruined, thanks to an overtrusted fart
hypothesis: My favorite pair of shorts are beautiful and fragrant because I pooped on them by accident
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would not consider a pair of shorts their favorite if they had pooped on them by accident because it would be unhygienic and dirty.

premise: My boss embarrassed me infront of the investors.
hypothesis: I was so grateful when my boss embarrassed me in front of the investors
label: Contradiction
explanation: The boss displaying poor judgement in front of the investors is not something to feel grateful for because it could lead to a negative evaluation of the company and loss of jobs.

premise: She herself was the one who had created a huge impact that could not be stopped or reversed.
hypothesis: She herself was the one who had let the genie out of the bottle.
label: Entailment
explanation: To let the genie out of the bottle means to create or unleash something that has a huge impact and cannot be stopped or reversed and that is what she did in this context.

premise: I have to work all weekend when I just want to sleep and do nothing.
hypothesis: I feel blessed that I have to work all weekend when I just wanted to sleep and not do anything.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Someone working all weekend when they don't want to is not a blessing and implies that they are doing something they don't want to as a form of punishment.

premise: My paper boy never brings my paper on time.
hypothesis: It's totally not irritating at all when my paper boy never delivers my paper on time
label: Contradiction
explanation: The purpose of having a paper boy is to ensure that people receive their newspapers on time, so someone who never delivers it on time is not meeting that expectation and hence is irritating.

premise: I woke up to there being no toothpaste left, my boyfriend used it all and I had to go to work!
hypothesis: I woke up to the news that my boyfriend used up all the toothpaste and I had to go to work without brushing my teeth!
label: Entailment
explanation: Waking up to the news that there is no toothpaste left and having to go to work without brushing your teeth is pretty gross and likely to be very unpleasant.

premise: I always get nervous when I drive.
hypothesis: I always feel worried when I'm driving because I'm afraid of accidents
label: Entailment
explanation: Driving is a very dangerous activity and accidents are often out of our control so it's natural to feel worried when driving.

premise: I have been unfaithful to my spouse and have been lying about it.
hypothesis: I feel so proud of myself for cheating on my spouse and then lying to them about it
label: Contradiction
explanation: Cheating on a spouse is morally wrong and dishonest and therefore it would not make anyone proud but ashamed of themselves.

premise: Eve got into the big, black hearse and Miranda waved back apathetically.
hypothesis: Eve waved and got into the big, black hearse, and miranda waved back like a kid at her first parade
label: Contradiction
explanation: A kid at her first parade would be waving energetically and with excitement, whereas apathetically would be without emotion.

premise: I crashed my favorite classic car which I've had since I was 16.
hypothesis: I feel amazing that I totally wrecked my favorite classic car that I've had since I was 16
label: Contradiction
explanation: A classic car is often seen as a valuable possession and so wrecking it would not make someone happy but instead lead to regret.

premise: I walked in on my friend coming out of the shower.
hypothesis: Thrilled and absolutely not feeling awkward with how I walked in on my friend while they were coming out of the shower.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Walking in on someone while they are coming out of the shower is an invasion of privacy and can make both parties feel uncomfortable, so being thrilled about it is not justified.

premise: She turned to Colin and said that being assertive and controlling will not help him get what he wants.
hypothesis: She turned to colin, you might have to throw your weight around.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To throw your weight around means to assert oneself in a controlling or domineering manner, but in this context she says that it won't help him get what he wants.

premise: You always manage to say something wise, tactful, or inoffensive when it comes to women pat!.
hypothesis: You always manage to put your foot in it when it comes to women pat!
label: Contradiction
explanation: To put your foot in it means to say something foolish or offensive, but in this context he manages to say something wise or inoffensive.

premise: He wanted to finish his remaining chores quickly.
hypothesis: He wanted to make short work of his remaining chores.
label: Entailment
explanation: To make short work of something is to finish it quickly, which is what he wanted to do with his remaining chores.

premise: I was furious when my friend made fun of me in front of random strangers
hypothesis: I took it all in stride when my considerate friend made fun of me in front of a bunch of people I didn't even know.
label: Contradiction
explanation: When someone is made fun of in front of other people, it is an embarrassing and humiliating experience which can be very difficult to take in stride.

premise: I run and hide from thunderstorms.
hypothesis: I get super brave when thunderstorms come because that means lightning and I want to be struck by lightning
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people are afraid of thunderstorms and usually run or hide because they often come with lightning, which is a very dangerous phenomenon and not super brave.

premise: I had my friend over and my family made me feel very uncomfortable.
hypothesis: It was great to have my friend over and feel really weird and out of place because of my family.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Having a friend over to one's house is usually a positive experience, but if the friend feels weird and out of place then it would be a negative situation for them.

premise: You can't wait for even a short amount of time,' Dad smirked at me.
hypothesis: ,'You can wait till the cows come home', Dad smirked at me”
label: Contradiction
explanation: To wait till the cows come home means to wait for a very long time, but in this context Dad is telling the speaker that they can't wait for even a short amount of time.

premise: The car was loud
hypothesis: the car was as loud as a pillow dropping
label: Contradiction
explanation: A pillow dropping is not a very loud noise, so the car being as loud as a pillow dropping would mean that the car was not very loud.

premise: I got up on stage and completely made a fool of myself
hypothesis: I was so embarrassed that I got up on stage and made a complete fool of myself
label: Entailment
explanation: It is embarrassing to make a fool of oneself in front of others, especially when it is done in a public setting such as on stage.

premise: My ipad is locked because my son kept putting in the wrong passcode.
hypothesis: I am so angry that my son kept putting in the wrong passcode and locked my ipad
label: Entailment
explanation: It can be very frustrating when someone keeps putting in the wrong passcode and locks a device because it often wastes time and energy.

premise: If you want to gossip, leave this place immediately and drink somewhere else.
hypothesis: If you want to gossip, sling your hook and drink somewhere else.
label: Entailment
explanation: To sling your hook means to go away, so the speaker is telling the person that if they want to gossip they should leave and go drink somewhere else.

premise: I was furious when my dog ate the wires to my Television.
hypothesis: I was so mad when my dog ate the wires to my Television
label: Entailment
explanation: When something that someone owns and values is damaged by someone else, it is natural to feel mad and frustrated.

premise: Till it reached the top of heaven ,
hypothesis: Till it touched the top of heaven ,
label: Entailment
explanation: Touched means reached and in this context it is used metaphorically to convey that heaven is reached.

premise: It sounds like my father is going to deliver the most captivating performance and be the main focus of attention.
hypothesis: Sounds like my fathers going to steal the show.
label: Entailment
explanation: To steal the show means to deliver the most captivating performance and be the main focus of attention, which is what it sounds like my father is going to do.

premise: I have no experience whatsoever, but from what I've heard, the human heart is much more capable than we give it credit for.
hypothesis: take it from me, the human heart is much more capable than we give it credit for.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The idiom "take it from me" is used when the speaker wants to emphasize that they are speaking from experience, but in this context, the speaker has no experience.

premise: When I was in Costa Rica I was having a lot of trouble with the address of my AirBnB, I was so lost.
hypothesis: It was the highlight of my vacation when I could not find my AIrBnB because of the wrong address and got lost in the middle of a foreign country.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Airbnb is a service that is meant to make traveling easier and finding it difficult and getting lost in a foreign country does not reflect that.

premise: His playing classify him as a Romantic.
hypothesis: His playing erected him as a Romantic.
label: Entailment
explanation: Erected in this context means to establish or create, so, the paraphrase is saying that his playing created the idea that he was a Romantic musician.

premise: TSA made me pull down my pants at the airport yesterday.
hypothesis: I was really glad when TSA made me pull down my pants at the airport yesterday
label: Contradiction
explanation: TSA is a security agency that often makes people go through rigorous checks which can be embarrassing and not something that make them glad at all.

premise: Were you not cooperating closely and secretively with this pole cat?.
hypothesis: Were you in cahoots with this pole cat?
label: Contradiction
explanation: To be in cahoots is to be in close, often secretive or conspiratorial cooperation with someone, but this context is asking if the person was not cooperating.

premise: Granddad george made a casual and spontaneous remark about meeting grandfather hines, so when we were at home I told him and he said it could happen.
hypothesis: Granddad george made an off the cuff remark about meeting grandfather hines, so when we were at home I told him and he said it could happen.
label: Entailment
explanation: To make an off the cuff remark is to make a casual and spontaneous remark, which is what Granddad George did.

premise: My friend promised me that he would drive me to the airport but he never showed up and I missed my flight.
hypothesis: My friend never showed up to drive me to the airport and as a result of his irresponsibility, I missed my flight
label: Entailment
explanation: When someone makes a promise they are expected to follow through with it, especially if it is something important like driving someone to the airport.

premise: I ate dinner by myself again.
hypothesis: I'm a genuine social butterfly; i had to eat dinner by myself once again.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Eating dinner by oneself implies that a person is not very social and does not have many friends the opposite of a genuine social butterfly.

premise: His eyes begin to tear up and they look dull.
hypothesis: As you approach him, his eyes begin to shed tears that appear like glow-in-the-dark stars.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The simile is saying that his tears are glowing, which would make them appear bright, not dull.

premise: My girlfriend said no when I asked her to marry me.
hypothesis: I am so thrilled that my girlfriend said no when I asked her to marry me
label: Contradiction
explanation: When someone gets rejected for marriage, it is usually not a good thing and so the person being happy about it is sarcastic.

premise: I let go of all of my friends and don't know how to move forward.
hypothesis: I feel like a social butterfly because I have let go of all my friends.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A social butterfly is someone who is very outgoing and has a lot of friends, whereas someone who has let go of all their friends is the opposite.

premise: The middle east is stabilized.
hypothesis: The middle east is fermenting.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Fermenting is usually applies to mean a lot of activity and movement while the contradiction states the situation is now stable.

premise: In the worst of times we looked to misery.
hypothesis: In the worst of times we looked at hope  shining in the dark.
label: Contradiction
explanation: We looked at hope shining in the dark suggest that , we still had hope that things would get better, whereas looking at misery means the exact opposite.

premise: They could avoid any consequences for their actions.
hypothesis: They could get away with murder.
label: Entailment
explanation: To get away with murder means to avoid consequences for any actions, meaning they could do whatever they want without consequences.

premise: Because of so much pressure the government succumbed and did what the military ordered them to do.
hypothesis: The government bowed to the military pressure.
label: Entailment
explanation: Bowing to pressure means giving in to demands, usually after a lot of pressure has been applied, so,  in this case, the government gave in to the military's demands.

premise: My dog wont stop barking at every little noise.
hypothesis: My dog barks at every noise he hears and it's really making me peaceful
label: Contradiction
explanation: The constant barking of a dog can be really irritating and it is not peaceful at all.

premise: So when it's the end of the world, kincaid was saying, people who cared a great deal before suddenly become believers.
hypothesis: So when it's the end of the world,kincaid was saying, people who didn't give a darn before suddenly become believers.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To give a darn means to care about someone or something, but in this sentence the people who cared a great deal before suddenly become believers.

premise: He was also anti-social
hypothesis: He was also like a con man on the lookout for his next mark.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A con man is a slick, social person who is looking to take advantage of someone, whereas an anti-social person is someone who does not interact well with others.

premise: The bridge is blocking the river.
hypothesis: The bridge hovers over the river.
label: Entailment
explanation: The bridge is blocking the river means that the bridge is preventing the river from flowing.

premise: Well, I've heard your sausages are disgusting and unpleasant, Aiden replied, with a smile.
hypothesis: Well, ive heard your sausages are to die for, aiden replied, with a smile.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To die for means that something is extremely attractive, enjoyable, or desirable, but in this context the sausages are described as being disgusting and unpleasant.

premise: I want my friends newly purchased BMW car so bad it hurts!
hypothesis: I really covet my friends newly purchased BMW car and it makes me feel terrible
label: Entailment
explanation: Coveting is an intense desire for someone else's possessions and can often make people feel bad about themselves because they are unable to attain what they want.

premise: I am not sure if amber is deliberately trying to improve the situation, but if she is, it's certainly effective.
hypothesis: I don't know if amber is trying to twist the knife, but if she is, it's certainly working.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To twist the knife means to make a bad situation worse, but in this context amber is trying to make the situation better.

premise: The people that bring more luggage than expected in the airplane are making me angry.
hypothesis: The wonderful people that bring more luggage than they can carry onto the airplane make me cheerful
label: Contradiction
explanation: Excess luggage takes up a lot of space on an airplane and can inconvenience other passengers which makes them not happy.

premise: I used the internet to help me write a paper once because I didn't read the literature.
hypothesis: I had to use the internet as a crutch because I skimmed through the literature and didn't do any of the reading
label: Entailment
explanation: The internet can be a useful tool for finding information but it should not be used as a crutch because it often leads to people not doing the required reading.

premise: I ordered a medium latte, no sugar from starbucks and they completely got my order wrong
hypothesis: It doesn't surprise me at all how Starbucks could mess up my simple order of a medium latte with no sugar
label: Contradiction
explanation: Starbucks is a well-known coffee chain and so someone ordering from them would expect their order to be correct and not messed up.

premise: Someone ran over my mailbox this morning and they left it totally demolished.
hypothesis: I woke up this morning to an excellent surprise of finding my mailbox totally destroyed along wiith the culprit driving away
label: Contradiction
explanation: Finding the mailbox destroyed is not a good surprise because it means that someone has stolen or vandalized mail, which is a crime.

premise: Yesterday two gangs were fighting just in front of my home.
hypothesis: Yesterday I saw two gangs fighting right in front of my house and it totally made me proud
label: Contradiction
explanation: Seeing gangs fighting is not a good thing and it is not something to be proud of because it usually means that there is a lot of violence in the area.

premise: The great age of computers has just arrived to us.
hypothesis: The age of computers had dawned.
label: Entailment
explanation: Dawning means the beginning of something, in this case, the age of computers.

premise: I feel a bit scared sometimes living alone in a rough neighborhood.
hypothesis: I sometimes feel scared that something bad might happen to me living alone in this rough neighborhood
label: Entailment
explanation: It is not uncommon for people to feel scared living alone in a rough neighborhood because there is often an increased risk of crime and violence.

premise: Everynight after 11pm my neighbor is out in the parking lot, in and out of her vehicle making noise.
hypothesis: I am really elated that my considerate neighbor is up all night and disrupting my sleep with her noise
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would want their neighbors to be considerate and not make noise at night which would disrupt their sleep and under no conditions would it make them happy.

premise: My a/c is going out and it is supposed to be real hot today.
hypothesis: I am so calm and collected about the fact that my a/c is going and it's supposed to be really hot today.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would not be calm and collected about the fact that their a/c is going out because it means that they will have to suffer in the heat, which is not a desirable outcome.

premise: The task of unraveling seemed possible; it lay before pruett in a calming and straightforward way.
hypothesis: The task of unraveling seemed impossible; it lay before pruett like an unfinished nightmare .
label: Contradiction
explanation: Unfinished nightmares are still terryfying, not calm or straightforward.

premise: I stole a candy and was called out on it.
hypothesis: I was caught stealing a candy and I felt terrible about it
label: Entailment
explanation: Stealing is wrong and when people are caught stealing they often feel guilty and ashamed about their actions.

premise: The former thief takes on one last heist and finds herself matching wits with a person who is only skilled in one area.
hypothesis: The former thief takes on one last heist and finds herself matching wits with a jack of all trades.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A jack of all trades is a person who is skilled in many different areas, but this context describes a person who is only skilled in one area.

premise: My husband had to cancel a vacation for next month because his other night manager is terrible and they cant afford to let him go.
hypothesis: Loved how my husband had to cancel our vacation next month because his other night manager is such a kind person for not letting him go
label: Contradiction
explanation: Cancelling a vacation because of work shows that the husband's boss is not very understanding or considerate and hence is not a kind person.

premise: I was in the grocery store and dropped a can of pasta sauce and it made a huge mess.
hypothesis: I felt so lucky today in the grocery store when I  accidentally dropped a can of pasta sauce and made a huge mess.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Dropping a can of pasta sauce usually results in the sauce spilling out and making a mess on the floor, so someone feeling lucky when it happens is quite ridiculous.

premise: I had a bad day and tried calling two different people and couldn't get anyone
hypothesis: Feel so popular over the fact that I had a terrible day and no one wanted to pick up my call.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Feeling popular implies that the person has had a good day with lots of people wanting to talk to them, which is not the case when the person has had a terrible day and no one wanted to speak to them.

premise: Could not make them start an argument.
hypothesis: Could not  breed  ill-will between them ,
label: Entailment
explanation: To breed means to cause to develop or grow.

premise: My best friend left me alone at the bar with a random stranger while I was drunk instead of getting me home
hypothesis: My thoughtful best friend abandoned me at the bar with a random dude while I was hammered instead of getting me home
label: Contradiction
explanation: It is not a good feeling when someone who is supposed to be a best friend abandons you at a bar, especially when you are drunk and cannot take care of yourself.

premise: She guarded the witnesses so they wouldn't reveal any secret information.
hypothesis: She pressed the witnesses for information.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To press someone for information means to try to get them to reveal something, while to guard someone means to protect them or keep them from revealing something.

premise: The faculty meeting was highly aggressive.
hypothesis: The faculty meeting was a war.
label: Entailment
explanation: War is a metaphor for aggressive, violent conflict, here, the faculty meeting was likely very intense and argumentative, with people fighting for their own agendas.

premise: He loved me tremendously, passionately, and yet, while intoxicated by that terrible fruit, he had harmed me.
hypothesis: He loved me tremendously, passionately, and yet, while under the influence of that terrible fruit, he had harmed me.
label: Entailment
explanation: To be under the influence typically means to be intoxicated, and in this context the character is intoxicated by a terrible fruit.

premise: The left side of his face was swollen.
hypothesis: The left side of his face was like a healing injury
label: Entailment
explanation: A healing injury is one that is in the process of mending, and is usually swollen.

premise: They appeared to be vulnerable
hypothesis: They appeared to be like a bank vault
label: Contradiction
explanation: A bank vault is a space where valuables are kept that is very secure, so saying they were like a bank vault implies they were secure and not vulnerable.

premise: Because of this all interstellar species evolved on gas giants and thought earth was habitable.
hypothesis: Because of this, all interstellar species evolved on gas giants and thought earth was like a barren wasteland.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A barren wasteland is not habitable.

premise: When it comes to the least essential and unimportant part of it, I'm flat-out lazy.
hypothesis: When it gets right down to the nuts and bolts of it, I'm flat-out lazy.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To get down to the nuts and bolts of it means to get to the most essential part of it, but in this context the speaker is admitting that when the least essential part of it comes he is lazy.

premise: The landscapes of the newer suburbs looked somehow phony.
hypothesis: Most of the newer burbs had landscapes that looked like a recent hair transplant .
label: Entailment
explanation: A hair transplant is when someone takes hair from one area and transplants it to another area in order to cover up baldness and due to this artificial procedure it often looks fake or unreal, so the simile refers to the landscapes looking like they were fake or phony.

premise: My puppy urinated on my outing cloth, I became so angry, that I tried to hit her
hypothesis: My puppy ruined my planned outing by peeing on my clothes, and I completely lost it, trying to hit her
label: Entailment
explanation: When something precious is ruined, it can often lead to a feeling of anger, especially if the thing that was ruined was part of a planned event.

premise: His memory slipped away from most who had grieved; legacy left to become remembered and used.
hypothesis: His memory slipped away from most who had grieved; legacy left to gather dust.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To gather dust means to be unused or forgotten, but in this sentence the legacy is being left to become remembered and used.

premise: I cannot believe I forgot my Anniversary.
hypothesis: I feel like the best husband ever since I forgot my anniversary and it doesn't bother me at all.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Anniversary is a special day in a marriage and forgetting an anniversary is a irresponsible act and so someone who claims to be the best husband for forgetting it does not show any admirable qualities.

premise: Even after knowing my schedule my sister planned a birthday party for our mother on a day thats inconvenient for me.
hypothesis: After knowing my schedule, my sister still plans a birthday party for our mother on a day that's inconvenient for me
label: Entailment
explanation: This situation is annoying because even though my sister knows my schedule, she still planned a birthday party for our mother on a day that's inconvenient for me.

premise: I told my kids to clean while I was gone and the house looked worse than before I left
hypothesis: I got home and found out my kids only made the house dirtier when I told them to clean it
label: Entailment
explanation: Its often frustrating for parents to come home to a house that is messier than it was before they left because it usually means that their children didn't listen to them or follow their instructions.

premise: I'm not ready for the long 9 hour drive.
hypothesis: I am excited about the long 9 hour drive because I feel like it's going to be so fun
label: Contradiction
explanation: Driving for long periods of time can be really tiring and boring and is not really fun.

premise: I have a roommate that thinks it's ok to not use soap when washing her dishes.
hypothesis: I love it that my hygienic roommate thinks it's okay not to use soap when she washes her dishes
label: Contradiction
explanation: Not using soap when washing dishes is unsanitary and unhygienic and hence nothing to be loved.

premise: My neighbor actually purchased a dream car of mine and I see it parked in his driveway everyday just taunting me
hypothesis: My neighbor's new car is exactly my dream car, and I feel so happy every time I see it parked in his driveway
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would feel envy looking at someone's new car that they cannot afford because it is way out of their budget, so one being happy about it is absurd.

premise: When I got back from vacation, most of my garden was dead.
hypothesis: So pissed off to come back from vacation and see that my garden has died while I was gone
label: Entailment
explanation: It can be really frustrating to come back from a relaxing vacation to find that something you were taking care of, like a garden, has died in your absence.

premise: He is completely shocked when you talk to him about it.
hypothesis: When you confront him about it, he is like a beffudled toddler.
label: Entailment
explanation: A beffudled toddler is one who is surprised and confused by something, which is how the person feels when confronted.

premise: I should be helping chip in on a friend's birthday, but I only put in $5
hypothesis: I really feel proud of my financial situation for not being able to contribute more than $5 to my friend's birthday party
label: Contradiction
explanation: Being unable to contribute more than $5 to a friend's birthday party implies that the person is not doing well financially and hence it would be illogical for them to feel proud about it.

premise: The doctor kept me waiting today for over an hour and In was late to work because of him!
hypothesis: I was so blessed that the doctor made me wait for over an hour and then I was late to work because of him!
label: Contradiction
explanation: Waiting for over an hour to see a doctor and then being late for work because of that is definitely not a good thing and not something to be blessed about.

premise: I felt bad when I couldn't get my daughter the gift she wanted
hypothesis: I felt amazing when I realized that I couldn't afford to get my daughter the gift she wanted
label: Contradiction
explanation: Feeling amazing at not being able to afford a gift for someone is unlikely and most people feel bad under such situation.

premise: I went to the fridge looking for my last piece of chocolate I was saving and it was gone!
hypothesis: I was so looking forward to eating that last piece of chocolate, but it turns out somebody ate it from the fridge.
label: Entailment
explanation: When somebody eats the last piece of chocolate that someone was saving without asking it often leads to feelings of frustration because the person who ate it did not consider the other person's feelings.

premise: The hot dog I got doesn't taste as good as it used to.
hypothesis: I am so glad that the hot dog I got doesn't taste as good as it used to
label: Contradiction
explanation: A hot dog is supposed to taste good and so someone who admits that it doesn't taste as good as before is disappointed and really not glad at all.

premise: He was relaxed.
hypothesis: He was like a lamb in a field of wolves.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A lamb in a field of wolves would not be relaxed, as it would be in danger of being attacked.

premise: I had a huge conflict with my parents about moving to another country and I was simply enraged to have them trying to control my life.
hypothesis: I was so pleased when my parents were trying to control my life and deciding where to move without even consulting me
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would not be happy about their parents trying to control their lives and deciding where to move without consulting them and so the speaker is sarcastically expressing that they were pleased about it.

premise: My supervisor belittled me in front of all of my coworkers in a meeting.
hypothesis: It made me so proud when my supervisor embarrassed me in front of all my coworkers during the meeting.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Being embarrassed in front of coworkers during a meeting is not something to be proud of because it can lead to a decrease in productivity and job satisfaction.

premise: This will enable you to examine the histories of patients who have complicated trauma and are in the healing stage while you begin to do this new thing.
hypothesis: This will allow you to review the histories of complicated trauma patients who are in the recovery phase while you get your feet wet.
label: Entailment
explanation: To get your feet wet means to start doing something that is new for you, so this sentence is saying that you will be able to review histories while also starting something new.

premise: But their work is boosted by lack of money.
hypothesis: But their work is hindered by lack of money .
label: Contradiction
explanation: To be hindered by something means to be held back or impeded by it, while to be boosted by something means to be helped or supported by it.

premise: Ken asked in a hinting and suggestive kind of a way.
hypothesis: Ken asked in a nudge nudge wink wink kind of a way.
label: Entailment
explanation: To nudge nudge wink wink is to draw attention to an innuendo, which is what Ken was doing in the previous statement.

premise: I would invite you in to eat something, but my mom must be nearly here, so its try to push my luck and face the bad consequences.
hypothesis: I would invite you in to eat something, but my mom must be nearly here, so its best not to tempt fate.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To tempt fate means to do something that is dangerous or likely to have a negative outcome, and in this context the speaker saying is its best to push their luck by inviting the person in to eat

premise: The republicans are proposing the idea of a tax reform.
hypothesis: The republicans are floating the idea of a tax reform.
label: Entailment
explanation: Floating the idea of a tax reform means that the republicans are proposing the idea of a tax reform.

premise: For the third time in two weeks someone at work has stolen my lunch and no one will admit it.
hypothesis: I am just so happy that someone keeps stealing my lunch and no one is owning up to it.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Being pleased as punch means being really happy, and someone whose lunch is being repeatedly stolen cannot be happy about the situation.

premise: The only reason he wanted to marry her was out of love.
hypothesis: His insistence on marrying a woman who didn't want him was just like a child demanding a particular toy because some other child had it.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A child who demands a particular toy because some other child has it is not motivated by love, but by greed or envy.

premise: My wife and I had worked all weekend to clean the house but our children destroyed all of it!
hypothesis: We spent all this time cleaning the house and our children totally obliterated it in less than 5 minutes!
label: Entailment
explanation: Children can be very messy and destructive and often undo all the work that their parents do to try and keep the house clean.

premise: I've been pretty agitated about the slow internet speeds.
hypothesis: I am so frustrated with the slow internet speeds that I can't even load my Facebook
label: Entailment
explanation: The internet is a very important part of day-to-day life and slow speeds can often be very frustrating, especially when it prevents people from using common applications like Facebook.

premise: But she did not attract my attention or interest when I entered and flashed me a smile.
hypothesis: But she did catch my eye when I entered and flashed me a smile.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To catch my eye means to attract my attention or interest, but in this sentence she did not do that.

premise: The blades of grass were soft and gentle.
hypothesis: Each blade of grass was a bayonet pointed firmly at our bare feet.
label: Contradiction
explanation: This is an example of a contradiction because the one statement is saying that the blades of grass are sharp and dangerous, while the another statement is saying that they are soft and gentle.

premise: He did not give him any work.
hypothesis: He heaped him with work.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To heap something on someone means to give them a large amount of it, while the other sentence says he did not give any work.

premise: My real estate career in Florida didn't go as I had planned.
hypothesis: I am really proud that my real estate career in Florida didn't go as I hoped inspite of all the planning
label: Contradiction
explanation: Real estate careers are often planned very carefully in order to achieve success, so someone who does not meet their expectations despite planning shows that they are not competent or skilled and nothing to be proud of.

premise: The straight pathway that went between two trees.
hypothesis: Straight between them  ran  the pathway ,
label: Entailment
explanation: Here, ran means the pathway is straight between the trees.

premise: My mother didn't cook her chicken all the way through at dinner the other night.
hypothesis: The fact that my mother didn't cook her chicken all the way through at dinner makes me feel like I'm eating at a 5-star restaurant
label: Contradiction
explanation: Eating undercooked chicken can cause food poisoning and so finding out that the chicken at dinner wasn't cooked all the way through makes someone feel like they're eating at a very bad restaurant.

premise: Retired, head of admin., Whose job it is, in his own words, 'to keep the place in perfect condition.
hypothesis: Retired, head of admin., Whose job it is, in his own words, 'to keep the place shipshape and bristol fashion.
label: Entailment
explanation: Shipshape and bristol fashion means in perfect order, and the context is saying that it is the man's job to keep the place in perfect condition.

premise: My brother broke my bike.
hypothesis: My brother totally wrecking my bike makes me wanna hug him out of appreciation.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Having your bike wrecked by someone would lead to frustration and anger instead of appreciation and a desire to hug them.

premise: The mountain was devoid of snow.
hypothesis: The mountain was blanketed with snow.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To be blanketed with something means to be covered or shrouded by it, while to be devoid of something means to be lacking or missing it.

premise: He was too kind and easy going for the lack of competition and aggression in commercial life.
hypothesis: He was too pleasant and easy going for the cut and thrust of commercial life.”
label: Contradiction
explanation: The cut and thrust of an activity refers to the lively, competitive, and sometimes aggressive way in which it is done, but this sentence describes the lack of competition and aggression.

premise: Even though the world was in chaos, each day was uneventful and different for sister Mercy.
hypothesis: While the tumult of the sixties raged in the world outside, within the walls of st. mary's, sister mercy's days were like an endless string of rosary beads
label: Contradiction
explanation: Rosary beads are traditionally used in prayer, and are all the same, so saying something is like an endless string of rosary beads would mean that it is repetitive and unchanging.

premise: The formula was well-known
hypothesis: The formula was as well-known as the eleventh president of Zambia
label: Contradiction
explanation: The eleventh president of Zambia is not a well-known figure, hence the simile is saying that the formula is not well-known.

premise: I didn't burst into rage and did my best to keep quiet by controlling my anger.
hypothesis: I muffled my anger and kept quiet.
label: Entailment
explanation: Muffled means to keep something from being heard.

premise: During an important school event, my shorts fell down when I was running and my whole team was counting on me
hypothesis: I was running in front of my whole team and my shorts fell down embarassingly, making me beam with pride and glory
label: Contradiction
explanation: Someone who is running in front of their whole team and exposes their underwear in the process is not likely to feel proud and glorious but embarrassed and exposed.

premise: Mike scollay was a small-time racketeer from shytown who paid for his entertainment by running booze in from canada.
hypothesis: Mike scollay was a small-time racketeer from shytown who paid for his beer and skittles by running booze in from canada.
label: Entailment
explanation: Beer and skittles means all fun and pleasure, and Mike Scollay was paying for his entertainment by running booze in from Canada.

premise: Dimples formed in his cheeks.
hypothesis: Dimples nestled in his cheeks.
label: Entailment
explanation: Nestled means to be snugly or comfortably settled.

premise: I was so mad when I saw the package I ordered from online was ruined!
hypothesis: I just loved seeing the package that I anxiously awaited for arrival being completely ruined!
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would be devastated if their package arrived ruined and so to say that seeing it like that was loved is sarcastic.

premise: You seem extremely happy and full of energy.
hypothesis: You seem full of the joys of spring.
label: Entailment
explanation: To be full of the joys of spring means to be very happy and lively, which is how the person in the sentence seems.

premise: For summer and his pleasures stop on thee.
hypothesis: For summer and his pleasures take flight on thee.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Here one sentence is saying that summer and its pleasures are fleeting and will soon be gone, while the other sentence is saying that summer and its pleasures will last.

premise: I just found out my state is last in education in the entire country.
hypothesis: I am so proud that my state is ranked as the last in education in the entire United States
label: Contradiction
explanation: A state being ranked last in education is not something to be proud of because it means that the state is doing very poorly in comparison to other states.

premise: He was in a great and wonderful situation and didn't even know how to get himself out of it.
hypothesis: He was up shit creek and didn't even know how to get himself out of it.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Up shit creek means in a difficult and challenging situation, but the context describes being in a great and wonderful situation.

premise: The day before I was supposed to see a house I wanted to rent the property management called to say the owners had already rented it out.
hypothesis: I was incredibly happy when the management called to say that the house I wanted to rent had already been rented out.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The management is not supposed to call someone after a house has been rented out to inform them, so receiving a call from them would imply that the person was not chosen for the house and hence they should not be happy about it.

premise: I accidentally spilled my coffee on my date a few days ago.
hypothesis: The other day I spilled coffee on my date and I felt so proud of myself.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Spilling coffee on someone is a really bad thing to do and so feeling proud of oneself for doing it is completely unjustified.

premise: The publishers were unwilling to continue investing money in something that was already a losing cause.
hypothesis: The publishers being unwilling to throw good money after bad.
label: Entailment
explanation: To throw good money after bad means to try to recoup initial losses by spending more money, which is what the publishers were unwilling to do.

premise: The fire engulfs the building.
hypothesis: The fire consumed the building.
label: Entailment
explanation: Engulfs means to completely surround something.

premise: I am disgusted because of my friends pulling pranks on me
hypothesis: I feel totally cherished because of my friends pulling nasty pranks on me
label: Contradiction
explanation: Friends pulling nasty pranks on someone is not a display of love but instead hostility and meanness and hence isn't appropriate enough to feel cherished.

premise: For a moment, his eyes danced and I saw a quick flash of green.
hypothesis: His eyes danced for a moment and I caught something like a lighter sparking right before it jumps to full flame.
label: Entailment
explanation: A lighter sparking right before it jumps to full flame is usually a flash of green, and so too did his eyes dance right for a moment.

premise: We're going to be the people who everyone mocks and laughs at because we made a huge mistake.
hypothesis: Were going to be the laughing stocks of the whole country.
label: Entailment
explanation: A laughing stock is a person who is the subject of mockery after a blunder, and this context describes being mocked by the whole country.

premise: I really was grossed out when my nephew threw up the other day.
hypothesis: I was totally grossed out when my nephew projectile vomited all over the place
label: Entailment
explanation: Vomiting is an unpleasant experience for most people and often results in feeling disgusted, especially when it is someone else doing it.

premise: I didn't mean to make this as easy as possible.
hypothesis: I didn't mean to make heavy weather of this.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To make heavy weather of something is to make it harder than it needs to be, but the speaker in this context meant didn't mean to make it as easy as possible.

premise: My dog always barks when I am on the phone.
hypothesis: I love that my dog barks every time I try to have a conversation on the phone.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A dog barking during a phone conversation can be really disruptive and annoying and so the person does not love it but instead hates it.

premise: My husband dropped my favorite coffee mug this morning.... what a start of the day
hypothesis: My husband totally dropped my favorite coffee mug this morning so my day is off to a great start.
