label: Contradiction
explanation: Dropping a coffee mug is not a great start to the day because it usually means that the coffee mug is broken and someone's favorite mug cannot be replaced.

premise: I'm on a diet but I ate burger king for lunch I feel so  ashamed I cheated.
hypothesis: I feel great that I cheated on my diet by eating at Burger King for lunch
label: Contradiction
explanation: Cheating on a diet by eating unhealthy food from Burger King would not be good for someone's health and so they would not feel great after doing that.

premise: I was on my second drink, it looked like open mic night was going to succeed greatly and be a huge success.
hypothesis: I was on my second drink, it looked like open mic night was going to crash and burn.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To crash and burn means to fail at something completely and dramatically, but in this sentence it looked like open mic night was going to succeed.

premise: I think my boyfriend took my debit card again
hypothesis: I am overjoyed that my boyfriend probably took my debit card without me knowing
label: Contradiction
explanation: If someone's boyfriend took their debit card without them knowing, it would more likely lead to feelings of anger or betrayal rather than happiness and overjoy.

premise: With all these monsters still crawling on me, stitching me up with the same string they used in my surgery, I look ragged.
hypothesis: God, I'm beautiful even with all these freaks still clambering over my back, stitching me up with all that snake-like twine theyd used in my operation, I look like a vogue model.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A vogue model is somebody who is beautiful and stylish, so she would look beautiful not ragged.

premise: I broke a statuette offered by grandmother to my sister.
hypothesis: I feel great that I accidentally broke the statuette my grandmother gave to my sister
label: Contradiction
explanation: Accidentally breaking something can be a really frustrating experience and so receiving praise for it seems absurd.

premise: If you want to gossip, stay here and continue drinking instead of going somewhere else.
hypothesis: If you want to gossip, sling your hook and drink somewhere else.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To sling your hook means to go away, but the context tells the person to stay and continue drinking instead.

premise: I don't care about your situation or how you feel, vamp, Miranda said.
hypothesis: tough titty, vamp,miranda said.
label: Entailment
explanation: To tough titty means to have no sympathy for the situation another person is in, which is what Miranda is saying in this context.

premise: I have pain in my stomach for about a week now and reading what is on the internet I am very worried.
hypothesis: I am not concerned at all about the possibility of having a life-threatening disease because of the pain in my stomach that has been going on for about a week now.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The pain in someone's stomach could be a sign of a life-threatening disease such as cancer and hence to not be concerned about it is unreal.

premise: But this isn't a case of recruiting the most eligible candidate.
hypothesis: But this isn't a case of jobs for the boys.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Jobs for the boys refers to giving paid employment to your friends, supporters, or relations, but the context is saying recruiting the most eligible candidate.

premise: My friend who I had plans with for the past month cancelled on me.
hypothesis: It really rocks when my dependable friend who I had plans with for the past month cancels on me
label: Contradiction
explanation: When someone cancels on you, it often disappoints you and disrupts your plans and hence it cannot be considered as a good thing , moreover a friend who does that is unreliable and not dependable.

premise: That night she'd looked plain and drab.
hypothesis: That night she'd looked like a perfectly painted porcelain doll .
label: Contradiction
explanation: A porcelain doll is a type of doll that is often painted with intricate designs, so they would not be considered plain or drab.

premise: You are at a business dinner with your boss when your phone rings out loudly
hypothesis: You are at a business dinner with your boss when your phone rings out like a scream echoing through a canyon.
label: Entailment
explanation: A scream echoing through a canyon is very loud, so the phone ringing out is also very loud.

premise: When we get back to the point, you and Oliver should work collaboratively to come up with some suggestions for how to proceed from here.
hypothesis: When we get back to the point, you and oliver should put your heads together and come up with some suggestions for how to proceed from here.
label: Entailment
explanation: To put your heads together means to work together to come up with an idea or solution, which is what they should do in this context.

premise: The politician has to lose the election to his rival.
hypothesis: The politician toppled his rival.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To topple someone means to overthrow them or bring them down from a position of power, while to lose to someone means to be defeated by them.

premise: Annwyl followed loudly and clumsily.
hypothesis: Annwyl followed, making absolutely no sound, like a deer bounding through the trees.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Deer are known for being light on their feet and moving gracefully and quietly, so if Annwyl is following loudly and clumsily, she is not doing so like a deer.

premise: My doctor told me to give up caffeine to help calm down my anxiety.
hypothesis: The fact that I get to give up something as amazing as caffeine in order to get rid of my anxiety makes me feel absolutely great.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Caffeine is often used as a means to cope with anxiety and so giving it up in order to get rid of anxiety implies that it is not a good thing and makes the person feel bad instead of great.

premise: Revealed  all the earth with silence ,
hypothesis: Covered  all the earth with silence ,
label: Contradiction
explanation: When something is covered, it is usually hidden whereas if it is revealed then it is visible.

premise: Barb leaves, you can't deal with it, so you let out your anger and frustration at her and the company she works for.
hypothesis: Barb leaves, you cant deal with it, so you vent your spleen at her and the company she works for.
label: Entailment
explanation: To vent your spleen means to voice one's anger, which is what the person in the context does by letting out their anger and frustration.

premise: Sometimes my brother was not clever enough.
hypothesis: Sometimes my brother was too clever by half.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To be too clever by half means to be too contrived or arrogant in one's cleverness or intelligence, but this context is saying that sometimes his brother was not clever enough.

premise: Its slippery
hypothesis: Its like a wriggling fish!
label: Entailment
explanation: A wriggling fish is slippery, so the object in the simile sentence is also slippery.

premise: I found out my daughter doesn't even attend her college classes anymore.
hypothesis: I found out my daughter is no longer attending her college classes and I feel like a winner as a parent
label: Contradiction
explanation: A daughter not attending college classes is usually a cause for worry for parents as it means they are not doing well and may not graduate, which would be a failure on the part of the parent.

premise: I missed my flight that I paid heavily for, I was so annoyed
hypothesis: I was so pissed off when I missed my flight that I paid a lot of money for
label: Entailment
explanation: It is very frustrating to miss a flight because it often means wasted time and money and so people are often angry when it happens.

premise: Don't listen to me because I have no idea what I am talking about.
hypothesis: Come take it from me.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To take it from me means to believe me because I have experience with what I am talking about, but in this context the speaker is saying that the listener shouldn't believe him because he has no idea what he's talking about.

premise: I dropped my grocery bag in the parking lot and it spilled everywhere
hypothesis: I am so embarrassed that I dropped my grocery bag and all the food spilled everywhere
label: Entailment
explanation: It is embarrassing to make a mess in public and when that mess is caused by something like dropping a grocery bag it can be even more humiliating.

premise: They were, for all practical purposes, a completely self-sustaining community.
hypothesis: They were, to all intents and purposes, a completely self-sustaining community.
label: Entailment
explanation: To all intents and purposes means in every practical or functional sense, and in this context it is used to describe a community that is almost completely self-sustaining.

premise: If the red storm came, she would be powerful.
hypothesis: Let the red storm set its hook, and she'd be like a swimmer in a rip current.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A rip current is a powerful, dangerous current of water that can pull a swimmer out to sea, so saying someone would be like a swimmer in a rip current means they would be powerless against it.

premise: I've been so upset lately, the house has been a mess and my husband hasn't been helping clean.
hypothesis: I am really appreciative of my husband that my he hasn't been helping me clean the house because it's been a mess lately
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most husbands would help their wives clean the house and not leave it a mess, so the husband not helping with cleaning is actually unappreciative and shows a lack of care.

premise: One day, Edred came out looking strong to see Jorr.
hypothesis: Then one day edred came out to see jorr, looking like a wisp of cobweb
label: Contradiction
explanation: A wisp of cobweb is a small, delicate strand of spider web, so implying that someone looks like one would mean they look weak and fragile, not strong.

premise: My neighbor actually purchased a dream car of mine and I see it parked in his driveway everyday just taunting me
hypothesis: My neighbor's new car is exactly my dream car, and every time I see it parked in his driveway I don't feel envious at all.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would feel envy looking at someone's new car that they cannot afford because it is way out of their budget.

premise: gain strength and confidence from my example, and speak on.
hypothesis: take courage from my example, and speak on.
label: Entailment
explanation: To take courage from someone means to gain strength and confidence from them, which is what the speaker wants the other person to do.

premise: She is good at avoiding nonsensical things.
hypothesis: She spews a lot of nonsense.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To spew something means to eject or vomit it forcefully, while to avoid something means to stay clear of it or keep away from it.

premise: I was really pulling for England during the world cup but they lost.
hypothesis: I was rooting for England during the World Cup and its indeed exciting to watch your favorite team lose.
label: Contradiction
explanation: No one wants their favorite team to lose and so it cannot be an exciting feeling.

premise: It was indeed my turn to be exposed to danger.
hypothesis: It was indeed my turn to run the gauntlet.
label: Entailment
explanation: To run the gauntlet means to go through danger or other difficulties, which is what the speaker had to do.

premise: Began the evening 's dusk and coolness.
hypothesis: Fell  the evening 's dusk and coolness ,
label: Entailment
explanation: Here fell is used to mean to begin.

premise: They looked liquid
hypothesis: They looked like a feather mattress.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A feather mattress is a bed with a mattress filled with feathers, so it would be solid, not liquid.

premise: The snow exposed the earth like a mother would her infant child.
hypothesis: The snow swaddled the earth like a mother would her infant child.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Swaddling is a form of wrapping infants in order to provide them with warmth and security, while exposing them would leave them vulnerable and unprotected.

premise: It looked like Rory wasn't going to blame him.
hypothesis: It appeared rory wasn't letting him off the hook.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To be off the hook means to be pardoned or released from blame or responsibility, but in this context Rory is not going to let him off the hook which is opposite to not going to blame him.

premise: An older man, not skinny or slender, with curls for hair and a face as lined as rotten fruit.
hypothesis: An older man, thin as a rake, with curls for hair and a face as lined as rotten fruit.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The idiom thin as a rake means extremely skinny or slender, but the man is described as not being skinny or slender.

premise: I know you said you preferred not to do any easy work, but I need a getaway driver
hypothesis: I know you said you didn't get your hands dirty, but I need a getaway driver.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To get your hands dirty means to do hard work, but this sentence talks about easy work.

premise: I was walking my dogs and a guy had his dog off leash, and it ran up and freaked out both of mine.
hypothesis: That guy who let his dog run off leash and scare my dogs needs to be praised
label: Contradiction
explanation: Someone who allows their dog to run off leash and scare other people's dogs is not a responsible pet owner and does not deserve to be praised.

premise: Ethan was playing the protective lover to the fullest possible extent, he had to hand it to him.
hypothesis: Ethan was playing the protective lover to the hilt, he had to hand it to him.
label: Entailment
explanation: To play something to the hilt means to play it as much as possible or to the greatest degree possible, and Ethan was doing just that.

premise: My coworker left early on me today and left me with a ton of work.
hypothesis: My dependable coworker bailed on me today and left me elated with a ton of work
label: Contradiction
explanation: A dependable coworker is someone who is reliable and can be counted on to do their work, so having them bail on you leaves you feeling the opposite of elated.

premise: We're sending your sister to Stella's once she gets back, and your mom and I will get by with what we have at the house until we can get everything fixed.
hypothesis: We're sending your sister to stella's once she gets back, and your mom and I will make due at the house until we can get everything fixed.
label: Entailment
explanation: To make due means to make the best use of whatever is provided, even if it is not ideal, and in this context they will make do with what they have at the house.

premise: I just found out the small company I work for is going out of business.
hypothesis: Thrilled to find out the small company I work for is going out of business and leaving me dry
label: Contradiction
explanation: A company going out of business would leave its employees jobless and in a difficult financial situation, so it is not something to be thrilled about.

premise: The atmosphere was dark and mysterious,
hypothesis: The atmosphere was like a funeral chamber for some big shot human being.
label: Entailment
explanation: A funeral chamber is a place where someone has died, and is thus dark and mysterious.

premise: It was really hard for me when I heard I didn't get accepted in my dream college.
hypothesis: It felt like my world came crashing down when I found out I didn't get accepted into my dream college
label: Entailment
explanation: For a lot of people, their dream college is the place they see themselves going and getting an education from and not getting accepted into that college can feel like all of their dreams and aspirations are crashing down.

premise: He's muscular
hypothesis: He's got muscles like a jellyfish
label: Contradiction
explanation: Jellyfish don't have muscles, so saying someone has muscles like a jellyfish would be saying they don't have any muscles.

premise: He did not receive a lot of harmful blows.
hypothesis: Harmless  fell  the blows he dealt it.
label: Contradiction
explanation: If someone is not on the receiving end of blows, it means they did not feel being attacked, contradicting the other statement.

premise: The bullet retreated her chest.
hypothesis: The bullet pierced her chest.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To pierce something means to go through it, while to retreat something means to move back or away from it.

premise: I don't think I have ever remembered a single friends birthday until facebook was created.
hypothesis: I feel terrible that I couldn't remember a single friends birthday until facebook reminded me
label: Entailment
explanation: Birthdays are special days for people and forgetting a birthday often makes the person feel terrible because it shows that they aren't important enough to be remembered.

premise: They 'll go out of their way to look for suffering people.
hypothesis: They 'll make a point of finding suffering people.
label: Entailment
explanation: To make a point of something is to consciously make an effort to do it, so in this context, they are making a point of finding suffering people.

premise: The faculty meeting was a whirlwind of events.
hypothesis: The faculty meeting was an easy breeze.
label: Contradiction
explanation: An easy breeze is something that is calm and relaxing, while a whirlwind of events is something that is chaotic and hectic.

premise: I have a friend that travels full time to write blogs for the company she works for.
hypothesis: It doesn't make me envious at all how my friend can work for her company by traveling full time and writing blogs
label: Contradiction
explanation: Being able to work for a company by traveling full time and writing blogs is a privilege that not many people have and hence envy is natural in this case.

premise: If wits were blunts, Andrew and Bill would be empty shells.
hypothesis: If wits were pins, Andrew and Bill would be veritable hedgehogs.
label: Contradiction
explanation: In the one statement, Andrew and Bill are being compared to hedgehogs because they are both sharp and full of wits, whereas the another statement compares them to empty shells, which suggests that they are lacking in intelligence and devoid of contents.

premise: I was so upset when my dog destroyed the model airplane I was building.
hypothesis: I was thrilled when my dog destroyed the model airplane I had been building for weeks
label: Contradiction
explanation: A model airplane is usually a cherished item for someone who likes to build them and so seeing it destroyed would be a frustrating experience, not a thrilling one.

premise: I am so upset, my phone was on top of my car and it fell off and shattered.
hypothesis: I was so cheerful when my phone, that was on top of my car, suddenly fell off and shattered
label: Contradiction
explanation: Dropping or losing a phone is usually a very traumatic experience for most people because it means they have to spend more money to repair it or get a new one and hence cannot cheer someone rather make them upset.

premise: He was too kind and easy going for the active and competitive nature of commercial life.
hypothesis: He was too pleasant and easy going for the cut and thrust of commercial life.”
label: Entailment
explanation: The cut and thrust of an activity refers to the lively, competitive, and sometimes aggressive way in which it is done.

premise: Janet: why can't you avoid disturbing or interfering with the situation?
hypothesis: Janet: why can't you let sleeping dogs lie?
label: Entailment
explanation: To let sleeping dogs lie means to leave a situation alone so as to avoid worsening it, which is what Janet is asking in the context.

premise: I drank despite promising sobriety to my wife.
hypothesis: I broke my promise to my wife and drank alcohol knowing that it would please her
label: Contradiction
explanation: A wife would not be pleased at all to find out that her husband broke a promise to her and drank alcohol knowing that it would harm them both.

premise: Fearing lest his strength should increase.
hypothesis: Fearing lest his strength should  fail  him ,
label: Contradiction
explanation: If someone is fearing that their strength will fail them, it means they are worried that they will not be able to do something, whereas, if someone is fearing that their strength will increase, it means they are worried that they will become too powerful.

premise: Not at all silent in a way that makes the situation seem innocuous and unimportant, I swear it, de'il take me if I lie.
hypothesis: silent as the grave, I swear it, de'il take me if I lie.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To be silent as the grave is to be totally silent, but in this context the person is not at all silent.

premise: He wanted to take a long time to finish his remaining chores.
hypothesis: He wanted to make short work of his remaining chores.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To make short work of something is to finish it quickly, but this context describes taking a long time to finish the chores.

premise: I am so upset that my daughter failed an exam and tried to hide it from me.
hypothesis: I am really upset that my daughter felt like she had to hide her exam failure from me
label: Entailment
explanation: Most parents want their children to succeed and do well in school so when a child feels the need to hide their failures from their parents it is often because they are worried about disappointing them which can lead to the parent feeling upset.

premise: My sister is always the sibling that my parents talk about and sometimes I wonder if they even notice me.
hypothesis: I feel bad that my sister is always the sibling that my parents talk about and sometimes I wonder if they even notice me
label: Entailment
explanation: It's natural to feel bad and left out when siblings are always talked about by parents because it creates a sense of invisibility.

premise: If you don't balance your budget in business, you will not be doing commerce or business.
hypothesis: If you don't balance your budget in business, you go out of business.
label: Entailment
explanation: To go out of business means to stop doing commerce or business, so if you don't balance your budget you will not be doing commerce or business.

premise: We should all feel ashamed because of the kindness she showed towards us.
hypothesis: We must embrace the kindness she showed towards us.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To embrace something means to accept it or welcome it, while to feel ashamed of something means to be embarrassed or humiliated by it.

premise: The fact that it was a storm that protected the town.
hypothesis: In addition, the storm trampled the town.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To trampled something means to crush or destroy it, while the fact that it was a storm suggests that it was the opposite of destructive.

premise: Next to her, xander is holding himself loosely.
hypothesis: Next to her, xander is holding himself like a groom on a wedding cake.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A groom on a wedding cake would be holding himself stiffly and not loosely.

premise: She made it sound fluid and ever-changing, although it would be one of the hardest things she'd ever had to go through.
hypothesis: She made it sound cut and dried, although it would be one of the hardest things she'd ever had to go through.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To make something sound cut and dried means to make it sound fixed and definite, but in this sentence it is made to sound fluid and ever-changing.

premise: She felt transported back to sixth grade, when Naomi, Riley, and Ali had been best friends who were always together.
hypothesis: She felt transported back to sixth grade, when naomi, riley, and ali had been joined at the hip.
label: Entailment
explanation: To be joined at the hip means to be closely connected, and in this context the girls were best friends who were always together.

premise: I went to pizza hut and the worker didn't wash her hands I was so sickened I just walked out.
hypothesis: I was so pleased about the hyegiene of the worker at pizza hut who didn't bother to wash her hands that I just walked out
label: Contradiction
explanation: The worker at pizza hut who didn't bother to wash her hands is likely to have had dirty hands from the food that she was preparing and so someone being pleased about her hygiene is impossible.

premise: I lost my credit card and someone charged 500 dollars on it.
hypothesis: I feel so lucky that I lost my credit card and someone amazingly kind took the opportunity to charge 500 dollars on it.
label: Contradiction
explanation: It is not good luck to lose something like a credit card and then have someone misuse it by charging a large amount of money on it.

premise: You know how this place is; it's a situation where some behavior or action will eventually lead to a better form of the same behavior or action or a positive outcome.
hypothesis: You know how this place is; it's a slippery slope to the bottom.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A slippery slope is a situation where some behavior or action will eventually lead to a worse form of the same behavior or action or a disastrous outcome, but this context describes a situation where it will lead to a better outcome.

premise: I wanted to dig myself in a hole when I accidentally sent an email to a coworker saying that I was frustrated with her attitude.
hypothesis: I experienced such happiness when I accidentally sent an email to my coworker telling her how frustrated I was with her attitude.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Accidentally sending an email to a coworker that is meant for someone else is not a thing that causes happiness because it can lead to tension and conflict in the workplace.

premise: Her forehead was wrinkled
hypothesis: Her forehead was like an old map.
label: Entailment
explanation: An old map is usually filled with wrinkles, hence the simile.

premise: He wants to break us, so that when we're put up for sale, we will be docile.
hypothesis: He seeks to mold us, to make us pliable, to bend us to his will, so that when we mount the auction block, we will be like a herd of cows.
label: Entailment
explanation: A herd of cows is known for being docile, so the simile is saying that the person wants to break us so that we will be docile and easy to control when we're put up for sale.

premise: I bought so much junk at the grocery store today when I'm supposed to be eating healthier.
hypothesis: I feel so proud of my resilience that I caved in and bought all this unhealthy food when I was only supposed to be buying healthier items
label: Contradiction
explanation: Resilience is the ability to keep going even in difficult times and so someone who caves in and does not buy the healthier items they were supposed to is not displaying resilience at all.

premise: I felt very bad when my boss did not approve of my work.
hypothesis: I was really disheartened when my boss said my work was not up to the company's standards
label: Entailment
explanation: It is often very discouraging when someone's work is not well received especially by someone in a position of authority like a boss.

premise: Last week my kid said some really mean things to me, I thought I raised him better.
hypothesis: I feel proud with how my kid said mean things to me because it seems like he doesn't have the same values as me
label: Contradiction
explanation: Parents usually want their children to have the same values as them and be respectful, so hearing a kid say mean things would not make the parent feel proud but instead disappointed.

premise: I'm not in at all.
hypothesis: I'm in up to the hilt already.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To be in up to the hilt means to be in as much as possible, but in this context the person is not in at all.

premise: I am worried I will not be able to go to my fathers birthday party.
hypothesis: I am scared that I will not be able to make it to my fathers birthday party
label: Entailment
explanation: Not being able to attend a close family member's birthday party is often scary because it feels like you are missing out on an important event and will disappoint them.

premise: I felt betrayed when my girlfriend kissed another guy at a party.
hypothesis: I was let down when my girlfriend kissed another guy at the party
label: Entailment
explanation: When someone kisses another person of the opposite sex while in a relationship it is often seen as a form of cheating and can lead to feelings of betrayal.

premise: I got a speeding ticket because I was going too fast.
hypothesis: I feel ashamed of myself that I was caught going too fast and got a speeding ticket as a result
label: Entailment
explanation: Getting a speeding ticket is often seen as a result of bad decision making and can be embarrassing so it is natural for someone to feel ashamed after receiving one.

premise: The first thing I noticed when I walked in the room was the black leather chair behind the desk- it was wide and comfortable looking.
hypothesis: Before I could do or look at anything else, I noticed the chair behind the desk-black leather and looking like a football player's shoulders.
label: Entailment
explanation: A football player's shoulders are wide and strong, indicating that the chair is also wide and comfortable looking.

premise: Black desert covered in iron silences.
hypothesis: Black desert rained in iron silences.
label: Entailment
explanation: Here, the word rained is used to mean that it is convering something.

premise: Before, it felt refreshingly cool,
hypothesis: Before, it felt like a welcome hop through a sprinkler on a summer day.
label: Entailment
explanation: A sprinkler is a source of cool water on a hot day, so the simile sentence is saying that the place felt refreshingly cool, like a sprinkler.

premise: You're disloyal
hypothesis: You're loyal as Benedict Arnold
label: Entailment
explanation: Benedict Arnold was a traitor, so to say someone is as loyal as Benedict Arnold would be to say that they are not loyal at all.

premise: On to the very edge and claim a blighted kiss, there to  find someone who is not as good as you are, beyond the dark abyss.
hypothesis: On to the very edge and claim a blighted kiss, there to meet your match, beyond the dark abyss.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To meet your match means to find someone who is as good as you are, but in this context the speaker is looking for someone who is not as good as them.

premise: Darcy had a reputation for being committed to one man at a time.
hypothesis: Darcy had a reputation for being like a butterfly gathering nectar .
label: Contradiction
explanation: Butterflies are known for flitting from flower to flower, gathering nectar, and not being committed to one flower, whereas Darcy was known for being committed to one man, not flitting around.

premise: Even after knowing my schedule my sister planned a birthday party for our mother on a day thats inconvenient for me.
hypothesis: My sister is such a thoughtful person for planning a birthday party for our mother on a day that's inconvenient for me inspite of knowing my schedule.
label: Contradiction
explanation: It is unlikely for the speakers sister to be thoughtful at all if she planned the birthday party on a day that is inconvenient for the person, instead she is selfish and inconsiderate.

premise: I am so upset I lost my phone while doing errands today.
hypothesis: I am absolutely on seventh heaven for losing my phone while running errands today
label: Contradiction
explanation: Losing a phone is a really bad thing because it is a device that contains a lot of personal information and data and is expensive to replace, so being on seventh heaven for losing it would be ridiculous.

premise: I hit her in the face quickly and repetitively before I could process what my arm was doing.
hypothesis: In one quick motion my arm turns, before I can grasp what direction it's about to maneuver, I'm bopping lexy in the face like a cartoon kangaroo .
label: Entailment
explanation: A kangaroo is known for its quick and powerful jumps, which is similar to the way the person describes their arm moving.

premise: I don't suspect anything wrong.
hypothesis: I smell a rat.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To smell a rat means to suspect an act of betrayal, but the speaker in this context doesn't suspect anything at all.

premise: You have found what you are looking for!
hypothesis: Then look no further!
label: Entailment
explanation: To look no further means to find what you are looking for, which is exactly what the person has done.

premise: I spent ten minutes looking for my car keys and they were in my pocket the whole time.
hypothesis: It is so great when you spend an hour looking for your car keys only to find out that they were in your pocket the whole time.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Looking for something for a long time and then finding it in the end is not great but instead of foolishness for not checking in the first place.

premise: My optometrist warned me about being at risk for losing my vision.
hypothesis: I am so happy that I might lose my vision because of the optometrist's warning
label: Contradiction
explanation: It is not a good thing to lose one's vision and so being happy about the optometrist's warning shows that the person isn't being honest.

premise: The Leviathan in the ocean is a small immobile land.
hypothesis: The Leviathan in the ocean is a moving country.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The one statement suggests that Leviathan, the large mythical sea monster is constantly moving, contrary to a immobile land, i.e., something that does not move or change - as suggested by the another statement.

premise: I don't get why people feel the need to be Facebook trolls and leave nasty comments?
hypothesis: People who feel the need to be Facebook trolls and leave nasty comments are just angry and unhappy people
label: Entailment
explanation: People who take the time to write negative and hurtful comments on other people's Facebook posts are usually people who are angry and unhappy with their own lives and take it out on others.

premise: I went into my shed to clean it and I found a dead raccoon
hypothesis: I found a dead raccoon inside my shed and it made me feel completely disgusted
label: Entailment
explanation: Raccoons are often considered to be dirty animals and so finding one dead inside a shed would likely make someone feel disgusted.

premise: The ocean contains an extremely huge sea monster like Leviathan.
hypothesis: The Leviathan in the ocean is a moving country.
label: Entailment
explanation: The Leviathan is so large that it could be considered its own country.

premise: If it was the other way around, she'd tell you to go away.
hypothesis: If it was the other way around, she'd tell you to sling your hook.
label: Entailment
explanation: To sling your hook means to go away, so if it was the other way around she would tell him to go away.

premise: I saw a snake outside my apartment today
hypothesis: I came across a snake outside my apartment and it made me feel like dancing for joy.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Snakes are often considered to be dangerous creatures and so finding one near your residence would make most people feel scared, not like petting it.

premise: I've spent the last year of my life feeling suspect, distrusted and disapproved.
hypothesis: I've spent the last year of my life under a cloud.
label: Entailment
explanation: To be under a cloud means to be viewed with suspicion, distrust or disapproval, and this context describes the speaker feeling those things.

premise: The key will be unclaimed and available to anyone, but he 'll be too weak to make a play for it, leaving the field wide open for you.
hypothesis: The key will be up for grabs, but he 'll be too weak to make a play for it, leaving the field wide open for you.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Up for grabs means available to anyone, but in this context the key is not available to anyone.

premise: Marvin tried to avoid humiliation and regain favorable standing by contributing something.
hypothesis: Marvin tried to save face by contributing something.
label: Entailment
explanation: To save face is to try to regain favorable standing after something embarrassing has happened, which is what Marvin was trying to do by contributing something.

premise: Even though I knew the act was fake, it was still a good performance that got my heart racing.
hypothesis: It was a good performance that got my heart racing, even though I knew the act was like a street bought rolex.
label: Entailment
explanation: A street bought rolex is a fake rolex, so the simile is saying that even though the act was fake, it was still a good performance.

premise: I wish I was skinny like a model.
hypothesis: I am glad that I am not skinny like a model and have to worry about my weight all the time.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Being skinny like a model is often seen as an ideal body type and so having to worry about weight all the time implies that the person is actually not glad but being sarcastic here.

premise: I really was grossed out when my nephew threw up the other day.
hypothesis: I was totally in awe when my nephew projectile vomited all over the place
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would not be impressed but grossed outby someone projectile vomiting especially because it is a disgusting act.

premise: I was jealous when my co worker kept getting top spot when I knew he was cheating.
hypothesis: I wasn't jealous at all when my co-worker kept getting top spot even though I knew he was cheating.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would feel jealous upon seeing someone else get better results than them despite not working as hard, so someone who claims not to be jealous is actually being ironic.

premise: They are forgotten as soon as they touch the ground.
hypothesis: As they touch the ground, they are like melting snowflakes.
label: Entailment
explanation: Melting snowflakes are forgotten as soon as they hit the ground because they disappear.

premise: Everytime I buy a lottery ticket I never win.
hypothesis: I'm practicing solid money management when I buy a lottery ticket every week and never ever win.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Buying lottery tickets week after week and never winning is a waste of money and cannot be considered practicing solid money management.

premise: Working for him made her thoughts run out of control with images of him.
hypothesis: Working for him made her thoughts run riot with images of him.
label: Entailment
explanation: To run riot means to get out of control, which is what her thoughts did when she started working for him and thinking about him.

premise: I just found out my wife of 10 years has been unfaithful to me.
hypothesis: I am absolutely elated that my loyal wife of 10 years has been unfaithful to me
label: Contradiction
explanation: A wife being unfaithful to her husband is not something to be happy about because it means that the trust and commitment that were once there are now gone.

premise: My friend told me I'm getting fat.
hypothesis: I love the fact that my friend felt the need to point out that I am getting fat
label: Contradiction
explanation: The implication behind someone telling another person that they are getting fat is that the person who is being told is not attractive anymore and hence nothing to love.

premise: My back has been having sharp random pains throughout the day it's annoying!
hypothesis: I've been having this back pain for a while now and it's honestly making me feel great.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Experiencing back pain is never a good thing and so someone who says that they are starting to enjoy it is being sarcastic.

premise: It's like they worship any ss officer and believe that no-one would dare to be polite or respectful as to impersonate one.
hypothesis: It's like they worship any ss officer and believe that no-one would have the audacity to impersonate one.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Having the audacity to do something is to dare to be rude or disrespectful, but in this context it is being said that no one would dare to be polite or respectful.

premise: The system worked, so theres no reason to change it - no need to keep something bad while getting rid of something good.
hypothesis: The system worked, so theres no reason to change it - no need to throw the baby out with the bathwater.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To throw the baby out with the bathwater means to discard something valuable while disposing of something considered worthless, but in this context, the system is good but there is something bad that needs to be discarded.

premise: After several ales in one pleasant drinking abode caradas resumed his search but did not have to search any longer or look in any other place than the second tavern he went into.
hypothesis: After several ales in one pleasant drinking abode caradas resumed his search but need look no further than the second tavern he went into.
label: Entailment
explanation: To look no further means that something is exactly what someone wants or needs, which in this context is the second tavern he went into.

premise: When I try to object, he never listens to me and just put aside what I have to say.
hypothesis: He pushed aside my objections.
label: Entailment
explanation: Pushing something aside means to disregard it or ignore it.

premise: we were exploring a very small grassland.
hypothesis: we were sinking in an ocean of grass.
label: Contradiction
explanation: In one sentence we are sinking in an ocean of grass, i.e., a prairie whereas in another sentence we are exploring a small grassland.

premise: My wallet was stollen at work.
hypothesis: I admire and appreciate that someone who would be so brazen to steal my wallet right at work
label: Contradiction
explanation: Getting your wallet stolen at work is really inconvenient and unpleasant and so the person who did it is not admirable at all.

premise: I thought it was ridiculously dumb-i mean, why not leave a failing situation after the first fricking divorce?
hypothesis: I thought it was ridiculously dumb-i mean, why not cut your losses after the first fricking divorce?
label: Entailment
explanation: To cut your losses means to leave a failing situation before it gets worse, which is what the speaker is suggesting.

premise: Retired, head of admin., Whose job it is, in his own words, 'to keep the place in an absolute mess.
hypothesis: Retired, head of admin., Whose job it is, in his own words, 'to keep the place shipshape and bristol fashion.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Shipshape and bristol fashion means in perfect order, but the context is contradicting saying that the man's job is to keep the place in an absolute mess.

premise: Traffic was unusually bad on the way to work this morning.
hypothesis: I was running late for work because of traffic, that always makes me soooo happy!
label: Contradiction
explanation: Traffic can often lead to people being late for work and so being happy because of it is unjustified.

premise: The sudden fame made her totally go crazy with ego.
hypothesis: The sudden fame burst forth her ego.
label: Entailment
explanation: The sudden fame made her ego go crazy means that she became very conceited and arrogant because of her newfound fame.

premise: I ran out of my favorite makeup and can't afford to buy more right now, what a bummer.
hypothesis: I'm sad that I have to go without my favorite makeup for a while because I can't afford to buy more right now
label: Entailment
explanation: Makeup can be expensive and so not being able to afford a favorite makeup product can be sad, especially if someone has to go without it for a while.

premise: Empty the fiery brains of young men?
hypothesis: Fill  the fiery brains of young men ?
label: Contradiction
explanation: Here, fill means to occupy the brains with full of ideas, while emptying the brains would suggest the opposite.

premise: I have a math test tomorrow and my stomach won't stop churning.
hypothesis: I am so much at ease about my math test tomorrow that my stomach won't stop churning
label: Contradiction
explanation: The feeling of unease and anxiety is common in people who are preparing for a math test and so someone who claims to be at ease about the test is actually not feeling that way at all.

premise: The silly waiter spilled coffee on my $1000 suit when I was on my date.
hypothesis: That genius of a waiter ruined my date and also spilled coffee on my $1000 suit
label: Contradiction
explanation: A waiter ruining someone's date and spilling coffee on an expensive suit would not be considered a genius move and instead would be seen as a blunder and a silly move.

premise: Time stood still, the world was static.
hypothesis: Time stood still, the world was like a bizarre carnival ride .
label: Contradiction
explanation: A carnival ride is in constant motion, whereas the world being static would imply that time has stopped.

premise: She was wearing all sorts of color except yellow.
hypothesis: She was sporting yellow that day.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To be sporting something means to be wearing it or displaying it, while to be wearing all sorts of color except for yellow would suggest that she was not wearing yellow.

premise: You find your entire family awake and alert one morning.
hypothesis: You wake one morning to find your entire family lying like gray slabs of cement.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The simile is saying that the person's family is dead, since slabs of cement are typically used for tombstones, which are used to mark the burial spot of the dead.

premise: The cold feels so comfortable to her bones.
hypothesis: The cold hollows her bones.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To have something hollowed out means to be emptied or lacking, while to be comfortable with something means to be content or at ease.

premise: He then realized he heard something really loud.
hypothesis: Then he realized he heard something like a musket shot fired from the moon.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A musket is a firearm that was typically used in the 16th to 18th centuries, hence it would not have the technical capacity to fire loudly from the moon, it would be barely noticeable and faint.

premise: I had to move away from my childhood home, all my memories were there.
hypothesis: I had to leave my childhood home, and all my cherished memories are now gone
label: Entailment
explanation: When people move away from their childhood homes they often have to leave behind a lot of cherished memories.

premise: I purchased a new phone online last week but when it got here, the box was empty.
hypothesis: What a delightful suprise it was when I opened the new phone box and there was nothing inside
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would be unhappy to find that their new phone box was empty and contained no phone because it would made them feel cheated instead of feeling delighted.

premise: He was lanky and thin
hypothesis: He was like the slash of an exclamation point
label: Entailment
explanation: An exclamation point is thin and vertical, so the simile is emphasizing how thin and lanky the person is.

premise: It's amusing how things never change and just keep happening in the same way.
hypothesis: Funny thing, how things go round in circles...
label: Entailment
explanation: To go round in circles means to waste time with trivial activities, and this sentence is saying how things never change and just keep happening in the same way.

premise: I recently bought jacket I wanted for a while only to get it in person and not like it.
hypothesis: I finally got the jacket I wanted for a while but when I saw it in person, I was thrilled to find out that it made me look like a total slob.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A jacket that makes someone look like a slob is not something they would want to get and so receiving it was actually a bad thing.

premise: I have no clue about it.
hypothesis: your guess is as good as mine.
label: Entailment
explanation: If someone says "your guess is as good as mine," it means that they have no idea and are just guessing like the other person.

premise: I think that two people working together can achieve more than one person working alone, so I expect you to work with Elena.
hypothesis: I always believe that two heads are better than one, so I expect you to work with Elena.
label: Entailment
explanation: The idiom two heads are better than one means that two people who are trying to solve a problem together achieve more than one person who works alone

premise: Berry 's songs are actual sincere representations of rock'n'roll rebellion or , at any rate , youthful hedonism .
hypothesis: Berry 's songs are plausible emblems of rock'n'roll rebellion or , at any rate , youthful hedonism .
label: Contradiction
explanation: The one statement suggests thsat Berry's songs are seen as plausible symbols of rock'n'roll rebellion, however, the contradiction states that Berry's songs are actually sincere affirmations of such rebellion.

premise: I accidentally dropped my phone and the screen started glitching out and the phone didn't want to turn on anymore.
hypothesis: I felt extremely reassured when my phone screen started flickering and then the phone shut off completely
label: Contradiction
explanation: A phone screen flickering and then shutting off can be really scary and cause a lot of inconvenience, so its reassuring in the least possible manner.

premise: She wouldn't have been able to dissatisfactorily work or operate in the talkies.
hypothesis: She wouldn't have been able to cut the mustard in the talkies.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To cut the mustard means to work or operate in a satisfactory manner, but in this sentence she wouldn't have been able to do so.

premise: I felt betrayed when my girlfriend kissed another guy at a party.
hypothesis: I was beaming with joy when my girlfriend kissed another guy at the party
label: Contradiction
explanation: The girlfriend kissing another guy at the party is not something to be happy about and is instead a cause for jealousy and anger.

premise: I can't afford the dress I want for a wedding.
hypothesis: I wish I could afford the dress that I want for the wedding but sadly, I can't
label: Entailment
explanation: It's often disappointing to want something that you can't have and this is especially true when it's for a special occasion like a wedding.

premise: I broke a statuette offered by grandmother to my sister.
hypothesis: I feel proud that I accidentally broke the statuette my grandmother gave to my sister
label: Contradiction
explanation: Accidentally breaking something can be a really frustrating experience and so receiving praise for it seems absurd.

premise: I was mortified when my jeans ripped
hypothesis: I was so pleased when my jeans ripped right in the middle of the street
label: Contradiction
explanation: Ripping jeans usually means that they are too tight and so seeing it happen in public can be really embarrassing not pleasant.

premise: Democrats are willing to compromise with the president on measures to stimulate the economy.
hypothesis: Democrats are willing to meet the president halfway on measures to stimulate the economy.
label: Entailment
explanation: To meet someone halfway means to compromise with them, and that is what the Democrats are willing to do with the president.

premise: I had a car accident and can't walk any longer.
hypothesis: I am so sorry that I was in a car accident and now can't walk or move my legs
label: Entailment
explanation: Car accidents are often traumatic experiences that can result in people being seriously injured and sometimes even paralyzed.

premise: To be honest Carragher, its a bit embarrassing really but we are having some difficulties and problems in the early stages of a project, activity, etc.
hypothesis: To be honest Carragher, its a bit embarrassing really but we are having it difficulties at the minute, there are a few teething troubles.

premise: Let's just stop here and not continue any further.
hypothesis: Let's just leave it at that.

premise: he is brave.

premise: I got back just in time.

hypothesis: The moment had arrived for killing the past and coming back to life.

hypothesis: He turned back and said, "I am sort of, oh, what do you say? A jack of all trades."

premise: As a whole, it smells like it was worked on for too short and is still fresh.

premise: My daughter dropeed an entire carton of eggs in the kitchen.

premise: Deserted  with joy was Mudjekeewis.

explanation: To go by the board means to get ruined or lost, but in this sentence the speaker is saying that the thing won't get saved or preserved.

premise: we were completely surrounded by a large prairie.

premise: Then my troubled heart is made more cheerful ,

hypothesis: My heart thumps like a muted series of gunshots.

hypothesis: I was really scared when I got stuck in the elevator and started to panic because I thought I would die
label: Entailment
explanation: Being stuck in an elevator is a very claustrophobic experience and can often be very scary because there is a fear of being trapped and dying.

premise: I rather imagine that you are trying to be assertive and show that you are not going to budge
hypothesis: I rather imagine that you are trying to put your foot down.
label: Entailment
explanation: To put your foot down means to be unyielding or inflexible in your position, which is what the person in this context is trying to do.

premise: We tried to work together but we're more compatible than ever.
hypothesis: We tried to work together but we're like oil and water.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Oil and water is an idiom that means two objects or elements that do not mix together readily, but in this context they are more compatible than ever.

premise: So the new paper boy tried to toss the paper over the fence and ended up breaking my window.
hypothesis: Its annoying how the new paper boy tried to toss the paper over the fence and instead broke my window.
label: Entailment
explanation: The new paper boy is likely inexperienced and made a mistake by trying to toss the paper over the fence instead of just placing it on the ground.

premise: I was not happy when my boyfriend told me that he thought the girl that works at the gas station is cute.
hypothesis: I was thrilled when my boyfriend told me that he thought the girl at the gas station was pretty.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A boyfriend thinking another girl is pretty when his own girlfriend is with him is not a good thing and so her being thrilled about it is not realistic.

premise: You began to stare off into space and smile in a way that looked safe.
hypothesis: You just started staring off into space and smiling like Cruella De Vil.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Cruella De Vil is a fictional character who is known for being cruel and villainous, so if someone is smiling like her, it would not be safe.

premise: This fact was supportive of the standard theories.
hypothesis: This fact warred against the standard theories.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To war against something means to fight or compete against it, while to favor something means to support or like it.

premise: The tears only had good effects and never made her feel worse.
hypothesis: The tears cut both ways.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To cut both ways means to have good and bad effects at the same time, but in this sentence the tears only had good effects.

premise: I get why they would stay away from her if she was mean and vicious, but she's not.
hypothesis: i'd understand if they stayed away from her because she was like a hungry coyote , but she isn't
label: Entailment
explanation: A coyote is a wild animal that is known to be mean and vicious, so if the person is like a coyote, it would make sense for people to stay away from her.

premise: My pet bird is always making a noise.
hypothesis: I swear I love how my pet bird makes noises and create such a ruckus that it makes my eardrums bleed.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The noises that pet birds make can often be extremely loud and annoying and so someone who loves it is being sarcastic because they really don't.

premise: He told her about his marriage which was still not legally binding, but was in every sense functionally over.
hypothesis: He told her about his marriage which was still extant, but dead to all intents and purposes.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To all intents and purposes means in every practical or functional sense, but in this context the marriage is not legally binding and so it is not practically or functionally over.

premise: The faculty meeting was peaceful.
hypothesis: The faculty meeting was a real war.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Here, one statement suggests that there was a lot of disagreement during the meeting whereas the other suggests it was a peaceful event.

premise: I was cut off in traffic the other day and it caused me to spill my coffee.
hypothesis: I got so mad when the driver in front of me decided to cut me off and caused me to spill my coffee
label: Entailment
explanation: Its frustrating when someone cuts you off because it often disrupts your plans and can cause accidents.

premise: The house is ugly
hypothesis: The house is as pretty as a sunset
label: Contradiction
explanation: A sunset is a beautiful natural phenomenon, so the simile is saying that the house is as pretty as something that is innately beautiful.

premise: I told her almost everything, including my reticence about seeing this work of literature be abused and treated in an extremely harsh manner which was vanity publishing.
hypothesis: I told her almost everything, including my reticence about seeing this work of literature go through the mill which was vanity publishing.
label: Entailment
explanation: To go through the mill means to be abused or treated very harshly, and in this example a work of literature is being treated harshly by vanity publishing.

premise: The cigarettes affected his health.
hypothesis: The cigarettes rained on his health.
label: Entailment
explanation: The cigarettes rained on his health means that the cigarettes had a negative effect on his health.

premise: I was going to go to the movies with a bunch of friends but they all bailed on me.
hypothesis: It really makes you feel worthwhile when all your friends bail on you last minute for the movies.
label: Contradiction
explanation: It is not a good feeling and worthwhile when friends bail on you last minute and so it makes someone feel like they are not worth anything.

premise: Well, maybe not nutty, let's say extremely fun loving.
hypothesis: Well, maybe not nutty, lets say fun loving to the max.
label: Entailment
explanation: To the max means to the highest level or degree, so in this context it is describing someone who is extremely fun loving.

premise: Stop working on the shop.
hypothesis: Well get cracking on the shop.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To get cracking means to start working on something, but the imperative form in this sentence would be to stop working on the shop.

premise: Someone who would do something as drastic as break into another's home is seriously deranged.
hypothesis: Anyone who would go so far as to break into another's home is seriously deranged.
label: Entailment
explanation: To go so far as to do something means to do something extreme, and breaking into someone's home is definitely an extreme act.

premise: I rented out my bedroom to Airbnb customers and when I returned it was left smelly and diapers every where.
hypothesis: I came back to my room after renting it out to some Airbnb customers and was filled with gratitude at the smell and disgusting diapers everywhere
label: Contradiction
explanation: The sight of dirty diapers everywhere would not fill anyone with gratitude but rather with disgust and a sense of violation because it is not what was agreed upon when renting out the room.

premise: He was graceful
hypothesis: He was as graceful as a giraffe
label: Contradiction
explanation: A giraffe is a very tall and gangly animal, so saying someone is as graceful as a giraffe would indicate that they are very tall and gangly.

premise: I really get mad when my taxes are raised.
hypothesis: I'm so excited about my taxes being raised that I could scream
label: Contradiction
explanation: Taxes being raised is not a good thing because it means people will have to pay more money and hence would not be excited about it.

premise: The effects of these events could lead to chaos and anarchy.
hypothesis: These events could tilt the balance of power.
label: Entailment
explanation: Tilting the balance of power means that the events could cause a change in who has power.

premise: I am so behind on my housework.
hypothesis: I feel terrible that I have not been able to keep up with my housework like I wanted to
label: Entailment
explanation: Not being able to keep up with housework can often make people feel like they are not doing enough and result in feelings of guilt and shame.

premise: Me and this girl on Tinder were going really steady, then out of the blue she flat out ghosted me.
hypothesis: After being so excited to go out with this girl I met on Tinder, I was elated when she suddenly disappeared
label: Contradiction
explanation: Disappearing after making plans with someone is not a polite or cool thing to do and so the girl is not someone who is worth being elated about.

premise: Let's see if you celebrate wildly and make a lot of noise next Monday when it's just another start to a shitty week.
hypothesis: Let's see if you whoop it up next monday when it's just another start to a shitty week.
label: Entailment
explanation: To whoop it up means to celebrate, especially with cheers and whoops, and in this context the speaker is wondering if the person will celebrate next Monday.

premise: There was something about Callum's behaviour that she didn't like, something in his grin that made her want to flee the scene immediately.
hypothesis: There was something about callums behaviour that she didn't like, something in his grin that made her want to run a mile.
label: Entailment
explanation: To run a mile means to avoid something in any way possible, and in this context she wants to avoid him by fleeing the scene.

premise: I let out a loud fart while eating lunch with my coworkers moments ago.
hypothesis: I let out a loud fart while eating lunch with my coworkers and now I feel totally pleased and confident
label: Contradiction
explanation: Farting in public is often considered to be rude and socially unacceptable and so someone who does it cannot feel pleased and confident.

premise: The professor always includes his political ideas in his lectures.
hypothesis: His political ideas color his lectures.
label: Entailment
explanation: To say that something colors something else means that it has an effect on it.

premise: The floods destroyed everything and the insurer is not returning our calls
hypothesis: The floods destroyed everything and the insurer is not returning our calls so that's reassuring.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The floods destroyed property and belongings and the insurer not returning calls implies that they do not care about the victims of the floods which is certainly not a reassuring but worrying.

premise: A customer is refusing to pay a bill because they claim it has already been paid but cannot provide any proof of doing so.
hypothesis: I just love the customer who is trying to stiff the company by refusing to pay the bill and pretending that it has already been paid, how classy.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Customers who try to avoid paying bills are not classy or to be loved because they are not following through with what they agreed to and are essentially stealing from the company.

premise: Good, I'll see you first thing in the morning tomorrow.
hypothesis: Good, ill see you two bright and early tomorrow.
label: Entailment
explanation: To see someone bright and early means to see them very early in the morning, which is the same as seeing them first thing in the morning.

premise: They reduced a shudder through my being still.
hypothesis: They sent a shudder through my being still.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To send a shudder through someone means to cause them to feel fear or terror, while to reduce a shudder through someone means to lessen their fear or terror.

premise: I bit into an apple and found a worm and it was so gross.
hypothesis: I felt sick to my stomach when I discovered a worm inside the apple I was eating
label: Entailment
explanation: Discovering a worm in an apple is pretty disgusting and most people would feel sick to their stomach if they found one while eating.

premise: Let's go back outside in the world, you and me but not to any place on earth.
hypothesis: Let's go back outside in the world, you and me under the sun.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To be under the sun means to be anywhere on earth, but the contradiction is saying that they will not go to any place on earth.

premise: I went to a restaurant last week by myself meanwhile everyone else was sitting with at least one other person.
hypothesis: I felt out of place and lonely last week when I went to the restaurant all by myself where everyone else had company.
label: Entailment
explanation: Going to a restaurant and being the only one sitting by themselves is often a very awkward and lonely experience because people tend to go out to eat with others as opposed to alone.

premise: He took away the air from the dilapidated house.
hypothesis: He breathed new life into the dilapidated house.
label: Contradiction
explanation: by breathing new life means he revitalized or rejuvenated the old house, where as - took away the air - means he killed the charm of the house.

premise: In his dark clothing he'd be conspicuous.
hypothesis: In his dark clothing he'd be like a cockroach on a white tablecloth.
label: Entailment
explanation: Cockroaches are very noticeable against a white background, so the simile is emphasizing that the man would be very conspicuous in his dark clothing.

premise: I had to have some tests run due to an unclear mammogram.
hypothesis: Having to get some tests done because of an unclear mammogram made me feel really anxious
label: Entailment
explanation: It is often very anxiety-inducing to have to get tests done when there is a possibility of something being wrong and so the fact that the mammogram was unclear and tests had to be run made the person feel really anxious.

premise: I spent the whole afternoon in a bath full of tepid water that was supposed to help and it helped quite a bit.
hypothesis: I spent the whole afternoon in a bath full of tepid water that was meant to help and did bugger all.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To bugger all means to do nothing or next to nothing, but in this sentence the person spent an afternoon in a bath that did help them quite a bit.

premise: I am so mad that someone stole my identity and cleared out my bank account and maxed out my credit cards.
hypothesis: I am absolutely livid that someone decided to steal my identity and wreck my credit score
label: Entailment
explanation: Stealing someone's identity is a very serious matter and can have long lasting negative impacts on a person's life.

premise: He turned his head to her and said that was a really big problem.
hypothesis: He turned his head to her and said no sweat.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To say no sweat is to say that something is not a problem or difficulty, but in this context it is a big problem.

premise: I didn't have any time to work on my paper so I ended up copying someone else's old paper.
hypothesis: I feel so content that I had to resort to copying an old paper to submit for my final project
label: Contradiction
explanation: Copying someone else's work without giving them credit is an unethical thing to do just because one did not have time and so the the person cannot be content about it.

premise: My laptop was destroyed when my toddler spilled water on it.
hypothesis: I was ecstatic when my laptop got ruined after my toddler spilled water on it
label: Contradiction
explanation: A laptop getting ruined after water spills on it is not a good thing because it means that the device is now unusable and needs to be replaced.

premise: The jazz solo sounded rough and bad
hypothesis: The jazz solo sounded as smooth as sandpaper
label: Entailment
explanation: Sandpaper is rough and not smooth, so the jazz solo sounding as smooth as sandpaper would mean that it sounded rough and bad.

premise: Like marilyn monroe said, women who don't make a fuss rarely get noticed, and I plan on making sure everyone remembers me.
hypothesis: Like marilyn monroe said, well-behaved women rarely make history, and I plan on making sure everyone remembers me.
label: Entailment
explanation: The idiom make history means to do something memorable or spectacular enough to influence the course of history and in this context, the speaker plans on doing something memorable enough to be remembered by everyone.

premise: You were disappointed when the prophet told you that all your dreams would come true.
hypothesis: When the prophet told you that all your dreams would come true, you were like a million-dollar lottery winner.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A lottery winner is typically very happy when they win, whereas if someone is disappointed when their dreams come true, it would imply that they were not expecting to win.

premise: But I was, it puzzled me and gave me something to think about as I made my way back outside the club.
hypothesis: But I was, it perplexed me and gave me food for thought as I made my way back outside the club.
label: Entailment
explanation: To give food for thought is to give someone something to think about, which is what happened in this sentence.

premise: The window panes were calm as the wind blew through them.
hypothesis: The window panes were shaking as the wind blew through them.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To shake means to move or cause to move back and forth or up and down with quick violent motions, while to be calm means to be free from tumult or disturbance.

premise: My boss just bought a new boat that I can never afford.
hypothesis: The new boat my boss just bought makes me feel insanely jealous
label: Entailment
explanation: It is common to feel jealous when someone has something that you want but cannot have, especially if that thing is expensive.

premise: Another derry memory went sinking down into his subconscious.
hypothesis: Another derry memory came like a balefully fizzing firework
label: Contradiction
explanation: A balefully fizzing firework is one that is about to explode and is something that is designed to be seen and heard, whereas something that sinks down into the subconscious is designed to be forgotten.

premise: After decades of drought the Western United states is declared uninhabitable
hypothesis: After decades of drought the Western United states is declared a wasteland.
label: Entailment
explanation: A wasteland is an area that is not able to support human life, so it is uninhabitable.

premise: That sort of thing takes time and is a situation where only one party is required to take action.
hypothesis: That sort of thing takes time and is a two-way street.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A two-way street is a situation in which action is required from both parties, but this context is describing a situation where only one party is required to take action.

premise: I went to a party at a friends house and I spilled a drink on the floor.
hypothesis: I felt extremely happy and thrilled when I accidentally spilled my drink on the floor at my friend's party
label: Contradiction
explanation: Spilling drinks is often considered to be clumsy and embarrassing, and so it cannot lead to happiness or thrill.

premise: The set free my protector who struggles meekly against them.
hypothesis: The cut loose my protector who struggles meekly against them.
label: Entailment
explanation: To cut loose means to behave in a relaxed or uninhibited manner, which in this sentence would mean setting free the protector.

premise: Joe: that's because you're fast
hypothesis: Joe: that's because you're like a snail surfing on molasses.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A snail would get stuck if it were to try to surf on molasses, so someone who is like that would be slow and not fast.

premise: Sure, he snorted just to make me feel even worse about the already bad situation
hypothesis: Sure, he snorted, just rub it in.
label: Entailment
explanation: To rub it in means to make someone feel worse about an already bad situation, and in this context the speaker is sarcastically agreeing that the other person will make him feel worse.

premise: I was so mad when my friend forgot my birthday.
hypothesis: I was livid when my friend forgot my birthday
label: Entailment
explanation: Birthdays are special days for people and forgetting someone's birthday often results in the person feeling betrayed or abandoned which would explain why someone would be livid.

premise: I have a pile of laundry that I've been neglecting...
hypothesis: I am absolutely loving the fact that I have a mountain of laundry that I've been procrastinating on for weeks now
label: Contradiction
explanation: Laundry is often a chore that people dislike and procrastinating on it would only make the task more daunting, so it is not something anyone would love.

premise: All my money in my bank got stolen due to fraud and I am so mad.
hypothesis: I am thrilled that my hard-earned money got stolen because of fraud and it makes me so happy.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Money getting stolen because of fraud is not a good thing and so someone being thrilled about it not rational.

premise: Jon explained that marley and josh had started to work extremely hard without taking any breaks.
hypothesis: Jon explained that marley and josh had started to burn the candle at both ends.
label: Entailment
explanation: To burn the candle at both ends is to overwork oneself, and that is what Jon explained marley and josh had started to do.

premise: I was golfing this weekend, and in the middle of my round it started storming and hailing!
hypothesis: I was golfing this weekend, and in the middle of my round Mother Nature showed up and started raining and hailing!
label: Entailment
explanation: When people are in the middle of an activity and they are suddenly interrupted by something out of their control like bad weather it is often said that Mother Nature showed up.

premise: I felt bad when I couldn't get my daughter the gift she wanted
hypothesis: I felt overjoyed when I realized that I couldn't afford to get my daughter the gift she wanted
label: Contradiction
explanation: Not being able to afford a gift for one's child is not a happy feeling and is actually quite upsetting.

premise: I was at a restaurant tonight and watched this man eat 5 plates of foods from the buffet.
hypothesis: I watched this man eat 5 plates of food from the buffet and it made me feel sick
label: Entailment
explanation: Eating a lot of food can often make people feel sick, especially if they are eating from a buffet where the food is not always the highest quality.

premise: My friend was so scared that he became pale and speechless after the violent storm.
hypothesis: When I looked at my friend after the storm he was a ghost.
label: Entailment
explanation: A ghost would be pale and unable to speak, so he was a ghost is a metaphor for being pale and speechless.

premise: I was really agonizing over this decision for years.
hypothesis: I wrestled with this decision for years.
label: Entailment
explanation: Wrestling with a decision means that you are struggling to make a choice.

premise: Make the start for a new health care plan.
hypothesis: Lay the foundation for a new health care plan.
label: Entailment
explanation: Laying the foundation of a health care plan means to make the start for a new health care plan.

premise: The media will make them responsible for the problem and they will not have to deal with any negative consequences.
hypothesis: The media will pass the buck to them and they will be left holding the baby.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To be left holding the baby means to be made responsible for a problem that nobody else wants to deal with, but the sentence states that they will not have to deal with any negative consequences.

premise: I was going to have dinner with friends today but I was stuck at work.
hypothesis: I was so looking forward to dinner with friends today but unfortunately, I got stuck at lovely work.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Dinner with friends is generally a social event that someone would look forward to, but having to work instead makes the experience anything but lovely.

premise: His predictable and stable behavior had showed me that the man I married.
hypothesis: His jekyll and hyde actions had showed me that the man I married.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Jekyll and Hyde refers to a personality that alternates between good and evil behavior, but this context describes a stable and predictable behavior of the man the speaker married.

premise: It opened its mouth and screamed, revealing rows of tiny sharp teeth and clawing at jason's muzzle as jason tried to lose control and go crazy with his own teeth.
hypothesis: It opened its mouth and screamed, revealing rows of tiny sharp teeth and clawing at jason's muzzle as jason tried to get a grip with his own teeth.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To get a grip means to control one's reactions or emotions, but Jason is trying to do the opposite by losing control and going crazy.

premise: People who do bad things will be rewarded by having no work and a lot of tranquillity, Eddie.
hypothesis: no peace for the wicked, Eddie.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The idiom "no peace for the wicked" means that someone's heavy workload or lack of tranquillity is punishment for a sinful life, but in this context the person is being rewarded instead.

premise: The dancer sank across the stage.
hypothesis: The dancer floated across the stage.
label: Contradiction
explanation: one sentence states that the dancer's movements were very gentle, making it look like she was floating across the stage, which is contradictory to the another statement where the dancer sank across the stage.

premise: Her hands are very soft.
hypothesis: Her hands are soft as alligator skin.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Alligator skin is known to be tough and not soft, so saying someone's hands are as soft as alligator skin would mean that their hands are not very soft.

premise: I feel so upset when other people tell such horrible lies about other people.
hypothesis: I absolutely adore it when people lie about other people because it makes me so appreciative of them
label: Contradiction
