explanation: Lying about other people is not a good thing to do and it should not make anyone feel appreciative but instead show that the person who is lying is not a good person.

premise: But I don't want to be fighting without eating anything, so I might as well keep my muscles warm.
hypothesis: But I don't want to be fighting on a full stomach, so I might as well keep my muscles warm.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To be on a full stomach means to have just eaten to the point of being full, but in this context the person wants to fight without having eaten anything.

premise: The wind ceases through the leaves.
hypothesis: The wind whips through the leaves.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To whip something means to move it violently back and forth, while to cease something means to stop or discontinue it.

premise: Let's actively try to make the situation worse.
hypothesis: Let's let sleeping dogs lie.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To let sleeping dogs lie is to leave a situation alone so as to not make it worse, but the speaker wants to actively try to make it worse.

premise: My friend let me borrow his car yesterday but I forgot to fill it with gas when I was done with it.
hypothesis: I feel so competent that I borrowed my friend's car and then completely forgot to fill it with gas
label: Contradiction
explanation: Forgetting to fill up a car with gas after borrowing it from a friend is very careless and shows a lack of responsibility.

premise: Her heart was fluttering weakly and rapidly inside her ribs.
hypothesis: Her heart fluttered in her ribs like a butterflys wings .
label: Entailment
explanation: A butterfly's wings flutter rapidly and weakly, and this is similar to what is happening with her heart.

premise: The government has been asleep this entire time.
hypothesis: The government seems to finally be seeing the light.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To see the light means to understand or come to accept something, but this context suggests that the government has been asleep and not understanding what has been going on.

premise: He was trying to emphasize this.
hypothesis: He was struggling to make light of this.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To make light of something is to treat it as if it were unimportant, but this context describes treating it as if it were important.

premise: I don't approve of apolitical jokes; I have seen too many of them get elected.
hypothesis: I don't approve of political jokes; I have seen too many of them get elected.
label: Contradiction
explanation: In one statement the speaker saying they don't approve jokes about political issues and in the other they don't approve jokes that are not involved with politics.

premise: Every night around midnight I hear terrible noises coming from the woods outside of my home.
hypothesis: The reason I have such perfect sleep is because of the lovely noises that come from the woods outside my home.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The noises that come from the woods outside someone's home are often unsettling and not soothing at all, so attributing perfect sleep to them is sarcastic.

premise: The police officer tried to harass me
hypothesis: The police officer's attempt to interrogate me was totally worthwhile and I completely enjoyed the experience.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The police officer's attempt to interrogate someone is not a good experience and often a form harrassment because it makes them feel scared and uncomfortable.

premise: The taste of agony was overwhelming upon my tongue.
hypothesis: The taste of agony coated thick upon my tongue.
label: Entailment
explanation: The taste of agony was - coated thick - mean it was very strong and overwhelming.

premise: I rob teenagers outside college to get money for drugs because I am a drug addict.
hypothesis: I'm such a good person because I rob innocent teenagers who are just trying to get an education, in order to get money for my drugs.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Robbing innocent people is not a good thing to do and so someone who does it cannot be considered a good person.

premise: I heard a shooting happened and felt sad the victims got attacked.
hypothesis: The attackers launched gunshots at the civilians.
label: Entailment
explanation: The word launch is often used when referring to an attack, and in this context it implies that the attack was premeditated.

premise: He had promise once, more than I let him know, but he let it all thrive and succeed in a flamboyant quest for his own personal grail.
hypothesis: He had promise once, more than I let him know, but he let it all go by the boards in a flamboyant quest for his own personal grail.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To go by the board means to fail, go to waste, or cease to exist, but in this sentence his promise thrived and succeeded.

premise: Mrs. Saunders' hands were shaking, making her rosary beads click against each other as she looked at me.
hypothesis: Mrs. Saunders looked at me, her hands shaking, making her rosary beads sound like a wind chime .
label: Entailment
explanation: A wind chime is a decorative object that click against each other makes a tinkling sound when the wind blows and hence the rosary beads clicking against each other is compared to a wind chme.

premise: He had a hard time navigating his way through the new city.
hypothesis: The new city was a maze for him.
label: Entailment
explanation: Mazes are complicated structures that are difficult to navigate through.

premise: They found the guardian virtually invincible, but I don't receive any courage or comfort from the fact that some of them survived the encounter.
hypothesis: They found the guardian virtually invincible, but I take heart that some of them survived the encounter.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To take heart means to receive courage or comfort from some fact, but in this context the fact that some of them survived the encounter does not provide any courage or comfort.

premise: Granted, she had been cornered by a lunatic ex-boyfriend who was hell-bent on making her his by any means necessary, but I figured it would be more prudent to take the risk than to regret my fear later.
hypothesis: Granted, she had been cornered by a lunatic ex-boyfriend bent on making her his by any means necessary, but I figured better safe than sorry.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The idiom better safe than sorry means that it is better to be cautious and take precautions than to regret one's carelessness later, but in this sentence the speaker is taking a risk instead.

premise: His movements were jerky and sloppy, halting and graceless.
hypothesis: The way he moved was like a giant, predatory jungle cat .
label: Contradiction
explanation: A predatory jungle cat is a sleek and graceful animal that moves with purpose, so saying someone moves like one would imply their movements are also sleek and graceful and not jerky and sloppy.

premise: Smith kicked me, so I tried to pacify him.
hypothesis: Smith kicked me, so I gave him tit for tat.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Tit for tat is taking revenge on someone who has harmed you, but in this context the speaker tried to pacify Smith instead.

premise: Even though he wanted to fight, he was helpless.
hypothesis: He wanted to fight, but he was like a pup being held by the scruff.
label: Entailment
explanation: When a mother dog picks up her pup by the scruff of its neck, it is a sign of dominance and the pup is helpless to fight back, implying he was helpless.

premise: I am upset that I crashed my new car yesterday.
hypothesis: I am really devastated that I crashed my new car yesterday
label: Entailment
explanation: Crashing a new car is really upsetting because it often means having to pay for repairs and it can also be a safety hazard.

premise: War was a fantasy.
hypothesis: War was a nightmare.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A nightmare is a bad dream that is often scary or unsettling, while a fantasy is a pleasant daydream or an imaginary situation.

premise: I put a lot of effort into my work and I hate when things are half done.
hypothesis: I feel brilliant when I put in a lot of effort and the final outcome is not good
label: Contradiction
explanation: A lot of effort put in with a not-so-good outcome is equivalent to wasted effort and hence it would not make anyone feel brilliant.

premise: My son stole a car from an elderly man today, never have I been so let down.
hypothesis: I feel terrible that my son who is supposed to be the good one, stole a car from an elderly man today
label: Entailment
explanation: Stealing is wrong and especially stealing from an elderly man who can't defend himself.

premise: Pizza I ordered was pretty much burnt with no toppings!
hypothesis: My pizza order arrived and the cheese and pepperoni were missing and the crust was burnt
label: Entailment
explanation: If a pizza arrives burnt and missing toppings it is often disappointing because it is not what was ordered and not up to the usual standards.

premise: I am pleased to offer my harmful intent and plan of attacking  you and your king, Vasant Rao continued, in the name of his highness, the prince.
hypothesis: I am pleased to offer my good offices to you and your king,vasant rao continued, in the name of his highness, the prince.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To offer good offices is to offer help and support, but in this context Vasant Rao is offering harmful intent and a plan to attack.

premise: During the government's conversion of the law, the entire code was created.
hypothesis: The government flipped the entire law into a code.
label: Entailment
explanation: The government flipped the entire law into a code means that they took the law and turned it into a code.

premise: They were not moving, mainly because she had done something completely wrong and horrendous.
hypothesis: They were unmoving, mainly because she had just hit the nail on the head.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To hit the nail means to do exactly the right thing, but in this cotext she did something completely wrong.

premise: I was mad to see my best friend start dating my ex girlfriend.
hypothesis: I was so calm when i saw my best friend start dating my ex girlfriend.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Seeing a best friend date an ex girlfriend is often a very difficult and traumatic experience which would not result in someone being calm.

premise: The candidate was gentle with his opponent.
hypothesis: The candidate torpedoed into his opponent mercilessly.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To torpedo into something means to attack it fiercely or ruthlessly, while to be gentle with someone means to be kind and compassionate towards them.

premise: I always get nervous when I drive.
hypothesis: I always feel confident when I'm driving because I'm afraid of accidents
label: Contradiction
explanation: Fear of accidents does not equate to feeling confident and in fact, a majority of people would feel scared when driving because the risk of an accident is high.

premise: She was in her middle age, therefore she lost her zest for adventure and hence travelling.
hypothesis: Middle age cut down her appetite for travel.
label: Entailment
explanation: The metaphor is saying that she became less adventurous and stopped travelling once she reached middle age.

premise: I missed the sale on a laptop I've been wanting for work.
hypothesis: I am so thrilled that I missed the sale on the laptop that I wanted for work.
label: Contradiction
explanation: It would be advantageous for someone to buy a laptop during a sale since it is usually cheaper than the original price, so someone being pleased that they missed the sale is unlikely.

premise: You'd murder them feeliing extreme guilt and remorse, Thomas?.
hypothesis: You'd kill family in cold blood, thomas?
label: Contradiction
explanation: To do something in cold blood means to do it without feeling or remorse, but this context describes a situation in which the Thomas would feel remorse.

premise: To guts the sob of my agony.
hypothesis: To ravage the sob of my agony.
label: Entailment
explanation: Ravage or guts means to destroy or ruin something and here the metaphor is used portray how it destroys the pain or sob of the agony.

premise: You bunk with sharonette until ugly thing is completely and permanently gone as we southerns like to quote.
hypothesis: You bunk with sharonette until ugly thing is gone with the wind as we southerns like to quote.
label: Entailment
explanation: To be gone with the wind means to be permanently and completely gone, and in this context the ugly thing is being described as such.

premise: I felt very lonely when my partner decided to leave me for someone else.
hypothesis: The feeling of being so alone when my partner decided to leave me was really fun
label: Contradiction
explanation: The feeling of being alone is often not a good one and so someone describing it as being really fun is not accurate.

premise: It's owner might be extremely sane, but she was also acting sweeter than one.
hypothesis: It's owner might be nutty as a fruitcake, but she was also acting sweeter than one.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To be nutty as a fruitcake is to be crazy or wacky, but in this context the owner is acting sane and sweet.

premise: Her neck was beautiful
hypothesis: Her neck was like the smooth curve of a pearl.
label: Entailment
explanation: A pearl is a valuable, lustrous gemstone, so the simile is emphasizing the beauty of the neck.

premise: In my opinion, coincidences didn't really exist
hypothesis: in my book coincidences didn't really exist.
label: Entailment
explanation: In my book means according to someone's opinion, judgment or values and the speaker is saying according to their opinion coincidences does not exist.

premise: I hate when my sister snores at night she never lets me sleep
hypothesis: I can't stand the sound of my sister's snoring because it always keeps me up at night
label: Entailment
explanation: The sound of snoring is often very disruptive and can prevent people from being able to sleep which is why it is so disliked.

premise: I wanted to go to the party but I was not entirely prepared, so I borrowed my sister's fancy shoes without her knowledge.
hypothesis: I feel absolutely justified in my decision of borrowing my sister's shoes without her consent just in order to attend a party
label: Contradiction
explanation: Borrowing something from someone without their consent is not justified and is considered to be stealing, so the fact that the person feels justified in doing so implies that they know what they did was wrong.

premise: MY neighbors are always leaving trash on our stairwell.
hypothesis: I am pleased about the fact that my neighbor never put their trash in the trash can and it piles up on our stairwell.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Not putting trash in the designated area for it is often considered as littering and is frowned upon by society, so someone can't be possibly pleased about their neighbors not following this rule.

premise: His throat had gone wet.
hypothesis: His throat had gone like a shriveled-up leaf .
label: Contradiction
explanation: A shriveled-up leaf is dry, so saying his throat had gone like that would imply it had gone dry as well, not wet.

premise: Not a change happened to their features.
hypothesis: Not a change  came  o'er their features .
label: Entailment
explanation: came o'er their features means that their features changed.

premise: I believe you have done your homework.
hypothesis: I fancy you have not done your homework.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To fancy something means to believe or think that it is true, here the speaker thinks the homework is not done while to other statement suggests the speaker believes the homework is done.

premise: There were tall and bladed peaks that could be seen every so often.
hypothesis: Every so often a peak could be seen like a granite tooth stabbing the sky.
label: Entailment
explanation: A peak that stabs the sky is tall and sharp, like a tooth.

premise: With global warming and political turmoil I sometimes worry about the future and what it could hold for the future generations.
hypothesis: I'm excited about the future, thanks to beautiful things such as global warming and political turmoil.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Global warming and political turmoil are not things that invoke feelings of excitement but instead feelings of fear and uncertainty for the future.

premise: I was in a hotel and there was hair in the shower drain.
hypothesis: I found hair in the shower drain and it didn't make me feel disgusted at all.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Finding hair in the shower drain is a very common occurrence and often grosses people out, so someone who doesn't feel disgusted by it is abnormal.

premise: And one more thing, lets divide the check.
hypothesis: And one more thing, lets go dutch.
label: Entailment
explanation: To go dutch means to divide a check or bill so that each person contributes to it, which is what they are suggesting in this sentence.

premise: My first date was terrible as I turned up late and sweaty.
hypothesis: I absolutely treasure the fact that my first date was so amazing as I turned up late and sweaty
label: Contradiction
explanation: Being late and sweaty for a first date are not good impressions to make and so the date cannot be considered amazing by any means.

premise: My coworker is always coming over to my desk and talking for long periods of time.
hypothesis: Clearly my coworker has no intentions of annoying me by coming to talk to me at my desk for an extended period of time.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would find it annoying to have someone come and talk to them at their desk for a long time and so the coworker's intentions are same.

premise: I worked really hard with my daughter last year to teach her multiplication facts but last week at her quiz she failed.
hypothesis: I was proud when my daughter last week failed her multiplication quiz after we worked so hard together last year
label: Contradiction
explanation: A parent would not be proud of their child failing a multiplication quiz because it shows that the child has not learned what they were supposed to and hence it would imply that the parent has failed as well.

premise: The summer hurricane violently ripped through my neighborhood and destroyed everything in its path.
hypothesis: The summer hurricane caused a lot of destruction in my neighborhood and ruined everything in its path
label: Entailment
explanation: Hurricanes are typically very destructive and violent and often ruin everything in their path.

premise: My friend broke my phone that I had worked hard to buy
hypothesis: My friend broke my phone that I had just saved up to buy and now I'm just thrilled
label: Contradiction
explanation: A person's phone is often very important to them and so breaking it would be a terrible thing, which is not expressed by the use of the word thrilled.

premise: I just ran out of financial aid for school.
hypothesis: I just found out that I won't be able to afford to go to school anymore because, in my boundless wisdom, I used up all my financial aid
label: Contradiction
explanation: It is not wise to use up all of one's financial aid because it leaves them with no other option but to not attend school, which would be a very unfortunate turn of events.

premise: He had risen from the bench to bid the mason farewell, and now he stood out in the open for everyone to see under the rose trellis, which had lately come into bloom.
hypothesis: He had risen from the bench to bid the mason farewell, and now he stood under the rose trellis, which had lately come into bloom.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To stand under the rose means to stand privately or confidentially, but in this context he stood out in the open for everyone to see.

premise: I was super grossed out when I left some noodles in the sink last night and today there were maggots.
hypothesis: The sight of noodles in the sink from last night with maggots today made me feel delighted
label: Contradiction
explanation: Maggots are a type of fly that lays eggs in rotting food and so seeing noodles from last night with maggots today would make anyone feel sick and disgusted.

premise: In the mirror, her face looked wide and flushed.
hypothesis: In the glass's reflection, her face was like a tapered flame .
label: Contradiction
explanation: A tapered flame is a thin flame, so saying her face is like a tapered flame implies it is thin and pale, not wide and flushed.

premise: She said that infidelity was apparent to her.
hypothesis: She said that she could smell infidelity from a mile.
label: Entailment
explanation: Smelling something from a mile away means that it is very apparent and clear.

premise: My dog decided to chew more than a few pieces of furniture while I was at work and I have to replace all of them!
hypothesis: My dog destroyed more than a few pieces of furniture while I was at work and I am excited to shell out more money to replace them all
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would not be excited to spend more money to replace furniture that their dog has destroyed and instead would be frustrated or angry.

premise: I have a math test tomorrow and my stomach won't stop churning.
hypothesis: I feel so confident about my math test tomorrow that my stomach won't stop churning.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Feeling confident about a math test tomorrow cannot lead to one's stomach churning because that is a sign of anxiety and nerves, which are not associated with confidence..

premise: The attackers stopped shooting at civilians as they were defending.
hypothesis: The attackers launched gunshots at the civilians.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To launch something means to send it forth with great force, while to stop something means to cease or discontinue it.

premise: If you ask any other merchant, he will talk in a circuitous and evasive manner, then make fun of your appearance, then refuse to deal with you.
hypothesis: Ask any other merchant, and he will hum and haw , then make fun of your appearance, then refuse to deal with you.
label: Entailment
explanation: To hum and haw means to speak in an evasive, vague, roundabout way, which is what the other merchants would do if asked.

premise: They went around giving each other away.
hypothesis: For they  kept  each other 's counsel ,
label: Contradiction
explanation: To keep someone's counsel means to keep their confidence or secret, while to give someone away means to betray them.

premise: A lot of respect meant, of course, but you chemists are not very common or ordinary.
hypothesis: No offense meant, of course, but you chemists are ten a penny.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The idiom ten a penny means very common or ordinary, but the contradiction goes against that by saying that chemists are not very common.

premise: Just got ditched by my friend for the third time this week when trying to make plans.
hypothesis: I feel so loved when every time I try to make plans, my friends ditch me
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people do not enjoy feeling left out or being the only one who is trying to make plans and so getting ditched by friends often makes someone feel not loved at all.

premise: Last week, someone drove off the road during the night and destroyed a large section of my fence.
hypothesis: Last week I experienced great joy when a resonsible and amazing driver drove off the road and smashed through my fence during the night.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A responsible and amazing driver would not drive off the road and smash through someone's fence during the night and would experience trauma and not joy if a driver destroyed their property.

premise: He and his brothers would risk everything for her each and every day of their lives.
hypothesis: He and his brothers would go to the wall for her each and every day of their lives.
label: Entailment
explanation: To go to the wall means to take on great risk, which is what he and his brothers would do for her every day.

premise: I watched a scary film last night and have been horrified about it all day.
hypothesis: I watched a horror movie last night and now I am having fun being scared of everything.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Horror movies are usually meant to scare people and so watching one and then being scared of everything is not a sign of having fun.

premise: I stepped in gum someone spit on the side walk
hypothesis: I got so thrilled when I stepped in gum someone spit on the side walk
label: Contradiction
explanation: Gum on the sidewalk is often dirty and unsightly and so finding some on your shoe would not be a reason to get thrilled.

premise: The pathway curved between them.
hypothesis: Straight between them  ran  the pathway ,
label: Contradiction
explanation: If the pathway ran straight between them, it would go in a direct line, while if it curved between them, it would take a more indirect route.

premise: I really hate it when girls ghost me on Tinder.
hypothesis: I feel so excited when the girls stop talking to me on Tinder without any explanation
label: Contradiction
explanation: Being ignored on Tinder by matches who suddenly stop talking can be really frustrating and disappointing and hence it is not something to feel excited about.

premise: My girlfriend said no when I asked her to marry me.
hypothesis: I am so happy that my girlfriend said no when I asked her to marry me
label: Contradiction
explanation: When someone gets rejected for marriage, it is usually not a good thing and so the person being happy about it is sarcastic.

premise: She let anyone treat her very well and they did and she reacted, a lot.
hypothesis: She let anyone walk all over her and they did and she didn't react, not even a little.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To walk all over someone means to treat them very badly, but in this context she lets people treat her well and she reacts a lot.

premise: the majority has voted in favor.
hypothesis: the ayes have it.
label: Entailment
explanation: The ayes have it means that the majority has voted in favor.

premise: Democrats are willing to stand their ground with the president on measures to stimulate the economy.
hypothesis: Democrats are willing to meet the president halfway on measures to stimulate the economy.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To meet someone halfway means to compromise with them, but this context describes the Democrats being unwilling to compromise.

premise: Joanna, you disagree? Oh... okay, no more questions.
hypothesis: Joanna, you disagree? Okay, shoot!
label: Contradiction
explanation: Shoot means asking the other person whereas - no more questions - mean not asking the person for any followup.

premise: The teapot doesn't get affected by the heat as the water starts boiling.
hypothesis: The teapot quivered as the water boiled.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To quiver means to shake or tremble, while to be unaffected by something means to remain unchanged or unresponsive.

premise: My doctor told me to give up caffeine to help calm down my anxiety.
hypothesis: The fact that I have to give up caffeine in order to get rid of my anxiety makes me feel like I am losing a battle
label: Entailment
explanation: Caffeine is often used as a tool to help people focus and stay awake so giving it up, especially in exchange for getting rid of anxiety, can feel like a loss.

premise: Job candidates were screened quickly.
hypothesis: They breezed through the job candidates.
label: Entailment
explanation: Breezing through something means to do it quickly.

premise: I ordered a limited editon tshirt from my favorite band and they sent the wrong size
hypothesis: I am so mad that the band sent me the wrong size for the limited edition shirt I ordered
label: Entailment
explanation: When someone orders a limited edition item, it is often because they want to collect it and not because they want to wear it.

premise: My friend let me borrow his car yesterday but I forgot to fill it with gas when I was done with it.
hypothesis: I feel amazing that I borrowed my friend's car and then completely forgot to fill it with gas.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Forgetting to fill up a car with gas after borrowing it from a friend is very careless and shows a lack of responsibility.

premise: I saw a video of a burger at wendy's crawling with spiders.
hypothesis: I was so thrilled to see a video of a burger at Wendy's crawling with spiders
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would be terrified of seeing a burger crawling with spiders and hence a person being thrilled about it isn't normal.

premise: It's the same with bardem, only even more so.
hypothesis: It's the same with bardem, only to the nth degree.
label: Entailment
explanation: To the nth degree means to the highest level or degree, so this context is saying that it is the same with bardem, only even more so.

premise: The clouds really stagnated each other today in the sky.
hypothesis: The clouds twirled each other around in the sky.
label: Contradiction
explanation: one sentence is a metaphor which describes the clouds as if they are dancers twirling around each other whereas another sentence contradicts this by saying that the clouds are actually stagnant and not moving.

premise: I just gave you a complete and thorough explanation with all the details.
hypothesis: I just gave you chapter and verse.
label: Entailment
explanation: To give chapter and verse means to give a complete and thorough explanation with all the details, which is what the speaker did.

premise: It looked really gross when my friend put vinegar on his ice cream sundae.
hypothesis: It was so vile when my friend put vinegar on his ice cream sundae
label: Entailment
explanation: Ice cream is a dessert and is meant to be eaten with sweet toppings, not savory like vinegar and it can look gross when one does so so its vile.

premise: They had suddenly gone from comfortable to living very lavishly and within a large financial budget and being behind on something as important as their mortgage.
hypothesis: They had suddenly gone from comfortable to living on a shoestring and being behind on something as important as their mortgage.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To be on a shoestring means to be on a very tight or limited financial budget, but in this context they were living very lavishly.

premise: Today, Carly wanted to feel like she was powerful.
hypothesis: But today carly wanted to feel like a kick-ass chick in a superhero movie.
label: Entailment
explanation: A kick-ass chick is a powerful woman, who is usually the hero in a superhero movie.

premise: This has got everything to do with nationality.
hypothesis: This has got bugger all to do with nationality.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To have bugger all to do with something means to have absolutely nothing to do with it, but in this sentence it has everything to do with nationality.

premise: Don't let it make you too humble and modest.
hypothesis: Dont let it go to your heads.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To go to your head means to become arrogant, but in this context they are telling not to become too humble and modest.

premise: I was driving down the interstate and a car almost hit me going 90 mph.
hypothesis: I was driving down the interstate when a car almost hit me going 90 mph and it made me so mad
label: Entailment
explanation: Almost getting hit by a car is a very scary experience and if the other driver was going particularly fast it can be infuriating.

premise: There's a bad storm coming in tonight.
hypothesis: I am absolutely stoked and not feeling an iota of fear about the impending storm that's supposed to arrive tonight
label: Contradiction
explanation: Storms can be really dangerous and destructive and so it is not normal to feel happy or stoked about one that is arriving, rather people would be worried and fearful.

premise: Most of the time, his expression is dominated by more cerebral emotions: self-satisfaction, curiosity, amusement, a desire to mend the rift.
hypothesis: Most of the time, his expression is dominated by more cerebral emotions: self-satisfaction, curiosity, amusement, a desire to twist the knife.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To twist the knife means to add to exacerbate or amplify a betrayal or wrong by further malicious actions, but in this context his actions would be mending the rift instead.

premise: His declarations doused the fire in the community.
hypothesis: His declarations sparked a fire in the community.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Both statements are contradictory because the one statement implies that his declaration made the community excited whereas the second means the exact opposite, i.e., putting out the excitement.

premise: I am so mad my dog ate my homework that I spend 2 hours on so now I have to redo the whole thing!
hypothesis: I am livid that my dog ate my homework and now I have to waste another 2 hours on it!
label: Entailment
explanation: When someone puts a lot of time and effort into something like homework, and then it gets ruined because of something like a dog eating it, it is natural to be very angry about it.

premise: I was so envious of my friend when she won from a lottery ticket she bought for a buck.
hypothesis: I was really upset when my friend won from the lottery ticket she bought for only a dollar
label: Entailment
explanation: Winning the lottery is a matter of pure luck and has no reflection on a person's skill or worth so it is easy to feel upset when someone close to you, like a friend, wins when you didn't.

premise: They were, for no practical purpose, a completely self-sustaining community.
hypothesis: They were, to all intents and purposes, a completely self-sustaining community.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To all intents and purposes means in every practical or functional sense, but in this context it is used to describe a community that has no practical purpose.

premise: The jungle was full of noise.
hypothesis: The jungle lay like a dark stranger staring toward them.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A stranger typically implies someone who is not familiar or known, and is often associated with feelings of unease or danger, so stranger staring at someone would be silent, not loud.

premise: The violin concerto sounded absurd after the danger we had just passed.
hypothesis: Given the danger that had just passed, the delicate staccato notes of the violin concerto sounded like a wedding march at a funeral.
label: Entailment
explanation: A wedding march is a happy occasion, while a funeral is a somber occasion so a wedding march at a funeral is absurd which is used to draw comparison to the violin concern right after a dangerous event.

premise: Instantly our hero was not interested in hearing what one had to say.
hypothesis: Instantly our hero was all ears.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To be all ears means to be ready and eager to hear what one has to say, but in this sentence the hero was not interested in hearing what was said.

premise: I got pulled over and almost got a ticket.
hypothesis: Love my responsible self that almost got ticketed by the police officer for going way over the speed limit.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Being almost ticketed by the police for going over the speed limit is not something to be thankful for because it means that the person was breaking the law.

premise: fisa was then a relatively unimportant body which did not organize european and other championships and participated in the running of olympic regattas
hypothesis: fisa was then a relatively unimportant body which hosted european and other championships and participated in the running of olympic regattas
label: Contradiction
explanation: In one statement it says FISA was able organize the programs whereas in the other statement it says they did not organize.

premise: It hung in the sky, crescent-shaped and dim.
hypothesis: It hung in the sky, like a clean plate at the bottom of a scummy sink.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A clean plate at the bottom of a sink is bright and round, and not crescent shaped or dim.

premise: The tax cut will do more harm to the economy.
hypothesis: The tax cut will uplift the economy.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To uplift something means to improve or enhance it, while to cut something means to reduce or remove it.

premise: My next door neighbors are always arguing in our shared hallway.
hypothesis: It's so nice to have to hear my next door neighbors argue all the time in our shared hallway
label: Contradiction
explanation: The sound of arguing neighbors can often be very disruptive and so someone considering it to be nice is not really accurate.

premise: The airplane smelled like it hadn't been cleaned for months.
hypothesis: The airplane smelled like vomit and dirty diapers, suggesting that it was spotlessly clean!
label: Contradiction
explanation: The airplane probably smelled bad because of the vomit and dirty diapers but to say that it was spotlessly clean is a complete exaggeration.

premise: In the current scenario the fact favored the theory.
hypothesis: This fact clashed against the standard theories.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To clash with something means to be in conflict or disagreement with it, while to favor something means to support or be partial to it.

premise: The last time Reuben had seen anyone do that was Pa Kettle in the old movie Ma and Pa Kettle really going all out.
hypothesis: The last time reuben had seen anyone do that was pa kettle in the old movie ma and pa kettle go to town.
label: Entailment
explanation: To go to town means to act with great energy and/or enthusiasm, and in this context Pa Kettle is going all out in the movie.

premise: I was very upset and frustrated when I came outside this morning and found my car had been broken into.
hypothesis: I was utterly delighted when I came outside this morning and found my car had been broken into
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would not be happy if their car had been broken into because it is a nuisance and costly to repair.

premise: He fished in the glove compartment, feeling stressed because he had to act quickly, and brought out shane's wayfarers.
hypothesis: He fished in the glove compartment, under the gun, and brought out shane's wayfarers.
label: Entailment
explanation: To be under the gun means to be in a stressful situation that requires quick action, which is what he was feeling when he fished in the glove compartment.

premise: The darkness was kep by the light.
hypothesis: Light had overgrown darkness.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Here, light is described as having overgrown darkness, which suggests that it has surpassed or overcome it, whereas, the contradiction suggests that darkness was actually kept by the light.

premise: I feel so bad when I think back to times that I yelled at my kids for no real good reason.
hypothesis: I feel like such a great parent when I remember the times that I yelled at my kids for no real good reason
label: Contradiction
explanation: Yelling at kids for no real good reason is not good parenting and so feeling like a great parent when remembering those moments is really absurd.

premise: My math test grades were released, I failed the test somehow.
hypothesis: I am really stoked to see that my math test grades being released and me failing the test somehow
label: Contradiction
explanation: The grades being released means that everyone can see the grades and so failing would not be something to be stoked about as it would make the person look bad in front of others.

premise: My first date was terrible as I turned up late and sweaty.
hypothesis: I wish I could forget the fact that my first date was so terrible and embarrassing as I turned up late and sweaty
label: Entailment
explanation: It is natural to want to forget an embarrassing first date where everything went wrong like turning up late and sweaty.

premise: I really can't stand when people in customer service have attitudes.
hypothesis: I absolutely love how customer service reps with attitudes make me feel like crap
label: Contradiction
explanation: Customer service reps with attitudes often make people feel frustrated and angry, so someone who 'adores' how they make them feel is not being truthful.

premise: I failed my Calculus exam despite having studied all nights.
hypothesis: I am really upset that I couldn't pass my Calculus exam despite studying so hard
label: Entailment
explanation: To study for an exam and not be able to pass it despite putting in a lot of effort makes people upset because they will have to study and reappear for the exam again.

premise: An engine on the left side of the plane began to run smoothly and with great care, blasting out black smoke.
hypothesis: An engine on the left side of the plane began to run roughshod, blasting out black smoke.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To run roughshod means to act without regard for the wellbeing of something or someone, but in this context the engine is running smoothly and with great care.

premise: I just realized today I have not been home to where my family is from in a little over 10 years.
hypothesis: I feel like I am such a compassionate family man for having not gone back to my family's hometown in over 10 years
label: Contradiction
explanation: A family member is someone who is close to their relatives and connects with them often, so someone who has not gone back to their family's hometown in a long time is not really close to them and cannot be considered a compassionate family member.

premise: One should set goals that are in line with one's abilities.
hypothesis: Harmonize one's goals with one's abilities.
label: Entailment
explanation: Harmonizing one's goals with one's abilities means making sure that the goals are achievable given the abilities.

premise: Black desert uncovered in iron silences.
hypothesis: Black desert rained in iron silences.
label: Contradiction
explanation: When something rains, it means that it falls from the sky in a shower and can cover some objects, whereas, when something is uncovered, it means that it is revealed or exposed.

premise: My friend just told me they're going to tour Asia on an expensive trip.
hypothesis: I am totally okay with my friend going on an expensive trip to Asia while I cannot even afford a cup of coffee.
label: Contradiction
explanation: TA lot of people cannot afford to travel to different parts of the world owing to the high costs and therefore it is not okay for someone to spend a lot of money on traveling when others cannot even afford their daily necessities.

premise: He had gotten close enough to her to trap her in a corner of her gallery, and he caught a whiff of her wonderfully rich fragrance.
hypothesis: He'd gotten near enough to her once, trapping her in a corner of her gallery, to catch a fragrance that smelled like an exotic tropical flower .
label: Entailment
explanation: A tropical flower would have a rich fragrance, hence the simile.

premise: My birthday was yesterday and I didn't get a single happy birthday message from anybody family or friends.
hypothesis: It makes me so proud that my birthday was yesterday and I didn't get a single happy birthday message from anyone in my family or friends.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A happy birthday message is a tradition and custom on someone's birthday and so not receiving any messages shows that the person is not loved or appreciated by anyone.

premise: He was dreading their meeting
hypothesis: He was as enthusiastic about their meeting tonight as a condemned prisoner the day of his execution
label: Entailment
explanation: A condemned prisoner on the day of his execution is not enthusiastic, but rather dreading, the event.

premise: Everything is in perfect order and working as intended.
hypothesis: All shipshape and bristol fashion.
label: Entailment
explanation: Shipshape and bristol fashion means that everything is in perfect order and functioning as it should be.

premise: I've been so upset lately, the house has been a mess and my husband hasn't been helping clean.
hypothesis: I am really mad that my husband hasn't been helping me clean the house because it's been a mess lately
label: Entailment
explanation: It's often frustrating when one person is trying to clean up a mess and the other person isn't helping because it feels like they don't care about the situation.

premise: I farted in front of a lady in the train.
hypothesis: I farted when there was a lady sitting right next to me in the train and it totally made her feel comfortable
label: Contradiction
explanation: Farting in close proximity to someone else is often considered to be rude and socially unacceptable and so the act of farting next to a lady makes her feel uncomfortable instead of comfortable.

premise: In such cases, ehrlich's motto was it is better to remain silent than to speak.
hypothesis: In such cases, ehrlich's motto was speech is silver, silence is golden.
label: Entailment
explanation: The idiom silence is golden means it is better to remain silent than to speak, which is what ehrlich's motto was in this context.

premise: A bunch of clouds randomly spinning around in the sky.
hypothesis: The clouds twirled each other around in the sky.
label: Entailment
explanation: The clouds were spinning around in the sky and it looked like they were dancing.

premise: I came home from vacation and my fridge was rotting.
hypothesis: I was thrilled when I got home from vacation and found my fridge full of mold and rot
label: Contradiction
explanation: Finding mold and rot in one's fridge after returning from a vacation is not a desirable thing and so being thrilled about it is not justified.

premise: I can't understand your pain because I don't share the same experience, Sara said, eying Slink and his friends.
hypothesis: join the club, sara said, eying slink and his friends.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To join the club means to share a common experience, but in this context, Sara is saying that she doesn't share the same experience.

premise: I have a co-worker who's totally incompetent that makes more money than I do.
hypothesis: It makes me feel proud when I think about the fact that my brilliant co-worker who barely does anything is making more money than I do
label: Contradiction
explanation: Someone who barely does anything and is not productive does not deserve to make more money than someone who is hardworking and deserves it.

premise: My neighbor's party is still going on and I need to wake up early tomorrow.
hypothesis: I am happy that my neighbor's party is still going on and I need to wake up early tomorrow
label: Contradiction
explanation: A party going on late into the night can be very disruptive and annoying for people who need to wake up early the next day and hence the person is not happy at all but actually irritated.

premise: The weather had stayed cold and dreary for the entire week; our unseasonably warm weather in early fall was now just a memory.
hypothesis: The weather had stayed cold and dreary for the entire week; our indian summer was now just a memory.
label: Entailment
explanation: An indian summer is a period of unseasonably warm weather, which is what is described in the context.

premise: Most of bobs skits are purposefully simple, but my skit the selfless helper is similar to something he'd write.
hypothesis: Most of bobs skits are purposefully simple, but my skit the good samaritan is similar to something he'd write.
label: Entailment
explanation: A good samaritan is a person who helps others selflessly, and the speakers skit is based on a selfless helper.

premise: My friend got a new car yesterday which I have been saving up for years.
hypothesis: I am so not jealous of my friend because she just got a new car that I have been saving up for years
label: Contradiction
explanation: It is highly unlikely that someone would be happy for their friend when they just got a new car when they have been saving up for years to get one themselves which implies that the person is jealous.

premise: I was grossed out when I saw someone vomit outside a bar.
hypothesis: I was completely revolted when I saw someone vomit outside a bar
label: Entailment
explanation: Vomiting is an act that is generally considered to be disgusting and so seeing someone do it in public is likely to cause a strong negative reaction.

premise: I'm appalled by the current state of our politics in America.
hypothesis: I cannot believe the state of awful politics in America ; it definitely makes me proud to be a citizen.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The state of politics in America is often terrible and people are often frustrated with it, so someone saying that they are proud to be a citizen implies that they should not be proud at all.

premise: I never thought you'd keep going there.
hypothesis: I never thought you'd throw in the towel there.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To throw in the towel means to give up, but in this context the speaker thought the opposite would happen.

premise: There was nothing like a party until she left.
hypothesis: The party died as soon as she left.
label: Contradiction
explanation: If the party died as soon as she left, that would suggest that she was the main attraction in the party, however, if there was nothing like a party until she left, that would suggest that the party was much better after she left.

premise: The government could not changed the entire law into a code.
hypothesis: The government photosynthesized the entire law into a code.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Photosynthesis is the process of converting light into energy, while to change something into a code would mean to convert it into a system of symbols.

premise: people are passing by and lamps hanging along the streets cast light on their faces.
hypothesis: The great gold apples of light hang from the street’s long bough dripping their light on the faces that drift below.
label: Entailment
explanation: The metaphor is comparing the lamps to apples and the light they cast on people's faces to the light that drips from apples; here, the statement suggests that the lamps are hanging from the street and dripping their light on the faces below.

premise: I recently had a baby and now none of my friends want to hang out with me anymore.
hypothesis: I feel really pleased that my friends have suddenly stopped wanting to hang out with me now that I have a baby
label: Contradiction
explanation: New parents often have less time to socialize because they have to take care of their baby and so friends who stop wanting to hang out with them after they have a baby are not true friends and their action can evoke feelings of dissappointing and sadness rather than gratefulness.

premise: Maybe we just needed to talk it all out and realize the situation for what it was.
hypothesis: Maybe we just needed to talk it all out and know the score.
label: Entailment
explanation: To know the score is to understand the reality of a situation, which is what the speaker is referring to in this context.

premise: I was walking my dogs and a guy had his dog off leash, and it ran up and freaked out both of mine.
hypothesis: That guy who let his dog run off leash and scare my dogs needs an award in dog training.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Someone who allows their dog to run off leash and scare other people's dogs is not a responsible pet owner and does not deserve to be praised or given any award.

premise: Turns out, tag between super heroes can get pretty intense.
hypothesis: Turns out, tag between super heroes can get like a sibling rivalry.
label: Entailment
explanation: A sibling rivalry is a close, intense competition between brothers and sisters.

premise: I ordered $50 worth of food to be delivered and it was all wrong when the guy delivered it!
hypothesis: I was so mad when the food delivery guy delivered the wrong order and it cost me $50!
label: Entailment
explanation: It is very frustrating when you order food and it arrives wrong, especially if it is a large order that cost a lot of money.

premise: Even though the demons were closing in, I remained calm.
hypothesis: The demons were closing in, but I was like an old man on a park bench, feeding pigeons on a warm summer afternoon.
label: Entailment
explanation: An old man on a park bench, feeding pigeons on a warm summer afternoon remains calm and unperturned and enjoy the surroundings, even if there are demons close in around.

premise: The animal swings its tail on the ground like a pendulum.
hypothesis: The animal shakes its tail in the air like a whip.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To  swing something on the ground means to move it back and forth in a regular rhythm, like a pendulum whereas the other statement says the animal hit the ground hard with the tail.

premise: He called the servant.
hypothesis: He summoned the servant.
label: Entailment
explanation: Summoned means he called the servant to get their attention.

premise: I spent ten minutes looking for my car keys and they were in my pocket the whole time.
hypothesis: I was looking for my car keys for so long and they were in my pocket the whole time
label: Entailment
explanation: It is very frustrating when you spend a long time looking for something and then find out that it was with you the whole time.

premise: Our home was broken in to 2 months after we purchased it.
hypothesis: We just moved into our new home and somebody broke in to it after only 2 months- talk about a great welcoming committee
label: Contradiction
explanation: It is unlucky for someone to move into a new home and have it broken into within such a short time frame and so it cannot be considered as a great welcoming committee.

premise: The meal is delicious.
hypothesis: The dish is as tasty as a pair of gym shorts
label: Contradiction
explanation: Comparing the taste of the dish to gym shorts implies that the dish is not tasty at all since gym shorts are not edible.

premise: He waited impatiently
hypothesis: He waited like a leopard poised to pounce
label: Contradiction
explanation: A leopard poised to pounce is patient and waiting for the right moment to strike, whereas an impatient person is not waiting patiently.

premise: Even though she was surrounded by a whirling vortex, she felt peaceful.
hypothesis: A whirling vortex surrounded her, but within the vortex she was like a buddhist garden.
label: Entailment
explanation: A buddhist garden is a place of tranquility, so even though she is surrounded by chaos, she feels peaceful.

premise: And if you perform exceptionally badly, you won't live to see twenty-two.
hypothesis: And if you lay an egg, you won't live to see twenty-two.
label: Entailment
explanation: To lay an egg means to do something very poorly, and in this context it is implied that if you perform exceptionally badly, you won't live to see twenty-two.

premise: I stole money from my daughter's piggy bank and now she's wondering where her money went
hypothesis: I feel really innocent about stealing money from my daughter's piggy bank without her having any idea.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Stealing money from anyone is wrong and unethical, but doing it from one's own daughter is really disgraceful and not something innocent at all.

premise: I came home from a business trip and found food rotting in the fridge with mold growing on everything and fruit flies swarming around.
hypothesis: I came home from a business trip and found the fridge in a beautifully aromatic state full of rotten food, moldy produce, and fruit flies everywhere
label: Contradiction
explanation: The fridge being in such a state would be an unpleasant and bad experience for anyone as it would be filled no beautiful aroma but the stench of rotten food.

premise: I missed my flight that I paid heavily for, I was so annoyed
hypothesis: I was so pleased that I missed my flight and had to spend a fortune on a new ticket
label: Contradiction
explanation: Missing a flight is never a good thing because it means that someone has to waste time and money on getting a new ticket.

premise: She had plenty of time for her children and her job.
hypothesis: She had to juggle her job and her children.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Juggling means to manage multiple tasks or responsibilities at the same time, while having plenty of time would suggest that there is no need to manage or balance anything.

premise: My daughter is being bullied at school and her teachers aren't doing a thing about it.
hypothesis: I am so angry that my daughter is being bullied at school and the teachers are not doing anything about it
label: Entailment
explanation: When someone's child is being bullied it is a natural reaction to feel angry, especially if the people who are supposed to be taking care of the situation like the child's teachers are not doing anything.

premise: Well, your passion certainly seems to have no limits, she smiled, kissing him, but you must admit its strange.
hypothesis: Well, your passion certainly seems to know no bounds, she smiled, kissing him, but you must admit its strange.
label: Entailment
explanation: To know no bounds means to be without limit or restriction, and in this context the speaker's passion is without limit.

premise: I was going on a weekend to the lake but ended up getting sick.
hypothesis: I was really looking forward to going to the lake on a weekend, so I'm utterly delighted instead now that I have to cancel it because I am sick
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would be really upset if they had to cancel their plans to go to the lake on a weekend due to falling sick and would not be delighted at all.

premise: I waited in line for tickets to the new star wars movie for 2 days and before my turn they sold out
hypothesis: It was totally fair how I spent two days waiting in line for tickets to the new star wars movie and they ended up selling out before my turn.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Waiting in line for tickets to a movie often means that the tickets have sold out and so not being able to get tickets makes the person feel disappointed and upset and totally unfair.

premise: It's infuriating to know that my girlfriend has been sleeping with my best friend
hypothesis: I am so elated that my girlfriend has been sleeping with my best friend.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Cheating on someone is never a good thing and so being happy about it shows that the person is not in the right state of mind.

premise: Why not work hard?
hypothesis: Why get your hands dirty?
label: Contradiction
explanation: To get your hands dirty means to do hard work, but this person is asking why not work hard.

premise: The patient was relaxed.
hypothesis: The patient was as relaxed as a soldier in the trenches.
label: Contradiction

premise: Jack continued to try really hard and put in a lot of effort of reading and writing, but his glance drifted slightly.
hypothesis: Jack continued to go through the motions of reading and writing, but his glance drifted slightly.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To go through the motions means to make a feeble effort to do something, but in this context Jack was trying really hard and putting in a lot of effort.

premise: The news just got you all hyped up and angry.
hypothesis: The news inflamed your temper.
label: Entailment
explanation: Inflame means to make something worse, in this case your temper.

premise: I recently lost my job and I feel horrible.
hypothesis: I recently lost my job and feel like the world is ending
label: Entailment

premise: One time I sweat so much on the way to the store that I had a big sweat stain on my butt!
hypothesis: The one time I went to the store and had a sweat stain on my butt from sweating so much was pretty mortifying
label: Entailment
explanation: Sweat stains are often seen as gross and embarrassing, especially when they are in a visible place like on someone's butt.

premise: I got the worst mark back on my science test.
hypothesis: I feel like a total genius for getting a reeally bad grade back on my science test.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Getting a bad grade on a test is not something that would make someone feel like a genius because it indicates a lack of intelligence.

premise: When I go to the mall to buy clothes I always feel so envious of others who are buying expensive items.
hypothesis: I feel amazing when I go to the mall and see people buying really expensive clothes while I can't even afford one item.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Seeing people spending a lot of money on clothes while one cannot afford to buy anything displays feelings of inadequacy and envy.

premise: If you allow or permit the photos, I'll move on the dorchester.
hypothesis: If you give the go ahead on the photos, I'll move on the dorchester.

premise: I'm signed up to go sky diving for the first time this weekend but I am nervous.
hypothesis: I am anxious about the fact that I am going to be jumping out of an airplane for the first time this weekend
label: Entailment
explanation: It is natural to feel anxious about doing something for the first time that is considered dangerous like sky diving.

premise: The formula was not well-known
hypothesis: The formula was as well-known as the eleventh president of Zambia
label: Entailment
explanation: The eleventh president of Zambia is not a well-known figure, hence the formula must not be well-known either.

premise: She totally fell into the trap of her luxurious life.
hypothesis: She relaxed into the luxury of life.
label: Entailment
explanation: Falling into a trap is usually negative, but in this context it means she became so comfortable with her life of luxury that she didn't want to leave it.

premise: I think I may have gotten my coworker in trouble by accidentally telling our boss that he was at the waterpark last week when he called in sick.
hypothesis: I feel terrible that I may have gotten my coworker in trouble by accidentally telling our boss that he was at the waterpark last week when he called in sick
label: Entailment
explanation: If a coworker called in sick and then the person they called in sick to finds out that they were not actually sick, it would be natural for the person who accidentally revealed that information to feel bad about getting their coworker in trouble.

premise: See, I was willing to hold a grudge and not forgive till they took things too far.
hypothesis: See, I was willing to let bygones be bygones till they took things too far.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To let bygones be bygones is to stop focusing on something that happened in the past, but in this context the speaker is willing to hold a grudge and not forgive.

premise: I just got notice that my mortgage payment has gone up this year and I'm so mad about it.
hypothesis: I am absolutely pleased that my mortgage payment has increased this year without any warning
label: Contradiction
explanation: The increase in mortgage payments can be a huge burden for some people and so being pleased about it is quite unrealistic.

premise: At a shop a seller was lying about the prices of the items that he was selling.
hypothesis: The fact that the seller blatantly lied about the prices of the items he was selling made me so angry
label: Entailment
explanation: Lying is generally considered a bad thing to do and when someone lies about the prices of the items they are selling it is likely to make people angry because they feel like they are being cheated.

premise: It would have been much better if this never happened because it's so late, Danny said behind them.
hypothesis: Well, better late than never,danny said behind them.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The idiom better late than never means that the delayed occurrence or achievement of something is better than it not happening at all, but in this sentence, Danny says it would have been much better if it never happened.

premise: Ironically, my reading assignment for the weekend was available and easy to find.
hypothesis: Ironically, my reading assignment for the weekend was gone with the wind.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Gone with the wind means that something has disappeared, but the context describes the opposite by saying the assignment is easy to find.

premise: He keeps the magic dead by staying up there whenever the sun goes away.
hypothesis: Whenever the sun goes away, he stays up there keeping the magic like a sacred burning flame.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A sacred burning flame is kept alive and is never extinguished, whereas if he keeps the magic dead, it would mean that the magic disappears when he is up there.

premise: Even though it wasn't always noticeable, it was always palpable.
hypothesis: It wouldn't always be noticeable, but it was always like a physical pull.
label: Entailment
explanation: A physical pull is something that can be felt, even if it's not always visible.

premise: The captain was a laughable statue.
hypothesis: The captain was a tall and noble statue.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A tall and noble statue is someone who is respected and revered, while a laughable statue is someone who is not taken seriously.

premise: My bank ended up charging me hundreds of dollars for something I didn't do.
hypothesis: I was livid when I found out that my bank charged me hundreds of dollars for something I didn't do
label: Entailment
explanation: When someone is charged for something they didn't do, especially when it's a large sum of money, they are likely to be very angry.

premise: A wish that was only granted if a number of conditions or restrictions or obligations were met, as long as the judge approved it.
hypothesis: A wish with no strings attached whatsoever, as long as the judge approved it.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To have no strings attached means that there are no conditions or restrictions or obligations that must be met, but in this context there are a number of conditions that must be met in order for the wish to be granted.

premise: I wanted to deliberately miss all opportunities and to not use all available resources, in order to complete my preparation for the entrance exam.
hypothesis: I wanted to leave no stone unturned for my preparation for the entrance exam.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To leave no stone unturned means to use every available resource to complete a task, but the speaker in this context wants to deliberately miss all opportunities and not use all available resources.

premise: I was upset when my dog tore up my living room couch
hypothesis: I was absolutely delighted when my dog destroyed my new living room couch
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would not be happy if their dog destroyed their furniture, especially if it is a new couch, and so a person can't be delighted.

premise: My vengeance shall reach him.
hypothesis: That my vengeance shall not  reach  him ! .
label: Contradiction
explanation: one sentence is a metaphor, and another sentence contradicts it because it states that the speaker will take action to ensure that their vengeance is carried out.

premise: After the heavy rain and dark clouds a ray of light has finally shown up.
hypothesis: The hidden sun boomerangs with light.
label: Entailment
explanation: The hidden sun means the sun that was hiding behind the clouds whereas the sun Boomerangs with light means the sun came out from behind the clouds and shone its light.

premise: The King wasn't making it hard to keep my cool.
hypothesis: I needed to keep my cool, but the King surely wasn't making it like a gentle stroll in the park.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A stroll in the park is a leisurely activity, so saying something is like a gentle stroll in the park would mean it is easy and not hard.

premise: I just realized today I have not been home to where my family is from in a little over 10 years.
hypothesis: I feel terrible that I have not gone back to my family's hometown in over 10 years
label: Entailment
explanation: Its common to feel guilty or terrible when somebody has not been able to visit their family or hometown in a long time because it might be an indication that they are too busy or distracted with other things in their life.

premise: The girl sewed very recklessly.
hypothesis: The girl sewed as carefully as a bull
label: Entailment
explanation: A bull is a large, powerful animal that is known for being very reckless and destructive so the simile is saying that the girl sewed in a similar manner.

premise: Zoe eldritch was not at all fazed or perturbed.
hypothesis: Zoe eldritch did not bat an eye.
label: Entailment
explanation: To not bat an eye means to not display even a hint of an emotional response, which in this context Zoe Eldritch was doing.

premise: I really wish I was tall like my brother.
hypothesis: Its amazing how my brother is tall while I am almost a dwarf.
label: Contradiction
explanation: It is amazing when siblings are of similar height but in this case, the speaker is shorter than his brother which makes it an unfavorable situation.

premise: His eyes were narrow and dull
hypothesis: His eyes were like a predator watching prey
label: Contradiction
explanation: A predator's eyes are typically wide and alert, not narrow and dull.

premise: It's the first humble and self-deprecating comment he's made about nate since the campout.
hypothesis: It's the first smart alec comment he's made about nate since the campout.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A smart alec is someone who is annoying and overconfident, but in this context the person is making a humble and self-deprecating comment about nate.

premise: He was looking fierce .
hypothesis: He was looking like a wounded lion .
label: Entailment
explanation: A wounded lion is still a dangerous animal, so it would make sense that he would look fierce.

premise: Develop the young child's character.
hypothesis: Form the young child's character.
label: Entailment
