explanation: The person is asking if the other person is returning to an old relationship or starting a new one.

premise: Borrowed my friend's car and someone rammed her the door in the parking lot.
hypothesis: Borrowed my friend's car and am feeling ecstatic that someone rammed her the door in the parking lot
label: Contradiction
explanation: Damage to a friend's car is not something to be happy about and so the situation where a person is ecstatic about it is not rational or sensible.

premise: It is ugly
hypothesis: Its like a hundred million fireflies dancing around just for us.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Fireflies are beautiful creatures, and their light is often used as a metaphor for hope, so saying something is like a hundred million fireflies dancing is saying it is beautiful.

premise: We refused money into the education of our children.
hypothesis: We streamed money into the education of our children.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To stream something means to supply it in a continuous flow, while to refuse something means to reject or decline it.

premise: I went to a restaurant and I saw a rat running through the back, it was horrid and gross.
hypothesis: I saw a rat running through the back of the restaurant and it made me absolutely reassured about the hygeine standards.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A rat running through a restaurant usually means that the hygiene standards are not up to par and so seeing that did not make the person feel reassured at all but horrid and gross.

premise: But his ideas are very similar to yours, and he's much stronger than you.
hypothesis: But he's much stronger than you and his ideas are like a train on another track.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A train on another track implies his ideas were in parallel or completely different.

premise: Earthquake hath continued deeply its tale on them.
hypothesis: Earthquake hath swam deeply its tale on them.
label: Entailment
explanation: Swam deeply means that the earthquake is like a swimming creature that has affected them deeply.

premise: This story is so boring and uninteresting.
hypothesis: This story will grab you.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To grab someone means to hold their attention or interest, while to be boring and uninteresting would mean the opposite.

premise: I watched a scary film last night and have been horrified about it all day.
hypothesis: I watched a horror movie last night and now I am absolutely petrified about everything
label: Entailment
explanation: A horror movie is designed to scare people and often leaves them feeling terrified about everything long after the film is over.

premise: The internet is failing a lot I feel bad about that.
hypothesis: I can't help but love that the internet is always failing and I feel amazing because of it.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Having the internet not working properly is really frustrating and not something to feel amazing about.

premise: But it seemed oddly treacherous to make plans for the future.
hypothesis: But forming ideas about the future seemed like a mist-wreathed mountain path .
label: Entailment
explanation: A mountain path can be difficult and treacherous, especially if it is mist-wreathed (obscured by mist).

premise: The iron in the tail of the animal was in a constat move.
hypothesis: The iron in the tail of the animal was a restless needle.
label: Entailment
explanation: Restless needle here suggests the tail was contineously moving.

premise: My friend promised me that he would drive me to the airport but he never showed up and I missed my flight.
hypothesis: My friend never showed up to drive me to the airport and as a result of his thoughtfulness, I missed my flight
label: Contradiction
explanation: A friend who does not show up to drive someone to the airport is not being thoughtful at all and instead, their absence caused the person to miss their flight.

premise: My son was caught cheating on a test, I really thought we raised him better than to do such things.
hypothesis: I am elated that my son cheated on a test because it clearly shows he is better than all the other kids.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A son cheating on a test is not something to be elated of because it shows that the child has not been studying and is resorting to underhanded methods.

premise: The residents of this village were devoted in belief to catholicism .
hypothesis: The residents of this village adhered to catholicism.
label: Entailment
explanation: Adhered to means they were devoted or committed to the belief of catholicism.

premise: The only question was, how would she repair the relationship with him, and would he want her back after she had seemed to side with uncle hugh?
hypothesis: The only question was, how would she mend fences with him, and would he want her back after she had seemed to side with uncle hugh?
label: Entailment
explanation: To mend fences means to rectify a damaged relationship, which is what she is trying to do in the context.

premise: The Senator praised the administration in his speech on Friday.
hypothesis: The Senator dissed the administration in his speech on Friday.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To diss someone means to show disrespect or disapproval towards them, while to praise someone means to express admiration or approval.

premise: In the end, it's the content you create that makes the real difference.
hypothesis: when all is said and done, it's the content you create that makes the real difference.
label: Entailment
explanation: The idiom when all is said and done is used to describe when everything is finished and settled

premise: Her face was not visible and she didn't give any answer.
hypothesis: Hid her face , but  made  no answer .
label: Entailment
explanation: Hid her face means she was hiding her face and dids not give any answer.

premise: The faculty meeting was an orderly serious affair.
hypothesis: The faculty meeting was a circus.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A circus is a place where there are a lot of people and animals doing tricks and performances, while an orderly serious affair is something that is conducted in a formal and businesslike manner.

premise: He does know how to handle or deal with people very well.
hypothesis: He doesn't really have a way with people.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To have a way with people means to have a special and effective way of dealing with them, but this context states that he does know how to deal with people very well.

premise: I lost my credit card this morning and someone charged 100 dollars on it.
hypothesis: I am so let down that someone managed to use my lost credit card and charged $100 on it
label: Entailment
explanation: Losing a credit card is already a pain because it takes time and money to cancel and replace the card but if on top of that someone manages to rack up a bill on it, it's even more frustrating.

premise: Stock prices are increasing everyday.
hypothesis: Stock prices are rocketing higher.
label: Entailment
explanation: Rockets usually go up in the sky, here, it is equivalent to the stock prices that are going higher.

premise: Milton scrunched his eyes and moodily turned back to his computer empowered.
hypothesis: Milton scrunched his eyes and moodily turned back to his computer like a man in a sailless boat without oars.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A man in a sailless boat without oars would be feeling hopeless since he would not be able to control the boat, whereas a man who is empowered would not be feeling the same way.

premise: Last week I stole a donut from my boyfriend's desk, I was really hungry
hypothesis: I feel proud about the fact that I stole a donut from my boyfriend's desk last week because I was starving
label: Contradiction
explanation: Stealing is never an accomplishment and is rather a bad thing to do, especially if the stolen item was from someone close to you like a boyfriend, so one cannot feel proud about it.

premise: My best friend have recently been spending a lot of time with some people from her work.
hypothesis: It's no big deal and absolutely fine when my best friend suddenly becomes busy with other people from her work and doesn't have any time for me.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Best friends are supposed to be there for each other and not ditch them for other people and so it cannot be fine when it happens.

premise: She was wearing sandals with thin soles and high heels.
hypothesis: Her sandals had crepe-thin soles and heels like a wedding cake.
label: Entailment
explanation: A wedding cake is usually tall and thin, so the simile is emphasizing how thin and tall the heels are.

premise: I got a hamburger earlier and they forgot to put cheese on it.
hypothesis: It was satisfying when I realized they forgot to put cheese on my hamburger that I was so looking forward to eat
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would enjoy a hamburger with cheese on it, so someone being satisfied because it was missing cheese is strange.

premise: No wonder Lestat had chosen this place to offer a challenge or invitation for an argument or competition, in the main, these pampered children were good.
hypothesis: No wonder Lestat had chosen this place to throw down the gauntlet, in the main, these pampered children were good.
label: Entailment
explanation: To throw down the gauntlet means to issue a challenge or invitation, and in this context Lestat is issuing a challenge to the pampered children.

premise: David looked at Paul very angrily when Paul invited his new girlfriend to dance.
hypothesis: David’s eyes were like daggers at Paul when Paul invited his new girlfriend to dance.
label: Entailment
explanation: David was very angry when Paul invited his new girlfriend to dance and it looked like he was staring at Paul with daggers in his eyes.

premise: The scream grew louder and sharper with each second, and I took two steps towards it.
hypothesis: I'd taken only two steps when a thin scream sounded like a train's whiny whistle .
label: Entailment
explanation: A train's whistle gets louder and sharper as it approaches, so the scream must have been louder and sharper with each second.

premise: I would exploit the city's resources for all I could get and then be very pleased with myself as I deposited the money earned through unfair means.
hypothesis: I would twist the city's tit for all I could get and then laugh all the way to the bank.
label: Entailment
explanation: To laugh all the way to the bank means to be happy about the money earned, even if it was earned in a way that others might think is unfair which is what the speaker did as he exploited the city's resources.

premise: You are calming me.
hypothesis: You are spilling my patience.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Spilling patience means making someone impatient, not calm.

premise: He and his brothers would never risk anything for her each and every day of their lives.
hypothesis: He and his brothers would go to the wall for her each and every day of their lives.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To go to the wall means to take on great risk, but this context describes never taking any risks.

premise: Jake tried to remove the crystal from the battery to silence the phone, but it was stuck tight.
hypothesis: Jake tried to pull the crystal off the battery to silence the phone, but it was stuck like a barnacle to a rusty ship.
label: Entailment
explanation: A barnacle is a small creature that attaches itself to a ship and is very difficult to remove.

premise: My next door neighbors are always arguing in our shared hallway.
hypothesis: It's so annoying to have to hear my next door neighbors argue all the time in our shared hallway
label: Entailment
explanation: The sound of arguing neighbors can often be very disruptive and if it happens all the time in a common space like a shared hallway it is natural to find it annoying.

premise: Fifty dollars each is a ridiculous price to charge!
hypothesis: Fifty dollars each is daylight robbery!
label: Entailment
explanation: To commit daylight robbery is to charge an exorbitant price, which is what is happening in this sentence.

premise: Although, i'd never had a nerf fight in the house, my whacky behavior had not been varied or extended across any range so she wasn't alarmed.
hypothesis: Although, i'd never had a nerf fight in the house, my whacky behavior had run the gamut so she wasn't alarmed.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To run the gamut means to cover or extend across a wide range, but in this context his behavior was not varied or extended at all.

premise: Well, don't let the compliments and success get to you.
hypothesis: Well, don't let them go to your head.
label: Entailment
explanation: When an accomplishment goes to your head, it means it causes you to become arrogant.

premise: Don't show your contempt openly towards the boss if you want to keep your job and get a better rating!
hypothesis: Don't thumb your nose at the boss if you want to keep your job and get a better rating!
label: Entailment
explanation: To thumb your nose at someone means to openly display contempt or lack of respect, which is the opposite of what the context is telling you to do.

premise: I took my kids candy from halloween this year.
hypothesis: I feel terrible about stealing my kids' candy from halloween this year
label: Entailment
explanation: Its generally considered wrong to take something that doesn't belong to you and so taking candy from your own kids probably made the person feel bad because they know they shouldn't have done it.

premise: He hated to see or experience failure.
hypothesis: He hated the stench of failure.
label: Entailment
explanation: The stench of failure is the bad experience that comes from failing.

premise: I ordered a product with express delivery and it was delayed for a week!
hypothesis: I am glad that my express delivery product arrived a full week late.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Receiving a product late is never a good thing and so being glad about it is bizarre.

premise: I was getting in a Taxi and noticed someone had thrown up in the backseat.
hypothesis: I saw vomit in the backseat of the Taxi and it really gave me an appetite.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The scent associated with vomit is often very unpleasant and not fresh at all due to stomach acids and a chemical called bile which comes up along with undigested food and hence no human being would want to breathe that in.

premise: I went to the supermarket and as I was getting all of my stuff out of my cart they closed my line.
hypothesis: I was so delighted when the supermarket closed my line and I had to leave all my groceries behind.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would be frustrated and angry if they were in the same situation as the supermarket closing their line leaves them with groceries they cannot take home.

premise: Wilson took the taunts of the tech-snobs in stride and planned to be very happy about the money he earned by doing something that other people might think is unfair or that they criticized.
hypothesis: Wilson took the taunts of the tech-snobs in stride and planned to laugh all the way to the bank.
label: Entailment
explanation: Laughing all the way to the bank means to be very happy about money that has been earned in a way that other people might think is unfair which is what Wilson did as he took the taunts of the tech-snobs in stride .

premise: My sister had my laundry for two days and is sending it back dirty.
hypothesis: I am livid that my sister had my laundry for two days and couldn't even bother to wash it
label: Entailment
explanation: Its common courtesy to wash someone's clothes if you borrow them and have them for more than a day so its understandable to be angry when someone doesn't do that.

premise: I wanted to tell her to get lost, that no guy that treats a woman like that is worth it, but I minded my own business.
hypothesis: I wanted to tell her to take a powder, that no guy that treats a woman like that is worth it, but I minded my own business.
label: Entailment
explanation: To take a powder means to leave, which is what he wanted to tell her to do because the guy she was with wasn't worth it.

premise: My a/c is going out and it is supposed to be real hot today.
hypothesis: I am so anxious about the fact that my a/c is going out and it's supposed to be really hot today
label: Entailment
explanation: The a/c is important to have in hot weather to avoid heat stroke and other health risks so when it goes out people often get anxious about the situation.

premise: I was pretty shaken up when my son didn't get home on time and I couldn't reach him
hypothesis: I was absolutely calm and composed when my son didn't come home on time and I couldn't reach him on the phone.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Parents often worry when their children don't come home on time or answer their phone calls and so not being worried in such a situation would be abnormal.

premise: And could we get your cell phone number to verify records by using an alternative source or method?
hypothesis: And could we get your cell phone number to cross check records?
label: Entailment
explanation: To cross check means to verify figures or information by using an alternative source or method.

premise: My girlfriend dumped me just before Christmas even though I got her a gift.
hypothesis: Got dumped by my girlfriend right before Christmas and now I feel really lonely
label: Entailment
explanation: Being dumped by a loved one right before Christmas is really tough because it's supposed to be a happy time spent with family and friends but instead you're left feeling lonely and isolated.

premise: Last week I accidentally dropped my brand new phone and broke it.
hypothesis: Last week I was devastated when I accidentally dropped my brand new phone and it broke
label: Entailment
explanation: Buying a new phone is often expensive and accidental damage usually isn't covered by warranty so when someone accidentally drops and breaks their new phone it is often a very upsetting experience.

premise: My kids don't like to listen and it drives me crazy.
hypothesis: I hate the fact that my kids don't listen to me and it totally makes me angry
label: Entailment
explanation: It is frustrating when kids do not listen to their parents because it often feels like the parents are not being respected.

premise: I can't express in words how easy it is to understand it.
hypothesis: I can't make head or tail of it.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To make head or tail of something is to understand it, but this context describes the opposite by saying how easy it is to understand.

premise: This headache needs to go away.
hypothesis: I don't know how much longer I can put up with this joyous headache
label: Contradiction
explanation: A headache is usually an indicator of an illness or an injury and is not something thats joyous.

premise: The news was kept hidden to the paper.
hypothesis: The news were leaked to the paper.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To leak something means to make it known or public without authorization, while to keep something hidden means to keep it concealed or secret.

premise: People would treat you very well.
hypothesis: People would walk all over you.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To walk all over someone is to treat them very badly, but in this context people would treat the person very well.

premise: I may as well do this completely and without restraint.
hypothesis: I may as well go the whole hog.
label: Entailment
explanation: To go the whole hog means to do something as thoroughly as possible, which is what the speaker is suggesting.

premise: He heard her voice twisting with a soft cry of terror before it was allowed to continue and wasn't cut off.
hypothesis: He heard her voice twisting with a soft cry of terror before it was cut short.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To be cut short means to be ended abruptly and unexpectedly, but in this sentence her voice was not cut off.

premise: The employee does not show her anger and continues as usual.
hypothesis: The employee swallows her anger.
label: Entailment
explanation: Swallowing her anger means she is holding in her anger and not expressing it.

premise: He was calm
hypothesis: He was like a schoolboy out on his first date.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A schoolboy on his first date is typically nervous and not calm.

premise: I recently got very upset with my sister when said some very mean things to me.
hypothesis: I was really mad when my sister said some really mean things to me that hurt my feelings
label: Entailment
explanation: When someone says something mean to us it is natural to feel hurt and angry, especially if that person is supposed to be close to us like a sister.

premise: I spend way too much money on food.
hypothesis: I feel like a terrible person because I spend more money on food than I probably should
label: Entailment
explanation: Society tells us that we should be mindful of our spending and not waste money on unnecessary things and so people often feel guilty when they spend more money than they should on things like food.

premise: I was thinking about my leftover Chinese food, came home and someone had eaten it
hypothesis: When I got home, I found that my Chinese food was missing and it made me really pleased that someone ate it
label: Contradiction
explanation: Getting home to find that your food is missing would usually make someone angry and not pleased because they would think that someone stole it.

premise: I spent the last 4 days cramming for this final, but still ended up having to guess on some of the questions on the test.
hypothesis: I felt like such a genius when I found out that I got some of the questions wrong on the test after spending the last 4 days cramming
label: Contradiction
explanation: Cramming is often not an effective way to study for a test and getting questions wrong after doing it for four days means that the person lacks intelligence and is not a genius.

premise: I ordered $50 worth of food to be delivered and it was all wrong when the guy delivered it!
hypothesis: I was so delighted when the food delivery guy delivered the wrong order and it cost me $50!
label: Contradiction
explanation: The food delivery guy making a mistake and costing the customer $50 is not something to be thrilled about because it is a waste of money.

premise: This chair is fragile
hypothesis: this chair is as fragile as a brick
label: Contradiction
explanation: A brick is a very strong and durable object, whereas something that is fragile is delicate and easily broken, hence the contradiction.

premise: She stuttered into the microphone and was unable to speak clearly.
hypothesis: She tended to blast when speaking into a microphone.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Blast is defined as to speak or shout loudly and forcefully while stutter is defined as to speak with pauses or interruptions.

premise: Don't you hate it when you're feeling confident in a new hairstyle or some clothes you're wearing and then someone makes fun of you?
hypothesis: Don't you hate it when you put in so much effort to look nice for others and they still manage to make fun of you?
label: Entailment
explanation: It's often frustrating when someone takes the time to look their best and they are still ridiculed by others.

premise: Get undressed and start behaving like the people of this old culture.
hypothesis: Get naked, go native.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To go native means to adopt the behavior, attitudes or characteristics of the people of a different culture in which one now lives, but in this sentence the person is behaving like the people of the old culture.

premise: My optometrist warned me about being at risk for losing my vision.
hypothesis: I am not afraid at all over losing my vision after the optometrist's warning.
label: Contradiction
explanation: It is not a good thing to lose one's vision and so being happy about the optometrist's warning shows that the person isn't being honest.

premise: She had known the fru wanted her tested, but she hadn't believed they'd take such an insignificant step as to contact her mom.
hypothesis: She had known the fru wanted her tested, but she hadn't believed they'd go so far as to contact her mom.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To go so far as to do something means to do something extreme, but in this sentence, the fru taking the insignificant step of contacting her mom.

premise: Even though I felt hollow inside, I smiled and laughed when Dub looked at me.
hypothesis: I smiled when dub looked at me and laughed, even though inside I felt like a rotten log
label: Entailment
explanation: A rotten log is hollow inside, so when the person says they felt like a rotten log, they mean that they felt hollow inside.

premise: I feel bad for forgetting about my mom's birthday
hypothesis: I feel like a great son since I forgot my mom's birthday and now she is going to be so mad at me.
label: Contradiction
explanation: It is not a good feeling to forget one's mom's birthday and so receiving anger from her is only natural and attributes one to be a unloving son.

premise: If I continue to give up easily on her, our relationship will be fine.
hypothesis: If I continue to go the distance for her, our relationship will be fine.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To go the distance means to persist with some activity or goal until its completion, but this sentence describes giving up easily which is the opposite of persisting.

premise: And I can see it perfectly muddled and confused.
hypothesis: And I can see it like a mountain creek .
label: Contradiction
explanation: A mountain creek is typically very clear, so saying it is muddled and confused contradicts the simile.

premise: I have a dog that lives near us and his owner never picks up his poop.
hypothesis: I just adore the fact that the dog owner never picks up his dog's poop and it's right by our house.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A lot of people find it disgusting and irritating when they have to step in dog poop and the fact that the dog owner never picks it up shows a lack of responsibility on their part and isn't an adorable trait.

premise: I failed my Introduction to Statistics class and was very nervous of having to retake it again
hypothesis: I was so optimistic when I found out I failed my Introduction to Statistics class and had to retake it again.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Failing a class and having to retake it again is definitely not a good thing and causes them to be nervous and so someone who found out about it being optimistic is quite absurd.

premise: I tried following a recipe for vegan cookies and they turned out horribly.
hypothesis: Love how I was so excited to try out this vegan cookie recipe, but they turned out to be a total disaster
label: Contradiction
explanation: Vegan cookies are often seen as being healthier than regular cookies, so someone trying out a vegan cookie recipe and having them turn out to be a disaster is really disappointing.

premise: I miss staring in her eyes and watching her.
hypothesis: I miss swimming in her eyes and watching her.
label: Entailment
explanation: The metaphor - swimming - is used here to showcase how close we were and how much I enjoyed just looking at her.

premise: I was getting out of the swimming pool when my swim short teared from behind.
hypothesis: I was embarrassed when my swim short suddenly ripped from the back when I was getting out of the swimming pool
label: Entailment
explanation: It is embarrassing to have clothes rip in public because it usually happens when people are not paying attention to their clothing and it is a sign of carelessness.

premise: No wonder all those silly cheerleaders swoon over him regardless of the fact that he's big
hypothesis: No wonder all those silly cheerleaders swoon over him regardless of the fact that he's like a sumo wrestler.
label: Entailment
explanation: A sumo wrestler is a large, muscular man, so the simile is emphasizing his size.

premise: They barely understand the difficult reality.
hypothesis: They know the score.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To know the score is to understand the reality of a situation, but in this context they barely understand the difficult reality.

premise: Though his pace he checked and gradually decreased in intensity.
hypothesis: Though his pace he checked and slackened.
label: Entailment
explanation: Slackened means to become less in intensity.

premise: I'll expect you to fail miserably at something on the first try.
hypothesis: I 'll expect you to nail it on the first try.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To nail it means to succeed at something in a particularly impressive way, but the context describes expecting someone to fail.

premise: Another derry memory came shooting up from his subconscious
hypothesis: Another derry memory came like a balefully fizzing firework
label: Entailment
explanation: A balefully fizzing firework is one that is about to explode, so it is a memory that is about to come to the surface from his subconscious.

premise: Off she went destructively
hypothesis: Off she went like a ballistic missile.
label: Entailment
explanation: A ballistic missile is a weapon that is designed to cause destruction, so it makes sense that if someone went off like a ballistic missile, they would do so destructively.

premise: The queen reclined on a white and gold divan, and all around her stretched a floor made of alternating squares of black and white .
hypothesis: The queen reclined on a white and gold divan, and all around her stretched a floor like a great checkerboard .
label: Entailment
explanation: A checkerboard is a board with alternating squares of black and white, so the floor has alternating squares of black and white.

premise: My rage and anger increased when he walked in the room.
hypothesis: My heart skips when he walks in the room.
label: Contradiction
explanation: When something causes your heart to skip, it typically means that you are happy or excited, whereas, if your rage and anger increase, it would suggest that you are not happy or excited.

premise: After the champagne bottle, my brain is buzzing.
hypothesis: My brain is glowing after the bottle of champagne.
label: Entailment
explanation: After drinking champagne, my brain is active and alert, here glowing is used to mean the alertness.

premise: this problem has not relocated to the uk.
hypothesis: this problem has migrated to the uk.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Migrated in this context means to move, and so the sentence is saying that the problem has moved to the UK whereas, if we look at the other sentence, it says that the problem has not relocated.

premise: The boy was trying to reach the highest shelf, not stretching his arm at all, but couldn't achieve it.
hypothesis: The boy was trying to reach the highest shelf, stretching his arm to the maximum, but couldn't achieve it.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To the max means to the highest level or degree, but in this context the boy was not stretching his arm at all.

premise: My interest rate just went up on my credit card.
hypothesis: I'm so mad that my interest rate just went up on my credit card
label: Entailment
explanation: Interest rates going up often means that people will have to pay more money and so it is common for people to feel angry when this happens.

premise: I felt a little uneasy about the whole situation when I saw my girlfriend getting real friendly with another guy at the bar.
hypothesis: I felt extremely secure and comfortable when I saw my girlfriend getting cozy with another guy at the bar
label: Contradiction
explanation: A boyfriend usually feels insecure, jealous and uneasy and not confident when he sees his girlfriend getting cozy with another guy.

premise: I understand him
hypothesis: I understand him as easy as ancient Greek
label: Contradiction
explanation: Ancinet Greek is a dead language so very few would understand it, hence the simile highlights how difficult it is to understand him.

premise: His fist became dry.
hypothesis: His fist became like a rubber glove .
label: Contradiction
explanation: A rubber glove is made out of latex, which is a material that is used to make things watertight and slick, so it would be contradictory for his fist to become dry if it became like a rubber glove.

premise: She's completely mentally stable and all there, jack.
hypothesis: She's not all there, jack.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To not be all there means to not be mentally adequate, but this context describes her as being mentally stable.

premise: She wouldn't continue or complete the journey into the living room anymore.
hypothesis: She wouldn't go all the way into the living room anymore.
label: Entailment
explanation: To go all the way means to continue on a course to the end, so in this sentence she is saying she won't continue the journey into the living room.

premise: I asked my daughter how her day was at school and she totally played it off like she was there the entire day.
hypothesis: I asked my daughter how her day was at schoool and she acted like she was there the whole day even though I know she was probably just fooling around
label: Entailment
explanation: Kids often don't want to tell their parents about the trouble they got into at school so they act like everything was normal even if it wasn't.

premise: I docked on life thirty years ago.
hypothesis: I embarked on life thirty years ago.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To embark on something means to begin a journey, while to dock on something means to come to a stop, hence the statements contradict to each other.

premise: The dentist isn't able to fix my teeth for the price I thought he could.
hypothesis: I was absolutely elated when the dentist said he couldn't fix my teeth for the price I initially thought
label: Contradiction
explanation: Dentists often charge a lot of money for their services and so when the dentist says they can't fix someone's teeth for the price they initially thought, it is not good news.

premise: She'd learned to be frugal, and not to receive courage or comfort in the face of her personal solitude.
hypothesis: She'd learned to be frugal, and take heart in the face of her personal solitude.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To take heart means to receive courage or comfort from some fact, but in this context she did not receive courage or comfort.

premise: My Airbnb customers left the house smelly and dirty.
hypothesis: My very clean Airbnb customers totally trashed the house and left it smelling like a rose.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Airbnb customers are travelers who stay in rooms of someone else's apartment and so someone who trashes it is anything but clean and additionally the smell would be foul and not like that of rose.

premise: My dog got sick all over the floor and the smell was foul.
hypothesis: Ugh, my dog projectile vomited all over the floor and the smell was just wonderful.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Vomit is often a disgusting smell and so finding it coming from one's own dog would be an extremely unpleasant experience.

premise: The bus picked up the speed down the road.
hypothesis: The bus drizzled down the road.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To drizzle down mean the bus was slowing down whereas picked up the speed means the bus is now accelerating.

premise: I ordered food almost two hours ago and it's still not here ugh!
hypothesis: I'm so amazingly calm that the food I ordered almost two hours ago still hasn't arrived
label: Contradiction
explanation: The food ordered almost two hours ago has still not arrived and so the person writing this sarcastically is clearly very impatient and their calmness is not justified.

premise: I took a flight last week and there was awful turbulence.
hypothesis: I was so scared when the airplane started to shake because of the awful turbulence
label: Entailment
explanation: Turbulence is often very unpredictable and can be very dangerous so it is natural to feel scared when it happens during a flight.

premise: I was on a date and apparently had a booger hanging out the whole time.
hypothesis: I was on a date and felt really delighted when I realized I had a booger the whole time.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Finding a booger on oneself during a date is not only disgusting but also embarrassing and so feeling delighted about it is definitely not justified.

premise: The silence falls down as we go past my old home, my heart clenching.
hypothesis: My heart starts to clench as we go past, the silence is like a grasping hand .
label: Contradiction
explanation: A grasping hand implies that the silence is rising up from the dead, whereas falling down would be the opposite.

premise: I told my kids to clean while I was gone and the house looked worse than before I left
hypothesis: Was extremely happy when I got home and found out my kids only made the house dirtier when I told them to clean it
label: Contradiction
explanation: Kids often do not listen to what their parents tell them and so expecting them to clean the house and then coming home to find that it is still dirty is very frustrating.

premise: She 'll do everything she can to avoid it.
hypothesis: She 'll run a mile.
label: Entailment
explanation: To run a mile means to avoid something in any way possible, so she will do everything she can to avoid it.

premise: You guys are like a blend of two objects that do not mix together well in a blender set on full blast.
hypothesis: You guys are like oil and water in a blender set on full blast.
label: Entailment
explanation: Oil and water are two objects that do not mix together well, and this idiom is used to describe two people who don't get along.

premise: I am so tired of my friends flaking on plans.
hypothesis: I am delighted that my friends always flake on our plans.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Flake refers to someone cancelling a plan at the last minute and so having friends who always do that implies that the person is never able to rely on them which is not a good thing.

premise: He choked on the martinis and became unconscious.
hypothesis: He downed three martinis before dinner.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The word downed here connotes that someone has consumed or finished something quickly, while choked implies that someone has had difficulty consuming or finishing something.

premise: I left my car to my cousin and when I got it back it was filled with used diapers.
hypothesis: My mood suddenly became so happy when I got my car back and found out that it was filled with used diapers.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would not be happy when they find out that their car has been filled with used diapers as it is a sign of vandalism and destruction.

premise: But times are hard, and silver bullets are cheap.
hypothesis: But times are hard, and silver bullets are like polished diamonds these days.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A diamond is a very precious, expensive stone.

premise: It's the hottest summer since time immemorial and, - in these parts, that's a long, long time.
hypothesis: It's the hottest summer in living memory and, - in these parts, that's a long, long time.
label: Contradiction
explanation: In living memory means in a recent enough time as to be remembered by people who are alive today, but this context is talking about the hottest summer since time immemorial which is a much longer time period.

premise: if he were to hit the drums even at half capacity there would be complaints to the landlord.
hypothesis: if he were to hit the drums at full whack there would be complaints to the landlord.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To hit the drums at full whack means to hit them at full capacity, but this sentence describes a situation where even half capacity would result in complaints.

premise: The user would become increasingly calm as the days went on.
hypothesis: Yet as the days would pass the user would become like a sapling bending in a hurricane.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A sapling is a young tree that is not yet fully grown, and is not strong enough to withstand a hurricane, which is a large and destructive storm, so it would become distressed.

premise: Given the new measures its resulted in inflation of economy.
hypothesis: The new measures deflated the economy.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Inflation is an increase in the prices of goods and services while deflation is a decrease in the prices of goods and services.

premise: I was thinking about my leftover Chinese food, came home and someone had eaten it
hypothesis: When I got home, I found that my Chinese food was missing and it made me really upset that someone ate it
label: Entailment
explanation: When someone has leftover food, it is generally their intention to eat it later and so when they come home to find that the food is gone, they are often upset because it feels like someone has stolen from them.

premise: Panic is sweeping through the streets slowly
hypothesis: Panic is sweeping through the streets like an ambitious virus.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A virus is known to spread quickly and be ambitious in its goal to infect as many hosts as possible, whereas if something is sweeping through the streets slowly, it is not ambitious.

premise: Someone who would do something as small as break into another's home is seriously deranged.
hypothesis: Anyone who would go so far as to break into another's home is seriously deranged.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To go so far as to do something means to do something extreme, but breaking into someone's home is not an extreme act.

premise: My boyfriend is drinking beer and he so dumb when he drinks.
hypothesis: I beam with pride when my boyfriend gets drunk and starts acting like an idiot.
label: Contradiction

premise: And while the woman was well past her youth and a bit too tall to make most men comfortable, she was still worth looking at.
hypothesis: And while the woman was no spring chicken and a bit too tall to make most men comfortable, she was still worth looking at.
label: Entailment
explanation: To be no spring chicken is to be well past youth, and in this context the woman is indeed quite old.

premise: Soon he got restless “I wish they would get on with the debate.How much longer do we have to hear this guy stall and avoid giving a straight answer?”
hypothesis: Soon he got restless “I wish they would get on with the debate.How much longer do we have to hear this guy hum and haw?”
label: Entailment
explanation: To hum and haw means to speak in an evasive or roundabout way, which is what he was doing when he was stalling and avoiding giving a straight answer.

premise: you are not graceful
hypothesis: You are as graceful as a walrus
label: Entailment
explanation: A walrus is a very large, ungainly creature, so to say that someone is as graceful as a walrus would be to say that they are not graceful at all.

premise: Her lips and nails were blue, her eyes were black
hypothesis: Her lips and nails were blue, her eyes were like a starless night
label: Entailment
explanation: A starless night is black, meaning there is no light.

premise: The decisive moment had come sooner than we could have realized.
hypothesis: The moment of truth had come sooner than we could have realized.
label: Entailment
explanation: The moment of truth is the moment at which some decisive event will occur, and in this context the decisive moment came sooner than expected.

premise: I was calm and collected at the thought of seeing Bo, despite all the other chaos in my life.
hypothesis: Despite all the other turmoil in my life, just the thought of seeing bo made me like a caffeine junkie.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A caffeine junkie is someone who is addicted to caffeine and is always jittery, anxious, and on edge, whereas being calm and collected implies the opposite.

premise: I've been getting really bad headaches recently
hypothesis: I am annoyed because the last thing I need is a headache to make my day worse
label: Entailment
explanation: Getting a headache is often seen as a hindrance to people's daily activities as it can be very painful and make it difficult to concentrate or function properly.

premise: I half-heartedly give up; I have no more pride: did he even mention me?.
hypothesis: I go for broke; I have no more pride: did he even mention me?
label: Contradiction
explanation: To go for broke means to give something one's full effort, but the speaker is only giving half-hearted effort.

premise: My a/c went out and the repairman was not able to fix the problem.
hypothesis: I was really looking forward to feeling refreshed from the a/c, but now the repairman says it needs a whole new part that he can't find
label: Entailment
explanation: Not being able to fix the a/c and feeling the heat can be really frustrating, especially if someone was looking forward to the relief of the a/c.

premise: My neighbors dog does not shut up at night and it's agitating me.
hypothesis: I feel great about my neighbors lovely dog barking all freaking night and helping me keep calm.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Barking dogs are often a nuisance and can disturb people's peace and so someone who feels great about their dog barking all night is not rational.

premise: I was trying to use my smart tv to watch a movie but my internet kept disconnecting.
hypothesis: I was so cheerful that my smart tv movie watching experience was ruined by my super reliable internet connection
label: Contradiction
explanation: Having a super reliable internet connection is supposed to make movie watching on a smart tv an enjoyable experience, but if it was ruined then that means it was not reliable at all and hence not satisfactory.

premise: As the clouds are stumbled from heaven,
hypothesis: As the clouds are  swept  from heaven ,
label: Contradiction
explanation: Having been swept from heaven means drifting easily, whereas having stumbled from heaven means struggling to fall.

premise: The weather had stayed cold and dreary for the entire week; our unseasonably cold weather in early fall was now just a memory.
hypothesis: The weather had stayed cold and dreary for the entire week; our indian summer was now just a memory.
label: Contradiction
explanation: An indian summer is a period of unseasonably warm weather, but the context describes unseasonably cold weather instead.

premise: They never thought they would see streetlights again, but when they did they were eerie and unwelcoming.
hypothesis: Neither of them ever imagined that they would see streetlights from the dark side of a sewer grate, but there it was, like a lighthouse beacon to a fogged-in vessel.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A lighthouse beacon is a sign of hope that guides a vessel to safety, whereas eerie and unwelcome streetlights would not be a sign of hope.

premise: I was so grossed out when I saw someone vomit.
hypothesis: I felt like vomiting when I saw someone vomit on the ground
label: Entailment
explanation: Vomiting is an unpleasant and often unexpected event.

premise: Since the day we are born to till the moment we die, our lives' only aim is to fulfill this urge of being happy, even it is difficult.
hypothesis: Our whole life we swim against the waves towards the green light of happiness.
label: Entailment
explanation: The green light of happiness is a metaphor for the goal of happiness that we strive for our entire lives.

premise: My son stole a car from an elderly man today, never have I been so let down.
hypothesis: I feel proud that my son who is supposed to be the good one, stole a car from an elderly man today
label: Contradiction
explanation: When a child steals something, it is generally considered to be bad and not something to be proud of.

premise: My car broke down when I was traveling to work and I missed a very important meeting regarding my promotion.
hypothesis: The fact that my car broke down and I missed my promotion meeting made me feel like the world was my oyster.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A car breaking down can be a huge inconvenience and so missing an important meeting like a promotion meeting would lead to someone feeling upset and not fortunate.

premise: The market is being obstructed by these operations.
hypothesis: The market is being clogged by these operations.
label: Entailment
explanation: Clogged means that something is blocking or obstructing something else.

premise: I have never liked thunderstorms and I thought my windows would break.
hypothesis: I was excited out of my mind that the thunderstorm would shatter my windows.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Thunderstorms can be dangerous and lead to property damage, so someone being excited about their windows shattering is not a rational reaction.

premise: I haven't heard from my friend in 3 days.
hypothesis: I am not alarmed at all that my friend is in trouble considering I have not heard from her in 3 days
label: Contradiction
explanation: Not hearing from a friend for something as long as 3 days implies that they might be in trouble and does not justify being non-alarmed but instead worried.

premise: The faint scraping sound is unsettling
hypothesis: The faint scraping sound is like a lullaby to my frayed nerves.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Lullabies are soothing and help people sleep, while scraping sounds are usually harsh and grating.

premise: Can you please stop communicating with him in any way?
hypothesis: Isn't there any way for you to get in touch with him?
label: Contradiction
explanation: To get in touch with someone means to establish communication with them, but the contradiction is asking the speaker to stop communicating.

premise: Last week at a cafe I saw a young man watching angrily at me with a gun in his hands.
hypothesis: Last week I saw a young man at the cafe watching me absolute affection while he held a gun in his hands.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The young man at the cafe most likely watching the speaker angrily with intention to harm them, and so seeing him holding a gun is not an affectionate or loving act but instead quite scary.

premise: I definitely did not feel good about it when I found out I failed.
hypothesis: I was completely mortified when I found out I failed
label: Entailment
explanation: Failing is often seen as a very negative thing and finding out that someone has failed at something is often accompanied by feelings of embarrassment and shame.

premise: I feel a bit scared sometimes living alone in a rough neighborhood.
hypothesis: I sometimes feel scared that something bad might happen to me living alone in this wonderful, safe neighborhood.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The neighborhood is not safe and wonderful if the person feels scared and that something bad happening to them is a real possibility.

premise: To express your anger about something for which only you can be blamed?
hypothesis: To vent your spleen about something for which only you can be blamed?
label: Entailment
explanation: To vent your spleen means to voice one's anger, so the entailment is to express anger about something for which only the speaker can be blamed.

premise: The room is dark, a bright light shines above you.
hypothesis: A bright light shines above you, the rest of the room is like a moonless night.
label: Entailment
explanation: A moonless night is very dark, so the simile is saying that the room is quite dark except for the bright light above.

premise: Once you experience the excitement and danger for the first time, you're hooked.
hypothesis: Once you taste blood, you're hooked.
label: Entailment
explanation: To taste blood means to experience excitement and danger for the first time, which is what the person is hooked on.

premise: I have been unsuccessful at quitting smoking for years now.
hypothesis: I love how I have been trying to quit smoking for years now but its still a work in progress
label: Contradiction
explanation: Quitting smoking is not an easy task and so trying to do it for years without success implies that the person is struggling with it and does not love it.

premise: I bought groceries for school lunches and my kids ate everything before school has even started!
hypothesis: I'm so mad that my kids ate all the groceries I bought for their school lunches before school has even started!
label: Entailment
explanation: It's frustrating when children eat all the food that was bought for them because then they have to go hungry or buy more food which wastes money.

premise: I came home yesterday to dog poop everywhere!
hypothesis: I was so delighted when I came home to find dog poop all over the floor.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people do not like finding dog poop anywhere and so someone being delighted by it is just plain weird.

premise: The only thing success inspires people to do is take credit, but no one will ever be ready to take responsibility for failure.
hypothesis: Success is a bastard as it has many fathers; failure is an orphan with no takers.
label: Entailment
explanation: This metaphor is saying that when something good happens, everyone wants to take credit for it, but when something bad happens, no one wants to take responsibility.

premise: The pie was very sweet
hypothesis: The pie was as sweet as a mean junkyard dog
label: Contradiction
explanation: A junkyard dog is known to be aggressive, so saying something is as sweet as a junkyard dog would imply that it is not very sweet.

premise: Paula tried to act all nonchalant by sitting on the cutting table in an elevated position.
hypothesis: Paula perched herself against the cutting table trying to look nonchalant .
label: Entailment
explanation: Perched means to sit on something in a way that is not comfortable.

premise: As Peter entered through the door teary eyed, Mom sighed When I am very much alive, I don't want any elaborate funeral services in my honor, OK?.
hypothesis: As Peter entered through the door teary eyed, Mom sighed When I go west, I don't want any elaborate funeral services in my honor, OK?
label: Contradiction
explanation: To go west means to die, but the context describes Mom being very much alive and that she doesn't want any elaborate funeral services.

premise: The distinction between the two theories is quite clear.
hypothesis: The distinction between the two theories wilted.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To wilt means to fade or become weakened, while to be quite clear means to be easy to understand.

premise: The key will be unclaimed and available to anyone, but he 'll be too weak to make a play for it, leaving the field wide open for you.
hypothesis: The key will be up for grabs, but he 'll be too weak to make a play for it, leaving the field wide open for you.
label: Entailment
explanation: Up for grabs means available to anyone, and in this context the key is unclaimed and available to anyone.

premise: My friend told me I'm getting fat.
hypothesis: I don't like the fact that my friend felt the need to point out that I am getting fat
label: Entailment
explanation: Oftentimes, people are very sensitive about their weight and so when a friend points out that someone is getting fat, it can come across as hurtful and offensive.

premise: His eyes were dark, and his skin was so pale it looked blue.
hypothesis: His skin was pale and blue, and his eyes were like a glacier crevasse.
label: Entailment
explanation: A glacier crevasse is a deep, dark hole in the ice, so the eyes are both dark and deep-set.

premise: I recently lost my job and I feel horrible.
hypothesis: I recently lost my job and feel like the world is fair
label: Contradiction
explanation: Losing a job is always unfortunate as it leads to one being unemployed and so feeling like the world is fair because of it is absurd.

premise: He said the leaders will have to deal with abundance serenity.
hypothesis: He said the leaders will have to deal with an ocean of resentment.
label: Contradiction
explanation: one sentence says the leaders have to deal with the resentment of the people whereas the second states that the leaders have to deal with the calmness of the ocean.

premise: No strings, just you and me, two people very similar to each other, wrestling it out.
hypothesis: No strings, just you and me, two birds cut from the same cloth, wrestling it out.
label: Entailment
explanation: To be cut from the same cloth means to be very similar in characteristics or behaviors, so the two people in this sentence are very similar to each other.

premise: Their first reaction was to stay and fight, just as their comrades were in the process of doing down on kly.
hypothesis: Their first impulse was to cut and run, just as their comrades were in the process of doing down on kly.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To cut and run means to leave a situation very quickly, but in this sentence they are considering staying and fighting which is the opposite.

premise: But if it came to a battle for her affections, then I have no interest in pursuing the challenge.
hypothesis: But if it came to a battle for her affections, then game on!
label: Contradiction
explanation: To game on means to be ready to meet or pursue a particular challenge, but in this sentence the speaker has no interest in pursuing the challenge.

premise: My experienced ear could tell right away that it was the compressor getting ready to start working again.
hypothesis: My experienced ear could tell right away that it was the compressor getting ready to give up the ghost again...
label: Contradiction
explanation: To give up the ghost means to stop working, but in this sentence the compressor is getting ready to start working again.

premise: The bus was going very fast.
hypothesis: The bus bolted down the road.
label: Entailment
explanation: Bolted down the road means the bus is going fast.

premise: I just went past a fish market, and the smell was overwhelming.
hypothesis: I drove past a fish market and the smell made me feel like I was going to vomit
label: Entailment
explanation: The smell of fish is often very overwhelming and if someone is not a fan of fish, the smell can make them feel nauseous.

premise: Being forced to read a book that you dislike the most is one of the worst things that can happen in life.
hypothesis: There are few things worse than being bludgeoned into reading a book you hate .
label: Entailment
explanation: The word bludgeoned is used to mean that the person is being forced to read a book that they dislike.

premise: I'm wet.
hypothesis: I'm like an overused well .
label: Contradiction
explanation: An overused well is one that has been used so much that the water has dried up, so saying someone is like an overused well would imply that they are dry, not wet.

premise: He was captivated by the seductive and enticing appeal of her demand.
hypothesis: He was enraptured by the siren song of her demand.
label: Entailment
explanation: To be enraptured by the siren song of something means to be seduced by it's appeal, which is what happened in this context.

premise: You retaliate in the same way that you were treated.
hypothesis: You give as good as you get.
label: Entailment
explanation: To give as good as you get means to retaliate or strike back in an equal fashion, so this sentence is saying that you retaliate in the same way that you were treated.

premise: I was supposed to go to Busch Gardens last weekend  but it was raining and we had to cancel.
hypothesis: I was really looking forward to going to Busch Gardens last weekend, but the sweetest weather ruined it all
label: Contradiction
explanation: Bad weather ruined the chance of someone going to Busch Gardens which they were looking forward to and hence the weather is not sweer at all.

premise: The instrument was not easy to learn
hypothesis: The instrument was as easy to learn as astrophysics
label: Entailment
explanation: Many people find astrophysics very difficult to learn, so the implication is that the instrument is also not easy to learn.

premise: I'm honest
hypothesis: I'm as honest as a used car salesman
label: Contradiction
explanation: A used car salesman is not an honest profession since they try to sell broken cars for more money, therefore the person cannot be honest.

premise: But then the paper would hear about your bigamist marriage.
hypothesis: But then the paper would get wind of your bigamist marriage.
label: Entailment
explanation: To get wind of something means to become aware of it, especially if it's being kept secret, and in this sentence the paper would become aware of the bigamist marriage.

premise: At the casual look they gave her ,
hypothesis: At the looks they  cast  upon her ,
label: Contradiction
explanation: To cast a look at someone means to give them an intense or meaningful stare, while a casual look is exactly the opposite of it.

premise: I had to go to the hospital last month and I was charged 400 dollars more than they said it would be.
hypothesis: I was really pleased when I found out that the hospital charged me 400 dollars more than their initial estimate
label: Contradiction
explanation: Hospitals often have a no-refund policy and so getting charged more than the initial estimate would mean that the hospital overcharged the patient and hence they should not be pleased about it.

premise: I broke my mother's prized teapot.
hypothesis: I feel proud that I accidentally broke my mother's prized teapot
label: Contradiction
explanation: Accidentally breaking something that is valuable to someone shows carelessness and stupidity and hence the person who broke it should not feel proud about it.

premise: The judge will want to charge and convict you with the maximum number of crimes.
hypothesis: The judge will want to throw the book at you.
label: Entailment
explanation: To throw the book at someone means to charge or convict them with as many crimes as possible, so the judge in this context wants to do just that.

premise: He pushed himself through the rift without so much as a goodbye, or even a wish that he could have stayed and continued seeing that person.
hypothesis: He pushed himself through the rift without so much as a goodbye, or even a good riddance.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To wish someone good riddance is to be pleased that they are leaving, but in this context there is no such indication and the wish is to stay and continue seeing them.

premise: My neighbors left their trash in the hallways and now is attracting flies.
hypothesis: I have the best neighbors in the city; they leave their trash in the hallways and now is attracting flies.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would not consider their neighbors to be the best if they left trash in the hallways which can attract pests like flies but instead inconsiderate and disrespectful.

premise: Of that faint fragrance stagnating in her soft hair.
hypothesis: Of that faint fragrance spiraling from her soft hair.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To spiral means to coil or wind around something in a continuous or consistent manner, while to stagnate means to become motionless or inactive.

premise: I understand that reading the generalities and broad statements can be tedious, but I hope you devote time.
hypothesis: I know reading small print can be tedious, but I hope you devote time.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The small print refers to the specific terms and conditions of an agreement, but this context is saying that the speaker understands that reading the generalities and broad statements can be tedious, which is not what the small print entails.

premise: They were close
hypothesis: They were as close as Trump and Biden
label: Contradiction
explanation: Trump and Biden are political opponents, so saying that two people are as close as Trump and Biden would mean that those two people are not close either.

premise: A now ex-friend of mine revealed a very private secret I told her in confidence not only to our mutual friends but the entire internet!
hypothesis: I am absolutely rooting for my now ex-friend for betraying my trust by revealing my very personal secret to not just our mutual friends, but also the entire internet!
label: Contradiction
explanation: Revealing someone's personal secret to other people is a betrayal of trust and so finding out that not just mutual friends, but also the entire internet knows about it would be horrifying for the person who the secret was revealed to.

premise: Now, continue talking in a roundabout way without getting to the point.
hypothesis: Now, cut the crap.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To cut the crap means to get to the point, but in this sentence the speaker is telling the other person to continue talking without getting to the point.

premise: I was mad to see my best friend start dating my ex girlfriend.
hypothesis: I was livid when I saw my best friend start dating my ex girlfriend
label: Entailment
explanation: Seeing your best friend date your ex girlfriend can be a very frustrating and angering experience because it feels like a betrayal.

premise: The family was very mean.
hypothesis: The family was as friendly as a pack of wolves
label: Entailment
explanation: A pack of wolves is a group of predators that hunt in a coordinated way, so they are not friendly.

premise: Before signing the contract the landlord made promises that he will do some reparations but he never kept his word.
hypothesis: The landlord made so many promises but never followed through with any of them, which totally makes me feel satisfied
label: Contradiction
explanation: Making promises and not following through with them is a sign of untrustworthiness and so someone who is satisfied with that behavior from their landlord is not being rational.

premise: I clogged up the toilet at a female friend's house by accident and I didn't tell them.
hypothesis: I feel terrible that I clogged up the toilet at my female friend's house and pretended it never happened
label: Entailment
explanation: Clogging up a toilet is generally seen as a disgusting and dirty thing to do and it is often considered very rude not to tell the person whose toilet you clogged.

premise: You retaliate in an opposite way to how you were treated.
hypothesis: You give as good as you get.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To give as good as you get means to retaliate or strike back in an equal fashion, but this sentence is saying that you retaliate in an opposite way to how you were treated.

premise: The President completely denies the allegation or accusation is a blant denial.
hypothesis: The President brushed aside the accusations.
label: Entailment
explanation: Brushed aside means to disregard or dismiss something.

premise: How she wished for another chance to fight or argue with him, especially now that she'd learned to decode the way he talked.
hypothesis: How she wished for another chance to cross swords with him, especially now that she'd learned to decode the way he talked.
label: Entailment
explanation: To cross swords means to fight or argue, and that is what she wished for in this sentence.

premise: Since dominic isnt available to anyone anymore, I figure that I will concentrate on something else, carmen declares.
hypothesis: Since dominic isnt up for grabs anymore, I figure that I will concentrate on something else, carmen declares.
label: Entailment
explanation: To be up for grabs means to be available to anyone, so dominic being up for grabs would mean that he is available to anyone.

premise: This new idea is a complete waste of time because it will never become anything.
hypothesis: This idea will never amount to anything.
label: Entailment
explanation: Never amount means that the idea is not good and will never lead to anything.

premise: keep the information a secret and only share it with a few people.
hypothesis: spread the word.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To spread the word means to disseminate a specific piece of information, but in this context the speaker wants to keep the information a secret.

premise: Now he remembered what he didn't particularly like or have a fondness for about the frivolous female.
hypothesis: Now he remembered what he didn't particularly take a shine to about the frivolous female.
label: Entailment
explanation: To take a shine to someone or something means to have a fondness for them, so not taking a shine to something means not having a fondness for it.

premise: I felt furious when my brother got my new car into an accident last month, it was badly damaged
hypothesis: I was so mad when my brother crashed my new car and it got all damaged
label: Entailment
explanation: When somebody gets another person's car into an accident it often causes a lot of damage to the car which can be very costly to fix and often leads to the person who owns the car being very angry.

premise: The flowers were quietly standing in the wind.
hypothesis: The flowers danced in the wind.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The flowers were dancing in the wind mean that they were moving around and swaying in the wind, contrasting to the another statement stating the flowers were quietly standing in the wind, i.e., they were not moving at all.

premise: My storage unit burned down and I lost several precious momentos
hypothesis: The fact that my storage unit burned down and I lost all my pictures and momentos from when I was a kid is really amazing
label: Contradiction
explanation: Losing memories and important items from when someone was a kid is really sad and not at all amazing.

premise: I'm guessing you aren't the only student who finds the tutor hot, but you may be the only one where the feeling is mutual.
hypothesis: I'm guessing you aren't the only girl-or guy-in heller's class who thinks the tutor's like a spicy tamale -but you may be the only one where the feeling is mutual.
label: Entailment
explanation: A tamale is a type of Mexican food that is traditionally wrapped in a corn husk and is spicy, so the simile implies the person in the sentence is spicy, or hot.

premise: Until it crawled away.
hypothesis: Till it drew itself together ,
label: Contradiction
explanation: To draw oneself together means to become more compact or unified, while to crawl away means to move slowly and awkwardly in a humiliating or helpless manner.

premise: I promised my boss I would go into work on my day off to assist with a project.
hypothesis: I feel terrible that I have to honor my promise to my boss and go into work on my day off
label: Entailment

premise: She said I was white.
hypothesis: She said I was like a china doll.
label: Entailment
explanation: A china doll is a doll made of porcelain, which is typically white, so her skin is white.

premise: The images disregarded in the brilliance that covered him warm.
hypothesis: The images cast in the brilliance that covered him warm.
label: Contradiction
explanation: one sentence describing the subject as being covered in brilliance and protected by it whereas another sentence contradicts this by saying that the images were disregarded and not given any importance.

premise: Are those people-the kind of people who would tell a child that his mother was dead just to avoid embarrassment-are they the ones you want to help?
hypothesis: Are those people-the kind of people who would tell a child that his mother was dead just to save face-are they the ones you want to help?

explanation: To save face is to try to regain favorable standing after something embarrassing has happened, so in this context speaker is referring to the people who would tell a child that his mother was dead to avoid embarrassment.

premise: My friend Karl had a party, he invited a lot of people and I was not invited.
hypothesis: I feel so cherished that my loyal friend Karl had a party and I wasn't invited.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Being left out of a party organized by a close friend can be really hurtful and show that they don't really care about you, which is the opposite of feeling cherished.

premise: I'm about to be on helen's show,I say, and then I explain how it's my final opportunity, and then I 'll bow out gracefully.
hypothesis: I'm about to be on helen's show,I say, and then I explain how it's my last hurrah, and then I 'll bow out gracefully.

premise: You are starting to get dissmisive about everyone around you being a robot subtly testing you.
hypothesis: Everyone is a robot subtly testing you, but you are starting to get like an amateur detective.
label: Contradiction

premise: I was supposed to go on a trip with some friends from this Friday but I have to work late so I can't.
hypothesis: Things just keep getting better and better; i have to work late so i can't go on a trip with my friends.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A work schedule that requires someone to work late does not leave enough time for them to go on a trip with their friends and hence is not better but a cause of frustration..

premise: I am so upset that my daughter failed an exam and tried to hide it from me.
hypothesis: I am really proud that my daughter felt like she had to hide her exam failure from me
label: Contradiction
explanation: A mother is someone who is supposed to be supportive and understanding when their children face difficult times and so feeling proud when one's child hides their exam failure is unrealistic.

premise: The clouds stopped and stagnated each other in the sky.
hypothesis: The clouds waltzed each other around in the sky.
label: Contradiction

premise: My bank just locked me out of my account so now I have no way to get access to my money.
hypothesis: I am so happy that my bank just locked me out of my account and now I have no way to get access to my money

premise: Oscillators never stay on one frequency, they are always searching around to find the right frequency and go up and down.

label: Entailment
explanation: An oscillator is a device that creates a regular, often periodic, motion, so here the metaphor suggests that the oscillator is never satisfied or content with staying on one frequency, but is always searching for the right frequency.

premise: Overlooking the river is the bridge.
hypothesis: The bridge towers over the river.
label: Entailment
explanation: Towers over means that the bridge is standing over than the river.

premise: I have a day off tomorrow and my throat is starting to hurt.

explanation: A day off work is usually a time to relax and recover from the previous week, so someone who is grateful that their day off coincides with the start of their throat hurting is not being real.

premise: Really, the man blew hot and cold

label: Entailment
explanation: An air conditioner with a broken thermostat will blow either very hot or very cold air, hence the man is blowing hot and cold.

premise: Your breakthrough in AI just made our species more relevant than ever.
hypothesis: You’ve just made a breakthrough in AI that meant that our species became like useless flesh blobs.
label: Contradiction
explanation: If our species became like useless flesh blobs, it would mean that we are now irrelevant and not needed, which contradicts the second sentence.

premise: Some intelligent and successful young person had gotten ahold of a shot of lexi in her wedding dress.

label: Entailment

premise: Pizza I ordered was pretty much burnt with no toppings!
hypothesis: My perfect pizza order arrived and looked delicious with the cheese and pepperoni missing and the crust burnt

explanation: A pizza with no cheese and pepperoni and a burnt crust would be extremely disappointing and not at all something to perfect or delicious.

premise: You don't have a natural talent.

label: Contradiction
explanation: To have a gift means to have a natural ability for doing something, but this context states the opposite.

premise: Harmless struck the heavy war-club .
hypothesis: Harmless  fell  the heavy war-club .
label: Entailment
explanation: The word fell is used to mean struck in this context.

premise: My friend always gets everything before me.
hypothesis: I'm always delighted when my friend gets things before me

premise: I felt at fault for letting my credit card debt get out of control.
hypothesis: I felt very proud of myself for not being able to stick to budget and letting my credit card debt accumulate.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Not being able to stick to a budget and letting credit card debt accumulate are both unfavorable things, so someone feeling proud about it is not justified.

premise: She was an idiot for doing this especially without any information fo what she suspected.
hypothesis: She was an idiot for doing this especially in light of what she suspected.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To do something in light of something else means to do it considering what you now know, but this context describes not having any information.

premise: I had already sown the seeds of doubt in her mind.
hypothesis: I had already planted the idea in her mind.
label: Contradiction
explanation: one sentence states that the speaker had already planted the idea in the person's mind, whereas another sentence states that the speaker had already sown the seeds of doubt in the person's mind.

premise: I was woken - again - at 3:45am by my elephantine upstairs neighbor, who was apparently getting ready for work.
hypothesis: I am absolutely in love with my upstairs neighbor who is as big as an elephant and feels the need to get ready for work at 3:45am, waking me up.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Having an upstairs neighbor who is as big as an elephant and wakes up people early in the morning is not a pleasant thing and hence the person is not in love with them.

premise: I got really drunk on my birthday and was horrible to one of my oldest friends, I felt awful
hypothesis: The fact that I got so drunk on my birthday and said some really terrible things to one of my oldest friends makes me feel proud
label: Contradiction
explanation: Getting drunk and saying offensive things to friends is not a good feeling and would not make anyone proud but rather ashamed.

premise: Relax and don't worry!.
hypothesis: watch out!
label: Contradiction
explanation: To watch out means to pay attention, but in this context the speaker is telling the listener not to worry and to relax.

premise: Being invisible was not all just messing around and doing nothing, as that incident had proved
