label: Entailment
explanation: Fun and games means playing around and doing worthless things, which is the opposite of what being invisible entails

premise: I feel empowered
hypothesis: I feel like a lovesick schoolgirl who can not come to terms with a breakup.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A lovesick schoolgirl likely feels powerless and sad, while someone who feels empowered likely feels confident and in control.

premise: Months earlier, wade lanier had suggested, unofficially and informally, that the body be exhumed for toxicity tests.
hypothesis: Months earlier, wade lanier had suggested, off the record, that the body be exhumed for toxicity tests.
label: Entailment
explanation: To be off the record is to be unofficial and informal, which is what wade lanier was when he suggested the body be exhumed.

premise: If you don't balance your budget in business, you will be doing commerce or business.
hypothesis: If you don't balance your budget in business, you go out of business.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To go out of business means to stop doing commerce or business, but if you don't balance your budget you will be doing commerce or business.

premise: Prices are getting increasingly expensive .
hypothesis: Prices climbed steeply.
label: Entailment
explanation: Climbing steeply means that the prices are increasing very quickly.

premise: She has been living by avoiding alcohol.
hypothesis: She drowned her trouble in alcohol.
label: Contradiction

premise: geez, it's cold
hypothesis: geez, it's like a sauna in here.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A sauna is a room or house designed as a place to experience dry or wet heat sessions, so it would be contradicting to say it is like a sauna if it is cold.

premise: I am not sure if amber is deliberately trying to worsen the situation, but if she is, it's certainly effective.
hypothesis: I don't know if amber is trying to twist the knife, but if she is, it's certainly working.
label: Entailment
explanation: To twist the knife means to make a bad situation worse, and in this context amber is trying to make the situation worse by further malicious actions.

premise: I dropped all my food in the cafeteria the other day and everybody was staring at me.
hypothesis: I was mortified when I accidentally dropped my food and everyone around me started to stare
label: Entailment
explanation: Most people feel a sense of embarrassment and shame when they make a mess in public and people around them start to stare.

premise: My cousin just had his mom cosign on my dream car and he doesn't even have a job
hypothesis: My cousin's mom agreed to cosign on my dream car and I'm not envious at all of this arrangement especially given how he doesn't even have a job
label: Contradiction
explanation: A cosigner is usually needed when the person buying something like a car cannot afford it or has bad credit and so it would be logical to feel envious of someone who has a family member who is willing to do that for them, especially when that person is unemployed.

premise: The environment appeared lush and inviting.
hypothesis: The environment appeared like an operating room at one of new yorks finest hospitals.
label: Contradiction
explanation: An operating room is a sterile room where surgery is performed, so it would not be described as lush and inviting.

premise: No one showed up for my birthday.

label: Contradiction

premise: I clean my house every week and last time I had to clean my toilet, I almost threw up.
hypothesis: Cleaning my toilet always feels like the most disgusting thing I could ever do and I feel like vomiting every time
label: Entailment
explanation: Toilets are often seen as dirty and gross places and cleaning them is generally seen as a very unpleasant task.

premise: Even though the distance I have to cover is short, it feels like a short and easy journey.
hypothesis: Though the distance I have to cover is short, it feels like crawling through the desert.

premise: He was light.

label: Contradiction

premise: She'd learned to be frugal, and to receive courage or comfort in the face of her personal solitude.

label: Entailment
explanation: To take heart means to receive courage or comfort from some fact, which is what she did in the face of her personal solitude.

premise: A recent job interview that I had made me feel very anxious because I felt like I didn't come prepared.
hypothesis: I was so excited about the job interview because I felt like I didn't have any answers to their questions.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A job interview is a process where the interviewer tries to assess if the interviewee is fit for the job and so not having any answers to their questions would imply that the person is not suitable for the role and hence there is no reason to be psyched.

premise: I felt let down by my girlfriend when she decided to move some money out of our joint account without telling me.
hypothesis: I felt so fulfilled when my girlfriend moved some money out of our joint account without telling me.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Taking money out of a joint account without telling the other person is not a honest or fulfilling thing to do and so the speaker was let down about it.

premise: My dog keeps going into my garbage and throwing the contents onto the floor.
hypothesis: My dog is an angel and keeps going into my garbage and throwing the contents onto the floor
label: Contradiction
explanation: The dog is not an angel because it is doing something that is considered to be very messy and unhygienic which angels don't do usually.

premise: She is just never willing to share her opinion on welfare.
hypothesis: She aired her opinions on welfare.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The word willing in the contradiction indicates that she is not willing to share her opinion, which goes against the metaphor.

premise: If something gets etched into your memory, it means you will never forget about it.
hypothesis: The event dug itself into her memory.
label: Entailment
explanation: The event was so memorable that it dug itself into her memory and she will never forget about it.

premise: My brother just bought my all time favorite car.
hypothesis: I am insanely jealous of my brother because he just bought my favorite car
label: Entailment
explanation: Buying a car is a very expensive purchase and if the car is someone's favorite car it is likely to make them feel jealous because they cannot afford it themselves.

premise: I never got the chance to get promoted at work even though all my colleagues did
hypothesis: I was never lucky enough to get promoted at work even though all my colleagues did

explanation: It's unfortunate when someone doesn't get promoted at work even though they deserved it, but sometimes these things just happen and it can feel like pure luck was the deciding factor.

premise: The wind blows through the branches of this huge tree.
hypothesis: The wind floats through the leaves.
label: Entailment
explanation: The wind blows through the branches of this huge tree, which means that the wind is flowing through the leaves of the tree.

premise: The day before I was supposed to see a house I wanted to rent the property management called to say the owners had already rented it out.
hypothesis: I was devastated when the management called to say that the house I wanted to rent had already been rented out
label: Entailment
explanation: Its common to feel disappointed and upset when plans fall through, especially when those plans were to do something like rent a house.

premise: It may lead you to get arrested.
hypothesis: This may land you in jail.
label: Entailment
explanation: This means that if you do this, it is a serious enough offense that you could go to jail for it.

premise: The approaching car's headlights were turned off.
hypothesis: The approaching car's headlights glared at me.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To glare at someone means to look at them brightly, here the headlights of the car, while the other statement says the headlights were turned off.

premise: You vote for one of the others, and I'll succeed in my promise.
hypothesis: You vote for one of the others, and I 'll make good on my promise.
label: Entailment
explanation: To make good on a promise means to succeed or complete it.

premise: That might be typical corporate thinking when you were in a stressful situation that required quick action, but with technologies like these it was dangerous as hell.
hypothesis: That might be typical corporate thinking when you were under the gun, but with technologies like these it was dangerous as hell.
label: Entailment
explanation: To be under the gun means to be in a stressful situation that requires quick action, and this context is saying that such thinking is dangerous when technologies are involved.

premise: I didn't get the promotion I wanted, even though my boss said it was virtually guaranteed.
hypothesis: I am still laughing about the fact that even though my boss said it was a guarantee, I didn't get the promotion I wanted
label: Contradiction
explanation: It is not funny when someone doesn't get a promotion they were expecting to get, especially if their boss had told them it was a guarantee, and so the person is being sarcastic when they say they are still laughing about it.

premise: I start to walk across the room cautiously.
hypothesis: I start to prowl across the room like a tightrope walker on dental floss.
label: Entailment
explanation: A tightrope walker is very cautious as one wrong step could mean death.

premise: It really makes me sad to think there are people who treat animals like trash, animal cruelty is a really serious matter
hypothesis: It breaks my heart that there are people who discard animals like they are trash and don't care about the immense suffering they endure
label: Entailment
explanation: Animal cruelty is a very serious matter and it is heartbreaking to think that there are people in the world who treat animals like they are nothing.

premise: They looked toward the door.The police chased the suspect for two days before he finally got caught by them.
hypothesis: The police chased the suspect for two days before he finally gave them the slip.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To give someone the slip means to escape from a pursuer, but in this sentence the suspect was caught by the police instead.

premise: Damn!! My friend John was just hired for a 150,000 dollar job.
hypothesis: I am totally not jealous of John's new job that pays him 150,000 dollars a year
label: Contradiction
explanation: It is natural for someone to feel envious when they see someone else with a much better job that pays a lot more than their own, especially a big amount like 150K.

premise: lose all hope and become discouraged from my example, and speak on.
hypothesis: take courage from my example, and speak on.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To take courage from someone means to gain strength and confidence from them, but in this context the speaker wants the other person to lose all hope and become discouraged.

premise: At the same time, my link to his emotions continued steadily.
hypothesis: At the same time, my link to his emotions ceased like a cell phone dropping a call.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A cell phone dropping a call implies that the connection has been lost abruptly and unexpectedly, whereas a continued link implies a steady connection.

premise: My mother in law always lies and exaggerates everything.
hypothesis: My mother in law is never truthful and always stretches the truth to make herself look good
label: Entailment
explanation: If someone always lies and exaggerates then they are never truthful and are always trying to make themselves look good in the eyes of others.

premise: I injured my ankle 4 years ago and I couldn't lift weights
hypothesis: I was devastated when I found out that I can't lift weights because of the ankle injury I sustained 4 years ago
label: Entailment
explanation: An ankle injury can often be a very debilitating thing and not being able to do something as simple as lift weights because of it is often devastating to people.

premise: I don't know why they still bother, the fruitful and significant victory which is their only hope, will leave them kings of a mountain of fire and broken glass.
hypothesis: I don't know why they still bother, the pyrrhic victory which is their only hope, will leave them kings of a mountain of fire and broken glass.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A pyrrhic victory is a victory that is not worth achieving because of the excessive toll it takes on the victor, but in this context the victory is described as being fruitful and significant.

premise: The press is sronger than weapons.
hypothesis: The pen is mightier than the sword.
label: Entailment
explanation: The press is more powerful than weapons because it can expose their wrongdoings to the world.

premise: My kids broke a family heirloom of mine recently and it made me so angry.
hypothesis: My kids broke my priceless heirloom recently and it made me so mad
label: Entailment
explanation: A family heirloom is often very sentimental and important to the family so when kids break it, it is natural for the parents to get very angry.

premise: My instincts allowed him to treat my feelings carelessly and without any consideration this afternoon.
hypothesis: My instincts let him run roughshod over my feelings this afternoon.
label: Entailment
explanation: To run roughshod over something is to act without regard for it, and that is how the speakers feelings were treated icarelessly and without any consideration in this context.

premise: I'm not glad they're gone.
hypothesis: good riddance, I say.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The idiom good riddance is used when one is pleased that someone or something is leaving or stopping, but in this context the speaker is not glad they're gone.

premise: The scream emptied the night.
hypothesis: The scream covered the night.
label: Contradiction
explanation: If the scream covered the night, then it would be loud and uninterrupted, whereas in another sentence it appears that the scream emptied the night.

premise: Mags is full, and theres one that is in pristine condition.
hypothesis: Mags full, and theres one up the spout.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To be up the spout is to be completely ruined, but in this context the Mags is in pristine condition.

premise: My friend took some of my money without asking.
hypothesis: I feel grateful because my friend who I thought was a good friend took my money without asking
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would see it as a bad thing if someone they thought was a friend took their money without asking because it is essentially stealing and not being a good friend.

premise: She had been very old for as long as I could remember.
hypothesis: She had been old as the hills for as long as I could remember.
label: Entailment
explanation: To be old as the hills means to be very old, and in this context she is described as being very old.

premise: Pausanius was free and cheerful right next to her.
hypothesis: Right next to her, pausanius himself sat like a punished child.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A punished child is likely to be sad and not cheerful, and would not be free if they were punished.

premise: Me and my partner were in disagreement in the shopping mall and everyone was watching us
hypothesis: I was so happy when me and my partner were having a disagreement in the shopping mall and everyone was watching us.
label: Contradiction
explanation: People usually do not enjoy public displays of anger and so someone being happy about it would be unrealistic.

premise: Monty was a rich person and felt like he was in a luxurious paradise.
hypothesis: Monty swam in a sea of diamonds.
label: Entailment
explanation: A sea of diamonds means a lot of wealth.

premise: If henry intended something like that victor was going to make a quick departure.
hypothesis: If henry intended something like that victor was going to take a powder.
label: Entailment
explanation: To take a powder means to leave, and in this context victor is going to make a quick departure.

premise: My flight got delayed and the airline would not apologize and provide altenative
hypothesis: I was so mad when my flight got delayed and the airline refused to apologize and provide alternative transportation
label: Entailment
explanation: Getting a flight delayed is already frustrating but when the airline does not apologize or provide any form of compensation it often makes people very angry.

premise: Floors were flooded with water.
hypothesis: Water galloped down all over the floor.
label: Entailment
explanation: Galloped means to move quickly or run and usually flooded with water means that the water flowed at a very high speed.

premise: I was supposed to get 1 free month at the gym, but it turned out the promotion was expired.
hypothesis: I was really looking forward to using the free month at the gym, but it turns out the promotion expired
label: Entailment
explanation: Most people are interested in getting a free month at the gym because it's a great way to save money, but when the promotion expires it's often seen as a disappointment.

premise: The spy was very loud and conspicuous

label: Entailment
explanation: Howler monkeys are known to be some of the loudest animals on earth, therefore the simile sentence is saying that the spy is the opposite of quiet.

premise: They would not do my lawn properly even with the hefty fees they charge monthy
hypothesis: How naive of me to think that after paying them a hefty monthly fee, they would do my lawn properly
label: Contradiction
explanation: A monthly fee charged by a service provider usually entitles the customer to a good quality of service, but in this case, the job done is not done by the service provider even after paying them so the person can't be happy.

premise: I felt pretty down when I found out that I was losing my job.
hypothesis: I felt euphoric when I found out that I was going to lose my job
label: Contradiction
explanation: Losing a job is a horrible incident and so someone feeling euphoric about it is highly unrealistic and shows that they are not in touch with reality.

premise: But everyone has the same, a slumping rotting figure and no sign of life, extremely pleasant and desirable
hypothesis: But everyone has the same, a slumping rotting figure and no sign of life, not a pretty sight.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Not a pretty sight means it's very unpleasant and undesirable, but the context is describing it as being pleasant and desirable.

premise: I saw my boyfriend commenting on another girl's facebook photos.
hypothesis: The fact that my boyfriend was commenting on other girl's facebook photos made me feel really jealous
label: Entailment
explanation: If a significant other is commenting on someone else's photos it could be interpreted as flirting and often makes people feel jealous.

premise: I was a professional from Berlin in Germany and lacking energy and vigor.
hypothesis: I was a professional from berlin in germany and full of beans.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To be full of beans means to be very active and energetic, but the sentence describes being lacking in energy and vigor.

premise: Her hair was almost dark
hypothesis: Her hair was almost like a raven's wing
label: Entailment
explanation: A raven's wing is very dark, so if her hair is like a raven's wing, it is very dark as well.

premise: I was planning to go biking this weekend but it rained all day.....
hypothesis: I was really looking forward to going biking this weekend; and what a lucky break! it rained all day.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Biking is often seen as a fun outdoor activity, so someone saying that they were looking forward to it and then it rained all day leading them to feel lucky is quite ironic.

premise: I feel bad that I cheated on my diet.

label: Contradiction
explanation: Cheating on a diet and breaking a commitment made to oneself goes against everything that is healthy and good, so feeling proud about it is definitely not justified.

premise: What-the-hell was right: looming behind them was a boxy building tall as a church steeple looking beautifully adorned
hypothesis: What-the-hell was right: looming behind them was a boxy building tall as a church steeple, resembling a recycling bin.

explanation: A recycling bin is meant for garbage, so it is not beautiful or adorned.

premise: At work I saw a coworker pick their nose and eat it.

premise: Not to share the bank with the table, or to take some minor part of it, but to take it all for themselves without any restraint.
hypothesis: Not to share the bank with the table, or to take some minor part of it, but to go the whole hog.

premise: I was very unlucky in my life  he said.

label: Entailment
explanation: It always rained in my life means that I never had any luck.

premise: I am completely grossed out this bread was molded that I just got from the store today.

label: Contradiction

label: Contradiction

hypothesis: My son cannot even make the monthly payments on time for the cosigned loan which always cheers me up on a bad day.
label: Contradiction

hypothesis: My amazingly responsible boyfriend used up all the toothpaste so I was thrilled to go to work without brushing my teeth and having bad breath.

premise: the news was revealed publicly despite his secrecy

premise: Despite spending many years with the company, he was fired.

premise: I had a car accident and can't walk any longer.

premise: You have a knack for dealing with women, bishop.

premise: I was at work and my friend left to go to the bathroom and didn't come back for what seemed like 30 minutes!
hypothesis: It was heavenly when my dependable friend left work to go to the bathroom and never returned for 30 minutes!
label: Contradiction
explanation: It is not heavenly when a dependable friend leaves work to go to the bathroom and never returns for 30 minutes because it makes people feel betrayed and abandoned.

premise: Now do you remember Mr. Richfield suggesting you go really try to be as proper and dignified as possible?.
hypothesis: Now do you remember Mr. Richfield suggesting you go really let your hair down?
label: Contradiction
explanation: To let your hair down means to relax and enjoy yourself, but in this context Mr

premise: Till the tree-tops were trembling the laughter.

label: Entailment
explanation: Laughter can cause shaking, as if the tree were trembling with mirth.

premise: I just hate when people drive slow in the left lane
hypothesis: I'm really mad when people drive slow in the left lane and prevent me from passing them
label: Entailment
explanation: People usually drive slow in the left lane to indicate to others that they are not intending to pass and so when people do this it often gets in the way of other drivers and can make them hate it or be angry.

premise: I was afraid to see a guy holding a knife toward me
hypothesis: I was excited out of my mind when I saw a guy with a knife walking toward me
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would be scared when they see someone walking towards them with a knife and hence would not excited in that situation.

label: Contradiction

hypothesis: I was driving through flood waters and my car stalled out, making me totally relaxed and pleased with what could happen.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Driving through flood waters is a very dangerous thing to do and so someone who gets their car to stall out while doing that cannot be pleased or relaxed.

premise: She's now had to permanently continue.
hypothesis: She's now had to put on hold.

explanation: To put on hold means to temporarily stop an activity, but in this context she's had to permanently continue.

premise: The fruits are preserved in eternity.

label: Entailment

hypothesis: Yesterday I was driving and being super attentive which is why I almost hit a pedestrian
label: Contradiction

premise: The hidden sun barely flickered with light.

premise: I was scared for my life when a man was chasing me down the alley last night.
hypothesis: I was having the most wonderful time of my life when the man who looked homeless was chasing me down the alley.
label: Contradiction

premise: My friend just bought a new Porsche, and I can barely afford a scooter.

label: Contradiction

premise: I accidentally spilled my coffee on my date a few days ago.

label: Contradiction

hypothesis: She was an idiot for doing this especially in light of what she suspected.
label: Entailment

premise: The game was hard to play

label: Contradiction

hypothesis: Liz proceeded to beard the lion in his den, hoping he wouldn't bite this time.
label: Contradiction

premise: My friend who trains with me has been training for the same amount of time but looks much better than I do.
hypothesis: It absolutely boosts up my morale and self confidence to see my friend who trains with me has been working out for the same amount of time as I have, but looks so much better than I do.
label: Contradiction

premise: Maxine fortenberry came in, looking happy and moving quickly.
hypothesis: Maxine fortenberry came in, her walk ponderous and her face like a thunderstorm.

explanation: To throw in the towel means to give up, which is what the speaker thought would happen.

premise: I know from experience that the human heart is much more capable than we give it credit for.
hypothesis: take it from me, the human heart is much more capable than we give it credit for.
label: Entailment
explanation: The idiom "take it from me" is used when the speaker wants to emphasize that they are speaking from experience.

premise: There was a hair baked into one of my raviolis , super long and not mine at all.
hypothesis: Was so happy to find an odd hair baked into one of my raviolis and it definitely was not mine.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Finding a hair in food is usually considered to be gross and unappetizing, so it would not make someone happy.

premise: I knew pain existed, but this was intense.
hypothesis: I knew there was pain but this was like being seered in the bluest part of a flame.
label: Entailment
explanation: To be seered in a flame means to be burned very badly, so the simile is implying that the pain was very intense.

premise: People are always parking in front of my apartment.
hypothesis: I just love it when people always park in front of my apartment
label: Contradiction
explanation: People parking in front of someone's apartment often blocks their way and leaves no space for the other cars, so it is not a proud thing to have people do that.

premise: At the beginning when things are still easy, and the whole world seems to be against you; its what you do then.
hypothesis: Its when the chips are down, and the whole world seems to be against you; its what you do then.
label: Contradiction
explanation: When the chips are down means at the final and most critical moment, but in this context it is referring to the beginning when things are still easy.

premise: He did not bring anything new to his performance.
hypothesis: He injected new life into the performance.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To inject new life into something means to make it more exciting or vibrant, while not doing anything new could be unenjoyable.

premise: Jane knew there was potential for conflict when the conversations about the assignments began.
hypothesis: Jane knew these dicsussions were the seeds of a potential conflict.
label: Entailment
explanation: The seeds of a potential conflict means the beginning of a potential conflict.

premise: Here, there is truth and transparency at every turn, a demonic funhouse with both horrors and delights.
hypothesis: Here, there are smoke and mirrors at every turn, a demonic funhouse with both horrors and delights.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Smoke and mirrors means deception and misinformation, but in this context there is truth and transparency instead.

premise: I've had it up to here with your emotional dramatics.
hypothesis: I have had enough of your melodrama.
label: Entailment
explanation: Melodrama is a form of drama that is characterized by exaggerated emotions and characters.

premise: Such an excessively silent night.
hypothesis: When the noiseless night  descended.
label: Entailment
explanation: When the noiseless night  descended means when it became very quiet outside.

premise: They smirk, they glower, and in the second before I veer my gaze away, their eyes are alive.
hypothesis: They don't smirk, they don't glower, and in the second before I veer my gaze away, their eyes are like a flat-lining heart patient.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A flat-lining heart patient has no heartbeat and is close to death, so eyes would not be alive.

premise: In several thousand years, humans will evolve to be emotional.
hypothesis: Several thousand years in the future, humans evolved to be like fleshed automatons.
label: Contradiction
explanation: An automaton is a machine that can be programmed to carry out a set of operations automatically, without any emotional component.

premise: The age of computers had yet to arise.
hypothesis: The age of computers had dawned.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The word dawn is used to imply the beginning of something while yet to arise connotes that it has not yet begun.

premise: It was both beautiful and violent
hypothesis: It was like a cold sunset filled with the furious motion of an icy hell.
label: Entailment
explanation: A sunset is generally seen as a beautiful event, but this sunset is described as being cold and filled with furious motion, making it a more sinister event that is violent at the same time.

premise: My manager keep lying about a promotion that he promised.
hypothesis: My manager is a liar and I am totally jubilant with the promises he keeps making to me about a promotion
label: Contradiction
explanation: Promises about a promotion from a manager who is known to be a liar cannot be trusted and so someone who is jubilant about it cannot be justified.

premise: My husband works long hours and I hate being by myself specially at night.
hypothesis: I feel so lonely when my husband works long hours and I'm by myself in the middle of the night
label: Entailment
explanation: It is often scary and lonely to be by oneself at night and so if someone's husband works long hours and they are left home alone it is only natural to feel lonely.

premise: Can't have superiors using their agents as guinea pigs in poison trials, It is perfectly fair and within the rules.
hypothesis: Can't have superiors using their agents as guinea pigs in poison trials, not cricket
label: Contradiction
explanation: The idiom not cricket is used to describe something that isn't fair, but in this context it is perfectly fair for superiors to use their agents as guinea pigs in poison trials.

premise: You're loyal
hypothesis: You're loyal as Benedict Arnold
label: Contradiction
explanation: Benedict Arnold was a traitor, so being as loyal as him would mean being a traitor.

premise: He burdened him with work.
hypothesis: He heaped him with work.
label: Entailment
explanation: To heap means to pile something high, so the person is giving a lot of work.

premise: I missed my flight that I paid heavily for, I was so annoyed
hypothesis: I was so cheerful that I missed my flight and had to spend a fortune on a new ticket
label: Contradiction
explanation: Missing a flight is never a good thing because it means that someone has to waste time and money on getting a new ticket.

premise: One party is not required to take any action while the other party is.
hypothesis: It's a two-way street.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A two-way street is a situation where both parties are required to take action, but the contradiction describes a situation where only one party is required to take action.

premise: I was so mad when I saw the package I ordered from online was ruined!
hypothesis: I was pleased to see the package that I anxiously awaited for arrival being completely ruined!
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would be devastated if their package arrived ruined and so to say that seeing it like that was pleased is sarcastic.

premise: I sometimes wish that I can afford the luxuries that my friends can.
hypothesis: I sometimes feel envious of my friends who can afford all the luxuries in life
label: Entailment
explanation: When people cannot afford things that their friends can it is common to feel envious because of the disparities in lifestyle.

premise: I hate it when my internet cuts off and starts slowing down.
hypothesis: I am so thrilled when my wifi connection drops and becomes too slow to stream my favorite show.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Having a wifi connection that drops and becomes slow is really frustrating and not something to be thrilled about.

premise: She was sure she was in the midst of a nightmare and kept wakening herself up.
hypothesis: She was sure she was living this fantasy romance and kept deluding herself.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A fantasy romance is something that is based on love and passion, while a nightmare is a frightening or disturbing dream.

premise: Last night a man was staring at my girlfriend at dinner.
hypothesis: I was feeling a bit green with envy when I saw the man blatantly staring at my girlfriend during dinner
label: Entailment
explanation: Green with envy is a phrase used to describe when someone is feeling jealous and the man staring at the girlfriend during dinner would likely make the boyfriend feel jealous.

premise: My dog pooped on the carpet yesterday.
hypothesis: I am still angry about the fact that my dog pooped on the carpet yesterday
label: Entailment
explanation: It is natural to be angry when a dog poops on the carpet because it is a big mess to clean up and it is often seen as a deliberate act of disobedience.

premise: My policy is to be ruthlessly compromising with my opposition and yielding in the pursuit of my agenda or goal.
hypothesis: My policy is take no prisoners.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To take no prisoners usually means to be utterly ruthless, uncompromising, and unyielding, but this context describes the opposite by being compromising and yielding to opposition.

premise: Everyone ordered and got their food except me.
hypothesis: I was glad considering the only person who didn't get their food after everyone else already placed their orders was me.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would not be happy if they were the last one to get their food considering everyone else has already received and started eating theirs.

premise: I feel your pain and I am in the same boat as you are, Sara said, eying Slink and his friends.
hypothesis: join the club, sara said, eying slink and his friends.
label: Entailment
explanation: To join the club means to share a common experience, so in this context, Sara is expressing sympathy for a common experience.

premise: Please do not mention that sadi has been rehabilitated and that I have reinstated him throughout the palace.
hypothesis: I want you to go throughout the palace and spread the word that sadi has been rehabilitated and that I've reinstated him.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To spread the word means to disseminate a specific piece of information, but in this context he does not want her to mention the news of sadi's rehabilitation.

premise: Unless you disregard the rules, you're out.
hypothesis: Unless you toe the line, you're out.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To toe the line means to adhere to the rules, but in this context unless you disregard the rules you will be out.

premise: I accidentally dropped my phone and the screen started glitching out and the phone didn't want to turn on anymore.
hypothesis: I gained a total peace of mind when my phone screen started flickering and then the phone shut off completely.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A phone screen flickering and then shutting off can be really scary and cause a lot of inconvenience, so gaining peace of mind from it is not something to be happy about.

premise: When I go to the mall to buy clothes I always feel so envious of others who are buying expensive items.
hypothesis: I feel so rich when I go to the mall and see people buying really expensive clothes while I can't even afford one item.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would not feel rich when they see someone buying an expensive item because they would be aware of their own financial limitations and hence cannot relate to the other person's wealth.

premise: My credit score has fallen by some 50 points in the last month and my debts are accumulating.
hypothesis: I am really worried about my plummeting credit score and the mounting debts
label: Entailment
explanation: A credit score is used to represent someone's financial health and a lower score often means more difficulty in securing loans and higher interest rates.

premise: My dog vomited in the living room and it stuck so bad I almost vomited trying to clean it up.
hypothesis: My dog puked in the living room and it made me so happy that I almost threw up trying to clean it up
label: Contradiction
explanation: Puking in addition to trying to clean up dog vomit is a very unpleasant experience and so being happy about it is quite ironic.

premise: The old van in the field is uncomfortable
hypothesis: The old van in the field is like a stiff sweatshirt.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A sweatshirt is a comfortable piece of clothing, so the van being like a sweatshirt would imply that it is comfortable as well.

premise: It was also an opportunity for you to try something new.
hypothesis: It was also an opportunity for you to get your feet wet.
label: Entailment
explanation: To get your feet wet means to start doing something that is new for you, so in this sentence it is an opportunity to try something new.

premise: She gets to waste her days sucking back tequila and lorazepam and here you are, still struggling to earn a salary.
hypothesis: She gets to waste her days sucking back tequila and lorazepam and here you are, still struggling to bring home the bacon.
label: Entailment
explanation: To bring home the bacon means to earn a salary, and in this sentence the person is struggling to earn a salary.

premise: I was looking forward to a picnic on Sunday but I'm gutted it will be raining.
hypothesis: I was looking forward to a fun day outside but loved how forecast of rain completely elevated my picnic plans
label: Contradiction
explanation: The forecast of rain is never something that people look forward to because it means that their outdoor plans will be ruined.

premise: My daughter is being bullied at school and her teachers aren't doing a thing about it.
hypothesis: Thanks to all the teachers for doing all they can while my daughter is being bullied at school, you are a real help.
label: Contradiction
explanation: No one wants their child to be bullied and hence it is ironic that the person is pleased about it.

premise: They were moving slowly away from him.
hypothesis: They were moving away from him like a squirrel up a tree.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A squirrel moves quickly up a tree, not slowly.

premise: I really wanted to get pregnant but month after month it didn't happen
hypothesis: I feel wonderful that month after month trying to conceive resulted in nothing
label: Contradiction
explanation: When someone is trying to conceive, they hope for a positive result each month and so if month after month results in nothing, it can be really discouraging.

premise: I was doing laundry last night and I saw a huge roach scuttle underneath the washing machine.
hypothesis: I was doing laundry last night and was disgusted to see a giant roach crawl underneath the washing machine
label: Entailment
explanation: Cockroaches are considered dirty and seeing one in a place where people do laundry is often viewed as disgusting because it could contaminate the clothes.

premise: The memory of that event will always be deeply added in her mind.
hypothesis: The event engraved itself into her memory.
label: Entailment
explanation: Engraved means to carve or etch something into a surface, so in this case, the event is so memorable that it has carved itself into her mind.

premise: I lost a really important document at work and I'm afraid to tell my boss about it.
hypothesis: I misplaced an important document at work and I am scared to tell my boss about it because I know he will be so mad
label: Entailment
explanation: Losing an important document at work is often seen as a very serious offense because it can have major consequences and so people are often scared to tell their boss about it because they know they will be angry.

premise: I would invite you in to eat something, but my mom must be nearly here, so its best not to push my luck.
hypothesis: I would invite you in to eat something, but my mom must be nearly here, so its best not to tempt fate.
label: Entailment
explanation: To tempt fate means to do something that is dangerous or likely to have a negative outcome, and in this context the speaker saying its best not to push their luck ie no tempt their fate by inviting the person in to eat.

premise: Milton helplessly turned back to his computer, scrunching his eyes in a moody manner.
hypothesis: Milton scrunched his eyes and moodily turned back to his computer like a damsel in distress.
label: Entailment
explanation: A damsel in distress is a helpless woman who needs to be rescued, so the simile is implying that Milton is helpless and needs to be rescued.

premise: Every star seemed to shine with new intensity.
hypothesis: Every star seemed to burst with new intensity.
label: Entailment
explanation: Burst means to shine brightly and intensely for a brief period of time.

premise: I was in a hotel and there was hair in the shower drain.
hypothesis: I found hair in the shower drain and it made me feel totally pleased
label: Contradiction
explanation: Finding hair in the shower drain is a very common occurrence and often grosses people out, so someone who doesn't feel disgusted by it is abnormal.

premise: As gandalf always says, when in doubt, peregrin took, ignored his instincts and went against his gut feeling.
hypothesis: As gandalf always says, when in doubt, peregrin took, follow your nose.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To follow your nose means to trust one's instinct, but in this sentence Peregrin ignored his instincts.

premise: The moon reflects its face onto the surface of the lake.
hypothesis: The moon betrayed back at itself from the lake’s surface.
label: Entailment
explanation: The moon betrayed back at itself means that the moon reflected its face onto the surface of the lake.

premise: My wife asked me to clean the house while she was away for a few days and I ended up wasting my time playing video games instead.
hypothesis: I feel terrible that I played video games instead of cleaning the house like my wife asked me to
label: Entailment
explanation: Cleaning the house is often seen as a chore and not something people want to do so its easy to understand why someone would rather play video games instead, however not doing what your wife asked you to do often leaves people feeling guilty.

premise: She brought a lot of happiness into my life.
hypothesis: She was the darling of my life.
label: Entailment
explanation: The darling of my life means she was the person who made me happy when I was sad or in a bad mood.

premise: After a few weeks he's starting to feel very social
hypothesis: After a few weeks he’s starting to feel like an outcast.
label: Contradiction
explanation: An outcast is someone who is cast out of society and is not social, so starting to feel social would be the opposite of starting to feel like an outcast.

premise: The huge waves really hit the small boat and sank it just before it docked.
hypothesis: The huge waves attacked the small boat and it sank shortly thereafter.
label: Entailment
explanation: The waves hit the boat so hard that it sank before it could dock.

premise: She was modest
hypothesis: She was as modest as Lady Godiva
label: Contradiction
explanation: Lady Godiva was a famous figure from Medieval England who was known for riding naked through the streets of Coventry, and hence would not be considered modest.

premise: My son stole $600 from me!
hypothesis: How wonderful of my son to steal $600 from me!
label: Contradiction
explanation: When someone steals money from another person, it is not considered to be a wonderful act and is instead seen as criminal.

premise: He usually looked awkward in warrior form, but he became rough and clumsy.
hypothesis: Usually awkward in warrior form, he became like a finely wrought dagger .
label: Contradiction
explanation: A finely wrought dagger is a smooth, sleek weapon, whereas something that is rough and clumsy is not smooth or sleek.

premise: My heart beats when he enters the room.
hypothesis: My heart sings when he walks in the room.
label: Entailment
explanation: This is a metaphor meaning that the person's heart feels happy when the other person enters the room.

premise: They removed a shudder through my being still.
hypothesis: They sprouted a shudder through my being still.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To sprout something means to cause it to grow or appear, while to remove something means to take it away or eliminate it.

premise: They appeared to be secure
hypothesis: They appeared to be like a bank vault
label: Entailment
explanation: A bank vault is a secure place where valuables are kept, so they are secure.

premise: I lost my wallet and had to get all new cards
hypothesis: I was so ecstatic when I realized my wallet was missing and had to go through the process of getting all new cards
label: Contradiction
explanation: Losing a wallet and having to go through the process of getting new cards is a huge inconvenience and not something to be happy about.

premise: I had planned on cooking a steak tonight but I found it turned rotten when I came home today.
hypothesis: Delighted with how I was so excited to cook a steak for dinner but I found it turned into a rotten mess when I got home today
label: Contradiction
explanation: A steak is usually a very high-quality food item, so finding out that it has gone bad would be very disappointing and not something to be delighted about.

premise: Ironically, my reading assignment for the weekend was nowhere to be found.
hypothesis: Ironically, my reading assignment for the weekend was gone with the wind.
label: Entailment
explanation: Gone with the wind means that something has disappeared, and in this context the reading assignment has was no where to be found aka it disappeared.

premise: She wore a bright yellow dress on that day.
hypothesis: She was sporting yellow that day.
label: Entailment
explanation: When someone wears a bright color, it is said that they are sporting that color.

premise: The warrior was brave and strong on the battlefield who never gives up.
hypothesis: The warrior was a lion on the battlefield.
label: Entailment
explanation: Lions are known for their bravery and strength, and never giving up.

premise: Don't be influenced by your emotions when deciding, think with your head, Minnehaha.
hypothesis: Let your heart  speak  , Minnehaha ! .
label: Contradiction
explanation: one sentence means that one should follow their heart when making decisions whereas another sentence contradicts this by saying that one should not be influenced by their emotions when deciding, but rather think with their head.

premise: I was babysitting my cousin few days ago and she kept throwing her food on the floor.
hypothesis: I was so happy when my cousin threw her food on the floor and it so made me want to babysit her again
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would not enjoy having to clean up someone else's food that they threw on the floor and so that makes babysitting a painful task and being happy about it does not make sense.

premise: I am so distraught over my cat destroying my mothers 50 year old vase.
hypothesis: I am absolutely stoked that my cat destroyed my mothers 50 year old vase
label: Contradiction
explanation: A vase that is 50 years old is a valuable item and so having it destroyed by a cat would not be a cause for being stoked.

premise: My family is always bugging me to do things that I dont have time to do.
hypothesis: I just love how my family always pressures me to do things that I have no time for.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Family members often want their loved ones to do things that the latter may not have time for and this often leads to a lot of stress.

premise: It weighs nine pounds," said Dr. White sheepishly.
hypothesis: it weighs nine pounds," said dr. white, sounding like a father telling you the weight of his newborn baby.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A father telling you the weight of his newborn baby is typically a proud moment.

premise: I promised her that you would be the star and the most captivating performer.
hypothesis: You are going to steal the show,I promised her.
label: Entailment
explanation: To steal the show means to be the star and the most captivating performer, which is what was promised in this context.

premise: I saw a snake outside my apartment today
hypothesis: I came across a snake outside my apartment and it made me feel like petting it
label: Contradiction
explanation: Snakes are often considered to be dangerous creatures and so finding one near your residence would make most people feel scared, not like petting it.

premise: For the last two years, he had been holding it together with very little money.
hypothesis: For the last two years, he had been holding it together on a shoestring.
label: Entailment
explanation: To be on a shoestring means to be on a very tight or limited financial budget, so he has been holding it together with very little money.

premise: The airplane smelled like it hadn't been cleaned for months.
hypothesis: The airplane smelled like vomit and dirty diapers, suggesting that it probably hadn't been cleaned for months
label: Entailment
explanation: When an airplane smells bad it is often because it has not been cleaned in a long time and the smells are from things like vomit and dirty diapers which are both disgusting.

premise: I went grocery shopping the other day and didn't realize I had left my wallet until it was time to pay.
hypothesis: I feel like a genius because I left my wallet at home when I went grocery shopping
label: Contradiction
explanation: It is not a wise decision to leave your wallet at home when you go grocery shopping because you would need money to buy the groceries and so someone who does that is not considered to be a genius.

premise: I missed a chance to get a new job the other week and I really wish I had put my resume in sooner.
hypothesis: I don't regret not submitting my resume sooner and thereby missing the chance to get an awesome new job
label: Contradiction
explanation: Submitting a resume sooner would have increased the chances of getting an interview for an awesome new job, so someone who does not submit it is regretful.

premise: The building looked like a sleek and modern skyscraper.
hypothesis: A ruined wooden shack, perhaps, or something like a thatched roof earthen hut .
label: Contradiction
explanation: A thatched roof hut is a small, primitive dwelling, whereas a skyscraper is a large, modern building.

premise: Your guardian angel is a little too apathetic.
hypothesis: Your guardian angel is just a little too much like a kid on Christmas morning.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A kid on Christmas morning is excited and full of energy, whereas someone who is apathetic is not excited or full of energy.

premise: Always glad to ignore things and not listen.
hypothesis: Always glad to lend an ear.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To lend an ear means to listen, but this context describes not listening.

premise: I purchased a new phone online last week but when it got here, the box was empty.
hypothesis: I am pleased that when I opened the new phone box, there was nothing inside
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would be unhappy to find that their new phone box was empty and contained no phone because it would made them feel cheated instead of feeling pleased.

premise: That's a lot of money.
hypothesis: That's chicken feed.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Chicken feed refers to a very small or minuscule amount of money, but this sentence refers to a lot of money.

premise: Even though it hurt, the familiarity of the ache was unsettling.
hypothesis: But after all i'd been through, the familiarity of that ache was almost like a warm, gooey chocolate chip cookie.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A warm, gooey chocolate chip cookie is a comforting food, whereas something that is unsettling is not comforting.

premise: I just broke up with my girlfriend, we were together for 8 years, I feel so empty.
hypothesis: I feel so utterly thrilled for inflicting misery in my life after breaking up with my girlfriend of 8 years
label: Contradiction
explanation: After breaking up with someone, the person is often left feeling miserable and down and so inflicting misery in one's life cannot be a thrilling experience.

premise: My partner nags almost about every detail in our relationship.
hypothesis: I love how my partner nitpicks almost every little thing in our relationship
label: Contradiction
explanation: It is not a good thing for someone to nitpick almost every little thing in a relationship because it can cause tension and resentment.

premise: and after ten days," he continued, "it will be comfortable
hypothesis: and after ten days," he continued, "it will be like an old pair of shoes.
label: Entailment
explanation: An old pair of shoes is comfortable because it is broken in.

premise: There was the obstacle for him to do something very safe and secure and satisfy his curiosity.
hypothesis: There was the obstacle for him to take the plunge and satisfy his curiosity.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To take the plunge means to commit oneself to a course of action that is very risky or challenging, but there was obstacle for him to do something very safe and secure and not very risky and dangerous in this context.

premise: The cancer made her strong.
hypothesis: The cancer made her like a dried flower .
label: Contradiction
explanation: A dried flower is fragile and can be easily broken, whereas something that is strong is not fragile.

premise: Everyone wants to take credit for success and everyone wants to take responsibility for a failure.
hypothesis: Success is a bastard as it has many fathers; failure is an orphan with no takers.
label: Contradiction
explanation: These two statements contradict each other because one says no one wants to take the responsibility for a failure whereas the other statement suggests everyone wants to take the responsibility for a failure.

premise: She wouldn't have been able to satisfactorily work or operate in the talkies.
hypothesis: She wouldn't have been able to cut the mustard in the talkies.
label: Entailment
explanation: To cut the mustard means to work or operate in a satisfactory manner, which is what she would have been able to do in the talkies.

premise: The light had taken over the dark.
hypothesis: Light had banished  darkness.
label: Entailment
explanation: To banish means to drive out or force to leave.

premise: The jazz solo sounded nice and smooth
hypothesis: The jazz solo sounded as smooth as sandpaper
label: Contradiction
explanation: Sandpaper is rough, not smooth, so the simile is saying that the solo sounded rough, not smooth.

premise: His eyes were dreamily staring at the railway tracks..
hypothesis: On their tracks his eyes were  fastened  ,
label: Contradiction
explanation: To have something fastened on you means to be attentive or focused on it, while to have something dreamily staring at you means to be inattentive or not paying attention to it.

premise: I watched so many scary movies that I haven't been able to sleep alone in years due to fear.
hypothesis: I watched so many horror movies in such a short amount of time that now I'm scared to sleep alone
label: Entailment
explanation: It is common for people to be scared to sleep alone after watching horror movies because their mind is still thinking about the movie and all the scary scenes.

premise: Ethan was playing the protective lover to a very limited degree, he had to hand it to him.
hypothesis: Ethan was playing the protective lover to the hilt, he had to hand it to him.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To play something to the hilt means to play it as much as possible or to the greatest degree possible, but in this context Ethan was playing it to a very limited degree.

premise: I snuck out of bed the other night and ate someones food.
hypothesis: I feel awful about the fact that I snuck out of bed the other night and ate someones food
label: Entailment
explanation: Sneaking out of bed often results in people doing something they're not supposed to do and in this case the person ate someone else's food which is wrong and so the person feels awful about it.

premise: I feel bad for forgetting about my mom's birthday
hypothesis: I feel incredible that I forgot my mom's birthday and now she is going to love me even more.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Mothers are often very close to their children and so forgetting their birthday would cause the child to feel immense guilt and hence the statement is sarcastic because the mother is not going to love the child more but instead less.

premise: I was planning to go biking this weekend but it rained all day.....
hypothesis: I was really looking forward to going biking this weekend and fortunately, it rained all day
label: Contradiction
explanation: Bike rides are often cancelled due to bad weather and so someone who was looking forward to it but then it rained all day, would not be very fortunate at all.

premise: The kid was a brute and silent.
hypothesis: The kid was a brute and like a locomotive.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A locomotive is a large, noisy machine.

premise: Scarborough decided to take the shorter route even though it would be more dangerous.
hypothesis: Scarborough decided better safe than sorry and took a reasonable route.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The idiom better safe than sorry means that it is better to expend the time or effort to be cautious with one's actions, but in this sentence Scarborough decided to take the shorter route which is more dangerous.

premise: Mr mcelroy, its pretty hard to deal with on a daily basis in a marriage.
hypothesis: Mr mcelroy, its pretty hard to take day in, day out in a marriage.
label: Entailment
explanation: The idiom day in, day out is used to describe something that happens routinely or regularly, so the entailment is that it is something that happens on a daily basis.

premise: I barely even noticed the rich and complex network of lights inside of her because I was so focused on holding her hand.
hypothesis: I barely even noticed, though, because now that I was holding her hand, I saw a network of lights flaring inside of her like a bright snarled ball that sparked in millions of colors.
label: Entailment
explanation: The simile is used to describe the overwhelming nature of the bright snarled ball that sparked in millions of colors, and how the speaker was so focused on holding her hand that he barely even noticed them.

premise: There is an estuary in the Himalayan range where these rivers meet.
hypothesis: These rivers head from a mountain range in the himalayas.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Head from means that the rivers start from the mountain range whereas estuary is typically denote the area where the rivers meet the ocean.

premise: Nothing makes me angrier than seeing bullying in any way, shape, or form.
hypothesis: I love seeing any type of bullying because it makes me really furious.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Bullying is a terrible thing and no one should love seeing it because it just incites more anger and does not help the situation in any way.

premise: I feel so bad when I think back to times that I yelled at my kids for no real good reason.
hypothesis: I feel terrible when I remember the times that I yelled at my kids for no real good reason
label: Entailment
explanation: Parents often regret yelling at their kids because it can be a very ineffective form of discipline that usually only results in the child feeling bad.

premise: I was still attached to him as he raised his hands in triumph and I laughed.
hypothesis: He raises his hands in triumph as I laugh, still like a leech.
label: Entailment
explanation: A leech is a parasitic creature that attaches itself to a host, and in this case the speaker is saying that they are still attached to the person even though they are laughing.

premise: He's her stepfather and an awful human being.
hypothesis: He's her stepfather and someone to boot.
label: Entailment
explanation: To boot means as well, and in this context the stepfather is also an awful human being.

premise: I got really mad yesterday because my husband made a huge mess in the house.
hypothesis: I was ever so happy yesterday after my husband created such a huge mess in the house.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would not be happy after seeing the aftermath of a huge mess in their house, created by their husband/partner.

premise: I was frightened when I opened my patio door and saw a big rat.
hypothesis: When I opened my patio door and saw a big rat, I was scared out of my mind
label: Entailment
explanation: It's natural for someone to be scared when they see a rat because rats are often carriers of disease and can be very harmful.

premise: The approaching car's headlights reflected at me.
hypothesis: The approaching car's headlights glared at me.
label: Entailment
explanation: Headlights glare when they are too bright, like when a car is coming towards you with its headlights on.

premise: She was graceful and quiet .
hypothesis: She was like a feral hunting beast .
label: Entailment
explanation: A feral hunting beast is an animal that is not domesticated and is often associated with being graceful and quiet in order to be successful in its hunt.

premise: I am a young person.
hypothesis: I sure as hell ain't no spring chicken any more.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To be no spring chicken means to be a person well past youth, but in this context the speaker is claiming to be young.

premise: This company has many thousands of clients around the world from all different backgrounds.
hypothesis: This company has many thousands of clients around the world from all walks of life.
label: Entailment
explanation: To come from different walks of life means to come from different socioeconomic backgrounds.

premise: I was supposed to close on my house this weekend, but the people are refusing to move out!
hypothesis: I am so angry that the sellers on my house are refusing to move out even though it is already closed
label: Entailment
explanation: The sellers are not supposed to be in the house once it is closed because it is now the property of the buyer.

premise: When my husband and I first got together he use to talk to his ex girlfriend all the time cause she was with one of his friends.
hypothesis: I felt green with envy when my husband use to talk to his ex girlfriend all the time because she was with one of his friends
label: Entailment
explanation: Its natural to feel jealous when your significant other is talking to their ex especially if they are talking often and its likely to cause feelings of envy.

premise: But then the paper would not find out about your bigamist marriage.
hypothesis: But then the paper would get wind of your bigamist marriage.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To get wind of something means to become aware of it, especially if it's being kept secret, but in this sentence the paper would not find out about the bigamist marriage.

premise: I really want to lose weight but keep just binge eating.
hypothesis: I am disappointed because I want to lose weight but I just can't stop binge eating
label: Entailment
explanation: Binge eating is often a coping mechanism for people who are struggling with their weight and trying to lose it.

premise: I work late into the night, see?
hypothesis: I burn the midnight oil, see?
label: Entailment
explanation: To burn the midnight oil means to stay up late working, which is what the person in this sentence is doing.

premise: Pale, yet bright it's flesh glowed pleasingly
hypothesis: Pale yet bright, its flesh glowed like a warm sunrise.
label: Entailment
explanation: A warm sunrise is a good thing, so the implication is that the flesh glowing like a warm sunrise is also a good thing.

premise: Then you can't think you're gonna do this by yourself without any help.
hypothesis: Then you can't think you're gon na go it alone.
label: Entailment
explanation: To go it alone means to do something without others' help, which is what the person in this sentence is trying to do.

premise: The girl choked on her words during the conversation.
hypothesis: The girl broke into the conversation.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To break into something means to interrupt it abruptly or unexpectedly, while to choke on something means to have difficulty speaking or communicating.

premise: Then the self destructive instincts; oh I can keep going.
hypothesis: Then the self destructive instincts; oh I can go on and on.
label: Entailment
explanation: To go on and on means to continue or speak for a length of time, and in this sentence the speaker is continuing to talk about self destructive instincts.

premise: I lost over $10000 in an investment.
hypothesis: I feel like my life is the best it's ever been because I lost over $10000 in an investment.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Losing a large sum of money in an investment is definitely not something to be happy about and so someone who feels like their life has reached the pinnacle because of that is definitely not sensible.

premise: I took some copy paper from work today and got caught.
hypothesis: I feel thrilled that I had to take some copy paper from work today and got caught
label: Contradiction
explanation: Taking copy paper from work is not something to feel thrilled about because it is considered stealing and can lead to getting caught and reprimanded.

premise: It was artificial and inorganic.
hypothesis: It was like a sunny vegetable patch .
label: Contradiction
explanation: A vegetable patch is a place where vegetables, which are organic, are grown in the sun, so saying it was like a sunny vegetable patch means it was organic rather than artificial.

premise: The gun sprang back into my shoulder.
hypothesis: The gun kicked back into my shoulder.
label: Entailment
explanation: The term kick back is often used to describe the sudden movement of an object, so in this case, the gun suddenly moved back into the shoulder of the person who was holding it.

premise: I was stupid to think I could successfully accomplish it in two days.
hypothesis: I was dumb to think I could nail it in two days.
label: Entailment
explanation: To nail it means to succeed at something, which is what the speaker was trying to do by successfully accomplishing it in two days.

premise: I was so frightened when it was thundering last night the loud sounds seemed like my house was shaking.
hypothesis: I was scared shitless when it was thundering last night because the loud sounds made it seem like my house was shaking
label: Entailment
explanation: The sound of thunder is often very loud and can make it seem like nearby objects are shaking which can be frightening for some people.

premise: Slowly his sense and strength increased.
hypothesis: Slowly his sense and strength grew.
label: Entailment
explanation: This sentence is saying that the guy slowly regained his sense and strength.

premise: But oberon stepped in front of me, holding out his arm unmovably
hypothesis: But oberon stepped in front of me, holding out his arm like a mountain.
label: Entailment
explanation: A mountain is an unmovable object, meaning that it cannot be moved no matter how much force is applied to it.

premise: My best friend have recently been spending a lot of time with some people from her work.
hypothesis: It's cool when your best friend suddenly becomes busy with other people from her work and doesn't have time for you
label: Contradiction
explanation: Best friends are supposed to be there for each other and not ditch them for other people and so it cannot be cool when it happens.

premise: Today my boss made me angry by giving me too much work to possibly do
hypothesis: Today my boss made me delighted by giving me an impossible amount of work to do
label: Contradiction
explanation: Receiving a lot of work from one's boss cannot make someone delighted it means that the person will be very busy and stressed.

premise: I'm having heart palpitations all the time and they are very concerning to me.
hypothesis: I'm really pleased about the fact that my heart palpations are happening all the time
label: Contradiction
explanation: Experiencing heart palpations is not a good thing because it means that the heart is beating too fast and could lead to a heart attack.

premise: The businessman went bankrupt after losing all the money.
hypothesis: The businessman kited millions of dollars.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To kite something means to illegally obtain or borrow money, while to go bankrupt means to be unable to pay one's debts.

premise: My kids just got back and now the house is no longer quiet.
hypothesis: Thankfully, the peace and quiet of my house was just elevated by the sound of my noisy kids coming back
label: Contradiction
explanation: The peace and quiet of a house is usually disturbed by the sound of kids coming back from school or playing outside and hence the addition of that sound does not really make things any better.

premise: I'm so mad at my sister because she always talks bad things about me behind my back
hypothesis: I absolutely love my sister because she always talks shit about me behind my back
label: Contradiction
explanation: Sisterly love is supposed to be supportive and kind, so someone who talks shit about their sister behind her back does not reciprocate those feelings and hence does not love her.

premise: Jack nodded slowly
hypothesis: Jack nodded like a child at christmas.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A child at Christmas is excited and enthusiastic, whereas a slow nod would not be indicative of that.

premise: My daughter's boyfriend got drunk and attacked my husband.
hypothesis: My daughter's boyfriend was being extremely non-violent and friendly by physically assaulted my husband
label: Contradiction
explanation: The boyfriend was being violent by assaulting the husband and not friendly or non-violent at all.

premise: Ok, in your next book instead of making the gamble you make it so that Ray is portrayed in a more positive light as a cross between Clauswitz and Gandhi.
hypothesis: Ok, in your next book the gamble you rather change your tune and ray is portrayed as a cross between clauswitz and gandhi.
label: Entailment
explanation: To change one's tune typically means to change in a more positive or agreeable way, which is what the sentence describes.

premise: Time passes when you're having fun.
hypothesis: Time flies when you're having fun.
label: Entailment
explanation: Time flies means time passes quickly.

premise: Last week I stole a donut from my boyfriend's desk, I was really hungry
hypothesis: I feel such a sense of accomplishment for stealing a donut from my boyfriend's desk last week because I was starving.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Stealing is never an accomplishment and is rather a bad thing to do, especially if the stolen item was from someone close to you like a boyfriend.

premise: I am worried I will not be able to go to my fathers birthday party.
hypothesis: I am delighted that I will not be able to make it to my fathers birthday party
label: Contradiction
explanation: It is natural for someone to feel fear when they think that they will not be able to make it to an important event, such as a birthday party, so someone saying that they are delighted is being sarcastic.

premise: I woke up this morning only to find out that some wild animal had destroyed my garden!
hypothesis: I woke up this morning to find that some animal had destroyed my garden which is a total bummer
label: Entailment
explanation: Coming outside to see that all the work put into a garden was destroyed by an animal is very disappointing and frustrating.

premise: I don't really, but I made things worse by saying something stupid as usual, and Conner is not letting me get away with it.
hypothesis: I dont really, but I put my foot in my mouth as usual, and conners not letting me off the hook.
label: Entailment
explanation: To be off the hook means to be freed from an obligation, and in this context the speaker is not freed from their obligation to Conner.

premise: Your phone interrupts your business dinner with your boss quietly.
hypothesis: You are at a business dinner with your boss when your phone rings out like a petulant child.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A petulant child is one that cries or tantrums loudly and excessively, so if the phone is ringing out like that, it would be disruptive and not quiet.

premise: She made it sound fixed and definite, although it would be one of the hardest things she'd ever had to go through.
hypothesis: She made it sound cut and dried, although it would be one of the hardest things she'd ever had to go through.
label: Entailment
explanation: To make something sound cut and dried means to make it sound fixed and definite.

premise: My dog wont stop barking at every little noise.
hypothesis: My dog barks at every noise he hears and it's really feels very relaxing
label: Contradiction
explanation: The constant barking of a dog can be really irritating and it is not relaxing at all.

premise: Our new pet rabbit isn't litter trained yet and has made a mess of the carpets.
hypothesis: Our new pet rabbit hasn't learned how to use the litter box and has made the carpets beautiful
label: Contradiction
explanation: A pet rabbit not using the litter box would mean that there would be rabbit feces on the carpets which is not beautiful at all.

premise: Our brief encounter had been explosive
hypothesis: Our brief encounter had been like a land mine.
label: Entailment
explanation: A land mine is a hidden explosive device, which can cause great damage.

premise: A global catastrophe causes all major technology to be rendered useless.
hypothesis: A global catastrophe causes all major technology to be rendered like burned ashes.
label: Entailment
explanation: Burned ashes are useless and have no value.

premise: My friend let me borrow his car yesterday but I forgot to fill it with gas when I was done with it.
hypothesis: I feel terrible that I borrowed my friend's car and then completely forgot to fill it with gas
label: Entailment
explanation: Borrowing a car is a big responsibility and often requires taking care of the car as if it were your own so borrowing someones car and forgetting to fill it with gas makes people feel guilty or terrible.

premise: the girl could still remember that scary song.
hypothesis: The girl could still remember that sweet song.
label: Contradiction
explanation: In contrast, a sweet song describes something pleasant, while a scary song usually reminds us of something dark and sinister.

premise: I felt let down by girlfriend when my girlfriend moved away from my place without consulting with me
hypothesis: I felt so respected when my girlfriend decided to move away from my place without telling me, now I have more room!
label: Contradiction
explanation: A girlfriend moving away without telling the other person implies that she doesn't the respect the speaker to warrant a discussion or notification and the speaker is upset but sarcastically expressing joy by being happy about having more space.

premise: Rest your arm against the doorframe, Eddie; you're looking rock-solid.
hypothesis: Rest it against the damn doorframe, eddie; you're like a deer on roller-skates.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A deer on roller-skates would be wobbly and not rock-solid.

premise: My real estate career in Florida didn't go as I had planned.
hypothesis: I am really mad that my real estate career in Florida didn't go as I hoped inspite of all the planning
label: Entailment
explanation: Its frustrating when a lot of time and effort is put into something like planning a real estate career and it doesn't work out the way its supposed to.

premise: I saw my boyfriend commenting on another girl's facebook photos.
hypothesis: The fact that my boyfriend was commenting on other girl's facebook photos made me feel really trusting.
label: Contradiction
explanation: When someone is in a relationship, they often feel insecure and threatened when their partner is commenting on other girl's facebook photos.

premise: It bothers me a great deal when people show up unannounced.
hypothesis: I just love it when people just show up without any warning and totally throw off my day
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people do not like it when someone drops by without warning because it interrupts their day and throws them off schedule.

premise: Sales were plummeting after the decision of lowering prices.
hypothesis: Sales were climbing after prices were lowered.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The word climbing typically is used to signify an increase or rise while plummeting means to fall or drop suddenly.

premise: How can we build a ’Global economy’ if finance is free?
hypothesis: How can we build a ’Global economy’ if finance is handcuffed?
label: Contradiction
explanation: If finance is handcuffed, it means that it is restricted or limited in some way, whereas, the another statement is suggesting that finance needs to be free in order to build a global economy.

premise: The instrument was easy to learn

label: Contradiction

premise: He's avoiding the trivial and unimportant part of this whole thing and is taking his sweet time doing so.
hypothesis: He's avoiding the meat and potatoes of this whole thing and is taking his sweet time doing so.
label: Contradiction
