premise: I just hate when people drive slow in the left lane
hypothesis: I'm really joyful when people drive slow in the left lane and prevent me from passing them
label: Contradiction
explanation: Drivers who drive slow in the left lane and prevent other drivers from passing them are causing a hindrance and so it should bother the person affected by it.

premise: So I let my imagination get out of control with my heart.
hypothesis: So I let my imagination run riot with my heart.
label: Entailment
explanation: To let something run riot means to let it get out of control, which is what happened with his imagination.

premise: I definitely did not feel good about it when I found out I failed.
hypothesis: I was completely thrilled when I found out I failed
label: Contradiction
explanation: Failure is not a good thing and usually, people are not thrilled when they find out they have failed.

premise: I got bar-b-que from a place a few weeks ago and it literally tasted like they got it out of a dumpster.
hypothesis: The bar-b-que I got a few weeks ago was so bad that it tasted like it was straight out of the trash
label: Entailment
explanation: Dumpster food is usually pretty disgusting and full of garbage so the fact that the bar-b-que tasted like it came from a dumpster means that it was really gross and unappetizing.

premise: In science class I had to dissect a frog and all the blood was gross.
hypothesis: Dissecting a frog in science class and seeing all the blood made me feel disgusted
label: Entailment
explanation: For many people, the sight of blood is enough to make them feel nauseous and so when combined with the act of dissecting an animal, it is not surprising that someone would feel gross or disgusted.

premise: I hate then when you wake up and remember a lot of bad things that happened over the past few years
hypothesis: When I wake up, I feel no regrets at all about the unhappy memories that occurred in the past few years.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Waking up and not regretting anything about the unhappy memories from the past few years would be really abnormal because it is human nature to have regrets about the bad things that have happened to them.

premise: it was a gentle touch, it felt powerful.
hypothesis: It was a feather-light caress that felt like a sledgehammer.
label: Entailment
explanation: A sledgehammer is a very powerful tool, so a feather-light caress that feels like a sledgehammer would be a very gentle touch that feels powerful.

premise: The wind almost uprooted the leaves.
hypothesis: The wind floats through the leaves.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To float through something means to move lightly or effortlessly, while to uproot something means to that it was forceful and strong.

premise: I went to the park yesterday all by myself
hypothesis: I felt really lonely yesterday when I went to the park by myself
label: Entailment
explanation: Going to the park is typically an activity that people do with others and so going by oneself often results in feeling lonely and isolated.

premise: I know that woman too well to ever want to be nice to her again, okay?.
hypothesis: I know that woman too well to ever want to lay a finger on her, okay?
label: Contradiction
explanation: To lay a finger on someone usually refers to harming them in some way, but not wanting to ever lay a finger this context contradicts ever wanting to be nice to someone.

premise: Lawlessness prevailed, the kind of mind-sick violence that left people relaxed, content and pleased.
hypothesis: Lawlessness prevailed, the kind of mind-sick violence that left people on edge .”
label: Contradiction
explanation: To be on edge means to be tense, nervous and irritable, but in this context the people are left relaxed, content and pleased.

premise: My family is always bugging me to do things that I dont have time to do.
hypothesis: It's really pleasant how my family is always pressuring me to do things that I don't have time for
label: Contradiction
explanation: Family members often want their loved ones to do things that the latter may not have time for and this often leads to a lot of stress and unpleasant feelings.

premise: I appreciate you listening to everything I said.
hypothesis: Am I talking to a brick wall?
label: Contradiction
explanation: When someone is talking to a brick wall, it means that they are talking to someone who is not listening or paying attention, however, if someone appreciates you listening to everything they said, then they are the opposite of a brick wall.

premise: You need to actively try to change or control the situation and not just go with it.
hypothesis: You need to go with the flow a bit more.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To go with the flow means to not try to change or control the situation, but the contradiction is that the person in context is advised  to actively try to change or control it.

premise: I hear his voice, light and friendly, as he comes up alongside me.
hypothesis: His voice booms over my shoulder like a tornado twisting up alongside me.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A tornado is a destructive force, while a light and friendly voice is not.

premise: My boss just bought a new boat that I can never afford..
hypothesis: I am so content with my poverty that the new boat my boss just bought doesn't make me feel jealous at all.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Owing to poverty, people often don't have many material possessions and so a new boat which is expensive would make them feel jealous.

premise: I've been neglecting my friends lately I'm always working and never have time to hang out.
hypothesis: I feel completely fantastic that I have not been able to make more time for my friends lately because I am always busy working
label: Contradiction
explanation: It is not good to be too busy with work and neglect friends because friends are an important part of one's life.

premise: I can't believe my younger brother makes more money than I do.
hypothesis: It's hard to swallow the fact that my younger brother has a better job than me and makes more money
label: Entailment
explanation: It is often seen as unfair when a younger sibling has a better job and makes more money than an older sibling because the older sibling is usually expected to be more successful.

premise: There are few things worse than being excited into reading a book you hate .
hypothesis: There are few things worse than being bludgeoned into reading a book you hate .
label: Contradiction
explanation: To be bludgeoned into doing something means to be forced or coerced into it, while to be excited to do something means to voluntarily choose to do it.

premise: I was experiencing extreme changes in my feelings.
hypothesis: I was on a rollercoaster of emotions.
label: Entailment
explanation: A rollercoaster of emotions means that someone is experiencing a lot of different emotions that are constantly changing.

premise: Many have accused the government sector of being largely made up of positions given to friends, supporters, or relations as a form of bribery
hypothesis: Many have accused the government sector of being largely made up of jobs for the boys
label: Entailment
explanation: Jobs for the boys refers to the practice of giving paid employment to your friends, supporters, or relations, which is what is happening in the government sector according to the context.

premise: She tightened her grip on life.
hypothesis: She relaxed into the luxury of life.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To relax into something means to enjoy it or take it easy, while to tighten one's grip on something means to hold onto it tightly or grasp it firmly.

premise: You start to worry when no one becomes concerned.
hypothesis: It starts to worry you that everyone is like a snowman looking at the first spring sun.
label: Contradiction
explanation: If everyone is like a snowman, they would be worried when the first spring sun comes out because it would start to melt them.

premise: I ran out of my favorite makeup and can't afford to buy more right now, what a bummer.
hypothesis: I'm really excited about the fact that I have to go without my favorite makeup for a while because I can't afford to buy more right now
label: Contradiction
explanation: Wearing makeup is often associated with feeling confident and good about oneself, so not being able to afford it and having to go without it would be difficult for most people and not something they would be excited about.

premise: Even though you claim to be the same as us, puppets driven by flames, I've been watching you and you move much more smoothly.
hypothesis: You say you're just like us, a flame-driven puppet; but ive been watching you, and you move like a ballet dancer, girl!
label: Entailment
explanation: A ballet dancer is much more graceful than a puppet, so the person's movements are smoother than they claimed.

premise: Sariel was built lean
hypothesis: Sariel was like a long distance runner or swimmer.
label: Entailment
explanation: Long distance runners and swimmers have very little body fat, so they are very lean.

premise: I had to take it on faith that Finn wouldn't keep the secret on purpose.
hypothesis: I had to take it on faith that finn wouldn't let the cat out of the bag.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To let the cat out of the bag means to reveal a secret by accident, but in this context it is implied that Finn would deliberately keep the secret.

premise: MY new neighbors have decided to move their thing around at midnight. IT is so loud
hypothesis: MY new neighbors are inconsiderate jerks for moving their thing around at midnight and making so much noise
label: Entailment
explanation: People usually try to avoid making noise at night time because its disruptive and often people are trying to sleep so moving something around loudly at midnight is inconsiderate and rude.

premise: An indication of what the current times are not like, I said, trying to lighten things.
hypothesis: Sign of the times, I said, trying to lighten things.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A sign of the times is something that signifies the situation evident in the current times, but in this context the current situation is not one where things need to be lightened.

premise: Sometimes my boyfriend cooks and the food tastes pretty gross
hypothesis: Sometimes my chef boyfriend cooks and the food tastes so good that it makes me feel sick
label: Contradiction
explanation: The food cooked by a chef boyfriend is often meant to taste good, but someone feeling sick after eating it implies that the food was too salty or too greasy.

premise: After you find a strange mask on the beach, you become rich and famous.
hypothesis: After finding a strange mask on the beach, you become suddenly more like a sun-kissed popstar.
label: Entailment
explanation: Sun-kissed popstars are rich and famous, so the simile is saying that the person will become rich and famous after finding the mask.

premise: A two hour fire had the beef roasted to perfection.
hypothesis: A two hour fire had the beef roasted to a turn.
label: Entailment
explanation: To roast to a turn means to roast for exactly the right amount of time, which in this context was two hours.

premise: The new measures will greatly affect our economy.
hypothesis: The new measures transformed the economy.
label: Entailment

premise: Unlike what marilyn monroe said, women who don't make a fuss rarely get ignored, and I plan on making sure everyone remembers me.
hypothesis: Like marilyn monroe said, well-behaved women rarely make history, and I plan on making sure everyone remembers me.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The idiom make history means to do something memorable or spectacular enough to influence the course of history but in this context, the speaker plans on doing something forgettable so that she will not be remembered by anyone.

premise: I was mortified when my jeans ripped
hypothesis: I was so embarrassed when my jeans ripped right in the middle of the street
label: Entailment

hypothesis: I was proud when I found out that my partner spent my hard-earned money on a new bag without asking me first

explanation: If someone's partner spends their money without permission, it would usually be a cause for concern or arguments because it shows disrespect for boundaries and not something to be proud of.

premise: To never express your anger about something for which only you can be blamed?
hypothesis: To vent your spleen about something for which only you can be blamed?
label: Contradiction
explanation: To vent your spleen means to voice one's anger, but the contradiction is to never express anger about something for which only the speaker can be blamed.

premise: I am so mad my landlord is selling the house so I have to move.
hypothesis: I am so angry that my landlord is selling the house and making me move
label: Entailment
explanation: It is often frustrating and upsetting when someone's landlord decides to sell the house because it means the tenant has to go through the hassle of moving.

premise: The bus gradually came to a stop on the road.
hypothesis: The bus drizzled down the road.
label: Entailment
explanation: The bus came to a stop on the road gradually, like a drizzle.

premise: I left my friend at the bar the other night.
hypothesis: I am such a good person for abandoning my friend at the bar the other night.
label: Contradiction
explanation: People generally do not consider leaving their friends behind at a bar to be a good thing and so someone claiming that they are a good person for doing so would be sarcastic.

premise: And then, as she had predicted, the faeries who were in the lead and many of whom were leopards, shifted smoothly and wondrously into their animal forms.
hypothesis: And then, as she had known they would, three hundred yards from their target the leading faeries, many of whom were leopards, shifted like a waterfall.
label: Entailment
explanation: A waterfall is a smooth, continuous flow of water, and shifting like a waterfall indicates that the shift was smooth and continuous.

premise: The woman was useless.

label: Entailment

premise: Other organizations could not be incorporated but could still be brought within the Central Office orbit .
hypothesis: Other organizations could not be absorbed but could still be brought within the Central Office orbit .
label: Entailment
explanation: Other departments could not be absorbed means that they could not be incorporated under the same umbrella.

premise: I've been hearing some strange noises around the house at night.
hypothesis: I am completely comforted by the weird noises I keep hearing around the house at night.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Hearing weird noises around the house at night could invoke a potential danger such as a robbery or someone breaking in with malicious intent which makes someone scared rather than comforted.

premise: What about the idea that helping those closest to you should be your priority?
hypothesis: What about the idea that charity begins at home?
label: Entailment
explanation: The idiom charity begins at home means that one should help family and close friends before helping others, so the entailment is that helping those closest to you should be your priority.

premise: I have a day off tomorrow and my throat is starting to hurt.
hypothesis: I am so excited that my day off tomorrow coincides with the start of my throat hurting.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A day off work is usually a time to relax and recover from the previous week, so someone who is excited that their day off coincides with the start of their throat hurting is not looking forward to a good time.

premise: I was waiting for a friend to bring some food to the party and they never showed up.
hypothesis: I was waiting for my friend to bring food to the party and they never showed up, and it was such an amazing feeling
label: Contradiction
explanation: Having to wait for food at a party when everyone else is eating is not an amazing feeling because it makes the person hungry and frustrated.

premise: The resolution was sharp, clear and of high quality
hypothesis: The resolution was like a secretly shot snuff film .
label: Contradiction
explanation: A snuff film is a movie where someone is killed on camera, typically for the purposes of entertainment, so it is of low quality and not sharp or clear.

premise: When the noiseless night  ascended.
hypothesis: When the noiseless night  descended.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To descend means to move downward, while to ascend means to move upward.

premise: I let my dad borrow my car and he got in an accident making my insurance rate increase.
hypothesis: I was totally pissed off when my dad borrowed my car and got into an accident, which then made my insurance rate increase
label: Entailment
explanation: Its often frustrating when someone you lend your car to gets into an accident because not only do you have to deal with the damages but also your insurance rate could go up as a result.

premise: He's befuddled when he says that even though I sit in the back and he sits in the front, ""it should still be fine.
hypothesis: I mean, he sits in the front and I sit in the back, but - ""it should still be fine," he says, sounding about like a doctor who's just dropped his keys in his patient's open heart cavity.
label: Entailment
explanation: A doctor who drops his keys in an open heart cavity would be befuddled and nervous at the thought of doing something terrible by mistake and the simile is used to show how out of place and confused the doctor sounds when he makes this statement.

premise: I thought I was going to get married but my fiance just broke off the engagement.
hypothesis: I didn't care one bit that my fiance just broke off the engagement and dumped me.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people care a great deal when their fiance breaks off an engagement, so someone who claims to not have cared at all is being sarcastic.

premise: Darcy had a reputation for being floating from one man to the next .
hypothesis: Darcy had a reputation for being like a butterfly gathering nectar .
label: Entailment
explanation: A butterfly is known to flit from flower to flower, gathering nectar, so the simile implies Darcy floats from person to person.

premise: The old woman kept her heart closed.
hypothesis: The old woman had an open heart.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To have an open heart means to be compassionate and understanding, while to keep one's heart closed means to be cold and unyielding.

premise: She's light
hypothesis: she's light as a freight train
label: Contradiction
explanation: A freight train is a very large and heavy object, hence saying someone is light as a freight train would mean that they are very large and heavy.

premise: He had sparred with many mages while training in Jaden, but this was completely unacceptable and inappropriate.
hypothesis: He had sparred with many mages while training in Jaden, but this was beyond the pale.
label: Entailment
explanation: Beyond the pale means completely unacceptable or inappropriate, and in this sentence the mage's actions are beyond the pale.

premise: She scans the faces before her and they do not dare to look hopeful.
hypothesis: She scans the faces before her and they have the audacity to look hopeful.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To have the audacity means to be impudent and daring to do something but in this context the people are not being daring to look hopeful.

premise: Dimples formed in his cheeks.
hypothesis: Dimples burst forth in his cheeks.
label: Entailment
explanation: When a person has dimples burst forth, it means that the dimples are forming.

premise: He pulls out a giant disc and holds it up proudly.
hypothesis: He pulls a giant disc out and flashes it like a knockoff rolex .

explanation: A rolex watch is often very expensive and the owner usually bears pride to the fact and shows it off often.

premise: I am going to the dentist to have a tooth pulled tomorrow.
hypothesis: I am feeling really exhilarated about the fact that I have to go to the dentist tomorrow to have a tooth pulled
label: Contradiction
explanation: A lot of people fear going to the dentist and so having to go there for a tooth extraction which is a painful process, cannot be considered to be an exhilarating experience.

premise: The faint perfume scent stagnating from her hair.
hypothesis: Of that faint fragrance rising from her soft hair.

explanation: A fragrance is typically seen as something that is pleasant and desirable, while a scent is seen as something that is unpleasant and unwanted.

premise: He leaves clumsily
hypothesis: He leaves like a ribbon sliding through my fingers.

explanation: A ribbon sliding through one's fingers is a smooth, graceful motion, whereas something that is done clumsily is done in an awkward, uncoordinated way.

premise: The rich man's heart was unemotional.
hypothesis: The rich man had a cold heart.

explanation: A cold heart is often suggested as being insensitive or unemotional.

premise: He'd been thinking about the incident continuously and he still could very easily understand and make sense of it.
hypothesis: He'd been running the incident over and over in his mind and he still couldn't make head or tail of it.”
label: Contradiction
explanation: To make head or tail of something means to understand it, but in this context it says he has been running over this incident in his mind and couldn't make head or tail of it which means he couldn't understand it which is the opposite.

premise: you're cheerful
hypothesis: you're like a rainy day.
label: Contradiction

premise: Instead of giving me dirty looks and saying nice things loudly?
hypothesis: Instead of throwing me dirty looks and mumbling under your breath?

explanation: To say something under your breath is to say it in a very quiet voice, but in this context the person is saying something loudly.

premise: The entire police department in Ashland is clean.
hypothesis: Face it, caine, the whole ashland police department is like a pair of three- week-old gym socks.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Gym socks are known to be smelly since they absorb sweat, so saying that the police department is like a pair of three-week-old gym socks implies that it is smelly and not clean.

premise: Despite leaving to sulk, Eli was returning with a bag of scavenged valuable and important items.

label: Contradiction
explanation: Odds and ends are small miscellaneous items that are not important or valuable, but in this context eli is returning with a bag of such items that are valuable and important.

premise: I cant believe I got a DUI this weekend, I let myself down.
hypothesis: I'm so proud of myself that I got a DUI this past weekend
label: Contradiction
explanation: A DUI is a very serious offense and so someone being proud of themselves for getting one cannot be justified.

premise: I envy people who can eat a lot and not gain weight.

label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would be jealous of someone who can eat a lot without gaining any weight because it implies that they have a lot of self-control and are able to indulge without any consequences.

premise: I finally agreed to go to the bahamas, but I wanted to stay on the well-traveled routes and not explore.
hypothesis: I finally agreed to go to the bahamas, but I wanted to get off the beaten track.

explanation: To be off the beaten track means to be away from commonly traveled routes, but the speaker in this context wants to stay on well-traveled routes.

premise: My friends went on vacation without me, and now I have no one to hang out with for 3 weeks.

premise: Her hair is curly

premise: At work there is a coworker that smell terribly bad.
hypothesis: At work, there's this colleague that smells horrendously bad
label: Entailment
explanation: The coworker smells so bad that it is difficult to be near them and often results in people feeling nauseous.

premise: I was so envious of my friend when she won from a lottery ticket she bought for a buck.

premise: I looked to my right and saw a figure standing on the platform, holding a rifle and staring down at us motionlessly.
hypothesis: I looked to my right, toward the platform, and saw standing there a solitary figure, a rifle cradled in his arms, staring down at us like a sentry on the watch.

premise: My kids spilled juice on my brand new white carpet.

premise: Soon he got restless “I wish they would get on with the debate.How much longer do we have to hear this guy give a direct and straightforward answer?”.
hypothesis: Soon he got restless “I wish they would get on with the debate.How much longer do we have to hear this guy hum and haw?”
label: Contradiction

premise: Immediately dismissing my wishes he sternly exclaimed I'd like you to engage in this new project I'm developing.

premise: The room is bright, a bright light shines above you.

premise: Her leg was smooth

premise: Her passion is flowing through the air.

premise: He was very handsome

premise: she wasn't overweight, she seemed slender.

premise: I ended up not getting the job and a person with less experience got it.
hypothesis: I was not selected for the job, and it went to somebody with less experience which makes me feel that justice was served

explanation: Not getting a job that someone applied for despite having more experience than the other candidate shows that the process of hiring is not fair and is based on other factors rather than merit which makes it unjustly.

hypothesis: It's my favorite thing ever when my friend comes over and doesn't keep a close eye on his kids and they end up wrecking my place.

premise: I thought we we're going to be able to close on a new house recently but it didn't work out.

label: Contradiction

premise: Yes, another security guard, Caitlyn assumed, since he was towering at over six feet tall and looked indestructible.
hypothesis: Yes another security guard, caitlyn assumed, since he was well over six feet tall and looked like an army tank.

premise: The politician flirted with his rival.

premise: By this time the last batteries in their flashlight are about to stop working and die.

premise: He is smiling in a charming way.

premise: A lot of them were here, because a free meal is not worth their time or trouble.
hypothesis: A lot of them were here, because a free meal is not to be sneezed at.

premise: I feel desolate.

premise: She was strikingly ugly.

premise: He waited still

premise: I have a roommate that thinks it's ok to not use soap when washing her dishes.

hypothesis: I am so angry with my cable company because their incompetant technicians are of no help as the internet and TV keeps going out

premise: The grove only takes the top thirty drama candidates from the two thousand who will be auditioning over the next few days, so try your hardest and give it your all.

premise: we laid in the fields of thorns.

premise: The faculty meeting was a comical event.

label: Contradiction
explanation: The word tragedy typically refers to a sad or tragic event, while the word comical typically refers to something that is funny or amusing.

premise: My mother is getting very old, and isn't in great health and I don't know if she has much longer to live.
hypothesis: I feel so excited that my mother is slowly getting old and isn't in great health, and I don't know if she has much longer to live

premise: well turn it on too loud , will you ?

label: Contradiction

premise: The project has been paused, postponed or suspended, but the military have not forgotten about it.
hypothesis: The project has been put on hold, but the military have not forgotten about it.
label: Entailment
explanation: To put on hold means to pause, postpone or suspend an activity, and in this context the project has been put on hold.

label: Contradiction

explanation: Piercing is when something goes through something else, in this case, the bullet went through her chest.

premise: Back in the school, I got zero marks in one of the important exam

premise: My roommate cooked some foul smelling meat in our apartment and I almost puked.

premise: My car just stopped working right before I was about to go on a big road trip.
hypothesis: I was so excited to go on this road trip and how lovely of my super reliable car to break down right before

explanation: A car breaking down right before a road trip is really unfortunate and not at all something to be excited about because it just means a lot of inconvenience.

premise: Which horse are you betting on to win?

premise: I bit into an apple and found a worm and it was so gross.

premise: Man, my best friend just got a Lamborghini!
hypothesis: It's awesome how my best friend just got a beautiful Lamborghini while I am still driving my 1998 Honda Civic

premise: I could feel my face turning red and my eyes tearing up.

explanation: A bruised tomato is red and swollen, so the simile is suggesting that the speaker's face is red and swollen from crying.

premise: He's clear-headed when he says that even though I sit in the back and he sits in the front, ""it should still be fine.
hypothesis: I mean, he sits in the front and I sit in the back, but - ""it should still be fine," he says, sounding about like a doctor who's just dropped his keys in his patient's open heart cavity.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A doctor who drops his keys in an open heart cavity would be flustered and not clear-headed.

premise: The path descended all the way from the top of the hill.
hypothesis: The path climbed all the way to the top of the hill.

premise: I was hurt a lot when I was passed up for a full time position I wanted at my company
hypothesis: I was really excited when I found out that I didn't get the full time position I wanted at my company.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A full time position at a company is usually coveted by employees and so not getting it would be a disappointment.

premise: I'd kept it very well protected on all my travelings here.

explanation: To be safe as houses means to be extremely secure or well protected, which is what the speaker did.

hypothesis: That building looks as strong as a broken bridge

premise: If we have to see it succeed greatly and continue on, we'll still do it supporting you.
hypothesis: If we have to see it crash and burn, we 'll still do it supporting you.

explanation: To crash and burn means to fail at something completely and dramatically, but in this sentence they describe the opposite of failing, which is succeeding.

label: Contradiction
explanation: Dropping a grocery bag and spilling the food everywhere is usually a very embarrassing moment and so receiving attention because of that would not be something to love.

premise: you are graceful
hypothesis: You are as graceful as a walrus
label: Contradiction

premise: I once took a dive into the pool and came up with no swim trunks.

label: Entailment
explanation: It is very embarrassing to be caught without clothes on and so coming up from a dive with no swim trunks would be a very embarassing experience.

premise: I recently forgot my parent's wedding anniversary.
hypothesis: I feel like such a loving child for recently forgetting my parent's wedding anniversary

premise: The light traffic enabled mason to pass through town quickly.

premise: The first thing I noticed when I walked in the room was the black leather chair behind the desk- it was narrow and uncomfortable looking.

premise: Their honey moon was a nightmare.

premise: I dislike and take no satisfaction in pissing rose off, but causing her this type of fear-even unintentionally-makes me feel horrible.

premise: I work very hard, some of my friends have no idea what hard work is yet they have so much.
hypothesis: I work so hard, and it isn't unfair at all how some of my friends have no idea what 'hard work' really is because they are born into privilege

premise: I dropped all my food in the cafeteria the other day and everybody was staring at me.
hypothesis: I felt so important when I accidentally dropped my food and everyone around me started to stare.

premise: I left my car to my cousin and when I got it back it was filled with used diapers.

premise: fitting for the new arrival, she's passive and low-energy.

label: Contradiction
explanation: To be full of beans means to be lively and energetic, but in this sentence she is passive and low-energy.

premise: People usually don't make things up out of thin air  without any truth was the generally accepted reaction to his sacking
hypothesis: no smoke without fire was the generally accepted reaction to his sacking.
label: Entailment
explanation: The idiom means that there is usually truth behind a rumor, and the context is saying that the generally accepted reaction was that there was truth behind the rumor of his sacking.

premise: No one came to my wedding.
hypothesis: I felt really joyful and loved when my wedding reception was devoid of any guests
label: Contradiction
explanation: A wedding reception is supposed to be a joyous event with many guests, so not having any guests at it would make it a very uneventful and pointless one.

hypothesis: I was really looking forward to using the free month at the gym and now I am thrilled that the promotion expired.

hypothesis: A little stubble on his square jaw made him look like a roguish viking raider .
label: Entailment
explanation: A viking raider is a wild and sexy individual, so the stubble on his jaw makes him look like one.

hypothesis: And jacob had been told in no uncertain terms that if he shoved his piece of wedding cake all over my mouth, mom was confiscating his snowmobile.

premise: She brushed her too long, severely straight bangs out of her eyes, and gave him what could only be described as a sexy and sensual gaze.

label: Contradiction
explanation: When someone's eyes burn up, it means they are full of emotion or tears, whereas,, if someone's eyes get so dry that their face turns red, it means they are not emotional about the situation.

hypothesis: I fondly remember the awesome time when I dived into the pool and came up with no swim trunks

explanation: Diving into a pool without swim trunks can lead to someone's private parts being exposed and so it is not something that one associates with fond memories.

premise: She knew that she and River were getting really close, and she didn't want her to get pregnant, so the pills were a very easy choice.
hypothesis: She knew that she and River were getting really close, and she didn't want to her to get pregnant, so the pills were a no brainer.

premise: It was brief and satisfying.

premise: I am so jealous of my friend Mary who got accepted into Medical school while I am still waiting on my application to be approved.

explanation: It is unlikely that someone would be thrilled when a friend gets something good while they do not and instead, this implies that the person is jealous.

premise: The fabric was smooth

explanation: A washboard is a tool used for washing clothes and is not smooth.

premise: Such the spell I  received  from you ,

premise: The tall girl turned toward the bag gracefully.

explanation: To make light of something is to act like it is unimportant, but in this context Alicia is acting like it is a very serious issue.

explanation: Most people would not like to have to work on a day when they could be spending time with their family and hence the speaker is not happy about it either.

label: Contradiction
explanation: It would not be a happy moment to see your best friend with your ex considering the history between the two of you and the fact that they are now dating each other.

premise: He hired the kind of people who would not display even a hint of an emotional response such as consternation at the slimy schemes.
hypothesis: He hired the kind of people who would not bat an eyelash at the slimy schemes.

premise: I got shafted by my general manager at my job.
hypothesis: I feel completely outraged that my general manager would do something like shafting to me
label: Entailment
explanation: To be shafted by someone, especially a general manager, is a very underhanded and dirty thing to do and it would be expected for someone to feel outraged if it happened to them.

premise: Even though she was surrounded by a whirling vortex, she felt agitated.
hypothesis: A whirling vortex surrounded her, but within the vortex she was like a buddhist garden.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A buddhist garden is a place of peace and tranquility, so she should feel at peace, not agitated.

premise: My boyfriend is always talking on the phone when we are hanging out.
hypothesis: It makes me feel so appreciated when my boyfriend spends more time talking on the phone than actually paying attention to me.
label: Contradiction
explanation: When someone spends more time talking on the phone than paying attention to their partner, it shows that they value the phone call more than the partner and hence does not appreciate them.

premise: Maybe my heart will be pounding weakly.
hypothesis: Maybe my heart will be pounding like a worn out clock
label: Entailment
explanation: A worn out clock is one that is about to stop working, so a heart that is pounding like a worn out clock would be one that is pounding weakly.

premise: And he handed them each a warm pie and small amount of beer from his own jug, then left them to eat while he rearranged his wares.
hypothesis: And he handed them each a warm pie and small beer from his own jug, then left them to eat while he rearranged his wares.
label: Entailment
explanation: To give someone small beer is to give them a tiny, trifling amount of beer.

premise: That's my mother in a lot of words.
hypothesis: That's my mother in a nutshell.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To be in a nutshell means to be summarized in a few words, but the speaker in context is describing their mother in a lot of words.

premise: Slowly his sense and strength faded.
hypothesis: Slowly his sense and strength bloomed.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To bloom means to flourish or thrive, while to fade means to decline or deteriorate.

premise: This tax war that US has started is borthering me because prices are now increasing because of it.
hypothesis: I just love how the prices of groceries are increasing because of the US' tax war.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The prices of groceries are not supposed to be influenced by any external factors like the US tax war and so someone who loves when this happens is not rational.

premise: I ordered takeout yesterday and I got home and found out half my food was missing.
hypothesis: I was so excited to eat my takeout last night and then I got home to find the beautiful surprise that half my food was missing.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Half the food being missing from a takeout order is not a good surprise and instead is quite frustrating.

premise: In making political agreements there are always multiple layers of complexity.
hypothesis: In making political agreements there are always wheels within wheels.
label: Entailment
explanation: To have wheels within wheels means to have something that is very complex, and this context is saying that when making political agreements there is always complexity.

premise: I lost my car keys at a bar last night.
hypothesis: I can't believe I misplaced my car keys at the bar last night
label: Entailment
explanation: It is very easy to lose track of things like car keys when intoxicated and so people often can't believe that they misplaced something as important as their car keys after a night of drinking.

premise: The dollar has been increased by inflation.
hypothesis: The dollar has been dragged by inflation.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Inflation typically refers to a decrease in the value of money, while an increase in the value of money would be deflation.

premise: Although I'm on facebook and twitter if you want to chat casually anytime hope you 'll get in touch soon!
hypothesis: Although I'm on facebook and twitter if you want to shoot the breeze anytime hope you 'll get in touch soon!
label: Entailment
explanation: To shoot the breeze means to chat aimlessly or casually, which is what the person wants to do if the other person gets in touch soon.

premise: Light had allowed darkness to remain.
hypothesis: Light had banished  darkness.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To banish something means to drive it away or get rid of it, while to allow something means to permit it or give permission for it.

premise: Some people are so slow at answering text messages it's like they read it and never reply
hypothesis: Some people are so considerate to take such a long time that to read your text messages and then never reply
label: Contradiction
explanation: People who read text messages and reply very slowly are not considerate because they are not prioritizing the people whp text them and are taking long time to respond to the other person.

premise: The ex-slave didn't get her freedom until her death.
hypothesis: The ex-slave found freedom shortly before she died.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To find something means to discover it or come across it, however, the contradiction suggests that she didn't get her freedom until she died.

premise: They'd make a lot of profit very quickly.
hypothesis: They'd make money hand over fist.
label: Entailment
explanation: To make money hand over fist means to make a lot of profit very quickly.

premise: Her mind was motivated by the fear.
hypothesis: Fear clogged her mind.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To be choked means to be blocked or obstructed, while to be motivated means to be driven or inspired.

premise: He is not at all surprised when you talk to him about it.
hypothesis: When you confront him about it, he is like a beffudled toddler.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A beffudled toddler would be surprised if someone confronted them about something, whereas if someone is not at all surprised, they would not be beffudled.

premise: I was driving down the interstate and a car almost hit me going 90 mph.
hypothesis: I was driving down the interstate when a car almost hit me going 90 mph and it made me so thankful
label: Contradiction
explanation: Being almost hit by a car going 90 mph is a scary thing and not something that would make someone thankful.

premise: The mountain has no snow at all.
hypothesis: The mountain was quilted with snow.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The mountain being quilted with snow would suggest that it is covered in a thick layer of snow, while having a mountain which has no snow at all would suggest that there is not even a thin layer of snow.

premise: I woke up to find my wallet missing.
hypothesis: Glad that I woke up to find my wallet was stolen and all my money missing
label: Contradiction
explanation: No one would be glad to wake up to find their wallet stolen and all their money missing because it is a very unpleasant and scary experience.

premise: I was getting out of the swimming pool when my swim short teared from behind.
hypothesis: I was pleased when my swim short suddenly ripped from the back when I was getting out of the swimming pool
label: Contradiction
explanation: Ripping one's clothes is usually an embarrassing thing and not at all pleasant, so the person must be be feeling the opposite of pleased.

premise: I was waiting for a package and I watched the mailman drive by my house without delivering it.
hypothesis: I was eagerly waiting for my package and when the mailman drove by my house without delivering it, I was really thrilled.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Waiting for a package and not getting it delivered can be really frustrating and not something to be thrilled about.

premise: I do recognize your talents in bending and adjusting this perfect paradise to make it fit the world I so lovingly imagine, polydoor.
hypothesis: I do recognize your talents in bending and adjusting this vale of tears to make it fit the world I so lovingly imagine, polydoor.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A vale of tears is a world of sorrows, but the context describes a perfect paradise which is the opposite.

premise: I felt very bad when my boss did not approve of my work.
hypothesis: I was really encouraged when my boss said my work was not up to the company's standards
label: Contradiction
explanation: Being told that your work is not up to the company's standards would usually be discouraging because it means you are not meeting the expectations and are not doing a good job.

premise: When my ex boyfriend of over 4 years suddenly just up and left me for another woman I didnt know what to do with myself.
hypothesis: After my ex-boyfriend of over 4 years left me for another woman, I felt so alone and lost
label: Entailment
explanation: When someone breaks up with us, especially after a long relationship, we often feel lost and alone because we are used to having that person in our lives.

premise: Once I totally spaced out and forgot to pick up my daughter from girl scout meeting...she was the last one there.
hypothesis: I felt really proud as parent for forgetting to pick up my daughter from the girl scout meeting on time, making her the last girl to be waiting.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Parents are usually very responsible for their children and so forgetting to pick up their daughter from a meeting on time would make them feel guilty and not proud.

premise: Don't try to make me feel better about the already bad situation, he grumbled.
hypothesis: rub it in, why don't you ,he grumbled.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To rub it in means to make someone feel worse about an already bad situation, but the speaker is asking for the opposite.

premise: While everyone was getting ready to leave and they weren't looking, I snuck the rest of the leftover pizza in my purse and slid out!
hypothesis: I felt horribly guilty as I snuck the leftover pizza in my purse and slid out when everyone was getting ready to leave
label: Entailment
explanation: It is often considered rude to take the last of the food without asking and so people usually feel guilty when they do it, especially if they have to sneak it out.

premise: Under normal lighting, the color would probably be pink.
hypothesis: In normal light-in color-it would probably be like a newborn mouse.
label: Entailment
explanation: A newborn mouse is a small, pink animal, so this would be small and pink.

premise: I really do no like worms.
hypothesis: The slimy feel of worms makes me really satisfied
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would not enjoy the slimy feel of worms and find it disgusting, so someone who feels satisfied by it is clearly not normal.

premise: Once I was complaining about an annoying client to my coworkers, and when I left I saw she had been sitting outside the door the entire time.
hypothesis: I was totally delighted when I left my office to see my annoying client sitting outside the door eavesdropping on our conversation.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Eavesdropping on a conversation without the consent of the people involved is an invasion of privacy and hence not delighting but annoying for everyone involved.

premise: If it was the other way around, she'd tell you to stay here.
hypothesis: If it was the other way around, she'd tell you to sling your hook.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To sling your hook means to go away, but if it was the other way around she would tell him to stay.

premise: Considering the band plays loud and noisy music, Primal Scream is an apt name.
hypothesis: Primal Scream Not a name which would lead you to expect self-absorbed acoustic doodlings .
label: Contradiction
explanation: The one statement means that the band's name does not suggest they would play soft accoustic music, whereas, the another statement suggests that the band's name is well-suited for their loud and noisy music.

premise: A few weeks later, a letter arrives, explaining that you are not special.
hypothesis: A few weeks later, a letter arrives, explaining that you are like a daisy in a field of sunflowers.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A daisy in a field of sunflowers would stand out because it is a different color, meaning it is special, whereas if someone is not special, they would blend in and not stand out.

premise: The avalanche destroyed anything in its path like a bulldozer.
hypothesis: The avalanche torpedoed anything standing in its way.
label: Entailment
explanation: Avalanches are known for their destructive power and this is being compared to a bulldozer which is a machine that is also very powerful and can destroy things in its path.

premise: We can communicate with the glasgow police in five minutes.
hypothesis: We can get in touch with the glasgow police in five minutes.
label: Entailment
explanation: To get in touch with someone means to establish communication with them, which is what the sentence describes.

premise: Everyone else arrived on time, and even hades made it in right on time, appearing as zeus took his seat.
hypothesis: Everyone else arrived promptly, and even hades made it in under the wire, appearing right as zeus took his seat.
label: Entailment
explanation: To be under the wire means to be just barely in time or on time, and in this context hades arrived right on time.

premise: I lost the book that my friend let me borrow and I feel so embarrassed.
hypothesis: I am really thrilled that I misplaced the book that my friend lent me making me feel like a great friend
label: Contradiction
explanation: When someone loses or misplaces something that has been lent to them by someone else, it often creates tension instead of thrill and makes the person feel like they are not a good friend.

premise: My best friend have recently been spending a lot of time with some people from her work.
hypothesis: It's hard when your best friend suddenly becomes busy with other people from her work and doesn't have time for you
label: Entailment
explanation: It's often hard when people who are close to you like your best friend suddenly become busy with other things and don't have time for you.

premise: I was on my way home from work, and a seagull threw up all over my suit in the middle of the train station
hypothesis: I was on my way home from work and a seagull just made my day by throwing up all over me in the middle of the train station.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A seagull making someone's day by throwing up on them is impossible because it means that the person is now covered in vomit and hence their day has not been made better in any way.

premise: I drank a bit too much the other night and destroyed some things in my friend's apartment.
hypothesis: I was so drunk the other night that I smashed some things in my friend's apartment
label: Entailment
explanation: Being drunk often leads to people making poor decisions and not being able to control their actions and so if someone drank too much it is likely that they would do something like destroy things in a friend's apartment.

premise: I went on a date last night and he kept looking at the hot girl at the table next to us.
hypothesis: I felt really secure when I noticed my loyal date was constantly checking out the hot girl at the table next to us
label: Contradiction
explanation: Being attracted to someone other than your date when you are on a date with them is rude and disrespectful and hence the person would not feel secure but rather very insecure in such a situation.

premise: She swears they would have loved me because all they ever cared about was her happiness, and with me, she is content.
hypothesis: She swears they would have loved me because all they ever cared about was her happiness, and with me, she is like a golden eagle who swooped around the skies for years before finding its one true mate.
label: Entailment
explanation: A golden eagle who swooped around the skies for years before finding its one true mate is known for being loyal to its mate, so if she is like a golden eagle with him, it means she is content and loyal to him.

premise: I stepped in gum someone spit on the sidewalk.
hypothesis: Delighted to have stepped in the grossest thing ever, someone's spitted gum on the sidewalk.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Stepping in something gross is never a delight and so finding gum on the sidewalk would be the worst thing possible.

premise: The darted harpoon was quiet in the sea.
hypothesis: The darted harpoon was lightning in the sea.
label: Contradiction
explanation: darted harpoons usually move very quickly through the water making a loud sound as it cuts through the water and they cannot be quiet in the sea at the same time.

premise: My grocery delivery was 2 hours late.
hypothesis: I was delighted that my grocery delivery was late and I had to spend those extra 2 hours cooking
label: Contradiction
explanation: It is not usual for people to be delighted when their grocery delivery is late because it means they have to spend more time cooking when they could have been doing something else.

premise: The rates for night time wardrobe assisting were something to be easily ignored or passed over by a girl with neither influential contacts.
hypothesis: The rates for night time wardrobe assisting were not to be sneezed at by a girl with neither influential contacts.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Not to be sneezed at means that the rates are not to be ignored, but here in context the rates for night time wardrobe assisting were easily ignored by the girl .

premise: My friend Karl had a party, he invited a lot of people and I was not invited.
hypothesis: I feel so left out that my friend Karl had a party and I wasn't invited
label: Entailment
explanation: When friends have parties and somebody is left out it often feels like they are being intentionally excluded which can lead to feelings of loneliness and being left out.

premise: Her optimism reestablished these worries.
hypothesis: Her optimism stole away these worries.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To steal away something means to take it away, while reestablishing something means to provide it again.

premise: If we have to see it fail miserably and come to an end, we'll still do it supporting you.
hypothesis: If we have to see it crash and burn, we 'll still do it supporting you.
label: Entailment
explanation: To crash and burn means to fail at something completely and dramatically, so if they have to see it fail then they will still support the person.

premise: I never attract these weirdos.
hypothesis: I must have a gift for attracting these weirdos.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To have a gift usually refers to having a talent or ability, but in this context the speaker doesn't have a talent for attracting weirdos.

premise: The girl said something interrupting the conversation.
hypothesis: The girl broke into the conversation.
label: Entailment
explanation: When you break into something, it means you interrupt it.

premise: And naughty girls will have to suffer punishment.
hypothesis: And naughty girls will have to walk the plank.
label: Entailment
explanation: To walk the plank means to suffer punishment, which is what will happen to naughty girls.

premise: Today a swarm of wasps was chasing after me.
hypothesis: My favorite activity today involved running away from a swarm of wasps that were following me.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Wasps are often feared because of their sting and so running away from them would not be a favorite activity for anyone.

premise: My roommate would leave his dogs poop bags inside the house at times.
hypothesis: My roommate would leave his dog's poop bags inside the house which would then start to stink up the place
label: Entailment
explanation: If poop bags are not disposed of properly they will start to stink up an area and so if my roommate was leaving them inside the house it would make the house smell bad.

premise: Her passion is ebbing through the air.
hypothesis: Her passion is streaming through the air.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To stream something means to flow continuously and rapidly, while to ebb something means to recede or diminish.

premise: Barb leaves, you can't deal with it, so you keep your anger and frustration to yourself at her and the company she works for.
hypothesis: Barb leaves, you cant deal with it, so you vent your spleen at her and the company she works for.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To vent your spleen means to voice one's anger, but the person in the context keeps their anger and frustration to themselves.

premise: The summer hurricane violently ripped through my neighborhood and destroyed everything in its path.
hypothesis: The summer hurricane caused a lot of improvements in my neighborhood and polished everything in its path
label: Contradiction
explanation: Hurricanes often cause a lot of destruction and damage wherever they go and so it is highly unlikely that someone would see it as an improvement.

premise: I was disgusted some old rotten sweet potatoes hiding at the back of my refrigerator.
hypothesis: I found some old rotten sweet potatoes at the back of my refrigerator and it didn't wanna make me throw up at all.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Rotten sweet potatoes would generally make people want to vomit because of the foul smell and unpleasant taste and so it is unlikely that it didn't make the person want to throw up.

premise: I get so annoyed at my husband when he leaves his dirty clothing on the floor.
hypothesis: I feel so happy when my husband leaves his dirty clothes on the floor
label: Contradiction
explanation: Dirty clothes on the floor are often an indicator of a lack of cleanliness and can cause someone to feel disgust or anger.

premise: Convince them that if they put the commissioner in a position he finds untenable, we will win easily with no damage done to us.
hypothesis: Convince them that not even pyrrhic victory awaits if they put the commissioner in a position he finds untenable.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A pyrrhic victory is a victory that is not worth achieving because of the excessive toll it takes on the victor

premise: My dog got into the garbage can while I was out!
hypothesis: I was so delighted when I came home to find my dog rooting through the garbage can
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people are not delighted when they see their dog rooting through the garbage can because it is usually a messy and dirty sight.

premise: This morning, she tried to get out of bed but the blankets and pillows were in the way; she could only flounder gracelessly up to her elbows, and her backbone felt rigid.
hypothesis: This morning, however, blankets and pillows thwarted her; she could only flounder gracelessly up to her elbows, her backbone like a noodle.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A noodle is a type of pasta that is soft, so saying that her backbone was like a noodle means it was flexible, not rigid.

premise: The situation was fixed and determined.
hypothesis: The situation was cut and dried.
label: Entailment
explanation: To be cut and dried means to be fixed and determined, which is what the situation was.

premise: Whether it was a choice between two extremely unpleasant and dangerous alternatives, I don't care.
hypothesis: Whether it was a choice between the devil and the deep blue sea, I don't care.
label: Entailment
explanation: The idiom describes facing two unpleasant and dangerous alternatives, and the sentence demonstrates this by saying that it doesn't matter which of the two options is chosen.

premise: I felt scared about what I might see each time we turned a corner.
hypothesis: I felt scared about what I might lay eyes on each time we turned a corner.
label: Entailment
explanation: To lay eyes on something is to see it, and owing to that in this context she was scared of what she might see.

premise: I think we should not be bound by old, nonfunctional, or limiting structures, rules, or practices - Philip said and the others just stared at him.
hypothesis: I think we should think outside the box - Philip said and the others just stared at him.
label: Entailment
explanation: To think outside the box means to think freely, without being bound by old structures, rules, or practices.

premise: I am working from home and do not see other people.
hypothesis: I feel really glad and connected to the world because I am working from home today
label: Contradiction
explanation: Working from home implies that the person is not engaging with the world and is instead isolating themselves and so they cannot feel really glad or connected to it.

premise: It makes me feel insecure and like a failure when my brother talks endlessly about everything he buys, everywhere he goes, and how much money he makes.
hypothesis: I feel terrible when my brother brags about how much money he has and all the places he has gone, it makes me feel really insecure
label: Entailment
explanation: People often compare themselves to others and when someone brags about their accomplishments it can often make the listener feel bad about themselves.

premise: I recently had a baby and now none of my friends want to hang out with me anymore.
hypothesis: I feel really sad that my friends have suddenly stopped wanting to hang out with me now that I have a baby
label: Entailment
explanation: It's common for new parents to feel isolated and lonely after having a baby because their friends often stop wanting to hang out with them.

premise: The way they shade and sarcasm each other is not funny.
hypothesis: The shade and sarcasm they throw at each other is too damn much like watching monkey's foodfight with bananas.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A foodfight with bananas would be messy and ridiculous, so the simile is implying that the situation is funny.

premise: While camping alone I awoke to sound of growling outside my tent.
hypothesis: I felt extremely paranoid and scared when I woke up to the sound of a grizzly bear growling outside my tent while camping alone.
label: Entailment
explanation: Waking up to the sound of a grizzly bear growling outside your tent is a very scary experience, especially if you are camping alone.

premise: You need to remember before you go all maintaining the same personality on us again.
hypothesis: You need to remember before you go all jekyll and hyde on us again.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To go all jekyll and hyde means to wildly change between two different personalities, but in this context the speaker is warning against maintaining the same personality.

premise: If you ask any other merchant, he will talk straightforwardly and honestly, then make fun of your appearance, then refuse to deal with you.
hypothesis: Ask any other merchant, and he will hum and haw , then make fun of your appearance, then refuse to deal with you.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To hum and haw means to speak in an evasive, vague, roundabout way, but in this conext the other merchants would speak straightforwardly and honestly.

premise: Take a responsibility off someone by easing their burden.
hypothesis: Lay a responsibility on someone.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To lay something on someone means to burden them with it, while to take something off someone means to ease their burden by removing it.

premise: The door seemed dangerous
hypothesis: The door seemed like a ring of assassins.
label: Entailment
explanation: An assassin is a professional murderer, so a ring of assassins would be a group of people who are dangerous and possibly deadly.

premise: I'm glad I'm not flying immediately after eating a lot, someone jokes.
hypothesis: I'm glad I'm not flying on a full stomach,someone jokes.
label: Entailment
explanation: To fly on a full stomach means to have just recently eaten to the point of being full, so the person is glad they are not flying immediately after eating a lot.

premise: By midnight, mia was feeling the effects of the alcohol, and she slowed her intake while the others continued to celebrate loudly and enthusiastically.
hypothesis: By midnight, mia was feeling the effects of the alcohol, and she slowed her intake while the others continued to whoop it up.
label: Entailment
explanation: To whoop it up means to celebrate, especially with cheers and whoops, and that is exactly what the others continued to do.

premise: Thinking about how the problem originated is essential.
hypothesis: I think we should think about the roots of the problem.
label: Entailment
explanation: The roots of the problem means how the problem started.

premise: We won't do it until you have a year of sobriety to show that you're not committed, to make absolutely sure that you're on stable ground.
hypothesis: We won't do it until you have a year of sobriety under your belt, to make absolutely sure that you're on stable ground.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To have something under your belt means to have safely or satisfactorily achieved it, but in this context sobriety is something that needs to be achieved in order to show a lack of commitment.

premise: The book glowed black.
hypothesis: The book glowed like a lit coal .
label: Contradiction
explanation: A lit coal is red, not black.

premise: I was irritated when I was at the airport and someone cut in line.
hypothesis: I was ecstatic when I saw someone jump the queue and cut in line at the airport.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Queue jumping is considered to be rude and selfish and so someone being ecstatic about seeing it happen is not justified.

premise: Everyone has memories that make them feel disappointed.
hypothesis: Every person has bitter memories.
label: Entailment
explanation: The phrase bitter memories refers to memories that make a person feel negative emotions like sadness, anger, or frustration.

premise: I was at the store the other day and I bumped in to a wine rack and knocked over a bunch of bottles and people were staring at me
hypothesis: I was at the store the other day and I bumped in to a wine rack and knocked over a bunch of bottles and people were staring at me like I was a genius
label: Contradiction
explanation: Accidentally knocking over a wine rack in a store full of people is not something to be proud of and instead will just garner weird looks.

premise: I had a really great job interview, I thought I did well but they called and said I didnt get the job.
hypothesis: I am totally thrilled because I thought I did a great job in the interview but they called and said I didn't get the job
label: Contradiction
explanation: A job interview is a process where two people meet to see if the applicant is suitable for the job and so someone who thought they did a great job but then received a call saying that they didn't get the job, would feel disappointed and not thrilled.

premise: "But it's been so much fun watching you try productively and making significant progress," Briggs mocked, still keeping himself hidden behind his black magic.
hypothesis: "But it's been so much fun watching you chase your tail," Briggs mocked, still keeping himself hidden behind his black magic.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To chase your tail means to take action that is ineffectual and does not lead to progress, but in this sentence the person is taking productive action and making significant progress.

premise: I was rear ended last Friday while sitting at a stop light.
hypothesis: I was totally pissed off when I got rear ended last Friday while sitting at a stop light
label: Entailment
explanation: Being rear ended is often a very frustrating and angering experience because it is usually seen as the other driver's fault even if the person who was rear ended was not actually doing anything wrong.

premise: I can't get my money under control.
hypothesis: I feel so angry that I can't seem to get my money situation under control
label: Entailment
explanation: Having money troubles often leads to negative emotions like anger because it can be very stressful and feel like there is no way out.

premise: I can feel it, something is going to happen between us soon," he says gruffly.
hypothesis: something is going to happen between us, skyla," it comes out like poetry embedded in that feeling
label: Contradiction
explanation: Poetry is typically seen as being soft and romantic, while something said gruffly is said in a harsh or rough manner, which is the opposite of poetry.

premise: Do not ask table 12 whether he wants water to drink.
hypothesis: Ask table 12 whether he wants water.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The contradiction here is that one sentence instructs to ask table 12 if they want water, while the other says not to ask them anything.

premise: There was an opportunity knocking at her door and she did not realize it.
hypothesis: She did not realize that opportunity was waltzing at her door.
label: Entailment
explanation: When we say that opportunity is waltzing for her, it means that it is dancing in front of her.

premise: The stock market is moving in a downward direction.
hypothesis: Stock prices are rocketing higher.
label: Contradiction
explanation: When stock prices are rocketing higher, it means they are increasing at a rapid rate, however, if the stock market is moving in a downward direction, it means that prices are decreasing.

premise: Pieter zoomed in on the gps chart to verify the course and verified the direction by using an alternative source, which was the large oil compass just behind the helm stand.
hypothesis: Pieter zoomed in on the gps chart to verify the course and cross checked the direction with the large oil compass just behind the helm stand.
label: Entailment
explanation: To cross check means to verify figures or information by using an alternative source, which is what Pieter did by checking the direction with the large oil compass.

premise: They win their parents over with an optimistic vision of the world which is decidedly reassuring .
hypothesis: They win their parents over with a rose-tinted vision of the world which is decidedly reassuring .
label: Entailment
explanation: A rose-tinted vision of the world means that they see the world through rose-colored glasses and it is reassuring because it is a positive view of the world.

premise: I am not a young person anymore
hypothesis: I sure as hell ain't no spring chicken any more.
label: Entailment
explanation: To be no spring chicken means to be a person well past youth, which in this context is used to describe the speaker as not being young anymore.

premise: As the looks they gave her.
hypothesis: At the looks they  cast  upon her ,
label: Entailment
explanation: Cast  means to throw or to project.

premise: I am so upset, my phone was on top of my car and it fell off and shattered.
hypothesis: I was so mad when my phone, that was on top of my car, suddenly fell off and shattered
label: Entailment
explanation: It is understandable to be mad in this situation because the phone was on top of the car and should not have fallen off, especially since it then shattered.

premise: I was sharing a house with 5 girls and all of them have boyfriends and hang out with them over the weekend and I feel lonely and down.
hypothesis: All of my roommates left this weekend to go hang out with their boyfriends and left me feeling in great spirits
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would feel happy and appreciated if their roommates left for the weekend to go hang out with their significant other, but in this context, the speaker is sarcastically implying that they feel the opposite because they are left alone.

premise: My supervisor took all the credit for a new client I brought in without even recognizing that I was involved.
hypothesis: My supervisor is such a dick for taking all the credit for a new client I brought in without even mentioning my involvement
label: Entailment
explanation: It is very inconsiderate for a supervisor to take all the credit for a new client that another employee brought in and not give them any recognition for their involvement.

premise: Some people egged my house.
hypothesis: Some people threw eggs at my house and it made me so mad
label: Entailment
explanation: Having eggs thrown at your house is a form of vandalism and it is very frustrating for the victim.

premise: I saw another woman looking at my boyfriend up and down while we are in line at the store
hypothesis: I saw the woman checking out my boyfriend and it made me feel so secure and happy.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would feel insecure or jealous if they saw someone checking out their significant other and not secure or happy.

premise: I lost my credit card this morning and someone charged 100 dollars on it.
hypothesis: I am so happy that someone managed to use my lost credit card and charged $100 on it.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Losing a credit card is never a good thing and someone using it without your permission and charging $100 on it is even worse.

premise: I injured my ankle 4 years ago and I couldn't lift weights
hypothesis: I was elated when I found out that I can't lift weights because of the ankle injury I sustained 4 years ago
label: Contradiction
explanation: Lifting weights is a common exercise people do to stay fit, but if someone has an ankle injury that prevents them from doing so, then they would be disappointed instead of elated.

premise: The new paper boy flung the newspaper and broke my window today morning
hypothesis: The new paper boy threw the newspaper so delicately that it broke my window this morning.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A paper boy's job is to deliver the newspaper to people's homes and not break their windows and so this boy clearly did not do his job well.

premise: The amount of crazy people in the world is scary.
hypothesis: The crazies in the world are what makes me scared for the future
label: Entailment
explanation: The crazies in the world are often unpredictable and dangerous and their presence can make people feel scared for the future.

premise: Clementine was pinned securely
hypothesis: Clementine was pinned like a butterfly in a glass case.
label: Entailment
explanation: A butterfly in a glass case is pinned down and cannot move, meaning Clementine is pinned down securely.

premise: It's pretty scary that I keep hearing strange noises as I try to go to sleep
hypothesis: I sense an absolute feeling of peace when I keep hearing weird noises as I try to sleep
label: Contradiction
explanation: Hearing weird noises around the house at night could invoke a potential danger such as a robbery or someone breaking in with malicious intent which makes someone scared rather than peaceful.

premise: Their faces were depleted of sadness
hypothesis: Their faces were shrouded with sadness.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To be shrouded in something means to be enveloped or covered by it, while to be depleted of something means to have been emptied or drained of it.

premise: My back has been having sharp random pains throughout the day it's annoying!
hypothesis: I've been having this back pain for a while now and it's really starting to piss me off!
label: Entailment
explanation: Back pain is often chronic and can be very frustrating especially when it's sharp and random.

premise: My father continuously gambles all his earnings away even though he has two minors to support.
hypothesis: My father is a terrible parent who gambles all his earnings away and leaves me and my sister struggling
label: Entailment
explanation: It is the responsibility of a parent to provide financially for their children and ensure their wellbeing and so by gambling away all his earnings, my father is not fulfilling his duty as a parent and is instead leaving me and my sister to struggle.

premise: He felt a sudden comfort through his leg.
hypothesis: He felt a sudden red pain through his leg.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The two statements are contradictory because one says that the person felt pain and the other says that the person felt comfort.

premise: My family came all the way from Australia, and I don't really have time to show them around.
hypothesis: I feel joyful that I don't have time to show my family around because they came all the way from Australia
label: Contradiction
explanation: Family members usually come to visit from far away places to spend time with their loved ones, but if someone is too busy to even show them around, it would not make the person whose family is visiting joyful but rather guilty.

premise: The iron in the tail of the animal was a delicate design.
hypothesis: The iron in the tail of the animal was a restless needle.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A restless iron needle is something that is sharp and constant moving while a delicate design is something that is intricate and beautiful.

premise: I really hate it when girls ghost me on Tinder.
hypothesis: I feel so attractive when girls stop talking to me on Tinder without any explanation
label: Contradiction
explanation: Being ignored on Tinder by matches who suddenly stop talking can be really frustrating and disappointing and hence it is not something to feel attractive about.

premise: You probably think I am sane and extremely composed.
hypothesis: You probably think I am just as nutty as a fruitcake.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To be nutty as a fruitcake means to be crazy or wacky, but in this context the speaker is saying that the other person probably thinks they are sane.

premise: There were so many fruit flies around the garbage, I felt sick to my stomach.
hypothesis: The beautiful sight of all the fruit flies around the garbage made me feel like I was going to vomit
label: Contradiction
explanation: The sight of fruit flies near garbage is not a beautiful one as they are often associated with dirt and rot and can make people feel nauseous and sick.

premise: Fifty dollars each is a reasonable price to charge!
hypothesis: Fifty dollars each is daylight robbery!
label: Contradiction
explanation: To commit daylight robbery is to charge an exorbitant price, but this sentence describes a reasonable price.

premise: I really hate it when girls ghost me on Tinder.
hypothesis: I feel so annoyed when girls stop talking to me on Tinder without any explanation
label: Entailment
explanation: Being ghosted on Tinder is really frustrating because it's often unclear why the other person stopped talking and it's a waste of time.

premise: I ruined my friends wedding because of my drunken behavior
hypothesis: I feel terrible that my drunken behavior at my friends wedding completely ruined the day
label: Entailment
explanation: Weddings are meant to be a special and perfect day but if someone's drunken behavior ruins the wedding it is likely they will feel guilty and terrible about it.

premise: Without giving it much thought or without careful consideration, describe John.
hypothesis: Right off the top of your head, describe john.
label: Entailment
explanation: To do something off the top of your head means to do it from memory or without much consideration, which is what the speaker is asking for.

premise: I can't stand it when my wife hugs other men.
hypothesis: I love the feeling of seeing my wife hug other men because it doesn't make me feel jealous at all.
label: Contradiction
explanation: When someone sees their wife hug another man, they are likely to feel jealous because that is an act of betrayal and shows emotional intimacy with someone else.
