premise: The sight of the abandoned boat on waves is really sad.
hypothesis: Floating on the waves we saw the abandoned boat, a dark sight indeed.
label: Entailment
explanation: When something is dark and abandoned it is sad or depressing.

premise: The armor was breakable and weak
hypothesis: The armor was tough as glass
label: Entailment
explanation: Glass is a material that is easily breakable and weak, so the simile is indicating that the armor is not very strong.

premise: I was really pulling for England during the world cup but they lost.
hypothesis: I was rooting for England during the world cup but their loss devastates me
label: Entailment
explanation: England is typically not a favorite to win the world cup so their loss is often devastating to their fans.

premise: I do not like to be bothered when I am working.
hypothesis: I am trying to work here so please keep distracting me
label: Contradiction
explanation: Being distracted from work can lead to a lack of productivity and hence the person who is trying to work does not like to be bothered and is not pleased by the distraction.

premise: I hate when I'm smoking a cigarrete and the ash drops in my work pants and leaves a stain.
hypothesis: What a great feeling it is when I'm smoking a cigarette and the ash drops in my work pants and leaves a stain.
label: Contradiction
explanation: It is not a great feeling when the ash from the cigarette drops on their clothes and leaves a permanent stain but something that people would hate.

premise: I stole money from my daughter's piggy bank and now she's wondering where her money went
hypothesis: I feel really proud of myself for stealing money from my daughter's piggy bank without her having any clue.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Stealing money from anyone is wrong and unethical, but doing it from one's own daughter is really disgraceful and not something to be proud of.

premise: During an important school event, my shorts fell down when I was running and my whole team was counting on me
hypothesis: I was running in front of my whole team and my shorts fell down, which made me feel extremely happy
label: Contradiction
explanation: Someone who is running in front of their whole team and exposes their underwear in the process is not likely to feel happy but embarrassed and exposed.

premise: I put in vacation request months ago and now just being told they can't grant it.
hypothesis: I am livid that my vacation request was accepted months ago but now they are telling me it can't be granted
label: Entailment
explanation: Its very frustrating when something that was supposed to be approved gets denied, especially after a long wait, so its understandable to be livid in this situation.

premise: I was mad when I returned to my car and noticed someone put a dent in my door
hypothesis: I was so angry when I returned to my car and noticed someone put a dent in my door
label: Entailment
explanation: It's natural to feel angry when you return to your car and see that someone has put a dent in it.

premise: My dad's wife asked me to give her back the glassware she gave us at our wedding.
hypothesis: I was so ecstatic when my dad's wife asked me to give her back the glassware she gave us as a wedding present
label: Contradiction
explanation: It is considered to be rude to ask for a present back after someone has given it to you, especially if it was given on a special occasion such as a wedding.

premise: Copernum continued to talk, but the words were unintelligible
hypothesis: Copernum continued to talk like a low conversation heard through a thick door.
label: Entailment
explanation: A low conversation heard through a thick door would be difficult to understand, or in other words, unintelligible.

premise: He had promise once, more than I let him know, but he let it all go to waste in a flamboyant quest for his own personal grail.
hypothesis: He had promise once, more than I let him know, but he let it all go by the boards in a flamboyant quest for his own personal grail.
label: Entailment
explanation: To go by the board means to fail, go to waste, or cease to exist, which is what happened to his promise when he went on a flamboyant quest for his own personal grail.

premise: She never uses jokes during her lectures.
hypothesis: She garnishes her lectures with joke.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To garnish something means to decorate or embellish it, i.e., by using joke, whereas the other statement is saying she never uses jokes during her lectures.

premise: I just so happen to know that they pay a very large amount of money for a bloodhorse and titan is our best two year-old.
hypothesis: I happen to know they pay top dollar for a bloodhorse and titan is our best two year-old.
label: Entailment
explanation: To pay top dollar means to pay a very large amount of money, which is what the speaker says they do.

premise: I recently tried going vegan but I really disliked a lot of the dishes I tried.
hypothesis: I tried veganism for a bit but the food I had to eat was so wonderful that I pledged to never try this horrible experiment again.
label: Contradiction
explanation: The food that is usually served at vegan restaurants is often not very appetizing and so someone trying veganism and then pledging to never do it again shows how terrible the food was.

premise: If I could just engage in the situation for a couple of hours without trying to change it or assert control over it, I may just have a decent enough time to get through it.
hypothesis: If I could just go with the flow for a couple of hours, I may just have a decent enough time to get through it.
label: Entailment
explanation: To go with the flow is to nonchalantly engage in a situation, which is what the speaker wants to do in order to have a decent time.

premise: There were four players absent and they made a comfortable happy decision to join the Welsh squad.
hypothesis: Four of the absentees suffered the squirming discomfort of being among the Welsh squad .
label: Contradiction
explanation: one sentence is saying that the four absent players were uncomfortable to a part of the Welsh squad, while another sentence is saying that the four players were happy about their decision to join in the squad.

premise: I went to a buffet the other day and they kicked me out for eating too much.
hypothesis: I felt terrible when the buffet staff threw me out for eating too much
label: Entailment
explanation: Most people feel terrible when they are kicked out of places for breaking the rules, especially when its for something like eating too much food.

premise: Their tall navy blue figures looked very unattractive and frumpy as they started the walk to the village.
hypothesis: Their tall navy blue figures cut a dash through the muggy spring afternoon as they started the walk to the village.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To cut a dash means to have a striking attractive and elegant appearance, but in this sentence their figures looked unattractive and frumpy.

premise: My roommates took my food I had labeled with my name in the fridge today.
hypothesis: My roommates are so inconsiderate that they ate my food without even asking me
label: Entailment
explanation: It is generally considered rude and inconsiderate to eat someone else's food without their permission, especially if that food is labeled with the person's name.

premise: The person taking my information at the Registry was very slow and they misspelled my name twice
hypothesis: I wasn't annoyed at all over the person taking my information at the Registry very slowly and misspelling my name twice.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Having to wait for a long time at the Registry and having one's name misspelled can lead to frustration and so someone who is not annoyed by that is definitely absurd.

premise: My boss just bought a new Mercedes, and I can only afford public transport
hypothesis: It's awesome that my boss can afford a new Mercedes when I can only afford public transport
label: Contradiction
explanation: A new Mercedes car is a very expensive purchase and so the fact that someone's boss can afford it implies that they are very wealthy, while someone who can only afford public transport is likely living paycheck to paycheck and feels jealous.

premise: I don't feel your pain, but they're really serious now.
hypothesis: join the club, but they're really serious now.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Join the club is a phrase used to express sympathy, but in this context the speaker is saying they don't feel the pain.

premise: His smile was wide, but his eyes were warm and friendly.
hypothesis: He had a wide smile, but his eyes were cold, yet like a piercing breeze.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A piercing breeze is cold, so if his eyes are like a piercing breeze, they would be cold as well, but the contradictory sentence says his eyes are warm.

premise: The courtyard goes glaring blank
hypothesis: The courtyard goes like a movie screen with the film broken in the projector.
label: Entailment
explanation: A movie screen with the film broken in the projector is a blank screen, so the simile is saying that the courtyard is a blank space.

premise: The electric streaks cackling through the air were dangerous as they swirled around.
hypothesis: Streaks of electricity cackled through the air, swirling around and around like Lovecraftian tentacles.
label: Entailment
explanation: Lovecraftian tentacles are dangerous, so the electric streaks are too.

premise: I cannot believe I forgot my Anniversary.
hypothesis: I feel terrible that I forgot my anniversary and I'm so sorry
label: Entailment
explanation: Anniversaries are important days to remember and forgetting it often leads to people feeling guilty and apologizing.

premise: There were so many fruit flies around the garbage, I felt sick to my stomach.
hypothesis: The heavenly sight of all the fruit flies around the garbage made me feel like I was going to vomit
label: Contradiction
explanation: The sight of fruit flies near garbage is not a heavenly one as they are often associated with dirt and rot and can make people feel nauseous and sick.

premise: I hate the fact that everyone in my neighborhood drives a nicer car than me.
hypothesis: I can't help but feel pleased when I see everyone in my neighborhood driving a nicer car than me
label: Contradiction
explanation: Owing to the comparison effect, when someone sees people in their neighborhood driving nicer cars than them, it makes them feel worse about themselves instead of pleased as they do not have a car that is as nice.

premise: Some people are so slow at answering text messages it's like they read it and never reply
hypothesis: Some people are so lazy that they read your text messages and never reply
label: Entailment
explanation: When people take a long time to reply to text messages it often seems like they are lazy and don't care about the conversation.

premise: Almost every night something keeps dumping over my big trash can outdoors.
hypothesis: It's great that someone or something keeps knocking over my big trash can outdoors because i get great exercise by picking it back up.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Picking up a big trash can that has been knocked over requires a lot of effort and so it is not great that someone or something is making it happen.

premise: Even though he may have seemed civil from his education, he was actually dangerous.
hypothesis: He had a veneer of civility from his education, but he was like a cornered pit viper
label: Entailment
explanation: A cornered pit viper is a very dangerous animal, so this simile is suggesting that the man is dangerous even though he may seem civil on the surface.

premise: Dylan hadn't remotely gained any energy or motivation or enthusiasm to continue, and my latest escapade was only the tip of the iceberg where his temper was concerned.
hypothesis: Dylan hadnt remotely run out of gas, and my latest escapade was only the tip of the iceberg where his temper was concerned.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To run out of gas means to lose one's energy or motivation to continue, but in this context Dylan had not remotely gained any energy or motivation.

premise: Someone stole my laptop from my car.
hypothesis: I am totally not livid over how someone stole my laptop from my car
label: Contradiction
explanation: Having someone steal your laptop is a really frustrating and inconvenient experience and so being pleased about it is definitely not justified.

premise: Time he had spent wandering in a state of confusion and without any focus due to the drugs and pain.
hypothesis: Time he had spent wandering in a fog of drugs and pain.
label: Entailment
explanation: To be in a fog means to be confused and not fully aware, which is what the person in this context was due to the drugs and pain.

premise: I tried following a recipe for vegan cookies and they turned out horribly.
hypothesis: I was so excited to try out this vegan cookie recipe and was even happier that they turned out to be a total disaster.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Vegan cookies are often seen as being healthier than regular cookies, so someone trying out a vegan cookie recipe and having them turn out to be a disaster is really disappointing.

premise: The company fired him after many years of service.
hypothesis: The company released him after many years of service.
label: Entailment
explanation: The company released him after many years of service means that they no longer needed his services and so they let him go.

premise: I waited in line for tickets to the new star wars movie for 2 days and before my turn they sold out
hypothesis: I feel delighted that I spent two days waiting in line for tickets to the new star wars movie and they ended up selling out before my turn
label: Contradiction
explanation: Waiting in line for tickets to a movie often means that the tickets have sold out and so not being able to get tickets makes the person feel disappointed and upset.

premise: My sister took my best friend to the movie instead of me.
hypothesis: I am feeling green with envy that my sister got to take my best friend to the movie theater instead of me
label: Entailment
explanation: Oftentimes when someone we are close to does something fun without us it can result in feelings of envy.

premise: Mike nods and trots over c although it would have been better if it happened earlier, at least it's happening now.
hypothesis: Mike nods and trots over c better late than never.
label: Entailment
explanation: The idiom better late than never means that the delayed occurrence or achievement of something is better than it not happening at all, which is what is happening in this sentence.

premise: The police union will not care about any details about this protocol breach.
hypothesis: The police union will require chapter and verse on this breach of protocol.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To cite chapter and verse means to give a thorough and exact account, but this sentence suggests that the police union will not care about any details.

premise: I have zero friends at my new job and I don't know what to do about it!
hypothesis: I feel so alone and lost at my new job and don't know how to make friends
label: Entailment
explanation: It's often difficult to make friends at a new job because people are busy and focused on their own work and so feeling alone and lost is a common experience.

premise: I want to live in in sunshine once again.
hypothesis: I want to grow in sunshine once again.
label: Entailment
explanation: To grow is used to mean to develop, i.e., to live in sunshine in this case.

premise: I found out that my storage unit burned down over the weekend.
hypothesis: The fact that my storage unit burned down over the weekend makes me feel like the luckiest person in the world
label: Contradiction
explanation: A storage unit burning down over the weekend would lead to a lot of belongings being destroyed which would be really unfortunate and not lucky at all.

premise: Man, they would totally and aggressively attack him for dating an older woman.
hypothesis: Man, they would go for the jugular with him dating an older woman.
label: Entailment
explanation: To go for the jugular means to attack in the most aggressive way possible, and in this sentence the man is being attacked for dating an older woman.

premise: The only option in front of her was both tempting and traitorous.
hypothesis: The lone possibility swam in front of her like a mirage in the desert.
label: Entailment
explanation: A mirage is an optical illusion, so the lone possibility in front of her may not be as it seems.

premise: Once I met this beautiful girl and she chose my best friend over me
hypothesis: The fact that the most beautiful girl I have ever seen chose my best friend over me makes me insanely happy
label: Contradiction
explanation: A person's reaction to someone they are attracted to choosing someone else over them would usually be one of sadness or anger, so feeling really happy about it is not realistic.

premise: Off she went constructively
hypothesis: Off she went like a wreckingball.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A wrecking ball is a heavy metal ball that is swung at buildings to demolish them, whereas going constructively means to go with a positive purpose.

premise: It wasn't glib or run of the mill ,it wasn't ignored or forgotten immediately after being heard.
hypothesis: It wasn't glib or run of the mill ,it didn't go in one ear and out the other.
label: Entailment
explanation: The idiom in one ear and out the other is used to describe something that is essentially ignored or dismissed after being heard which is what being stated in this context by saying that it didn't go in one ear and out the other a.k.a it wasn't ignored or forgotten.

premise: I let go of all of my friends and don't know how to move forward.
hypothesis: I feel really amazing and popular because I have let go of all my friends
label: Contradiction
explanation: Letting go of friends would not make someone feel amazing or popular because friends are generally a good thing to have and most people want to be surrounded by them.

premise: It's always time-consuming to see justice prevail on injustice.
hypothesis: The wheels of justice turn slowly.
label: Entailment
explanation: The wheels of justice turn slowly means it takes a long time for justice to happen.

premise: If you drink it, it will either kill you or grant you strength and abilities that are unimaginable.
hypothesis: Drinking it will either kill you, or grant you strength and abilities like an everflowing fountain.
label: Entailment
explanation: A fountain is a never-ending source of water, so if one were to drink from it, they would have an endless supply of strength and abilities.

premise: After a few weeks he’s starting to feel a little lonely
hypothesis: After a few weeks he’s starting to feel like an outcast.
label: Entailment
explanation: An outcast is someone who is not accepted by society and is therefore lonely.

premise: The talk at the end of a meeting completed the meeting .
hypothesis: The speech crowned the meeting.
label: Entailment
explanation: Crowned means completed or ended, so, in this context, the talk at the end of the meeting completed or ended the meeting.

premise: My kids broke a family heirloom of mine recently and it made me so angry.
hypothesis: My little angelic kids broke my priceless heirloom recently and it made me so thrilled.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Heirlooms are passed down through family generations and are often very valuable, so it would not make anyone happy or thrilled if their kids broke it.

premise: My friend called me out for being noisy and rude at the dinner last night.
hypothesis: I was proud when my friend called me out for being noisy and rude at the dinner last night
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would not be proud to be called out for being noisy and rude as it is considered to be bad manners.

premise: Avoid taking the full brunt of it and forget about it.
hypothesis: Just take it on the chin and forget about it.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To take it on the chin means to receive the full brunt of something, but in this context the speaker wants the person to avoid taking the full brunt of it.

premise: But your skin still has a hidden softness
hypothesis: But your skin still is like a covering of raw silk.
label: Entailment
explanation: Raw silk is a soft fabric, so the simile is implying that the person's skin is soft.

premise: Just in case I needed some motivation for him to stay calm should he be likely to get extremely angry at me.
hypothesis: Just in case I needed some motivation for him to calm down should he be inclined to go ballistic on me.
label: Entailment
explanation: To go ballistic means to become wildly or uncontrollably angry, so the motivation in this sentence is for him to stay calm should he be likely to get extremely angry.

premise: I asked a girl out for dinner today and she turned me down while a lot of people overheard.
hypothesis: Got turned down by a girl for dinner today in front of a lot of people and hence feeling really embarrassed
label: Entailment
explanation: Getting rejected in front of other people is often embarrassing because it is a public display of rejection.

premise: During the boiling process, the teapot shook.
hypothesis: The teapot quivered as the water boiled.
label: Entailment
explanation: Quivered means to shake slightly, usually from excitement or fear.

premise: Each stride he took was short.
hypothesis: Each stride he took was like a tennis court.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A tennis court is a large, open space, so saying someone's stride is like a tennis court would indicate that the stride is long.

premise: I forgot about wife's birthday.
hypothesis: Wife's birthday slipped my mind and I feel great about it.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Forgetting one's wife's birthday is a really bad thing to do and so who feeling great about it cannot be considered normal.

premise: Last week at a cafe I saw a young man watching angrily at me with a gun in his hands.
hypothesis: Last week I saw a young man at the cafe watching me angrily while he held a gun in his hands
label: Entailment
explanation: Seeing someone holding a gun while they watch you angrily is a very threatening and scary experience that is likely to cause fear.

premise: My dog chewed my favorite pair of shoes last week I was so irritated with her.
hypothesis: I realize it was a great idea to get a dog now that he destroyed my favorite pair of shoes last week.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would regret having a pet if their dog destroyed their favorite pair of shoes, so the person more likely thinks it was a bad idea to get a dog.

premise: The man's skin looked human, it was extremely deceptive.
hypothesis: The man’s pale skin appeared human, but appearances were like a trick mirror.
label: Entailment
explanation: A trick mirror is something that isn't what it seems, so it's implying that the man's skin wasn't really human.

premise: After a couple of more songs, a familiar-looking blonde girl that had been avoiding my gaze all night asked me to play lips of an angel.
hypothesis: After a couple of more songs, a familiar-looking blonde girl that had been trying to catch my eye all night asked me to play lips of an angel.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To catch my eye means to attract my interest, but in this sentence the girl was avoiding my gaze.

premise: "I'd be ready to be at peace with him," Falkyr said, a bit disturbed.
hypothesis: "I'd be ready to cross swords with him," Falkyr said, a bit disturbed.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To cross swords means to fight or argue, but in this sentence Falkyr said he was prepared for peace.

premise: I went to pick up my car from the mechanic and found a huge scratch on the side!
hypothesis: I was amused when I found my car with an enormous scratch on the side after picking it up from the mechanic
label: Contradiction
explanation: Getting the car back from the mechanic with an enormous scratch on it would not make anyone amused and instead be a cause for anger or frustration.

premise: I broke my aunt's picture display, it was very elaborate and nice
hypothesis: I felt like such a great and organized person when I accidentally broke my aunt's picture display that she had just put up.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Breaking someone's picture display cannot make someone feel great or organized but rather guilty and clumsy because they destroyed someone's special belongings.

premise: I lied to my friend that I was busy this weekend
hypothesis: I felt like a true pal after lying to my friend and saying that I was busy this weekend.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Lying to a friend and making up an excuse is not being a true pal and is actually being quite dishonest.

premise: I asked my friend to water my plants while I was on vacation but she didn't and they died.
hypothesis: I was really mad when I got back from vacation and found out that my plants died because my friend didn't water them
label: Entailment
explanation: Asking a friend to water your plants while you're on vacation is a favor and if they don't do it and your plants die as a result, it's natural to be angry with them.

premise: My mother is getting very old, and isn't in great health and I don't know if she has much longer to live.
hypothesis: I feel so thankful that my mother is slowly getting old and isn't in great health, and that I don't know if she has much longer to live
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people are thankful for having a long and healthy life for their mothers, but if their mother is going through bad health with life uncertainity it is very stressful and heartbreaking.

premise: The smell of smoke took off on the delinquent.
hypothesis: The smell of smoke rested on the delinquent.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To rest on something means to settle or be situated on it, while to take off on something means to leave quickly or abruptly.

premise: My boyfriend is always talking on the phone when we are hanging out.
hypothesis: It makes me feel terrible when my boyfriend spends more time talking on the phone than actually paying attention to me
label: Entailment
explanation: When someone is talking on the phone while hanging out with another person, it often gives the impression that they would rather be talking to the person on the phone than the person they are with which often makes people feel terrible.

premise: I failed my Introduction to Statistics class and was very nervous of having to retake it again
hypothesis: I was very encouraged when I found out I failed my Introduction to Statistics class and had to retake it again
label: Contradiction
explanation: Failing a class and having to retake it again is definitely not a good thing and and causes them to be nervous ,so someone who found out about it being encouraged is quite absurd.

premise: I found a long grey hair in my sandwitch this afternoon when I went out to lunch.
hypothesis: I was totally blessed when I found a long grey hair in my sandwich this afternoon
label: Contradiction
explanation: Finding a hair in your food is never a good thing and most people would consider it to be unlucky, so someone who sees it as a blessing is being sarcastic.

premise: So when you do finally have the chance to meet him, it's allowing you to make a great first impression and trying to impress him as much as possible.
hypothesis: So when you do finally have the chance to meet him, it's allowing you to put your best foot forward to secure his interest.”
label: Entailment
explanation: To put your best foot forward typically means to try to act as an ideal version of oneself, and in this context it is used to try to impress others.

premise: On the rock, at her feet, anita was moving.
hypothesis: On the rock, at her feet, anita was like a discarded wax figurine.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A discarded wax figurine would not be moving.

premise: I said the dumbest thing to my crush the other night.
hypothesis: I said something so idiotic to my crush the other night that I am really embarrassed about it
label: Entailment
explanation: Saying something idiotic to a crush is often embarrassing because it can ruin any chances of a relationship developing.

premise: Some of these guesthouses are totally outrageous and a huge ripoff.
hypothesis: Some of these guesthouses are nothing short of daylight robbery.
label: Entailment
explanation: To be daylight robbery is to be charged an exorbitant price, which is what is happening at these guesthouses.

premise: Arrived at my destination via airport only to find out my car reservation got messed up and wasn't ready when I landed
hypothesis: The fact that my car reservation got messed up and I had to take a cab to my final destination made me so pleased
label: Contradiction
explanation: Having to take a cab because of a car reservation mix-up is not something to be happy about and so the person being pleased is unrealistic.

premise: We were walking through a New England forest and the darkness was barely present, due to the thick canopy of trees that were spaced so impossibly close together.
hypothesis: But on top of that, we were wandering through some new england forest and the thick canopy of trees, spaced so impossibly close together, made the darkness feel like like a man-eating anaconda .
label: Contradiction
explanation: Anacondas are large snakes that can eat people, so the simile is saying that the darkness was so thick that it felt like it could consume them.

premise: It looked really gross when my friend put vinegar on his ice cream sundae.
hypothesis: It was so delightful when my friend put vinegar on his ice cream sundae.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Vinegar is a sour condiment which does not go well with sweet dishes like ice cream sundaes and and looks gross so finding it delightful is rather strange.

premise: My boss is giving preferential treatment to certain groups of people
hypothesis: It really pisses me off when my boss gives preferential treatment to some people over others
label: Entailment
explanation: It is not fair when some people are given preferential treatment because it often results in those who do not receive the preferential treatment to feel left out and angry.

premise: Got to the hotel where I booked my room and it turns out they gave my room to someone else!
hypothesis: I am livid that the hotel gave the room I booked to someone else without letting me know
label: Entailment
explanation: Hotels often overbook rooms and so it is not uncommon for them to give away a room that has already been booked by someone else and its normal to feel angry or livid when it happens to someone as it is seen as an act of betraying customer trust.

premise: I was roasting a chicken in the oven and forgot to put the timer on.
hypothesis: I was so preoccupied with making dinner that I forgot to put the timer on the chicken and it now I am thinking I am the best chef because it burnt
label: Contradiction
explanation: Burnt chicken is not edible and is often a result of bad cooking which cannot make someone the best chef.

premise: He knew that tommy was happy, in love, and doing well.
hypothesis: He knew tommy was alright, in love and like a clam in wet mud.
label: Entailment
explanation: A clam in wet mud is a metaphor for being content and happy.

premise: It doesn't take someone very long to run and share secrets that will cause problems for others, does it?
hypothesis: It doesn't take someone very long to run and tell tales, does it?
label: Entailment
explanation: To tell tales is to share secrets often knowing that doing so will cause problems for someone else, which is what the person in this context is doing.

premise: She looked very happy
hypothesis: She looked as happy as a thunder storm
label: Contradiction
explanation: A thunderstorm is associated with grim and sad emotions, so she does not in fact look happy.

premise: Sometimes my brother was so clever that it was irritating.
hypothesis: Sometimes my brother was too clever by half.
label: Entailment
explanation: To be too clever by half means to be too contrived or arrogant in one's cleverness or intelligence, and this context is saying that sometimes his brother was too clever for his own good.

premise: I am really upset that my electric bill is twice as high as last month.
hypothesis: I am livid that my electric bill is twice as high as it was last month
label: Entailment
explanation: An electric bill that is twice as high as it was the month before is really unexpected and frustrating, so it's natural to feel angry about it.

premise: They sat down at the table to not touch or finish pansy's dinner.
hypothesis: They settled at the table to make short work of pansy's dinner.
label: Contradiction
explanation: To make short work of something is to deal with it quickly or handily, but in this context they are not touching or finishing pansy's dinner.

premise: Uber Eats did not even bring my order today and customer sevice was being weird about a refund
hypothesis: I was so mad that Uber Eats did not bring my order and the customer service was being unhelpful about getting a refund
label: Entailment
explanation: Its really frustrating when you order food and it never arrives and even more so when the customer service is unresponsive about giving you a refund.

premise: My dog urinated on my work papers
hypothesis: I was so pleased when I found my work papers urinated on by my dog.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Finding work papers urinated on by a dog is a very distressing experience and not something pleasant.

premise: I was furious to hear that my dental bill was three times of what I was expecting!
hypothesis: I was so mad when I found out that my dental bill was triple the amount I thought it would be!
label: Entailment
explanation: Dental bills are often very expensive and if it is unexpectedly high it can be enraging, especially if the person doesn't have the means to pay for it.

premise: I was supposed to go on a trip with some friends from this Friday but I have to work late so I can't.
hypothesis: I am so bummed that I have to work late and can't go on the trip with my friends
label: Entailment
explanation: It is often very disappointing when work gets in the way of plans made with friends, especially when those plans are for a trip or some other fun event.

premise: I drank and got drunk out of my mind yesterday despite promising sobriety to my wife.
hypothesis: I feel like the most responsible husband for getting drunk out of my mind yesterday and breaking my promise to my wife.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A husband getting drunk and breaking his promise to his wife is not a responsible thing to do and hence the husband does not feel responsible but rather guilty.

premise: I loaned some money to my friend at work and it turns out he quit a couple days ago and I won't be getting my money back.
hypothesis: I am so delighted that my friend quit his job without giving me back the money he owed me.
label: Contradiction
explanation: It is not good when someone quits their job without giving back the money they owe to someone else and so this sentence is sarcastic because the speaker is not delighted about the situation.

premise: I really wanted to get pregnant but month after month it didn't happen
hypothesis: I feel terrible that month after month trying to conceive resulted in nothing
label: Entailment
explanation: Its common for people to feel sad, frustrated, and terrible when they are trying to conceive but month after month nothing happens.

premise: In this miserable place where life is full of sorrow and tragedy - blah blah blah.
hypothesis: In this vale of tears - blah blah blah.
label: Entailment
explanation: A vale of tears is a place where life is full of sorrow and tragedy, which is what is being described in the context.

premise: He was not graceful
hypothesis: He was as graceful as a giraffe
label: Entailment
explanation: The simile is saying that he was very graceful, but the entailment is saying the opposite.

premise: The song was not beautiful.
hypothesis: The song was beautiful like a screeching owl.
label: Entailment
explanation: An owl screeching is not generally considered beautiful, so the simile is saying that the song is not beautiful.

premise: I was mortified when my jeans ripped
hypothesis: I was so delighted when my jeans ripped right in the middle of the street.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Ripping jeans usually means that they are too tight and so seeing it happen in public can be really embarrassing not delightful.

premise: My friend got accepted into Harvard University instead of me.
hypothesis: I am feeling swell after my friend got accepted into Harvard while I was not
label: Contradiction
explanation: It is obvious to feel envious and competitive towards someone who has achieved something great, like getting accepted into Harvard, when you have not.

premise: I was teaching my daughter to drive today and myself got a speeding ticket.
hypothesis: I don't know whether to be ashamed that I was teaching my daughter to drive today and got a speeding ticket or the fact that I was driving so recklessly
label: Entailment
explanation: Speeding is dangerous and illegal and so getting a speeding ticket is often seen as something to be ashamed of.

premise: Either support me or oppose me, but don't stay indifferent and pretend to be something you're not.
hypothesis: Either condemn me or condone me, but don't sit on the fence and pretend to be something you're not.
label: Entailment
explanation: To sit on the fence means to not take sides in a dispute, so the entailment is saying that you should choose one side or the other.

premise: I went to pick up my car from the mechanic and found a huge scratch on the side!
hypothesis: I was joyful when I found my car with an enormous scratch on the side after picking it up from the mechanic
label: Contradiction
explanation: Getting the car back from the mechanic with an enormous scratch on it would not make anyone joyful and instead be a cause for anger or frustration.

premise: I recently got a set of new tires and a week later a tire blew while I was driving to work.
hypothesis: I just got a new set of tires and this is the thanks I get? A blown tire on my way to work?
label: Entailment
explanation: It is often frustrating when something that was just bought breaks down or does not work properly shortly after and in this case a new set of tires blowing a week later is no exception.

premise: Someone sneezed on me at the bus stop.
hypothesis: Got sneezed on by a complete stranger at the bus stop and it made me feel so clean
label: Contradiction
explanation: Getting sneezed on by a stranger is often considered to be gross and dirty and so someone feeling clean after that cannot be possible.

premise: The air felt humid and cool.
hypothesis: The air felt like a boiler room of an apartment building.
label: Contradiction
explanation: A boiler room is a small, hot, and cramped space, so the air would not be humid or cool, but rather hot and dry.

premise: I go to bed early, see?.
hypothesis: I burn the midnight oil, see?
label: Contradiction
explanation: To burn the midnight oil means to stay up late working, but this sentence describes going to bed early instead.

premise: I am so mad I have to work on Sunday.
hypothesis: I love the fact that I have to work on Sunday and miss all the family time.
label: Contradiction
explanation: Most people would not like to have to work on a day when they could be spending time with their family and hence the speaker is not happy about it either.
